title: Sales Manager- Catering
description:
Position: Sales Manager - Catering

Location: Canadian Niagara Hotels

Department: Sales

Why work for Canadian Niagara Hotels as a Sales Manager?

As a part of Canadian Niagara Hotels, you’ll have access to an amazing medical and dental benefits plan and discounts at hotels around the world. We’re a company that believes in the talent of our associates, and invests in helping them learn and grow in their career. Most important, you’ll be a part of a team that’s includes 2500+ talented and dedicated hospitality enthusiasts who are dedicated to providing a luxury to each guest so they feel welcome, comfortable, and free to be themselves.

Overview

This Sales position requires a well-spoken individual who has a passion for sales, a high standard of guest service and attention to detail. The ideal candidate will possess professional communication and presentation skills, knowledge of the Company’s products and services, strong sales skills, is goal oriented and excels in a team or individual atmosphere.

Sales Manager Responsibilities:

· Responsible for all group sales for Catering focused events including Weddings and social functions.

· Complete and actively action monthly and annual sales plans.

· Prospect, solicit, negotiate, close and report on all Catering sales.

· Responsive and effective problem resolution as required.

· Attend weekly and monthly meetings.

· Other duties assigned.

What you’ll need as a Sales Manager:

Experience: 1+ years’ experience in a sales role and/or hotel setting preferred but not required

Education: College/University Degree in Hospitality/Tourism or related program is preferred

Other Qualifications:

· Previous related successful sales track record, preferably within a hospitality, food and beverage and/or attraction environment.

· Experience with outbound sales, sales calls and presentations.

· Outstanding persuasion, interpersonal and communication skills.

· Drives guest loyalty through excellent customer service throughout the sales process, including site visits and presentations, to ensure repeated business and revenue.

· Demonstrate superior negotiation and presentation skills in order develop and maintain relationships with guests to ensure repeated business.

· Demonstrate initiative in order to personally generate leads, proposals, and carry out sales solicitation by making personal and sales calls.

· Demonstrate innovative ability to meet sales targets and grow business.

· Demonstrated ability to maintain professional composure at all times, while performing multiple tasks to meet timelines and sales quotas.

· Able to effectively build and maintain relationships with clients and operations management.

· Fluent with Microsoft Office Suite products – particularly Outlook, Word and Excel programs.

· Previous experience with sales booking system an asset.

· Demonstrate the ability to set high priorities and standards, and demonstrates urgency to achieve critical goals and objectives.

· Ability to quickly respond to changing work volume with high-energy level and speed.

· Good Team Player – refers business leads outside of scope to applicable team members/properties.

· Flexible to work according to client requirements.

· Able to work independently.

We also understand that diversity includes people with disabilities who might require reasonable accommodation in order to fully participate and contribute to their full capabilities or candidates for employment interested in reviewing or receiving information pertaining to careers at Canadian Niagara Hotels. This includes being able to fully participate in the Hotel's candidate selection process, including personal interviews in many circumstances, wherever possible and practical.

#P

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Discounted or free food
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance

title: Catering Sales Manager
description:
Position Overview

Kettlemans is seeking a self-motivated and talented communications manager to lead our communications department. In this position, you will facilitate production of high-quality content that engages customers and builds brand recognition along with creating informative content, press releases, articles, and media opportunities to share our company’s brand, products, and services.

History

Kettlemans Bagel was founded in 1993 by a young entrepreneur from Montreal, that realized Montreal bagels were not just loved by Montrealer’s, but by everyone! The traditional technique of hand-rolling each bagel, followed by kettling the bagels, and baking them in a wood burning oven, is what makes Kettlemans Bagels unique in the marketplace. The result: a fresh, hot delicious bagel that keeps customers coming back for more!

Kettlemans has quickly grown to become Ottawa’s leading bagel store. This success is based on our commitment to serve top quality, competitively priced bagels, backed by the best customer service in the business.

Our Philosophy

Our philosophy is based on the belief that freshness, quality and traditional standards are the cornerstone on which a good business rest. We have incorporated these standards into our business, along with conviction that provides positive attitude and a common-sense approach which leads to ultimate success. We believe that personal customer service, bagels made in the traditional way and an open concept where the customer is the inspector, is what makes Kettlemans unique.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Kitchen/Food/Menu Management Activities

· Has a full working knowledge of all products and suppliers required in operating the business.

· Works closely with the kitchen crew to ensure all facets of catering operations are maintained to Kettlemans standards and guidelines.

· Must ensure that all food costs percentage goals are met by working closely with the BOH and Business Manager.

· Bringing in new catering clients for events, establish and maintain clientele rapports.

· Oversee catering functions and special events for internal and external clients/ groups.

· Meet with clients to determine catering requirements, floor plans, rentals, staffing for events.

· Responsible for final approval of catering contracts pre-event.

· Ensure job instructions are clearly understood so that tasks are completed effectively to the client’s satisfaction.

· Ensure all staff provide quality, courteous service to all customers.

FOH Management Activities

· Oversees catering crew to ensure all facets of operations are maintained to Kettlemans standards and guidelines.

· Assists in the hiring of seasonal crew and approves the decision to bring new crew on and at what time with the FOH manager.

· Ensure that food and service meet quality control standards.

  • Manage catering purchases and inventory.
  • Participate in Operational Reviews for Catering Department.
  • Responsible for Catering Budget.

Labor & Staff

· Responsible for bi-weekly payroll and ensure that all crew members are paid out on time including reimbursements.

· Effectively manage staff conflict and any issues coming in from clients

Administration

· Collects and verifies all invoices and submits approved purchases for payment.

· Maintaining and updating client database and catering website information

· Responsible for collecting payment, invoicing, and accounts receivable

· Weekly: labour systems, dry goods management, sales reports

· Provides payroll input to the office and is accountable for accuracy of information submitted

Qualifications:

· At least 2- 4 years of Catering experience required

· Demonstrated experience in successful business growth

· Completion of Hospitality or Food and Beverage program.

· Excellent customer service skills ad communication skills.

· Up to date on current food & beverage trends.

· Strong leadership skills to manage a team of 3 members and organizational skills.

· Ability to multitask

Kettlemans Bagels is an Equal Employment Opportunity provider and hires qualified people without regard to race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, age, record of offences, family status, religion, disability, handicap, gender, sexual orientation, or marital status.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $60,000.00-$65,000.00 per year

title: newRestaurant and Catering Manager
description:
Reporting to the General Manager, the successful candidate will oversee daily restaurant & catering operations.
Duties to include:

  • Determining customer requirements and proposing catering options.
  • Negotiating prices and preparing meticulous catering order forms.
  • Planning menus and overseeing venue, equipment, food, and service preparations.
  • Hiring, training, and supervising staff, as well as scheduling employee shifts.
  • Liaising with customers and chefs
  • Overseeing seating arrangements, the serving of meals and beverages, and the clearing of tables.
  • Monitoring the availability of restaurant and catering stock and supplies, and ordering replenishments.
  • Maintain accurate records.
  • Assist servers when required.
  • Adhering to food and health industry regulations and standards.

Requirements:

  • Accredited course in catering & restaurant management an asset
  • 3-5 years of experience in catering management, or similar
  • Cash handling experience.
  • Provide Certificate of Conduct
  • Exceptional ability to deliver catering services within budget and on time.
  • Experience in hiring, training, and overseeing catering staff.
  • Ability to coordinate catering requirements with customers, chefs, and suppliers.
  • The ability to apply industry knowledge to improve catering services.
  • Advanced knowledge of best practices in catering & restaurant management.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $20.00-$24.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Holidays
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
Face mask required

Application deadline: 2022-05-31
Expected start date: 2022-06-07

title: newEvent Catering Manager
description:
100 Kellogg is Ontario’s premier indoor adventure park and must-do attraction! With so many attractions under one roof, London's newest entertainment destination is looking for positive, energetic and service oriented professionals who are passionate about hospitality and looking to join a dynamic team!

100 Kellogg is looking for a part time Event Catering Manager who has a passion for food and is able to assist in the execution of various events. The Catering Manager is responsible for arranging and organizing the food and beverage sales for private events.

Reports To: Director of Events

Job Duties

  • Provide Catering suggestions for private events
  • Upsell catering packages when possible
  • Catering execution including but not limited to; Event setup and take down, ensure food service is arranged and organized
  • Be on the floor during the event to manage the event service
  • Provide a positive guest experience
  • Training of event servers
  • Catering supplies inventory control

Must Haves

  • Minimum 2 years hospitality experience
  • 1 year experience in a leadership role considered an asset
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Wiling to work a flexible schedule. Evening and weekends included
  • Computer knowledge
  • Organizational skills
  • Professional appearance and attitude

Work Conditions

  • Must be able to stand for long periods of time
  • Must be willing to work evenings and weekends

As an employer, we are committed to supporting an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection process in a work environment where all employees feel valued, respected and supported. Upon request, we are happy to make reasonable accommodations available to persons with disabilities.

We thank everyone who takes the time to apply, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $45,000.00-$50,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Holidays
  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

Experience:

  • Hospitality: 2 years (required)

title: Events Manager
description:
District 28 is a Downtown Toronto based Event Venue, Production Studio, Shared Workspace and Meal Prep Catering company that is looking to grow its team. District 28 hosts a vast range of events including Product Launches, Weddings, Corporate Events, Social Events and more.

District 28 is currently seeking a full time Event Manager. This individual will work closely with the rest of the team to help coordinate, plan, and execute all things pertaining to District 28 Events. This position is ideal for a new graduate looking to break into the event industry and gain valuable experience. The ideal candidate must be highly organized, detail oriented, professional and personable. We are looking for someone who is organized, with a sales driven focus that can also be hands on with set up and teardown working as the banquet manager and leading the F&B team on event days.

We are looking for an individual who has a flexible schedule and can be available on weekdays, weekends, and evenings. In the Event Industry each day and week is different, and therefore the schedule of the Event Manager may vary from week to week. Responsibilities include, but not limited to:

  • Pull leads from various sources, and close sales
  • Walkthroughs and Client Meetings
  • Submitting Rental Orders
  • Follows up with Clients to insure contracts, documents and payments are all submitted in a timely manner
  • Assists with set up of Events and insures floor plans are executed accordingly
  • Staffing shift details for events staff
  • Assists with Catering and Event Signage
  • Venue Management during Events
  • Smart Serve Certified Required
  • Lead Food & Beverage and catering staff during events
  • Coordinate with Chef, and kitchen staff to ensure event standards are met

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $40,000.00-$50,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

title: newSales & Operations Manager
description:
Sol Cuisine is a trusted legacy brand catering to a growing community of retail and restaurant consumers in search of Non-GMO, Wheat and Gluten-Free, Kosher, Halal and Organic vegan products. Our vision is to be the leading provider of Plant Based alternatives with a wide variety of great tasting vegan gourmet items. Sol Cuisine was acquired by PlantPlus Foods, an innovative, fast-growing company in the plant-based meat category with the best of the energy and fresh ideas of a start-up combined with the broad experience and capabilities of two global parent companies, Marfrig Global Foods and Archer-Daniels-Midland (ADM), in the protein and food ingredients sectors.

Dedicated to quality and the satisfaction of our customers, each Team Member will perform duties in accordance with industry specific regulations, Global Food Safety Initiative Standards, Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points Certification, Good Distribution Practices, Standard Operating Procedures, Quality Standards, performance expectations as well as Workplace Health and Safety Policies and Procedures.

Each Team Member is responsible for food safety and to report on safety and/or quality problems to personnel with the authority to initiate corrective actions.

SUMMARY

Reporting to the Head of S&OP and Strategy located in Chicago, the Sales and Operations Manager is responsible for leading sales and operations and production planning process in North America also supporting other regions to ensure that customer service targets are met, and production schedules meet our efficiency and inventory targets. The production planner will report this role.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

· Work with of sales to coordinate the rolling 12 month demand forecast

· Translate the demand plan into an inventory plan based on achieving target service and inventory levels

  • Manage process to collect global demand and coordinate with Purchasing Manager to align with supplier capacity
  • Lead the cross-functional weekly and monthly Demand and Operations planning cadence

· Manage the production planning process to balance customer demand against manufacturing and supply chain capability

· Maintain the capacity plan and facilitate planning between the production, sales and marketing teams to ensure that the capacity plan supports the business plan, and to identify opportunities to support increasing sales

· Act as the key liaison between sales and operations on all supply and service issues

· Evaluate supply capability to support promotional and trade activities

· As part of the annual budget process, convert the sales forecast into a production plan as the basis of budget plan preparation as well as forecasting of material requirements

  • Create and drive continuous improvement of the S&OP process to ensure it continues to be up to date with current best practice and suitable for business requirements
  • Build a central repository of expertise, methods, tools & templates to enhance the value of the S&OP framework

· Tracking of KPI’s to support the assessment of operational performance and identify improvement opportunities. These KPI’s will include fill rate, on time performance, forecast accuracy, sales plan accuracy, production adherence and shipping lead times for all categories and regions managed

· Support the financial forecast process by providing input to the sales plan and production plan

  • Serve as S&OP process owner to govern S&OP calendar, meeting cadence, planning time horizons, document decisions and action items
  • Influences and builds capabilities of critical team members to embed the new processes, tools and cycle of S&OP

· Keeps current with industry best practices and applies best practices to the S&OP process in alignment with established governance – including scenario planning and projections.

· Tracks performance on sales activities and listings, promotional lifts, product launch modelling

QUALIFICATIONS:

· Minimum of 6 years of management in a food or similar consumer goods environment preferred

· Experience in working in a cross functional S&OP environment

· Proven track record of meeting and achieving goals/targets, cost control skills

· Good technical/computer/closing skills

· Excellent communication skills

CORE COMPETENCIES

· Able to Work in Fast-Paced Environment

· Detailed Oriented, Analytical Thinking, Planning and Organizing

· Able to Work Independently as well as in a Team

· Excellent Communication and Problem-Solving Skills - Results Driven

· Good Manual Dexterity

· Intermediate/Advanced Math Skills

· Hands on attitude and Leadership Mindset

QUALIFICATIONS

  • 10+ years’ experience in demand management, production control, planning, inventory control and/or materials, in a fast-paced manufacturing environment with a well developed S&OP processes
  • Bachelor’s Degree ideally in Supply Chain Management, Engineering, Business Management or related technical field
  • Proficient in Supply Chain concepts (safety stock planning, MRP calculations, scheduling constraints and bottlenecks, warehouse, and distribution networks etc.)
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office applications (Excel and Power BI)
  • Previous ERP experience is required; SAP and Microsoft Dynamics is considered an asset.
  • Ability to lead by collaboration, influence people, and communicate well cross functionally with strong planning, organization and meeting facilitation skills.
  • Lean/Six Sigma, Continuous Improvement, or equivalent experience.
  • Demonstrated ability to multi task and work to deadlines, in a fast-paced environment.
  • Highly developed analytical, quantitative and data analysis aptitude with Advanced Excel capability
  • Proactive individual with excellent time and project management skills.
  • Excellent communication and a well-defined sense of diplomacy, including conflict resolution, and people management skills.
  • Creative thinker and ability to think “outside the box”; create processes and ways of working.
  • Constantly challenges the team and self to improve; builds aligned cohesive teams that pull in the same direction to win.
  • Consumer and customer focused; gives the customer a seat at the table and brings their voice into the business.

WORKING CONDITIONS

· Manufacturing environment

· Hearing protection, appropriate clothing and steel toe shoes required

· Standing for long period of time (approximately 10 hours per shift)

· Repetition high

· Some heavy lifting and carrying up to 50lbs

· Various temperatures throughout the plant – cool to warm and humid

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: From $130,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Mississauga, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • Manufacturing - S & OP Process: 8 years (required)

Application deadline: 2022-05-20

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Specializing in structural engineering, building science, structural restoration, structural glass engineering, parking facility design and building energy modelling, RJC Engineers (RJC) is one of Canada’s leading engineering firms. Recognized as an exceptional workplace, we mentor the next generation of Canada’s ‘best and brightest’ engineers and technologists. With offices and expertise across Canada, we challenge our people to push technical boundaries and provide leadership in our fields of practice, while providing services for clients and projects nationwide

We are proud of our ability to balance creativity with practicality to help our clients achieve their vision, and understand that creativity starts with the ingenuity of our people. We have a culture of learning and facilitating growth of skills and capabilities; of helping our people fulfill their potential through coaching, teamwork, challenging work assignments and open communications. We strongly believe that if you feel engaged and driven to excel, you will enjoy your daily work experience, and that will result in a level of service that will keep our clients coming back.

Candidate Profile
Reporting to the Office Services Manager, the Administrative Assistant will work with the Engineering staff to address the Administrative needs of the RJC Edmonton office.
Key Responsibilities:
Looking for a highly adaptable and focused individual to assist the administration team with a variety of administration duties. Duties include, but are not limited to:

  • Handle a busy multi-line switchboard
  • Handle daily mail/courier packages
  • Book and manage boardrooms; catering and ensure tidiness and clean-up
  • Prepare supplies orders for general inventory
  • Maintain supply stock at various photocopier stations throughout office
  • Provide back-up for word processing of documents in MS Word and MS Excel
  • Ownership of the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) program
  • Maintain office equipment
  • Daily maintenance of kitchen areas: replenish supplies, general cleanliness
  • Order rental vehicles & related paperwork
  • Electronic filing and hard copy file administration
  • Office tools administration
  • Project information administration
  • Assist with the management of marketing materials and resources

Professional Qualifications & Skills

EDUCATION:

  • Minimum completion of High School Diploma; or equivalent diploma and/or experience will be considered. Post-Secondary certificate/diploma from an administrative assistant program is considered an asset

EXPERIENCE:

  • 0 to 2 years of related experience
  • Familiarity working in an office environment would be an asset

SKILLS:

  • Intermediate to advanced level skills with Microsoft Word, and Excel. The candidate should have a general aptitude for computer usage.
  • Focused attention on detail and accuracy
  • Customer service oriented with exceptional phone and email etiquette
  • Fast learner with a desire to grow professionally and personally
  • Team player with ability to work independently and with minimal direction
  • Demonstrated effective verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to prioritize, multi-task and stay focused
  • Hard worker who readily and quickly assumes responsibility; who is punctual, dependable

Rewards & Benefits
Here are a few reasons why others have joined the team:

  • An Inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work
  • Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
  • An employee owned organization providing greater opportunity
  • A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
  • An extensive and generous benefits package
  • An annual $1000 annual health care spending account.

We appreciate the interest and efforts of all applicants; however only those short-listed as candidates will be contacted to set up an interview. Upon request, accommodations are available for any persons with disabilities participating in the selection process.

If you are a bright, energetic and ambitious individual who is looking for a challenging and fulfilling career, please visit our careers page and apply today!

Please apply at www.rjc.ca/careers

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $20.00-$25.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • Secondary School (preferred)

title: Customer Service -Office Services
description:
Role Overview

Reporting to the Site Manager, the incumbent is responsible for ensuring that all WCD customers receive helpful, consistent, and exceptional customer service in various job capacities as needed. Great opportunity to learn multiple positions.

Key Results

  • Provide back up support for key roles within our client environment
  • Assist with various projects/overflow work as required
  • Perform varied tasks

Print Coordination

  • Coordinate completion of printed materials offsite
  • Ordering Business cards
  • Data Entry

Mail Services

  • Sort & Distribute intercompany mail throughout the plant site
  • Sort mail into appropriate bins at each building
  • Track incoming/outgoing shipments as required
  • Delivery of copy paper and stationery orders
  • Provide same day delivery service to and from Red Deer driving our company van

Mailroom Services

  • Order and stock Building 2 stationery room with supplies
  • Order copy paper and specialty items are required
  • General cleaning/organizing of the storage area
  • Monitor toner levels, Replace as required
  • Order & maintain all toner supplies for prompt replacement (including all HP toner required)
  • Track & record all toner change data for reporting
  • Receive and place orders for Catering requests
  • Validate and Update Distribution lists

Third Party Services

  • Address, log & resolve complaints with vendors
  • Arrange for maintenance, repairs or replacement of equipment
  • Reconcile invoicing & process for payment; Interface with supplier to correct invoice discrepancies
  • Maintain list of all vendor equipment
  • Assist with orientation for new vendors

Candidate Profile

Education

  • High school diploma or GED is a requirement.
  • Post-secondary education in a related field is an asset.

Skills and Experience

  • A solid understanding of computers and office equipment is a requirement.
  • Must adapt to changing environments, work with a variety of people and have the flexibility to cover various positions on short notice.
  • Strong ability to remain organized and manage multiple projects and duties
  • Skills to be detail-oriented is a requirement.
  • Strong fluency in English written and verbal skills is a requirement.
  • Exceptional customer service ethic is displayed in the passion for the work.
  • Ability to desire to perform different functions daily as required
  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds

Additional:

  • Personal transportation is required as the site is located in a rural area.
  • A valid Alberta drivers license is required
  • To maintain our value of health and safety this position is subject to pre-employment drug testing as per our Health and Safety Policies and Procedures

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • Secondary School (preferred)

Experience:

  • customer service: 2 years (preferred)
  • Mailroom: 2 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Class 5 Driver's License (required)

title: newCatering Manager
description:
Employment Opportunity


Catering Manager

Toronto, Canada


TO Live has a full-time opportunity in its Patron and Event Services Department in the role of Catering Manager. We are looking for a talented Caterer to join our team. TO Live is one of Canada’s largest multi-art organizations, we are the team behind three iconic venues: Meridian Hall, St. Lawrence Centre for the Arts and Meridian Arts Centre.


The Catering Manager will work closely with the Executive Chef and the Patron and Event teams to create seamless events.


RESPONSIBILITIES


  • Coordinate and oversee all catering elements relating to corporate and private events.
  • Coordinate and oversee all elements of artist and event riders.
  • Prepare proposals/estimates as required.
  • Work with Executive Chef, and Client to determine a proper menu for each event and coordinate menu planning meetings as required.
  • Distribute Event Orders to all appropriate departments to facilitate efficient purchasing, planning, and employee scheduling.
  • Attend meetings as required.
  • Conduct weekly catering briefing to review menus and set up requirements and to ensure last minute changes are communicated.
  • Work with Event Manager to create floor plans for all food and beverage elements according to the event requirements.
  • Design and execute setups to create excellent patron experiences.
  • Coordinate external vendors to fulfill event requirements. (Linen, equipment, flowers, etc.)
  • Respond to patron and staff concerns.
  • Establish and maintain excellent rapport with clients, prior to, during and post event

Administration

  • In conjunction with Event Managers ensure that all costs and expenditures are within the budgeted levels agreed upon in the estimate.
  • Keep financial and administrative records of any changes that may affect the final billing for each event.
  • Prepare weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual reports as required
  • Review and monitor approved budget goals including revenues, cost of materials and payroll
  • Input and update relevant event information into EBMS (Event Business Management Software) including completion of service and purchase orders.
  • Ensure billing accuracy
  • Assist in the ordering and the maintaining of inventory
  • Any and all other duties assigned by the Director of Patron and Event Services or their designate.

Staffing

  • Organize, lead, and motivate the catering team including but not limited to internal and external staffing resources to deliver event requirements.
  • manage the payroll
  • Determine appropriate number of service staff required to deliver on event requirements.
  • Lead and direct the work of Event Attendants including hiring, training, scheduling and supervising
  • Ensure that all employees project a positive, approachable, friendly, and professional image.
  • Work with outside staffing agencies to supplement event staffing requirements
  • Ensure health and safety regulations are strictly observed by all staff working during set-up for events and event day, as per Toronto Public Health and TO Live Covid-19 Workplace Safety guidelines.

JOB SPECIFICATIONS


  • Smart Serve Certified.
  • Minimum 3 years experience as a Catering Manager or similar role
  • Strong Knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word, Explorer & Outlook in a Windows operating environment.
  • Understanding of food and beverage allergies, religious food restrictions, sensitivities, and current food and event trends
  • Understanding of basic food and beverage sanitation
  • Ability to communicate with employees and other business contacts in a courteous and professional manner.
  • Ability to multi-task and organize
  • Strong time-management skills

WORKING CONDITIONS


  • Must be familiar with working in a union environment and be aware of the working conditions set out in the Collective Bargaining agreement.
  • Variable hours of work depending on performance and event schedules
  • Lack of natural light in workplace.
  • Travel between TO Live venues as required.
  • Adhere to the TO Live Health & Safety policies and protocols including Covid vaccine and guidelines.

THE ORGANIZATION:


TO Live is one of Canada’s largest multi-arts organizations, operating three iconic venues: Meridian Hall, the St. Lawrence Centre for the Arts and Meridian Arts Centre. In addition, TO Live presents a full range of performing arts, theatrical and concert events at these venues in both downtown and uptown Toronto. With these two hubs of creativity and content creation, TO Live has a unique place and perspective to activate creative spaces by inspiring local and international artists, connect audiences and to be the nexus for new ideas, elevate artistic potential, and be the catalyst for creative expression that is reflective of Toronto’s diversity.


HOW TO APPLY:


Interested applicants should apply through our TO Live careers website at: https://tolive.bamboohr.com/jobs/


No phone calls or emails please. TO Live thanks all applicants in advance. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.


Together with the Toronto Public Service’s (TPS) initiatives, which TO Lives follows and adheres too, TO Live encourages applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized persons/persons of colour, persons with disabilities, women, LGBTQ2S persons, and others who may contribute to fostering innovative ideas and solutions.


We ask that you complete the questions provided as part of the online application to assist us in ensuring our recruitment process and programs are equitable and accessible. Your responses are voluntary and the information that you provide is strictly confidential.


We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environment in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). The Human Resources department will work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.


Date Posted: May 06, 2022

Application Deadline: May 19, 2022

Start Date: As soon as possible

title: newAdministrative Assistant
description:
SC Chemistry

Competition No. -
S104947793

Posting Date -
May 02, 2022

Closing Date -
May 09, 2022


Position Type -
Full Time - Operating Funded

Salary Range -
$46,627 to $62,954 per year

Grade -
07

Hours -
35


This competition is open to all applicants however internal candidates and applicants who were former employees of the University of Alberta in the past 18 months will be given priority consideration before external candidates. Please indicate your internal status using the "Advertisement" drop down menu when applying.


This position is a part of the Non-Academic Staff Association (NASA).

This position offers a comprehensive benefits package which can be viewed at: Faculty & Staff Benefits.

Location - North campus

Working for the University of Alberta

The University of Alberta acknowledges that we are located on Treaty 6 territory, and respects the histories, languages and cultures of First Nations, Métis, Inuit and all First Peoples of Canada, whose presence continues to enrich our vibrant community.

The University of Alberta is teeming with change makers, community builders, and world shapers who lead with purpose each and every day. We are home to more than 40,000 students in 200+ undergraduate and 500+ graduate programs, over 13,000 faculty and staff, 260,000 alumni worldwide and have been recognized as one of Canada’s Greenest Employers for over a decade.

Your work will have a meaningful influence on a fascinating cross section of people—from our students and stakeholders, to our renowned researchers and innovators who are quite literally curing diseases, making discoveries and generating solutions that make the world healthier, safer, stronger, and more just.

Department summary

The Department of Chemistry at the University of Alberta provides an outstanding environment for studies in chemistry, is among the most research active departments in Canada, and is regarded as being among the top three in the country. The department is one of the best equipped and best funded in North America and has a faculty renowned internationally for its excellence in teaching and research.

Position summary

The Department of Chemistry is seeking a customer-service focused administrator with excellent organization skills and superior attention to detail to fulfill the Administrative Assistant role. Under the supervision of the Academic Department Manager, this position is responsible for delivering a comprehensive set of administrative services to support the teaching and research programs of the Department.

Duties

  • Greets visitors and delivers exceptional customer service assistance while providing an overall welcoming environment
  • Responds to a variety of inquiries from visitors, students, and staff; evaluates incoming calls and emails, and responds or redirects as appropriate
  • Maintains and updates the Department’s website and social media accounts
  • Coordinates travel arrangements for faculty, staff, and students when traveling for business purposes, such as conferences or recruitment events
  • Coordinates the Department’s Visiting Speaker Program
    • Assists faculty and student groups with organizing visiting speaker program events, advertising, arranging travel and catering, scheduling site bookings, and other associated activities
    • Coordinates all aspects of meetings and speaking events; including creating agendas, tracking action items, obtaining venue, equipment, catering, coordinating with external service providers, sending out communications, etc.
  • Provides guidance and assistance to students, staff, and visitors for entering and submitting travel & expense claims; completes paper claims for non-employees as required
  • Assists researchers with the initiation and troubleshooting of purchase requisitions, purchase orders, and invoices through SupplyNet
  • Requests Corporate Credit Cards for faculty and staff through the Staff Service Centre as required
  • Performs credit card verifications and reconciliations for Departmental credit card and assists PIs with the reconciliation of their credit cards
  • Reviews individual financial transactions and supporting documentation for accuracy, appropriate authorizations, and compliance to institutional and granting agency policies
  • Provides guidance and assists Principle Investigators (PIs) with the initiation of routine financial transactions for their research grants and escalates issues to the Staff Service Centre or assigned Financial Partner
  • Identifies, troubleshoots, and corrects/resolves transactional issues, while escalating broader, more complex issues
  • Provides multi-dimensional support to the CFI-funded projects held under the Department
  • Maintains financial spreadsheets and/or databases for various Departmental programs
  • Runs standard reports, compiles and maintains data and assembles and formats data to create simple reports
  • Photocopies, prints, and collates documents for faculty members and instructors; submits orders to external printing services as required
  • Sorts and distributes mail and maintains mailroom equipment and supplies by adding new users, ordering supplies for photocopiers and fax machines; troubleshooting problems and submitting service equipment service requests as necessary
  • Manages the Department’s conference rooms, books meeting requests and/or provides booking assistance and oversight; accepts, alters, rejects, cancels, or holds booking requests via a dedicated email account

Qualifications

  • Minimum Business Administration Diploma preferred; equivalent combinations of education and experience will be considered
  • Minimum of two years related office or administrative experience
  • Adaptable, agile and technologically savvy; advanced capability with MS Office suite, Google Applications and PeopleSoft systems
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication (verbal and written) skills including strong ability to demonstrate professionalism, confidentiality, and diplomacy
  • Demonstrated ability to take initiative and perform duties independently
  • Superior organization, accuracy, and attention to detail
  • Excellent spelling, grammar, editing, and proofreading skills
  • Ability to work in a fast paced, high volume environment
  • Strong business acumen to confidently work with multiple stakeholders
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills and critical thinking skills

How to Apply

Note: Online applications are accepted until midnight Mountain Standard Time of the closing date.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those individuals selected for an interview will be contacted.

The University of Alberta is committed to an equitable, diverse, and inclusive workforce. We welcome applications from all qualified persons. We encourage women; First Nations, Métis and Inuit persons; members of visible minority groups; persons with disabilities; persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity and expression; and all those who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas and the University to apply.

COVID-19 Vaccination: Proof of full vaccination against COVID-19 in compliance with the University’s COVID-19 Vaccination Directive. Fully Vaccinated means a status an individual achieves 14 days after having received the recommended number of doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada or the World Health Organization, and requires the individual to maintain the recommended number and type of vaccine doses as updated and required by Health Canada thereafter.

title: Catering Manager
company: Cambridge Red Deer Hotel & Conference Centre
description:
A HOTEL WITH THE FREEDOM OF STYLE!

Located in the heart of Central Alberta, the CAMBRIDGE RED DEER HOTEL & CONFERENCE CENTRE is the ideal place to start your career in hospitality while providing excellent and personalized service to our guests while working within a positive team environment.

Under the direction of the Director or Sales and Marketing, the Catering Manager is responsible for the direction and the full operation of the Catering Consultant team. The Catering Manager is responsible for revenue maximization, negotiation services and detail oriented planning to ensure flawless execution of group functions. Attention to detail is a must in this position with the planning and coordinating of meals, guestroom blocks and all other areas required to ensure meetings and events occur smoothly.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Train, supervise and work with all catering staff, in order to solicit and book banquet and catering functions;
  • Ensure customer satisfaction and maximize hotel revenue and profitability;
  • Maintain achievement of revenue goals;
  • Determines the customer's needs, space availability, meeting details and food and beverage requirements;
  • Evaluate profitability, timeliness, and desirability of the business;
  • Negotiate pricing and aggressively and immediately close the sale;
  • Responsible for maximizing revenues as well as maximizing function space usage and profitability;
  • Must practice superior sales skills that result in building/maintaining of professional business relations;
  • The individual must have solid knowledge of Delphi or equivalent and the ability to understand booking guidelines, and rate parameters;
  • Responsible for communication and following through with hotel management and outside vendors to ensure the sale commitment is fulfilled;
  • Distribute written communications detailing the needs of the customer and sales commitment (group resumes, event orders, etc.);
  • Responsible for establishing customer relationships that will encourage repeat business;
  • Maintains up to date computer data files to ensure proper coordination of sales commitment as well as customer needs;
  • Analyze and identify booking trends and patterns to maximize revenue opportunities;
  • Attend and participate in daily stand-up meetings, and other meetings as requested;
  • Act as a liaison with competitors, industry associations, keeping abreast of competitor's services, facilities, and accounts to ensure the hotel remains in a competitive position;
  • Prepare contracts, rate proposals and property information databases;
  • Maintain account files including signed contracts with current direct-bill applications;
  • Work with accounts payable to ensure clients on direct billing are paying in a timely manner;
  • Serve as effective liaison between hotel and accounts regarding billing;
  • Anticipate guests' needs, respond promptly and acknowledge all guests;
  • Maintain positive guest relations at all times, participate in hotel and departmental functions for clients and employees;
  • Facilitate Daily EO meetings; Responsible for collecting and reviewing EO's;
  • Review space releases prior to sending to DOSM for final approval;
  • Establish one-on-ones with Catering team to coach and develop;
  • Develop annual catering sales budget with DOSM and Director of F&B as required;
  • Maintain Catering forecast sharing this information is with the hotel Catering and Leadership team;
  • Develop and direct yearly/quarterly marketing plan to meet and exceed budgeted catering sales goal;
  • Maintain prospecting of at least 25 calls/visits per week; networking and attending at least one civic/professional activity per month;
  • Return all inquiry phone calls/walk-ins, conduct tours/entertain potential clients, create menu presentations for potential clients;
  • Communicate to Banquet Manager/Chef, the needs of the clients;
  • Coordinate sales efforts between hotel sales department and catering/private dining sales to ensure proper utilization of function space to yield maximum revenues;
  • Be part of creation of appropriate sales collateral and tools for department;
  • Ensure that function set- up meets and/or exceeds customer expectations by working closely with each group’s meeting planners to determine their needs for meeting rooms, food & beverage, and audio-visual equipment requirements;
  • In coordination with the banquet department, ensure functions meet the customer’s expectations by following up before and during the function;
  • Maintain control of functions including complete details of bookings in the software program provided;
  • Responsible for the day to day negotiation of prices with clients for catering functions and meeting rooms, as well as guest rooms and all aspects pertaining to each client file;
  • Prepare contracts for incoming catering client’s and prepare proposals for potential clients;
  • Conduct post-function reviews with clients;
  • Solicits re-booking from meeting planners prior to customer’s departure;
  • Take the initiative to exceed guest’s expectations;
  • Participate in sales missions and activities; participate in customer appreciation functions;
  • Acquire full knowledge of the hotel, in-house facilities, and local information to respond to guest inquiries;
  • Host pre-event meetings, as required, to ensure clients are comfortable with their decisions;
  • Performs other duties and special projects as assigned;

Education, Knowledge and Skills Required:

  • University or college diploma or degree in Business Administration or Hotel Management preferred
  • Two or more years experience in Catering and Events department preferred
  • Proven leadership skills; able to train and mentor Catering Team;
  • Strong multi-tasking abilities; exceptional communication and organizational skills;
  • Detail orientated with strong analytical and problem-solving skills;
  • Understands customers, builds organizational creditability;
  • Displays a positive attitude, maintains enthusiasm and celebrates successes with the team;
  • Meets deadlines that are decisive and achievement orientated;

Physical Requirements as per job description but will include more:

  • Ability to sit for extended periods of time;
  • Ability to work on a computer for extended period;
  • Repetitive work such as keyboarding, filing, answering phones, etc.;
  • Forward bending and squatting while performing filing duties;

Hours of Work:
The hours of work for this position are typically Monday to Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Additional hours or hours outside of these timelines may be required due to operational requirements. Any additional hours or overtime must be approved by the Director of Sales and Marketing prior to being worked.
Full Time hours: 40 hours per week
Job Types: Full Time, Permanent

The CAMBRIDGE RED DEER HOTEL & CONFERENCE CENTRE is an equal opportunity employer and believes diversity strengthens us as a workplace;

All applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada. The successful candidate will be subject to a criminal record check and/or other background checks. This position will remain open until a suitable candidate is found. We appreciate and consider all applications; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

Job Type: Full-time

opportunities;', "Determines the customer's needs, space availability, meeting details and food and beverage requirements;", 'Must practice superior sales skills that result in building/maintaining of professional business relations;', 'Responsible for maximizing revenues as well as maximizing function space usage and profitability;', 'Distribute written communications detailing the needs of the customer and sales commitment (group resumes, event orders, etc.);', 'Ensure customer satisfaction and maximize hotel revenue and profitability;', 'Negotiate pricing and aggressively and immediately close the sale;', 'Maintain account files including signed contracts with current direct-bill applications;', 'Establish one-on-ones with Catering team to coach and develop;', 'Responsible for the day to day negotiation of prices with clients for catering functions and meeting rooms, as well as guest rooms and all aspects pertaining to each client file;', 'Maintain Catering forecast sharing this information is with the hotel Catering and Leadership team;', 'Responsible for communication and following through with hotel management and outside vendors to ensure the sale commitment is fulfilled;', 'Prepare contracts for incoming catering client’s and prepare proposals for potential clients;', "Anticipate guests' needs, respond promptly and acknowledge all guests;"]

title: Catering Manager
description:
Department:

Food & Beverage

Job Classification:

Full Time Salaried

A multi-award winning facility, the Metro Toronto Convention Centre (MTCC) has earned a solid reputation as North America’s leading Convention Centre, and has held over 18,000 events and hosted over 55 million guests since opening for business in October 1984. Covering over 2 million square feet, the MTCC is Canada’s largest convention facility, boasting seven exhibit halls, two large capacity ballrooms, and a beautiful 1,232 seat theatre among its many assets. It also houses 70 fully furnished meeting rooms, and 167,000 square feet of beautifully decorated pre-function spaces.

The MTCC is conveniently connected to Toronto’s Union Station railway and transit station through the Skywalk and is also accessible via the city’s underground PATH system.

MTCC is a Crown Corporation of the Province of Ontario and is proudly governed and led by an executive management team and an independent board of directors comprised of senior private sector business leaders. The mandate of the company is to position the Centre as a world-class destination, while helping to generate economic benefit to the community and at the same time remaining financially self-sufficient.

The Metro Toronto Convention Centre prides itself on its professionalism, responsiveness, and dedication to making every event it hosts memorable for its customers and guests alike.

Multiple full time positions have become available in our Food & Beverage Catering department. Reporting to the Director of Catering, you are an enthusiastic, organized, service oriented individual who will manage the day to day operations and functions of all aspects of assigned food & beverage events including direct client and supplier management, food & beverage event planning and revenue forecasting through to the successful completion of the event. This exciting and engaging client focused role is best suited to a highly organized, outgoing, welcoming and collaborative individual. Working both closely with other teams and independently when needed. Flexible hours including some evenings and weekends are required. The ideal candidate has worked in food & beverage and event plan operations and is now ready to expand their skill set within a high volume operation.

JOB DESCRIPTION

  • Guide clients through the event and food & beverage planning process within the Centre.
  • Analyze proposed client programs putting forth recommendations and advice to clients and suppliers to ensure success of assigned events.
  • Consult with Chefs on menu design, custom menus, additions or alterations.
  • Ensure that event orders for all functions are prepared and issued to the client and all relevant internal departments in a timely manner.
  • Manage all finances related to assigned accounts including forecasting, contract reviews and payment schedules.
  • Prepare food & beverage event plans for client events.
  • Design floor plans to support assigned food & beverage client events.
  • Ensure clarity in all communications with stakeholders, both internal and external.

JOB SKILLS AND REQUIREMENTS

Education: Hospitality Management Certificate or a Degree in a related field or equivalent industry experience.

Experience: 5 years minimum experience in a catering/special events and client management environment.

  • Microsoft Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel) skills are essential. Familiarity with other catering/event management software helpful.
  • Detail oriented, with strong organizational and time management skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to handle significant number of assigned events while prioritizing clients’ needs.
  • Numeracy and financial experience for budgeting and forecasting.
  • Ability to understand and manage a wide range of customers and various expectations.
  • Flexibility and the ability to solve problems in a variety of circumstances.
  • Developed customer service experience essential.

For a behind the scenes look at how our team helps our customers create successful events, visit our Instagram page:

@lifeatmtcc

May 6, 2022

Please note: The Metro Toronto Convention Centre is proud to provide employment accommodation during the recruitment process. During any stage of the recruitment process, applicants have the right to request accommodation.

title: newAssistant Manager
description:
Schedule
Includes some evenings and weekends

Education Level
Diploma or Degree

Career Level
Experienced in Hospitality industry




Job Description


JOB PURPOSE: Under the direction of the Senior Manager or Catering Manager, the Assistant Manager assists in the day-to-day task supervision of the restaurant (The Buttery) and catering operations as assigned. This position is an entry level management position in Hospitality Services. The incumbent provides consistent supervision to front-line staff to ensure operational efficiency, maintaining department standards for food qualify and presentation, service, safety and sanitation while assisting management in meeting and exceeding customer needs and the goals & objectives of the department.

GENERAL SKILLS: Demonstrated initiative and interest in progressive management opportunities

Good supervisory and organizational skills

Must be computer literate

Good communication and human resources

Ability to supervise and work side by side with service staff

Ability to cater to a wide customer base

Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines

Key Accountabilities:

  • Operational Management
    • Under the direction of the Senior Manager, Catering Manager or Associate Manager, assist in the day-to-day supervision of operations within Hospitality Services.
    • Provides supervision and direction to employees.
    • Operates under objectives set by the Senior Manager, Catering Manager or Associate Manager.
    • Assists in the monitoring of operational functions of assigned operation; including ensuring supplies and items ordered, identifying and recommending labour and food cost issues, and be conscious of the operational contribution of the unit.
    • Monitors inventory level, assists in ordering food and supplies
    • Assists with scheduling of staff
    • Ensures marketing, operational standards and service standards are executed and followed within assigned units
    • Assists with providing training to employees
    • Involved in front-line customer service, set-up and clean-up when needed in peak demand.
  • Human Resource Management
    • Provides direction to unionized and casual employees
    • Establish work priorities, shows employees how to do tasks, allocate staff during a shift
    • Assists with providing training by working side by side with employees to understand where training gaps exist, suggesting training programs to the Associate Manager, Catering Manager, or Chef Manager.
    • Fosters and supports a team-based work environment, empowering staff as they provide exceptional customer service.
    • Encourages staff to achieve high standards and apply creative skills in the presentation of food items.
    • Ensures healthy and safe working conditions for the staff to achieve objectives of injury reduction.

EDUCATION &

EXPERIENCE: College Diploma in Food and Beverage Management or equivalent plus a minimum of two years in junior management or supervisory capacity in a Hotel, Club or Restaurant.


  • Please note that the starting salary is expected to be approximately $52,500 per year. This position provides full benefits, Group RRSP, Management Professional Development Allowance, 3 weeks of vacation (increases with years of service), and paid time off during the Christmas break.




How To Apply


To apply for this job, please submit your application online.


Employment Equity Statement


McMaster University is located on the traditional territories of the Haudenosaunee and Mississauga Nations and within the lands protected by the “Dish With One Spoon” wampum agreement.

The diversity of our workforce is at the core of our innovation and creativity and strengthens our research and teaching excellence. In keeping with its Statement on Building an Inclusive Community with a Shared Purpose, McMaster University strives to embody the values of respect, collaboration and diversity, and has a strong commitment to employment equity.

The University seeks qualified candidates who share our commitment to equity and inclusion, who will contribute to the diversification of ideas and perspectives, and especially welcomes applications from indigenous (First Nations, Métis or Inuit) peoples, members of racialized communities, persons with disabilities, women, and persons who identify as 2SLGBTQ+.

As part of McMaster’s commitment, all applicants are invited to complete a confidential Applicant Diversity Survey through the online application submission process. The Survey questionnaire requests voluntary self-identification in relation to equity-seeking groups that have historically faced and continue to face barriers in employment. Please refer to the Applicant Diversity Survey - Statement of Collection for additional information.

Job applicants requiring accommodation to participate in the hiring process should contact:

  • Human Resources Service Centre at 905-525-9140 ext. 222-HR (22247), or
  • Faculty of Health Sciences HR Office at ext. 22207, or
  • School of Graduate Studies at ext. 23679

to communicate accommodation needs.


Vaccination Policy Statement


The University is committed to providing and maintaining healthy and safe working and learning environments for all employees, students, volunteers and visitors. In accordance with the University’s Vaccination Policy-COVID-19 Requirements for Employees and Students (the “Vaccination Policy”), effective October 18, 2021 all McMaster community members, including employees, accessing a McMaster campus or facility in person are required to be fully vaccinated or to have received an exemption from the University for a valid human rights ground. This is a term and condition of employment. The University will continue to follow the guidance of public health organizations to define fully vaccinated status.

Further information is available at the following link: https://covid19.mcmaster.ca/vaccination-mandate/. More information on the University’s Health and Safety framework is available online at https://hr.mcmaster.ca/resources/covid19/.

title: newEvents Manager
description:
Employment Opportunity


Events Manager

Toronto, Canada


TO Live has a full-time opportunity in its Patron and Event Services Department in the role of Events Manager. Reporting to the Director Patron and Event Services, the Events Manager in collaboration with the Executive Chef, Catering Manager and TO Live’s Sales Managers will provide leadership in the planning, coordination, and execution of corporate, private, and social internal and external events.


ACTIVITIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES


Event Coordination

  • Responsible for operational components of all assigned events once contracted by Sales Managers. Coordination of all elements of events while managing event process may include executing client meetings, preparing event details, creating and monitoring event budgets and sourcing external resources if required.
  • Liaise with all other required departments when planning and executing an event and insure timely completion of all event components as per client’s requirements.
  • Work with Executive Chef and the client to determine a proper menu for each event. Must coordinate menu planning meetings as required with all relevant parties.
  • Must be available to clients at all times during their events while observing and managing key service components of events.
  • Responsible for coordinating non-food supplies required for each event, including but not limited to linens and laundry suppliers, staffing agencies, equipment rental companies and florists.
  • Attend to and take all necessary action, statutory or otherwise, in the event of incidents or accident of fire, theft, loss, damage, unfit food, or other irregularities and take such action that may be appropriate.
  • Responsible for coordinating the layout for the event space according to the clients’ requirements and health & safety requirements. This relates to but is not limited to tables, seating, food stations, coat check, bars, food service areas, clearing stations, entertainment, dance floor and decor either with internal or external vendors to help supply equipment.
  • Coordinate internal receptions and meetings as assigned
  • Coordinate artist rider/backstage catering requirements as assigned
  • Incorporate and adhere to TO Live’s Covid-19 Workplace Safety Plan throughout coordination

Staff Coordination

  • Determine appropriate number of staff (service and bar) required to deliver on event requirements.
  • Organize, lead and motivate the catering team including but not limited to internal and external staffing resources to deliver event requirements.
  • Ensuring health and safety regulations are strictly observed by all staff working during set-up for events and event day, as per Toronto Public Health and TO Live Covid-19 Workplace Safety guidelines.
  • Report any faulty equipment to management/client, ensure they are rectified and ensure equipment is not used until safe.
  • Ensure that all employees project a positive, approachable, friendly and professional image.

Administrative Duties

  • Work with Sales Manager to ensure that all costs and expenditures are within the budgeted levels agreed upon in the estimate.
  • Ensure that all written communication represents a professional image to customers, clients and staff.
  • Keep financial and administrative records of any changes that may affect the final billing for each event.
  • Input and update relevant event information into EBMS (Event Business Management Software)
  • Ensure appropriate product inventory is taken prior to and at the conclusion of each event.
  • Any and all other assigned duties as required.

JOB SPECIFICATIONS

  • Five to eight years’ experience in event management.
  • The ability to work well independently on several projects concurrently, and possess excellent communication, organizational and creative thinking skills.
  • Focus on maximizing revenue consistent with providing the client with value and exceptional service.
  • Effective management skills within a unionized environment.
  • Ability to manage simultaneous deadlines.
  • Software proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point, is required; knowledge and experience in the event management booking software is preferred. Experience with EBMS, Auto/Turbo CAD an asset.
  • Strong initiative and hospitality orientation; Project Management, organizational and prioritizing skills; problem solving and detail oriented.
  • Demonstrate flexibility, pleasant persona coupled with sound judgment, discreet and able to maintain confidential information.

WORKING CONDITIONS

  • Extreme noise during some events.
  • Physical discomfort caused by lack of formal meal or comfort breaks.
  • Ability to move freely and quickly for long periods of time.
  • Variable hours of work depending on event schedules including late nights.
  • Lack of natural light in workplace.
  • Travel between TO Live venues as required.
  • Adhere to the TO Live Health & Safety policies and protocols including Covid vaccine and guidelines.

THE ORGANIZATION:


TO Live is one of Canada’s largest multi-arts organizations, operating three iconic venues: Meridian Hall, the St. Lawrence Centre for the Arts and Meridian Arts Centre. In addition, TO Live presents a full range of performing arts, theatrical and concert events at these venues in both downtown and uptown Toronto. With these two hubs of creativity and content creation, TO Live has a unique place and perspective to activate creative spaces by inspiring local and international artists, connect audiences and to be the nexus for new ideas, elevate artistic potential, and be the catalyst for creative expression that is reflective of Toronto’s diversity.


HOW TO APPLY:


Interested applicants should apply through our TO Live careers website at: https://tolive.bamboohr.com/jobs/


No phone calls or emails please. TO Live thanks all applicants in advance. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.


Together with the Toronto Public Service’s (TPS) initiatives, which TO Lives follows and adheres too, TO Live encourages applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized persons/persons of colour, persons with disabilities, women, LGBTQ2S persons, and others who may contribute to fostering innovative ideas and solutions.


We ask that you complete the questions provided as part of the online application to assist us in ensuring our recruitment process and programs are equitable and accessible. Your responses are voluntary and the information that you provide is strictly confidential.


We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environment in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). The Human Resources department will work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.


Date Posted: May 06, 2022

Application Deadline: May 19, 2022

Start Date: As soon as possible

title: Catering Sales Manager - Fixed Term Contract
description:
Join our team!
Are you ready to take the next big step in your hospitality career? Four Seasons Hotel Toronto is currently looking for a talented and dynamic Catering Sales Manager who shares our passion for excellence and who infuses enthusiasm into everything he/she does!
The Catering Manager is responsible for booking catering events for the hotel or resort. The Catering Manager will oversee all aspects of client liaison and build new client relationships within the marketplace on a continuous basis. Dealing with group business and private individual clients, the Catering Manager is responsible for planning all details of an event and managing client requirements to ensure that events run smoothly and accounts are kept in order for a seamless follow-up after all events. This is a fixed term position with an approximate end date of July 2023.
Job Requirements
We are looking for individuals who have a solid knowledge of food and beverage, able to evidence strong business acumen, have a proven track record displaying creativity and excellent communication skills. Applicants are required to have three to five years experience in service related food and beverage positions with supervisory and management experience included. A college degree preferably specializing in hotel/restaurant management is required.
Preferred qualifications & skills
  • Exceptional communication skills and command of English language
  • Good organizational skills
  • Attention to detail and ability to multitask
  • Able to handle a large volume of telephone calls in an efficient and professional manner.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, Lotus Notes, Opera and Delphi.
  • Food & Beverage knowledge is a plus.
  • Works well under pressure and is a team player.
ABOUT FOUR SEASONS HOTELS & RESORTS
Four Seasons is dedicated to perfecting the travel experience through continual innovation and the highest standards of hospitality. The deeply instilled Four Seasons culture is personified by its employees – people who share a single focus and are inspired to offer great service. At Four Seasons, we believe in recognizing a familiar face, welcoming a new one and treating every one we meet the way we would want to be treated ourselves. Whether you work with us, stay with us, live with us, discover with us, we believe our purpose is to create impressions that will stay with you for a lifetime. It comes from our belief that life is richer when we truly connect to the people and the world around us.
What to expect
  • Employee Travel Program that includes complimentary room nights & employee experience rates at Four Seasons Hotels & Resorts with discounted meals and other services at each location
  • Excellent Training and Development opportunities
  • Educational assistance, access to E-Cornell University online courses at discounted pricing as well as in-house training workshops for line and management employees.
  • Complimentary Employee Meals
  • A robust extended flex benefit plan, including medical, HCSA, dental, vision, life insurance, DPSP/RRSP and paid time off.
Learn more about what it’s like to work for Four Seasons:
http://jobs.fourseasons.com
https://www.linkedin.com/company/four-seasons-hotels-and-resorts
Learn more about Four Seasons Toronto on Social Media:
Instagram: @FSToronto
Twitter: @FSToronto
Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/FourSeasonsHotelToronto/
We look forward to receiving your application!
Four Seasons is committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation.

title: newCatering Manager
description:
You might not know our name, but you know where we are. That’s because Compass Group Canada is part of a global foodservice and support services company that’s the 6th largest employer in the world, with 625,000 employees.


You’ll find us in schools, colleges, hospitals, office buildings, senior living communities, tourist attractions, sports venues, remote camps and military installations and more. We’re in all major cities, at remote work sites and everywhere in between – doing business in Canada and 50+ other countries where you can learn and grow. Join us now and point your career forward!


Imagine creating a place where tomorrow’s leaders, big thinkers, and dreamers gather. Join us and know that you make it possible for others to learn, grow, and discover. Because of what we do, students and faculty share so much more than a meal. And that’s why this is so much more than a job.

Why work with Chartwells? We are a member of Compass Group Canada, the leading foodservice and support services company. We cater to Generation Z on college campuses and upcoming K-12 generations. We offer dining programs and solutions that fit the unique needs of today’s students. Join our commitment to providing responsible, healthy-eating solutions.


Click here to view our Team Member video!

Job Summary

Now, if you were to come on board as our Catering Manager, we’d ask you to do the following for us:


  • Monitor and organize catering orders with weekly invoicing
  • Perform administrative duties, including: All booking, coordinating and follow-up on all catering events, reconciling billing and invoices and preparing month end
  • Ensure specifications and requests of each catering event are communicated and executed down the channel effectively
  • Work collaboratively on menu planning with clients and Executive Chef, and identify revenue-generating opportunities
  • Assist in production, hiring, employee training, staff scheduling, associate supervising, as well as addressing and resolving employee relations issues
  • Direct department activities and maintain highest-quality service standards
  • Maintain compliance with industry, company, and legislative standards
  • Develop team and provide performance improvement programs


Think you have what it takes to be our next Catering Manager? We’re committed to hiring the best talent for the role. Here’s how we’ll know you’ll be successful in the role.


  • Degree in Hospitality/Food Service
  • AFST (Advanced Food Safety Training)
  • Strong management skills, capable of motivating, leading and developing associates
  • Excellent client relationship-building and communication skills
  • At least three or more years of related hospitality experience in a food service environment, as well as 3 years’ supervisory experience
  • Ability to control food and labour costs
  • Detail-oriented and a strong team player
  • Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
  • Proven Microsoft Office skills (Word, Excel, Outlook) and comfortable with utilizing multiple supporting programs
  • Must have ability to support managing larger groups in the main Retail Food operation

Compass Group Canada is committed to nurturing a diverse workforce representative of the communities within which we operate. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to race, colour, citizenship, religion, sex, marital / family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply.


For accommodation requests during the hiring process, please contact PeopleHub@compass-canada.com for further information.
