title: newAssistant Manager - Offsite Catering & Events
description:
Company Description


Whether in our kitchens, dining rooms, event venues or offices, our singular purpose is to captivate guests with our unparalleled quality, service, and food and wine knowledge. We achieve this only through the excellence, innovation and passion of our team members. If you are seeking a rewarding career that involves first rate training and education, mentoring and development, attractive compensation, and inspiring rewards and recognition, consider joining Oliver and Bonacini Restaurants.


Job Description


Under the direction of the Operations Manager, Offsite Catering & Events, the Assistant Manager is accountable for the day to day operations of the business including staffing, cost controls, staff training, budgeting and active floor management during events.

PRIMARY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Communicates the vision to all team members and leads by example. Reinforces the O&B values daily and inspires the team with his/her exciting vision for the future
  • Regularly monitors and achieves the O&B points of technical service and points of details
  • Builds and maintains relationships with guests, team members and senior management alike
  • Assists with the tracking of sales, invoicing, and managing inventory
  • Conduct briefings with event service staff prior to each function
  • Schedules event staff to properly service events/functions
  • Ensure accuracy and timeliness of payroll records
  • Strive for maximum efficiency and continual improvement of staff productivity
  • Follows bar, beverage and wine control procedures exactly
  • Shows leadership in creating a culture that revolves around the experience and enjoyment of food and wine
  • Demonstrates high personal integrity, business ethics and takes every opportunity to promote the venue
  • Conducts recruitment and selection and training and development initiatives as well as performance management and employee coaching
  • Uses conflict/resolution and problem solving skills
  • Participate on Health & Safety Committee, ensuring that the Occupational Health & Safety Act and WSIB procedures are being followed
  • Ensure catering facility is well maintained, repaired and spotless at all times
  • Build relationships with vendors, suppliers and key contacts at catering partner venues

ONSITE EXPECTATIONS

  • Client greeting and pre-event walk though
  • Review timeline and key moments of event with client
  • Lead onsite Event Server team for setup, execution and tear down of the event
  • Connect with staffing agency lead when applicable to ensure expectations are being met
  • Work directly with Culinary team and communicates last minute details, has pre-event meeting confirm timing and plan for the event
  • Expo all food from kitchen during event
  • Ensure set up is per floor plan and client changes
  • Liaise and grow relationships with catering partner venue managers and key partner contacts

Qualifications
  • Post-secondary diploma/degree in Business or Hospitality (preferred)
  • Minimum 2 years’ experience managing a variety of events (large and high profile functions)
  • WSET Intermediate Wine Certificate or comparable an asset
  • Must possess superior verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to demonstrate extreme organization in a fast paced environment
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage a large and variable work load, ensuring timely and accurate completion of assigned work
  • Proficiency in all Microsoft Office applications including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook
  • Strong business acumen
  • Team player

Additional Information


** We thank all applicants for their interest in Oliver & Bonacini Hospitality; however, only suitable candidates will be contacted to continue the application process. **

title: Receptionist and Administrative Assistant
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.


The opportunity


You’ll join our Enterprise Support Services (ESS) team, helping to support the important business enablement functions that keep our organization running strong. You will work across teams to provide the knowledge, resources and tools that help EY deliver exceptional quality service to our clients, win in the marketplace and support EY’s growth and profitability.


The hybrid role of Receptionist and Administrative Assistant provides administrative support and acts as a first point of contact for the firm and is a trusted advisor to our client-serving managers and senior managers who leverage the BSG. You are a driven administrative professional who is solution oriented. This is an on-site position.


Your key responsibilities


As a Receptionist and Administrative Assistant, you are the first point of contact for the firm, an active member of BSG supporting customer requests through our national queue while working in tandem with your colleagues to understand and anticipate customer’s needs to exceed expectations. Your key responsibilities include:


Reception coverage

  • Greet and maintain electronic visitor log
  • Answer queries, direct calls and monitor shared mailbox
  • Maintain Security badges: track all visitor and temporary building and/or office security badges
  • Maintain Reception Reference Manual: Stay informed; refer and update reception manual as needed
  • Light office maintenance: wiping down counters, emptying dishwasher, maintaining reception area
  • Mail/courier: sorting, distributing documents and packages; preparing documents and packages for pick up or delivery
  • Equipment management: Understand and operate office equipment, place service calls as needed
  • Supply provisioning and inventory control: Ordering, maintaining and distributing office supplies


Customer support

  • Engagement support: In-depth knowledge to support the client engagement management process, including tracking and reporting time and expenses as needed
  • Financial management support: Pivotal role with the engagement teams to provide reports and manage the billing process
  • Client Relationship Management (CRM): Support EY’s CRM tool
  • Document preparation and management: Use EY branding standards to create and format documents/presentations
  • Travel arrangements: Provide travel options, book air and ground travel using our online system, as well as associated logistics
  • Meeting and events: Coordinate meeting room bookings, including technology, set-up/tear down and catering where required


Skills and attributes for success

  • Committed to contributing to a strong team culture to ensure success
  • Ability to effectively meet customer needs, taking responsibility for customer satisfaction
  • Ability to maintain effectiveness and professionalism when experiencing change in work tasks and/or the work environment
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, team environment and under pressure of deadlines
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including active listening
  • Effective time management and organizational skills
  • Develop and maintain relationships to efficiently leverage expertise
  • Sound judgement regarding confidential and sensitive matters
  • Proven ability to meet multiple and/or unexpected deadlines in a demanding environment
  • Embraces change and has experience with process redesign
  • Motivated and driven to continuously improve by learning new skills


To qualify for the role, you must have

  • Post secondary education and/or equivalent relevant experience
  • Exceptional customer service experience
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint) with proven ability to learn customized software/tools



Ideally, you’ll also have

  • Professional services firm experience
  • General understanding of financial principles as they relate to the billing of chargeable time


What we offer

We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package allows you decide which benefits are right for you and which ones help you create a solid foundation for your future. Our Total Rewards package includes a comprehensive medical, prescription drug and dental coverage, a defined contribution pension plan, a great vacation policy plus firm paid days that allow you to enjoy longer long weekends throughout the year, statutory holidays and paid personal days (based on province of residence), and a range of exciting programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:

  • Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry
  • Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
  • The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you


Diversity and Inclusion at EY


Diversity and inclusiveness are at the heart of who we are and how we work. We’re committed to fostering an environment where differences are valued, policies and practices are equitable, and our people feel a sense of belonging. From our actions to combat systemic racism and our advocacy for the LGBT+ community to our innovative Neurodiversity Centre of Excellence and Accessibility initiatives, we welcome and embrace the diverse experiences, abilities, backgrounds and perspectives that make our people unique and help guide us. Because when people feel free to be their authentic selves at work, they bring their best and are empowered to build a better working world.


EY Way of Work and your health and safety


EY Way of Work recognizes flexibility in the way we collaborate, innovate and deliver with the ability to work in-person and remotely. To support a healthy and safe in-person working environment, EY has implemented various layers of health and safety controls while working in the office or at client or other locations. A critical component of EY’s workplace safety program includes our COVID-19 vaccination policy which requires all personnel to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless an accommodation based on a reason protected by human rights legislation is provided.


If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.


EY | Building a better working world


EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.


Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.


Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

title: Catering Sales Manager
description:
Danish Pastry House is looking for an experienced Catering Sales candidate that can launch our corporate catering program. Our successful candidate will have had corporate catering experience, preferably in Toronto’s Financial District.

The Catering Sales Manager position is responsible for cultivating and increasing catering sales in the local trade area of the GTA by soliciting new catering business via lead generation and catering sales marketing.

This position $50000 per year base salary+Commission

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

Solicit new catering customers through traditional and non-traditional sales techniques, including cold calling, direct outside sales and relationship building.

Build new relationships with corporate clients, as well as existing catering customers through phone communication, personal visits with sample products, and community events to ensure repeat business.

Effectively demonstrate required sales techniques to build sales and provide ongoing support of the customer to gain repeat orders.

Maintain on-going contact with catering customers through follow-up calls, thank-you letters, seeking feedback on catering orders and requesting referrals.

Utilize reports to track customer frequency, sales, average sales per order, etc.

Maintain detailed customer lists for mailing and follow-up systems.

Manage the sales cycle, quotas, customer follow-up and service requests for all customers.

Coordinate and work with our Head office ordering team to plan menus, orders, and deliveries with customers and us the opportunity to utilize suggestive selling techniques and reinforce our quality products and services.

Resolve customer complaints by investigating problems, developing solutions, and making recommendations to COO and CEO.

Keep COO abreast of your progress through daily activity logs, phone calls, attending regular head office meetings.

Set up and maintain house accounts.

Assist in catering deliveries if needed.

Maintain behaviours and actions consistent with the company’s values and standards.

Work additional hours as needed.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $50,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Tips

Benefits:

  • On-site parking
  • Store discount

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

title: newStore Manager
description:
Manager Position

Riverbank General Store and Café is a social enterprise in Mill Village NS which is part of the Queens Association for Supported Living (QASL). The Store is a historic landmark overlooking the beautiful Medway River.

The Riverbank General Store and Café originated from the dreams of individuals with disabilities to work in the community alongside individuals without disabilities as valued members of the work force.

We are looking for a Manager with a business background to join us on the journey and to continue the evolution of the business. The Riverbank Store and Café is an old-fashioned general store with a seasonal Café which provides lunch services, a weekly take-home dinner, and a small catering business.

The Role:

Reporting to the QASL Vocational Manager, some of your responsibilities would be:

· Managing the overall operation while delivering a first-class customer experience

· Management of a team

· Processing sales through Point of Sales system, monitor inventory and product costing

· Use of an email system, spreadsheets, website, and social media

· Promote products and services of parent company QASL and Penny Lane Enterprises

· Develop relationships with other Social Enterprises to promote local and meaningful products

· Carrying out daily tasks of Store and Café

Who We Are Looking For:

The ideal candidate will have a business degree with good general knowledge of retail and have experience working in a store environment or extensive hands-on training and experience in the retail sector. We are looking for someone with strong leadership abilities, who is able to think outside the box, has an engaging personality and superior customer skills that they can share with the team.

The successful candidate needs to have strong organizational and time management skills, effective communication, ability to delegate, and marketing skills. Flexibility is a must as there will be occasional evening and weekend work in order to effectively manage the team.

We are looking for someone who buys into our vision of providing people with employment barriers opportunities to develop skills in a community environment and to prove that people with disabilities are valuable employees.

Why will you want to work with us?

· Competitive Salary

· Health and Pension Benefits

· Autonomy

· Our customers are wonderful people!

· You have a team to support you

· Our team is dedicated and fierce about what we do

To apply, submit your resume with a cover letter

Deadline: 4:00pm on May 13th, 2022

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: From $42,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

COVID-19 considerations:
PPE provided

Application deadline: 2022-05-13

title: Administrative Coordinator
description:
Atkinson Construction is a general contracting, construction management and design build firm located in St Albert that services the public and private sector across Western Canada. The Administrative Coordinator will support the office manager and other office staff as follows:

Responsibilities

  • Perform processes related to project accounting and reporting in order to support job records, budgets and progress payments of ongoing projects
  • Monitor, order and organize office supplies as needed.
  • Provide backup coverage for Reception.
  • General Administrative tasks -- learn various other tasks to provide backup coverage and assistance (such as processing expenses, writing, and data entry).
  • Ensure cleanliness of shared space by ensuring that meeting rooms are kept clean during business hours and replenishing cleaning and sanitizing supplies as needed.
  • Be a key member of the office safety team that ensures we are compliant (keep track of fire wardens & first aiders, conduct inspections and fire drills, etc.).
  • Assist with event planning by organizing catering requirements for meetings and events.
  • Assist with and organize the storage of documents, materials and supplies
  • Assist the Information Technology team with minor IT help as required.

Qualifications

  • Experience in an administrative or customer service role
  • Provide high quality, professional service and attention to detail
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Basic computer skills, with experience preferred in Microsoft Office products such as Outlook, Word, Excel, Teams and SharePoint
  • Valid Driver's License
  • Strong organizational skills and ability to manage diverse tasks and multiple customers

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $34,008.00-$60,192.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • Secondary School (preferred)

Experience:

  • Front desk: 1 year (preferred)
  • Administrative experience: 1 year (preferred)

title: Sales & Catering Manager
company: Delta Hotels by Marriott Kingston Waterfront
description:
POSITION OVERVIEW:

Reporting to the Director of Sales, the Sales & Catering Manager works to develop and maintain long term, value-based customer relationships with existing and potential clients in order to achieve personal and team related goals in guestrooms, banquets, and private dining revenue.

KEY AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY:

  • Respond to inquiries efficiently and in a timely manner in an effort to provide exceptional customer service and to increase our hotels revenues
  • Issue proposals, contracts, negotiate and close business in the market segments as assigned and discussed with the Director of Sales
  • Negotiate and book new and repeat guestroom, banquet, and meeting business
  • Pass leads and pertinent client information on to Director of Sales where appropriate
  • Promote hotel using various methods including: sales and events kits, packages, flyers, email blasts, social media, guest room TV, websites, etc
  • Negotiate prices, prepare accurate quotes and confirm by written contracts
  • Attend trade shows, community events and industry meetings to maximize sales and revenue generation
  • Assist with annual Sales and Catering plan and subsequent monthly progress reports
  • Remain up-to-date on hotel’s competitive set and effectively sell against them
  • Participate in weekly revenue management meetings
  • Liaise with Kitchen, Banquet and Front Office departments for smooth transition to arrival for group
  • Solicit post-event follow-up, evaluate client experience and re-solicit business
  • Coordinate and maximize catering revenue opportunities including promotion of our sister properties

The above areas of responsibility are not all inclusive and may be amended from time to time.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Minimum of 2 years of sales experience, preferably in a catering environment
  • Completion of a two year community college diploma in a related area or equivalent
  • Ability to multitask while focusing on revenue goals
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Client-focused and a team player
  • Ensure a professional attitude and proper business attire while on property and ready to meet with clients at any time
  • Able to establish rapport with clients quickly to ensure guest satisfaction and repeat business
  • Excellent analytical, problem solving, organizational and interpersonal skills
  • Excellent time management skills and attention to detail
  • Highly motivated, a self-starter, and work with minimal supervision
  • Strong computer skills - Opera experience a definite asset
  • Must be able to work general office hours (8:30 – 4:30) with flexibility to work the occasional evening or weekend.
  • The Company's COVID-19 Workplace Vaccination Policy requires that all employees be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Individuals who are not vaccinated for medical reasons or other protected ground under the OHRC can request an exemption from the employer. If approved the individual will be subject to other health and safety guidelines.

Delta Hotels by Marriott Kingston Waterfront will make accommodation available to job applicants with disabilities in the recruitment process. During this process, if an applicant requests accommodation, please contact Human Resources at 613-650-5420 and we will consult with the applicant and arrange for a suitable accommodation that takes into account the applicant’s accessibility needs.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $50,000.00-$55,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Discounted or free food
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Sales: 2 years (preferred)

title: newExecutive Assistant and Office Manager
description:
Reporting to: VP, Talent Management Introduction: Our goal at Pivotree is to help accelerate the future of frictionless commerce. We will help lead this change over the next decade because we believe a future where technology is embedded intimately into all aspects of our everyday lives can benefit everyone and will shape the interactions with the brands we love. We will help shape the future of frictionless commerce by working together with some of the best brands in the world and some of the best people in the industry to leverage converging technologies that will make it possible to accelerate frictionless commerce faster than ever. Pivotree provides services focused on the design, implementation, management, and maintenance of complex ecommerce solutions for large enterprises.

We provide the technical skills necessary to enable the effective use of technologies combined with the business context to leverage a solution to solve our clients' business challenges. We strive to fill the gaps in available technology with our own IP to reduce the barriers to adoption. We enable inclusive, immersive and highly personalized experiences for our clients and their customers. We build our products with a view to productizing and scaling technology to lower the costs and reduce the risks of implementing and managing our integrated solutions.

Each of our solutions starts with reliable and reputable e-commerce and MDM platforms, which run on enterprise grade infrastructure that are customized to meet a variety of client needs, situations, and budgets. Over the next 10 years we will add new categories and capabilities that will define frictionless commerce ecosystems. This is a journey of technology acceleration combined with consumer readiness and adoption. We are looking for people capable of adapting relentlessly to the rapidly evolving world around us.

Position Summary: This successful candidate will provide extensive support to the leadership team and interact productively with external stakeholders and take care of all office management activities. As an active contributor, they coordinate meetings and events and participate on selected projects and initiatives as needed. This role requires a person that communicates effectively verbally and in writing. The successful candidate will be someone that thrives in a team environment, has a flexible mindset and enjoys working in a fast-paced business environment.

Must be available to come to the Toronto office from time to time. Roles & Responsibilities: Executive Assistant • Help senior executives be the most productive they can by helping them to focus on the highest value-add activities and reducing distractions. • Manage the calendar of the senior executives, set up appropriate work and meeting times. • Help manage travel and hotel for the senior executives • Help create an annual calendar for board and earnings related meetings.

  • Coordinate and manage meeting requests from the CEO and executives. • Manage recurring meeting guest lists to ensure invites are up to date • Book out-of-office lunch and dinners for small and large groups • Work on quarterly earnings call video subtitles for public distribution • Send out appreciation gifts for occasions that arise • Schedule quarterly post earnings call with investors • Manage sensitive matters with a high level of confidentiality and discretion especially decisions directly impacting the global operations of the company. Office Manager: • Partner with HR to coordinate onboarding and off-boarding of executive employees (manage and coordinate procurement, including new equipment for employees). • Coordinate org-wide meetings and assist with internal communications • Oversee and manage relationships with vendors and suppliers, including negotiating contracts • Help set up travel accounts for executives , in addition to serving as a liaison between the agent and employee for last minute travel.
  • Be the main point of contact for building related issues • Help us maintain a safe and secure workplace by maintaining emergency contact information for the buildings. • Assist with outlining or updating return-to-work policies, participating in real estate discussion and creating and distributing company-wide surveys. • Help set up company-wide meetings • Manage catering for in office meetings • Send employee appreciation gifts, sympathy and celebration flowers. • Help create an annual calendar for key company-wide meetings • Assist Legal with gathering and authenticating necessary documents.
  • Submit monthly surveys for business PPE use to the Government of Canada • Assist regional office admins with the purchase of office supplies and mail forwarding. • Address employee queries regarding office management issues while maintaining efficiency and professional relations with all staff Key Skills and Competencies: • Self-starter with the ability to multitask, and manage a significant workload • Excellent interpersonal skills and communication skills at all levels (both verbal and written) • Exceptional level of discretion and judgment with demonstrated problem-solving skills • Proven record of integrity and the ability to maintain confidentiality at the highest levels • Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced environment that is demanding with changing priorities and frequent interruptions • Ability to work independently prioritizing and establishing deadlines for own work, and when work is delegated, for the work of others • Professional, positive, and friendly manner • Demonstrated high level of attention to accuracy and detail Qualifications: • University Degree will be considered an asset. • 5 years of administrative support of Executives in a fast-paced, global company • Proficiency in Google Suite would be considered an asset • A proactive approach to work, with superior multitasking and prioritization skills • Exceptional attention to detail What we offer: • A fun, fast-paced environment where you can make an impact, and where you and your experience are valued. • Flexible work environment • Uncapped vacation policy • Medical and dental coverage, life insurance and other benefits • Retirement savings plan Pivotree is an equal opportunity employer.
We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive and accessible workplace.

title: Sales Manager
description:
THE OPPORTUNITY:

SALES MANAGER

REPORTS TO GENERAL MANAGER

THE COMPANY:

Passion Drives Performance. InnVest succeeds because our people love what we do. Our entire team shares a deep-rooted passion for the world of hospitality & travel that extends far beyond the walls of our offices and locations.

Our company culture is built on collaboration. A nimble team where everyone has a voice at the table and an opportunity to pursue their passions. Our skillsets are as diverse as our portfolio, but we all have a singular focus: a belief that partnerships deliver the best results, an entrepreneurial approach to decision making, respect for others, a strong sense of integrity, and a curiosity to challenge the status quo.

With over 75 hotels in our portfolio, representing 18 internationally recognized hotel brands, InnVest is the largest independent owner of hotels in Canada. In addition, our management team oversees the day-to-day activities of almost 70 hotels also making InnVest the largest independent operator of hotels in Canada. InnVest’s portfolio is geographically diverse with hotels from Vancouver, BC to Corner Brook, NL but also experientially diverse from roadside inns to luxury urban properties.

At InnVest, our mission is simple – to deliver outstanding guest experiences and superior returns on quality hospitality investment. A career at InnVest will provide you with unrivaled opportunities and invaluable exposure to Canada’s largest independently-owned and operated hotel portfolio.

THE HOTEL:

FAIRFIELD INN & SUITES BELLEVILLE – Belleville’s premier hotel and meeting destination. Strategically located close to all amenities and easy access to the 401. Recently renovated, this hotel has been a longstanding partner within the Belleville community.

THE ROLE:

JOIN A DYNAMIC TEAM

The Sales Manager position is responsible for executing sales strategies to maximize the profitability of the hotel while maintaining guest satisfaction. Securing new accounts and maintaining existing accounts, promoting guestroom and meeting/event services to maximize hotel revenue and client satisfaction. Negotiates contracts and agreements with a focus on sales controllable segments .

ACTIVITIES:

The duties of the Sales Manager include, but are not limited to the following:

· Implements effective sales and marketing strategies to maximize the generation of hotels’ sales/revenues.

· Actively acquire new business and maintain existing accounts through prospecting, planned sales calls, and solicitation.

· Develop and maintains relationships with key clients in order to produce group and/or meetings/event business, including room sales, meeting room, and catering services.

· Quote and negotiate prices within established parameters. Upon booking, prepare sales contracts, coordinate and follow up with other hotel departments to ensure delivery of promised service as originally agreed upon.

· Assist General Manager in the development and update of the hotel-level business plans to include input on sales goals and plans that support the overall business and sales strategies of the company.

· Develop quarterly action plan that addresses priorities and quotas and achieve sales activities as outlined in the hotels/individual action plans.

· Participate in business and industry-related organizations, representing the Hotel in a professional manner.

· Coordinate and participate in sites and industry/trade functions and shows.

· Utilize Property Sales System to track, solicit and follow up on accounts.

· Participate in prescribed Hotel/Brand training and special projects.

· Be independently responsible for the achievement of all objectives outlined in the action plans and budget.

· Ensure effective yield management for group bookings produced and contracted.

· Prepare weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual reports as required.

· Responsible for day-to-day duties of prospecting accounts, account development and site inspections.

· Acknowledge and monitor competition's sales and marketing strategies and collect market and competitive intelligence to assist in developing a strategic plan.

· Other duties as assigned by the General Manager.

COMPETENCIES WE ARE SEEKING:

  • University degree and/or College diploma in Hospitality
  • Minimum 2 years of hotel sales experience or equivalent
  • Special consideration will be given to those who exhibit exemplary performance
  • Strong oral and written communication skills required
  • Excellent organizational, verbal, and written communication skills
  • Must have a valid driver’s license and personal transportation
  • Computer skills including Word, Excel, Powerpoint
  • May be required to work nights and weekends
  • Will be required to work in a fast-paced, stressful environment

InnVest Hotels is an inclusive employer. As such, we welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. We appreciate all applications, however only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Experience:

  • sales: 2 years (preferred)

title: Lodge Manager
description:
ACLP is currently seeking a Lodge Manager for the Northern SK mine sites.

Who you are:

  • Down to earth and approachable. You are a well-rounded manager professional.
  • You have experience in management in a service industry.
  • You possess a valid class 5 Drivers License with a satisfactory driving record. You have current Safe Food Handling certificates.
  • You have good knowledge of applicable federal and provincial laws, industry regulations, Occupational Health and Safety and union agreements.
  • You can establish and maintain effective working relationships.
  • You have demonstrated the ability to develop, analyze, interpret financial data; manage budgets and programs.
  • You have knowledge of Microsoft office and data base programs, as well as have time management skills

What you will do:

  • Oversee and manage all ACLP departments; to ensure site operation follow client contracts, meet client obligations, applicable federal and provincial laws, OH&S regulation, and union agreements where applicable.
  • Ensure that site department budgets are monitored and meet ACLP monthly budgetary expectations. Ensure that all department staffing levels are adequate and maintained within budgetary requirements, reviewing all department work schedules and flight manifests, ensuring coverage is provided where and when necessary.
  • Ensure that discipline is consistent and within established company policy and procedure including collective bargaining agreements, if applicable.
  • Responsible to provide final approval on time sheets submitted to head office.
  • Being accountable to ensure safety functions at site are consistent and within established company policies and programs.

Perks:

  • Competitive salary
  • 2 weeks on and 2 weeks off
  • Great team environment
  • Extended health and dental benefits
  • Complimentary flights, accommodations, and meals

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Discounted or free food
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • On-site gym
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Holidays
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Application question(s):

  • Are you able to travel to and stay at a Northern Mine Site in Saskatchewan for 2 weeks at a time (flights, accommodations, and meals provided)?

Application deadline: 2022-04-04

title: Manager for catering company
description:
Job description:

RajahRam Caterers, a leading catering company specializing Sri Lankan and South Indian food in Toronto, is currently seeking a manager with strong analytical, communication and interpersonal skills to manage the catering services. Ideal candidate would be passionate about food, willing to lead and manage staff and have strong customer service skills.

Responsibilities:

  • Ensure smooth operation of catering services
  • Ensure that the quality of the food is of a high standard
  • Assist in planning, assigning and directing work, evaluating performance, rewarding and disciplining associate, addressing complaints and resolving problems
  • Running the business in line with health and safety, food hygiene, and nutritional regulations
  • Manage staff and prepares schedules of staff on a weekly basis
  • Monitor the quality of the service to customers and assure product delivered to customers is of optimum quality
  • Motivate and train catering staff to get the best result out of each individual
  • Develop the business by continually seeking opportunities to increase sales and improve service anticipating changes and planning accordingly
  • Oversee product ordering and inventory controls
  • Develop the client relationship
  • Must be able to work flexible hours

Requirements:

  • Familiarity with Sri Lankan and South Indian cuisine
  • Proven leadership experience in a Catering environment
  • Ability to develop and deliver sound recommendations
  • Passion for food
  • Passion for selling
  • Detail oriented
  • Proficiency on computer systems
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Ability to handle stressful situations
  • Analytical skills
  • Organization and planning skills
  • Ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks
  • Ability to delegate effectively
  • Ability to work flexible schedule, including weekends and holidays

Job Type : Full-time

Salary is Negotiable.

Please send resume to order@rajahramcom

title: Events & Meetings Manager
description:
We are looking for our next great team member to join us on our Sales team. Here is what we offer to all of our associates:

  • Highly competitive salary
  • Company sponsored exceptional benefit plan for eligible associates & their family members
  • RSP matching program for eligible associates
  • Flexible scheduling to help you with work/life balance
  • Opportunity to grow with us, a top rated company on Glassdoor
  • Discounts to any of our Crescent managed properties in North America for you & your family members
  • A workplace that you can be proud of, where you are valued, trusted and supported by the team

Here is what you will be doing each day:

  • Responding in a timely manner to incoming catering & event opportunities
  • Conducting hotel site tours and creative client presentations
  • Preparing all event documentation & contracts and coordinating with sales, hotel departments and client to ensure consistent, high level service throughout pre-event, event and post event phases
  • Attending client receptions, events and trade shows in order to showcase Hotel
  • Recognizing opportunities for upselling and maximizing revenue opportunities

Does this sound like you?

  • Graduate of a hospitality or event management program
  • Master at organizational skills and possesses a high attention to detail
  • Previous experience in a Sales or Events coordination role
  • Loves speaking with clients, assessing their needs and turning their vision into reality for a perfect event
  • Has a team focused approach at work, recognizing that one can't do the work alone
  • Loves variety in their work, and can be flexible with a work schedule, that may include some evenings, weekends from time to time
  • Ability to communicate in both English and French (French not required, but a definite bonus!)

At Crescent Hotels & Resorts and Hyatt Place Ottawa West we strive to create a great place to work where associates at all levels of our organization are respected for their differences, just like the guests and owners we serve. That’s why we are dedicated to creating an environment that facilitates open and honest conversations about race, equity, diversity, and inclusion. By examining our own beliefs and behaviors, we can create change through training, recruiting, and promoting diverse talent to strengthen our culture.

This position is at a location where Hyatt is not the employer. The employer of individuals working at this hotel may be a third-party management company that is responsible for all employment benefits and obligations at this location.

title: Assistant Banquet Manager (Full Time)
description:
Assistant Banquet Manager (Full Time)

Do you enjoy helping others and building emotional connections to make people feel special and welcomed? If so, then we want YOU to be part of our Fairmont Hotel Macdonald family.

Every day you will be responsible for engaging with our guests, clients and colleagues. You will create the MAC Memories at hotel that has been Edmonton’s iconic Chateau on the river for over 100 years, history at every footstep. You will be given the responsibility to ensure that our guests and colleagues feel WELCOMED, CARED FOR and INCREDIBLE

What is in it for you:


  • Employee benefit card offering discounted rates in Accor worldwide
  • Learning programs through our Academies and the opportunity to earn qualifications while you work
  • Opportunity to develop your talent and grow within your property and across the world!
  • Ability to make a difference in the local community through our Corporate Social Responsibility activities, like Planet 21


What you will be doing:

Reporting to Director of Banquets, You will ensure successful planning, organization and co-ordination of all assigned functions within the Department. This is not limited to items such as forecasting, scheduling, labor control, effective pre and post shift communication, communication of the vision to the service staff, etc. and supervise all employees including Banquet Captains assigned to ensure high level guest satisfaction.


  • Ensure smooth running of the banquet floor, leading Servers, bartenders, porters in their duties
  • Attend daily management briefings
  • Execute meetings and events through thorough review of BEO details
  • Review room set-ups for accuracy
  • Plan and co-ordinate event details with kitchen, stewarding and catering
  • Conduct pre & post function briefings and fosters effective communication with staff
  • Provides accountability to employee handbook and established standards for colleagues through performance management
  • Ensure standards are adhered to through regular quality checks of colleague work
  • Direct staff in maintaining clean, tidy and organized back of house service areas
  • Build & maintain communication channels with organizers before, during and after all services to ensure all needs are exceeded ( minimum 40min check in with clients)
  • Co-ordinate on site changes with kitchen and stewarding
  • Communicate with catering and all other departments as needed on the outcome, opportunities & successes of all functions through function log and personal follow up
  • Is available to client throughout their onsite experience via phone and in person
  • Coach and counsel line staff during shifts
  • Participate in monthly communication meetings
  • Undertake staff performance reviews
  • Follow disciplinary process to maintain colleague accountability
  • Aid them so they may excel in their positions
  • Ensure that billing of convention items is correct and posted in a timely manner
  • Follow established Billing Procedures
  • Liaise inter-departmentally to ensure that guests needs are prioritized
  • Maintain strong focus & constructive approach to achieving department goals with regards to: Meeting Planner Scores, Colleague engagement, revenue prioritization and Health & Safety
  • Conduct frequent inspections of Banquet facilities and equipment
  • Assist in the ordering and maintaining adequate par stock and overseeing control of: beverages, meeting supplies, server mis-en-place, items on BEO’s as required



Your experience and skills include:


  • Fluency in English (written and verbal) required
  • Post-Secondary Hospitality Degree an asset
  • Strong computer skills in Microsoft Suite required
  • Two years food and beverage management experience required
  • Previous leadership experience in banquets in a luxury hotel is preferred
  • Experience in leading Weddings & Social events preferred

Physical Aspects of the Position:

  • Frequent standing and walking throughout shift
  • Occasional lifting and carrying up to 50 lbs.
  • Occasional kneeling, pushing, pulling, lifting
  • Occasional ascending or descending ladders, stairs and ramps
  • Ability to focus attention on guest needs, remaining calm and courteous at all times

Must be legally eligible to work in Canada. The hotel is unable to assist candidates in obtaining work authorization documents

In order to keep our employees and the general public safe from the threat of Covid 19 and the rise of variants in the community, the Hotel has implemented a Covid-19 Vaccination Policy.



Your team and working environment:

Edmonton's "Chateau on the River" For more than 100 years, Fairmont Hotel Macdonald has effortlessly delivered timeless luxury in the heart of downtown Edmonton. Nestled upon the North Saskachewan River Valley, the hotel's charm and ever-evolving elegance has earned it the spotlight as one of the city's most sought after locations. A storied past, an unparalleled present, and a future to be reckoned with, Fairmont Hotel Macdonald has set the stage for luxury in the heart of the city. Edmonton's only four-diamond "Chateau on the River" offers unparalleled views of North America's largest expance of urban parkland. Boasting dignified style and timeless grace, each of our 198 classically designed guestrooms, including specialty suites, are tastefully adorned with the finest amenities. In 2016, we forever changed the game in luxury was we unveiled a completely re-designed Fairmont Gold and Lounge. Delivering personalized and discreet service, this hotel within a hotel offers an unrivalled experience unlike any other the city has seen, and likely ever will. From seasonally inspired menus to dining experiences that will satisfy any craving, see what our chefs are preparing in our confederation lounge and our award winning restaurant, The Harvest Room.

Our commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:
We are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit and promote diverse talent.

Why work for Accor?
We are far more than a worldwide leader. We welcome you as you are and you can find a job and brand that matches your personality. We support you to grow and learn every day, making sure that work brings purpose to your life, so that during your journey with us, you can continue to explore Accor’s limitless possibilities.
By joining Accor, every chapter of your story is yours to write and together we can imagine tomorrow's hospitality. Discover the life that awaits you at Accor, visit https://careers.accor.com/


Do what you love, care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo! #BELIMITLESS

title: newDana Hospitality - Food Service Director
description:
Dana Hospitality is a Canadian owned food service provider that focuses on making culinary creations from scratch using fresh local ingredients. We are passionate about the whole foods and ingredients we select, and the suppliers we chose. You will want to work for Dana because we have developed an industry reputation for exceptional cuisine and excellent customer service.

We are looking for a Food Service Director to join our culinary team. This is a pivotal role within our team and the successful candidate will be looking for growth opportunities while being passionate about food.

*
The position will...*

  • Lead assigned foodservice operations to maximize client and customer satisfaction and financial results
  • Establish short and long term goals and strategies that lead to increased growth of the unit
  • Maintain an efficient food service operation by developing a high quality team through effective recruiting, training, scheduling, coaching, managing performance, and motivating employees
  • Manage a variety of National Franchise Brand outlets in keeping with established standards, procedures, and operating practices
  • Implement and uphold our values and mission as well as Policies and Procedures
  • Responsible for budgeting and ordering food, talent management, customer service, client relationships, culinary excellence, inventory, Company standards, application of applicable legislation and regulations, cash handling, and operational excellence
  • Ensure that established sanitation and safety standards are maintained
  • Develop and implement marketing and catering plans, reports progress, and participate in ongoing improvement efforts
  • Establish and maintain a mutually beneficial client relationship
  • Directly overseeing a team that may include the Chef Manager, Chef, and additional service staff
  • Work with the corporate support group or operations team to ensure smooth operations
  • Monitor and follow-up to ensure accountability to plans and key performance indicators

This position reports into the District Manager and is field based.
The competencies and qualifications needed...

  • 3 years experience in a high volume, food service/cafeteria, dining room & executive catering environment, and 3 years working in a Management role or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience
  • Experience managing a multi-unit environment required.
  • ServeSafe and FoodSafe certified
  • People management experience – recruiting, coaching & developing, motivating and managing
  • Ability to communicate effectively in English, both verbally and in writing
  • Possess a strong commitment to customer service through the development and maintenance of effective business relationships
  • Problem solving and analytical skills with a strong focus on commitment and quality
  • Able to multi-task and set priorities

In return Dana will reward you for your hard work with…

  • Health and Dental benefits
  • Tuition reimbursement program
  • Company supplied uniforms and the opportunity to enjoy delicious subsidized meals (aligned to unit specific meal policies)
  • The opportunity to learn from industry professionals while working in an environment that promotes teamwork
  • Have the chance to further your career with a growing company in a fast-paced industry

Dana Hospitality and the client care about the health and safety of our staff and guests. As such, we have implemented a vaccination policy that the successful candidate will be required to abide by.
Apply...
If you are looking for an opportunity to love what you do while working with a great team reply to this posting with a copy of your resume.
Dana Hospitality is an equal opportunity employer and we would like to thank all applicants for their interest. Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. Dana would like to hear from all interested candidates; workplace accommodations for those with disabilities are available throughout the recruitment process and the duration of employment. Further information, including how to reach us should an accommodation be required, can be found on our website.

Experience
Required

  • 3 year(s): Food Service Management

Job Type: Full-time

title: Front of House Manager
description:
Survived and Revived Busy Centertown Restaurant Wants A Front Of House Managing Partner.

Established in 2010, Grounded is an experienced and confidant restaurant dedicated to serving great food and drink in an easy-going and trendy atmosphere

We want to continue to evolve with the changes & challenges our industry will continue to face. Though significant, it’s also an exciting time for the right individual who is a natural leader and is ready to grow with us!

We are a manageable size for the individual who is looking to stay challenged but not abused by an enormous workload. We value family, free time and health. We also have pride in exceeding expectations and always aspire to be the best.

The ideal candidate will have the potential to become a managing partner in our business. Regardless of financial ability to contribute, this person can invest through sweat equity and or can be offered a shareholding based on willingness, experience and results.

We want someone who

  • Wants to build a future with the talents you have been born with and the ones you’ve gained over years of experience working in the Front Of House
  • Has a magical intuition towards the needs of patrons, teammates and goals of the restaurant.
  • Is organized and particular about all things
  • Loves what they do and always has fun doing it

Characteristics we are looking for

  • Hardworking, outgoing and reliable
  • Calm, cool and collected
  • Charming and memorable
  • Creative in enhancing the dining experience
  • Clean and professional in appearance
  • Takes initiative to make decisions
  • Naturally earns the respect of a team
  • Polite and while staying in charge (able to diffuse conflict, while maintaining respect and trust)
  • Fast and able to multi-task

Qualifications needed for the job

  • At least a high school education;
  • Strong food and bar knowledge;
  • Experience working in restaurants with table service is ideal; but fast food, banquet rooms, cafés, catering, and event planning are also relevant;
  • Strong, fast, and able to stand or walk briskly for hours at a time; able to lift at least 30lbs; have flexible and healthy forearms and dexterity in hands.
  • Able to work long hours and aware of your limits (knowing when you need to refuel)
  • Smart Serve certification
  • Quick math skills
  • Able to use a modern POS system, online ordering platforms, and basic computer programs (e.g., Excel, Word, Power Point); Social Media platforms also an asset
  • Human Resource experience; managing individuals, small and large teams

Hours

  • Tuesday & Wednesday 11am to 5pm, Wednesday to Saturday 11am to 9pm
  • Off on Sunday & Monday
  • At least one week off over Christmas
  • Certain other Statutory Holidays off (i.e. Canada Day, Good Friday)

Pay

  • Hourly based on current minimum wage plus tips; calculates to a minimum base salary of $25 per hour. Can be negotiated to $27 to $29 per hour, based on experience, availability, motivation and results.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $25.00-$29.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Discounted or free food
  • Profit sharing
  • Store discount

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Ottawa, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

title: Catering Driver - Full-time
description:
Company Description


Ready for the next chapter of your career? Why not make one of Canada's leading restaurant groups a part of it! We value relentless innovation and kick-ass creativity! We provide advancement through training and development and our hands on managers empower people and awaken ability through responsibility and respect.

What’s in it for you?

  • Competitive wages/salary packages
  • Gratuity sharing
  • A comprehensive group benefits program
  • Training and development opportunities
  • Staff dining discount
  • RRSP matching program for managers

Job Description


The Catering Delivery is responsible for receiving products from the OB Caters team and delivering products to the appropriate offsite location/venue within Toronto and the Greater Toronto Area in a timely manner ensuring that all products are handled with care.

PRIMARY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Communicate with the Catering Chef and culinary team regarding delivery details
  • Packages, receives and loads products onto the company vehicle in a safe and timely manner
  • Safely deliver products via foot and/or vehicle while meeting deadlines
  • Practice road rules and follow directions while driving the company vehicle
  • Arrive safely at location, unload and deliver products to on-site management
  • Assist in properly receiving and storing delivered items
  • Follow Health & Safety regulations
  • Additional duties as assigned or required

Qualifications
  • Valid G Drivers License
  • Must provide positive drivers abstract/record
  • Criminal/credit check required
  • Ability to lift 20kg with ease
  • Ability to take direction and work calmly and effectively under pressure

Additional Information


** We thank all applicants for their interest in Oliver & Bonacini Hospitality; however, only suitable candidates will be contacted to continue the application process. **

title: Franchised Sales & Catering Manager
description:
Posting Date Apr 15, 2022
Job Number 22061369
Job Category Sales & Marketing
Location Delta Hotels Kingston Waterfront, 1 Johnson Street, Kingston, ONT, Canada
Brand Delta Hotels & Resorts
Schedule Full-Time
Relocation? Y
Position Type Management
Located Remotely? N


Additional Information: This hotel is owned and operated by an independent franchisee, Diamond Hotels Canada Inc.. The franchisee controls all aspects of the hotel’s employment policies and practices, including the selection and hiring process. If you accept a position at this hotel you will be employed by a franchisee and not by Marriott International.


POSITION OVERVIEW:


Reporting to the Director of Sales, the Sales & Catering Manager works to develop and maintain long term, value-based customer relationships with existing and potential clients in order to achieve personal and team related goals in guestrooms, banquets, and private dining revenue.


KEY AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY:


  • Respond to inquiries efficiently and in a timely manner in an effort to provide exceptional customer service and to increase our hotels revenues
  • Issue proposals, contracts, negotiate and close business in the market segments as assigned and discussed with the Director of Sales
  • Negotiate and book new and repeat guestroom, banquet, and meeting business
  • Pass leads and pertinent client information on to Director of Sales where appropriate
  • Promote hotel using various methods including: sales and events kits, packages, flyers, email blasts, social media, guest room TV, websites, etc
  • Negotiate prices, prepare accurate quotes and confirm by written contracts
  • Attend trade shows, community events and industry meetings to maximize sales and revenue generation
  • Assist with annual Sales and Catering plan and subsequent monthly progress reports
  • Remain up-to-date on hotel’s competitive set and effectively sell against them
  • Participate in weekly revenue management meetings
  • Liaise with Kitchen, Banquet and Front Office departments for smooth transition to arrival for group
  • Solicit post-event follow-up, evaluate client experience and re-solicit business
  • Coordinate and maximize catering revenue opportunities including promotion of our sister properties

The above areas of responsibility are not all inclusive and may be amended from time to time.


Job Requirements

  • Minimum of 2 years of sales experience, preferably in a catering environment
  • Completion of a two year community college diploma in a related area or equivalent
  • Ability to multitask while focusing on revenue goals
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Client-focused and a team player
  • Ensure a professional attitude and proper business attire while on property and ready to meet with clients at any time
  • Able to establish rapport with clients quickly to ensure guest satisfaction and repeat business
  • Excellent analytical, problem solving, organizational and interpersonal skills
  • Excellent time management skills and attention to detail
  • Highly motivated, a self-starter, and work with minimal supervision
  • Strong computer skills - Opera experience a definite asset
  • Must be able to work general office hours (8:30 – 4:30) with flexibility to work the occasional evening or weekend.
  • The Company's COVID-19 Workplace Vaccination Policy requires that all employees be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Individuals who are not vaccinated for medical reasons or other protected ground under the OHRC can request an exemption from the employer. If approved the individual will be subject to other health and safety guidelines.

This company is an equal opportunity employer.

title: newCatering Services Manager
description:
Job Description

The Catering Services Manager is a leadership position which leads all aspects of catering solutions and special events at the location. This position will lead the Catering team to complete events or catering delivery requests in line with customer expectations and service standards.

Job Responsibilities

  • Develop and complete catering solutions to meet customers’ needs
  • Develop and maintain effective client and customer rapport
  • Deliver consistent quality in planning and carrying out events
  • Facilitate the delivery of prepared food and set up of events crafted from banquet event orders
  • Assist clients in planning special events and providing creative solutions to clients’ needs
  • Train and lead catering employees to ensure catering and event standards are followed ensuring quality in final presentation
  • Provide completed Banquet Event Orders to team and provide quality assurance all requests are met prior to event
  • Responsible for delivering food and labor targets
  • Responsible for execution of catering events of varied size and scope including staffing and management
  • Ensure accurate reporting of all catering related revenue, expenses, and receivables
  • Recruit, train, schedule and develop team members
  • Ensure compliance with all food, occupational, and environmental safety policies

This job profile does not contain a comprehensive listing of all required activities, duties, or responsibilities. Job duties, responsibilities and activities may change, or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice.

Qualifications

  • Requires at least 2 years of experience
  • Prior experience in a management or supervisory role preferred
  • Previous experience in events, hospitality and catering preferred
  • Requires a bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
  • Available to work event-based hours
  • Must have excellent communications skills
  • Complete Food Handlers and Alcohol Service Certifications as required
  • Requires occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and pulling up to 50 lb.
  • Ability to stand for extended periods of time

Education

About Aramark

Our Mission

Rooted in service and united by our purpose, we strive to do great things for each other, our partners, our communities, and our planet.

At Aramark, we believe that every employee should enjoy equal employment opportunity and be free to participate in all aspects of the company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, pregnancy, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, military status, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by applicable law.

About Aramark

The people of Aramark proudly serve millions of guests every day through food, facilities, and uniform services in 19 countries around the world. Rooted in service and united by our purpose, we strive to do great things for each other, our partners, our communities, and our planet. We believe a career should develop your talents, fuel your passions, and empower your professional growth. So, no matter what you're pursuing - a new challenge, a sense of belonging, or just a great place to work - our focus is helping you reach your full potential. Learn more about working here at http://www.aramarkcareers.com or connect with us on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter.

title: Catering & Conference Services Manager
description:
Job description

Are you looking for an exciting career change at a bustling Downtown property? Join the dynamic Sales and Catering team at the DoubleTree by Hilton Toronto Downtown in the exciting role of Catering and Events Services Manager.

Located in the heart of Downtown Toronto, The DoubleTree by Hilton Toronto Downtown boasts 13,500 sq ft of flexible Meeting and Event space. We are looking for an experience Catering and Events Services Manager that has a passion for Food and Beverage, Sales and Hospitality join our team!

POSITION DESCRIPTION SCOPE

The Conference Services Manager reports to the Director of Sales and Marketing and is the primary contact for servicing the catering business at the hotel. To exceed budgeted revenue and goals. To perform duties in a creative, team oriented and dynamic fashion while always exemplifying the highest standards in customer service, integrity and work ethic.

Major areas of responsibility include, but are not limited to the following:

  • Secure inbound business leads and inquiries that support the hotel’s objective of maximizing revenue by evaluating client buying potential
  • Execute direct sales efforts to target catering accounts in order to increase all types of catering business for the Hotel
  • Perform sales activities such as sales calls, site inspections, entertainment and sales presentations
  • Promote the Hotel, including both the property and services, while maintaining a high level of personal contacts with clients and providing them with professional advice
  • Prepare proposals and bid on potential business
  • To meet and exceed client expectations to ensure the success of every event
  • Maintain and update a database of prospective and existing clients with detailed information profiles about their potential
  • Take a lead role in communicating client expectations to all Operating Departments through Group Resumes and Banquet Event Orders
  • Conduct site inspections as required for conventions, corporate and group business
  • Conducting pre-event meetings, and post-conference meetings with departing groups to address strengths weaknesses of an event while soliciting repeat business
  • Coordinate all external support for meeting & event organizers (linen, equipment, flower and décor rentals etc)
  • Effectively negotiate with clients and achieve maximum revenue/profit potential while satisfying the customer’s needs.
  • Evaluate, solicit, sell and confirm business as required to meet individual goals and overall budgeted sales and profitability.
  • Create and maintain accurate information on all accounts in Delphi.
  • Conduct thorough site inspections.
  • Sell all hotel services with emphasis on catering and food & beverage.
  • Sell hotel bedrooms associated with Catering bookings.
  • Understand and negotiate room rental rates and minimum food and beverage spend requirements according to sales strategy and guidelines provided.
  • Be familiar with cut-off dates, attrition and cancellation policies and be able to thoroughly explain them to customer.
  • Effectively handle leads coming from online channels by qualifying the lead properly and building a connection with the client prior to sending a proposal.
  • Keep hotel management promptly and fully informed of any problems / occurrences so that prompt corrective action can be taken.
  • Report activities and productions on a monthly basis and measure against plan/goal.
  • Coordinate with other departments to ensure quality of guest satisfaction.
  • Follow-up on progress of booked business and key account progress, as well as post event follow up.
  • Participate in sales meetings providing comprehensive information / feedback on accounts / territory.
  • Have a complete understanding and knowledge of the competition.
  • Understand and utilize Delphi for all account information, while adhering to standards.
  • Maintain a professional appearance at all times and conduct personal behavior in a mature and professional business manner.
  • Cosely with the Chef & the Banquet Department
  • Client servicing once the group is confirmed is handled by the Catering and Event Mgr.
  • Ability to perform other tasks or projects as assigned by the leadership team.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Minimum 2 years Catering Sales experience in a hotel setting.
  • College Diploma, University Degree from a Hospitality related program would be an asset
  • Good command of both written and verbal English is essential
  • Knowledge of menu planning is required
  • Experience with Delphi is an asset
  • Must have the ability to work in a fast paced environment with changing work priorities
  • Must be decisive and have the ability to work under stressful situations, handling several tasks at a time
  • Must have the ability to work within time constraints and deadlines
  • Must have advanced interpersonal skills for dealing with clients, peers, and managers
  • A professional and courteous disposition is required
  • Due to business levels working extended hours is sometimes required, including evenings

Working Conditions:

  • Generally, duties are completed in an indoor office setting; located 1 level below the main floor
  • Will be using a computer and telephone frequently

"The hotel is committed to providing an accessible environment to all employees and customers, whatever their ability. Accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process."

title: Catering Sales Manager
description:
Overview / vue gÃ©nÃ©rale:
King Edward Hotel

With its rich history, timeless elegance, and modern hospitality, the Omni King Edward Hotel has been a favourite of both locals and visitors for over 110 years. Located in the heart of downtown Toronto, this landmark hotel is just steps away from a wealth of diverse restaurants, tourist hotspots, and shopping centres. It's no wonder the Omni King Edward is the perfect destination for business and leisure travellers alike.

The Omni King Edward Hotel's associates enjoy a dynamic and exciting work environment, comprehensive training and mentoring, along with the pride that comes from working for a company with a reputation for exceptional service. We embody a culture of respect, gratitude and empowerment day in and day out. If you are a friendly, motivated person, with a passion to serve others, the Omni King Edward Hotel may be your perfect match
Job Description / description de l'emploi:
The ideal candidate will be responsible for maintaining relationships and increasing business levels with existing Catering accounts, and actively prospecting and securing new social and corporate group and event business in an upcoming market. A motivated individual that possesses excellent communication skills, understands the importance in attention to details and is self-motivated is what we are looking for.
Qualifications / qualifications:
  • High School Diploma or equivalent, college degree preferred.
  • Minimum of 1 year catering experience
  • Knowledge of the operations of the hotel industry.
  • Dynamic, enthusiastic, creative leader who thrives under pressure and is able to perform multiple functions and troubleshoot when needed.
  • Ability to communicate in the English language both written and verbal, with the ability to demonstrate warmth and empathy when engaging with others.
  • Must have proven selling, negotiating and presentation skills.
  • Requires knowledge of advanced sales techniques.
  • Highly developed customer service skills with strong attention to detail.
  • Proficient computer skills including but not limited to Microsoft Word, Power Point, Excel, and Outlook. Delphi experience preferred.
  • The ability to delegate, effectively train and coach.
  • Must be able to work a flexible schedule including nights, weekends and holidays.
Responsibilities / responsabilitÃ©s:
  • Respond to all inquiries in an effort to capture additional market share
  • Issue proposals, contracts, negotiate and closes business
  • Manage and service key clients as well as prospect potential new clients
  • Negotiate prices, prepare accurate quotes and then confirm by written contracts
  • Follow Omni’s Billing and Credit standards for all events
  • Prepare Banquet Event Orders, issue updates and distribute in a manner that ensures that all affected parties have the information that they require to execute the event seamlessly
  • Place follow-up calls to clients upon completion of events and re-solicit business
  • Deliver exceptional guest service and strong financial results
  • Regularly update forecasts to ensure financial accuracy
  • Coordinate Site inspections
  • Upon turnover of a booking, coordinate and follow up with the assigned Banquet Manager to ensure delivery of venues promised services
  • Prepare weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual reports as required
  • Participate in trade shows and promotional events within the hotel and trade related organizations
