title: newEvent Manager
description:
Who we are:

Redstone is made up of dedicated, intelligent, and hard-working individuals. We are a tech-savvy, digital-obsessed, and a Millennial-run agency striving to make a positive IMPACT on the event and association industry. We believe in establishing and maintaining TRUST with our team members and our clients.

We work hard and challenge ourselves to go the EXTRA MILE in everything we do and recognize that an organization’s success is completely dependent on the PEOPLE within it; that’s why we choose to only work with the very best.

Our Core Four Values make up who we are and is the foundation behind every decision and action we take as a company, within our team and alongside our clients.

What we do:

We are an industry-leading agency focused on delivering outsourced professional services to not-for-profit professional and trade associations. These services include membership management (retention and acquisition), board of director support, committee administration, sponsorship management, financial management, marketing, social and communications services, digital and hybrid event management, in-person event management, and so much more!

Our mission is to drive growth in our clients’ organizations, make a positive impact in their communities, and make the volunteer experience enjoyable for everyone we work with. Customer service is our passion.

Redstone life and culture:

We’re a full-service boutique agency with a growing team, which means you have a lot of responsibility, be challenged daily, and you’ll work side-by-side with the senior leadership as you learn and grow within our company. As a team, we work hard, are client-focused, and like to have fun. We value supporting the growth and business needs of not-for-profit organizations. Enhancing our culture and the employee experience is a top priority at Redstone, so we value career growth and development by investing in you.

You will thrive in this role if:

  • You are excited about the idea of doing meaningful work and have an eagerness to learn, grow, and contribute to Redstone and our clients’ success
  • You have a university or college degree or diploma in Business, Event Management, Communications or another related program
  • You have 5+ years of relevant, full-scope event planning experience which includes experience planning conferences
  • 1+ year executing digital events (webinars, virtual conferences, etc.)
  • You are comfortable testing new technology, new event platforms, and able to make informed recommendations to clients based on functionality, budget, and client-needs
  • You have experience managing all of the following key areas: meeting or event project planning, risk management, management of event financials (event budgets), sponsorship development and fulfillment, staffing and volunteer management, stakeholder management (including exhibitor relations), meeting/event design (program development, speaker management, coordination of F&B, AV, registration systems, crowd control, transportation, etc.), site management (selection, layout, logistics planning and onsite communications), event marketing (planning, development of materials, contribution to public relations activities)
  • You can juggle priorities and adapt in a busy and ever-changing environment, balancing the management of multiple large-scale concurrent events and adhering to strict deadlines
  • You have excellent people management skills and are able to assess complications and difficulties and swiftly deal with them to ensure client satisfaction
  • You can share event knowledge with your fellow staff members, sharing best practices and skills while adhering to Redstone’s core value of ‘PEOPLE’
  • You have the ability to work outside of regular working hours as required, including extended hours, holidays and weekends during busy periods and peak seasons

Brownie points if:

  • You have experience working at an Agency, and/or the Events and Association Management industry
  • You have earned PCMA’s DES certification or a similar designation
  • Comfortable fostering relationships on behalf of the Company, attending industry conferences tradeshows, and meeting with clients either in-person or via telephone/video call
  • You have an eye for good design and are comfortable using Canva, Adobe Pro (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign) and basic skills in video editing software or the aptitude to learn
  • You are bilingual in English / French

About the role:

As an Event Manager, you will manage an event portfolio for 2-6 association and corporate clients, providing full-service event support, planning, and execution for conferences, galas, tradeshows, webinars, and conventions alongside a team of 1-4 event planners who will report into you. This individual will be responsible for developing and implementing event strategies, solutions and innovations that are tailored to each client’s needs and work closely with stakeholders to deliver an exceptional event experience. Our event and association clients range from industries such as real estate, property, law, post-secondary education, healthcare, city planning, and sponsorship marketing, just to name a few.


What you’ll do:

Event Management

  • Manage all aspects of event planning while meeting strict deadlines and budget demands
  • Identify and elevate clients’ requirements and expectations from conception through post-event, ensuring high level communication throughout all phases
  • Responsible for the growth and development of direct reports and supporting their learning and career advancement
  • Nurture and build relationships with vendors, venues, clients, and stakeholders
  • Proactively identify and become proficient in digital event platforms (a few of our favourites are PheedLoop, Hopin, StreamYard, Airmeet, Zoom, and more!) while solving technical challenges
  • Conduct technology platform demos, make selections, prepare reports on recommendations
  • Plan and facilitate logistics for events, including creation of critical path, site preparation, catering, entertainment, transportation, décor, marketing materials, and onsite event execution (virtual or in-person)
  • Develop risk management and contingency plans for all events, anticipating attendee needs and preparing against potential risks
  • Source suppliers and negotiate for best value
  • Manage event registration and on-going communication with event attendees
  • Attend and lead committee meetings, board meetings, and conference calls and taking minutes when needed
  • Prepare and deliver weekly/monthly reporting to clients and management as needed
  • Maintain up-to-date databases and records (sponsorship, attendee, membership, etc.)
  • Create, maintain and report on budget and reconciliation
  • Completion of other tasks essential to the successful delivery of events according to scope and/or at Managements’ request

Marketing and Communications

  • Coordinate marketing initiatives including but not limited to e-blasts, and call campaigns; manage website updates
  • Manage various client projects including marketing and communication initiatives, event registration drives, and more
  • Content creation and deployment for various channels including industry publications, social media, blogs, and more
  • Draft press release announcements for electronic or print distribution

Be yourself. We like it that way:

At Redstone, we are committed to fostering and cultivating a culture of equity, diversity, and inclusion. We believe that a culture that celebrates EDI creates a better work environment and enables us to deliver outstanding services to our clients. We strive to create a workplace that reflects the communities we serve and where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work each day. We value building a team with a variety of backgrounds, skills, and views and embrace the characteristics that makes our team unique.

Thank you for your interest, however, due to the volume of applications, only successful applicants will be contacted with next steps.

www.redstoneagency.ca | www.redstoneevents.com

title: Catering Manager
description:
DRW is a diversified trading firm with over 3 decades of experience bringing sophisticated technology and exceptional people together to operate in markets around the world. We value autonomy and the ability to quickly pivot to capture opportunities, so we operate using our own capital and trading at our own risk.

Headquartered in Chicago with offices throughout the U.S., Canada, Europe, and Asia, we trade a variety of asset classes including Fixed Income, ETFs, Equities, FX, Commodities and Energy across all major global markets. We have also leveraged our expertise and technology to expand into three non-traditional strategies: real estate, venture capital and cryptoassets.

We operate with respect, curiosity and open minds. The people who thrive here share our belief that it's not just what we do that matters–it's how we do it. DRW is a place of high expectations, integrity, innovation and a willingness to challenge consensus.

We are looking for a Catering Manager to join our Montreal-based Workplace team. In this role, you will be responsible for overseeing the cleaning support staff as well as the Assistant Catering Manager. Your focus will be on providing good quality food service while maintaining high standards of hygiene and overall customer satisfaction.

Core Duties:

  • Manage the food team including cleaning personnel
  • Work closely with the Workplace Manager to achieve overall success of the food program
  • Staying on budget and maintaining financial and administrative records
  • Ensuring kitchen machinery and facilities are in good functioning order
  • Establish proper quantities and place orders accordingly
  • Coordinate maintenance of kitchen related appliances
  • Set up and tear down of food services (breakfast, lunch, buffet & salad bar)
  • Develop daily/weekly meal concepts and menus
  • Update menus on company intranet
  • Maintain relationships and develop new ones with caterers and various vendors
  • Research and negotiate prices
  • Adhere to sanitation and safety standards
  • Support catering needs for special events for the Workplace team

Required Skills & Experience:

  • High school diploma or higher education
  • Bilingual
  • Minimum 1- year of experience in the restaurant industry or in a similar position
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Capable of heavy lifting and being on your feet for hours at a time
  • Proficiency in MS Outlook for email and calendaring and proficiency with MS Word and Excel
  • Ability to remain calm and make quick decisions under stressful circumstances
  • Good understanding of food hygiene
  • Exceptional ability to deliver catering services within budget and on time
  • Strong organization skills and ability to meet deadlines
  • Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills
  • This job is for you if you are a reliable, hardworking, and someone who can solve problems quickly
  • A willingness to collaborate and assist whenever, wherever needed

What DRW Montreal has to offer you:

  • Recognized as one of Canada's Best Employers for the past 8 years
  • Committed to continuous learning & development
  • Industry leading benefits package and perks
  • Focused on employee well-being and work-life balance
  • Community initiatives, volunteer program and opportunities for giving back

Find out more about all of our perks & benefits here


For more information about DRW's processing activities and our use of job applicants' data, please view our Privacy Notice at https://drw.com/privacy-notice.

California residents, please review the California Privacy Notice for information about certain legal rights at https://drw.com/california-privacy-notice.

#KS-LI1

title: Catering and Events Manager
description:
You might not know our name, but you know where we are. That’s because Compass Group Canada is part of a global foodservice and support services company that’s the 6th largest employer in the world, with 625,000 employees.

You’ll find us in schools, colleges, hospitals, office buildings, senior living communities, tourist attractions, sports venues, remote camps and military installations and more. We’re in all major cities, at remote work sites and everywhere in between – doing business in Canada and 50+ other countries where you can learn and grow. Join us now and point your career forward!

Imagine a place where people work as one to create an experience that inspires many. Join us and know that you make it possible for friends, families, and co-workers to come together. No matter why they gather, we’re here to serve. Because of what we do, people share so much more than a meal. And that’s why this is so much more than a job.

Why work with Eurest Dining? We are a member of Compass Group Canada, the leading food and support Services Company. We provide diverse, innovative dining services to corporate headquarter locations, law firms, manufacturing facilities, distribution centres and call centres. Join our commitment to providing exceptional food service to the best of business and industry.

Job Summary

Now, if you were to come on board as our Catering Manager, we’d ask you to do the following for us:


  • Monitor and organize catering orders with weekly invoicing
  • Perform administrative duties, including: All booking, coordinating and follow-up on all catering events, reconciling billing and invoices and preparing month end
  • Ensure specifications and requests of each catering event are communicated and executed down the channel effectively
  • Work collaboratively on menu planning with clients and Executive Chef, and identify revenue-generating opportunities
  • Assist in production, hiring, employee training, staff scheduling, associate supervising, as well as addressing and resolving employee relations issues
  • Direct department activities and maintain highest-quality service standards
  • Maintain compliance with industry, company, and legislative standards
  • Develop team and provide performance improvement programs


Think you have what it takes to be our next Catering Manager? We’re committed to hiring the best talent for the role. Here’s how we’ll know you’ll be successful in the role.


  • Degree in Hospitality/Food Service
  • AFST (Advanced Food Safety Training)
  • Strong management skills, capable of motivating, leading and developing associates
  • Excellent client relationship-building and communication skills
  • At least three or more years of related hospitality experience in a food service environment, as well as 3 years’ supervisory experience
  • Ability to control food and labour costs
  • Detail-oriented and a strong team player
  • Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
  • Proven Microsoft Office skills (Word, Excel, Outlook) and comfortable with utilizing multiple supporting programs
  • Must have ability to support managing larger groups in the main Retail Food operation

Compass Group Canada is committed to nurturing a diverse workforce representative of the communities within which we operate. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to race, colour, citizenship, religion, sex, marital / family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply.


For accommodation requests during the hiring process, please contact PeopleHub@compass-canada.com for further information.

title: newRestaurant Manager
description:
Angithi Biryani and Wraps is a Pakistan cuisine restaurant located in downtown Toronto.

Reporting to the General Manager & Financial Controller, the Restaurant Manager is responsible for the effective administration of restaurant operations ensuring a high level of customer service to the patrons. Specifically, he/she is responsible for daily cost recording, inventory and reporting, hiring and training of staff, day-to-day business communication, marketing and promotion, kitchen and food services and other duties as assigned. This position also includes cooking as a backup for the Head Cook.

Specific Skills

  • Address customers' complaints or concerns
  • Recruit, train and supervise staff
  • Participate in marketing plans and implementation
  • Negotiate with clients for catering or use of facilities
  • Monitor revenues and modify procedures and prices
  • Ensure health and safety regulations are followed
  • Develop, implement and analyze budgets
  • Provide customer service
  • Negotiate arrangements with suppliers for food and other supplies
  • Set staff work schedules and monitor staff performance
  • Determine type of services to be offered and implement operational procedures
  • Plan, organize, direct, control and evaluate daily operations

Additional Skills

  • Conduct performance reviews
  • Balance cash, cash reports and related forms
  • Organize and maintain inventory

****MUST locating in GTA, ON, Canada

Job Type: Permanent

Salary: $40,000.00-$50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Discounted or free food
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Application question(s):

  • Are you currently living in GTA, ON, Canada and having valid working authorization?

title: Manager, Events
description:
THE ORGANIZATION

Founded in 1987, Entrepreneurs’ Organization (EO) is a peer-to-peer business network of more than 15,000 entrepreneurs in more than 209 chapters and 62 countries. EO’s core values are common pillars across regions helping members to learn and grow together, be bold, trust and respect their peers, and have fun. EO’s international staff collaborates successfully across cultures. Getting to know members and staff from around the world and a generous professional development allowance are frequently cited as among the most popular benefits of working at EO.

POSITION SUMMARY

The Event Manager is responsible for event planning and onsite execution of targeted Global Events for the membership to include, but not limited to, Universities, Global Leadership Conference, Exploration, Family Experience, Couple’s Retreat, etc. In addition, the Event Manager serves on the core team for the planning and production of EO Global Universities and EO Global Leadership Conference by managing all event communications, off-site activities, transportation movements, pre- and post-tours, and other duties as assigned. Assigned events will take place in the United States and internationally, challenging the Event Manager to execute high member expectations in various cultures and economic circumstances.

This position is open to be fully remote.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

For larger EO Global Events (Universities, Global Leadership Conference):

  • Function as lead of your designated portfolio for approved Global Events. Portfolios may include evening social scope, hospitality scope, off-site and pre-post tours scope, transportation scope, hotel room lists, etc.
    • Evening socials: Coordinate all evening social functions with DMC (entertainment, décor selections, run of show, catering)
    • Off-Sites Activities, Pre- and Post-Tours: Coordinate all off-site activities and pre- and post-tours in conjunction with the member committee and selected vendor(s)
    • Transportation: Coordinate all transportation for any off-property functions during the event, as well as VIP transfers
  • Communications: Coordinate the messaging for all communications and marketing deliverables with the internal Marketing and Communications team; liaise with EO staff and member committee(s) to produce the following: event website, registrant e-mail updates and mobile application
  • Onsite: Mobilize and train EO staff for execution
  • Provide assistance to the Event Director as directed.

Plan and execute Global Events (Exploration, Family Experience, Couple’s Retreat)

  • Serve as event lead in the planning and execution
  • Liaise with staff and member leaders responsible for content development
  • Coordinate all meeting setup, F&B and room blocks directly with venue/hotel
  • Manage budget
  • Responsible for vendor management (DMC, vendors)
  • Coordinate any off-site social events and transportation
  • Coordinate any marketing and communications pieces for the event
  • Lead and prepare a team of EO Global staff for the on-site execution of the event.

Support to the Learning Committee:

  • Sit on Learning Committee calls and other expert calls as deemed necessary
  • Support to the Learning Committee with templates, checklist and SOPs for various event planning tasks via sanctioned Global events and portfolios.

General Responsibilities

  • Participate in team meetings to address best practices for the organization
  • Provide assistance for, and share meeting-planning expertise with your peers
  • Support other teams as event lead or event support on their signature events
  • Develop and improve event templates, processes and procedures to better meet the needs of committees and staff team
  • Support other duties as assigned.


QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS, AND KNOWLEDGE REQUIRED

  • Bachelor's degree
  • Minimum of 2-5 years of event planning and operating experience
  • Works harmoniously and effectively with others as part of a team
  • Excellent organizational skills
  • Ability to interact with entrepreneurs with tact diplomacy and poise
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Promote quality through continuous performance improvement
  • The use of good judgment and good interpersonal communication skills
  • Well-developed analytical and problem solving skills
  • Works harmoniously and effectively with others as part of a team
  • A self-starter who desires to show ownership and commitment to the job
  • Exercises confidentiality and discretion

Ideal candidates will all have one or more of the following certifications and/or experience:

  • MPI (Meeting Planners International) membership
  • CMP (Certified Meeting Professional)
  • PMP (Project Management Professional)
  • Computer software skills training
  • Personal development training


ADA Specifications

  • Professional workplace where business casual attire is required.
  • Ability to work in a fast paced and high pressure environment.
  • Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties and responsibilities of the role.

title: Catering and Events Manager
company: Holiday Inn and Suites Windsor (Ambassador Bridge)...
description:
The Holiday Inn and Suites Windsor , Ontario is currently recruiting for Catering and Events Manager

Working closely with the Director of Sales, is expected to deliver exceptional guest service and strong financial results. The position will take the leadership role in developing our existing 16,000 sq ft of meeting space as a venue of choice in Windsor and implementing innovative sales for the same along with client retention. If you are confident that your background and proven skill sets support your suitability for this position…We want to hear from you !

If you are a passionate individual who thrives in an environment where you can optimize processes and efficiency by testing new ideas and strategies to drive business, we encourage you to take advantage of this exciting opportunity. We want to hear from you !

About the Role

We’re looking for an experienced events assistant manager to take a hands-on role in planning and leading various events including conferences, meetings, corporate parties, weddings and social events. Reporting to the director Sales, it’ll be the candidate's responsibility to ensure that all client’s needs are met and exceeded, right through from initial contact to final delivery.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Managing multiple events, parties and weddings simultaneously
  • Liaising with clients to understand event briefs and objectives for events
  • Taking end-to-end ownership of the event planning and management process
  • Ensuring that all events are planned and executed within the agreed budget
  • Finding and booking suitable event venues, contractors and suppliers
  • Managing and briefing third-party suppliers
  • Ensuring strict legal compliance across all events
  • Attending events and managing on site team, ensuring we exceed the client’s brief
  • Having weekly briefings with the Porter team, Restaurant Manager and Chef
  • Prospecting for future Business with sales calls and visits.
  • Printing and distribution of all weekly Event Orders, sending weekly summaries and ensuring timely settlement of Posting master Accounts
  • Maintaining all events records for audit purposes.

Location & Commitments

  • On property work role.
  • Full-time, 40 hours per week with 9–5 core work hours
  • Will be required to attend evening and weekend work for events based on needs, time off given in lieu.
  • Sales calls off site as required.

Candidate Requirements

Essential

  • At least 2 years of experience in the events industry, ideally as an event planner or manager with hotels
  • Proven results in planning or leading successful and profitable events.
  • Experience of negotiating deals with suppliers and contractors
  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills – a true ‘people person’ happy to talk to anyone and everyone
  • Strong multi-tasker with experience of juggling numerous projects and deadlines

Desirable

  • Knowledge of events booking database, Sales Force by Amadeus.
  • Previous IHG experience will be a plus.

All interested candidates may apply online for this position.

ReplyForward

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations:
yes all staff are to wear masks

Experience:

  • Event Planners & Managers: 2 years (required)
  • Hotel: 2 years (required)

Application deadline: 2022-04-25

title: Catering Manager
description:
Catering Operations Manager


This position oversees the entire Catering Department. It is the responsibility of this role to ensure all operations are running to their full potential, that sales goals are being met, and that quality of services are upheld. This position handles both internal and external catering sales (majorly focusing on the sales within the CAC Building), manages the catering budget and projects upcoming business, is responsible for marketing, menu development, custom quoting and standards. This position also handles all client invoicing, small wares inventory and ordering, as well as daily SPLH goals.

Responsible for: catering business operations, client relations, marketing, business development, food and beverages sales, menu creation, promotions and marketing, custom quoting, contract management, liaise with conference services, client invoicing, financial reporting, HR requirements, customer service, developing catering policies and standards, food quality management, communication between conference services and catering, managing CaterTrax website.


Reports to: Food Service Director

Manages: Assistant Catering Manager, Catering Supervisor, Set-Up Manager

Sales Management

  • Handle all catering sales calls
  • Meet with client to discuss catering requirements
  • Ensure all information acquired is accurately update din Catertrax
  • Advise clients on appropriate order, assist in planning, etc
  • Provide outstanding customer service
  • Utilize selling to encourage upgrades and add-ons
  • Completing custom quotes in conjunction with the Executive Chef


Event Contract Management

  • Collecting contracts on a daily basis from CaterTrax and Caterease
  • Ensuring both CaterTrax and Caterease copies are identical when it comes to Catering
  • Going over the logistics of an event with the Catering Manager and/or the conference office
  • Contacting the conference office if unsure about information on a room booking contract
  • Attend weekly meeting with the conference office and catering team


Daily Event Management

  • Contacting the conference office if unsure about information on a contract
  • Following up with the Assistant Catering Manager and Catering supervisor to ensure that everything is running smoothly and ensure that a quality check is done with them regarding any food and beverage if it is provided
  • Managing catering supervisor to ensure all details of the catering contract are executed correctly and on time


Financial Reporting and Management

  • Complete quarterly, monthly and weekly sales and labour projections
  • Complete any financial reports requested by the Food Service Director
  • Ensure team is working within the Catering Budget
  • Ensure expenses are accounted for
  • Ensure retail prices accurately reflect expenses and a reasonable profit margin

Marketing

  • Marketing catering business to both internal and external clients
  • Develop specials and LTOs to encourage ordering
  • Work with Conference Services to take part in Conference Centre marketing projects
  • Track success of marketing initiatives


Managing Assistant Catering Manager

  • Ensure he/she is fulfilling the requirements of their position
  • Training management in sales and conference centre standards
  • Take disciplinary action when needed
  • Implement and train new standards and systems with management team
  • Ensure health and safety standards are being met by managers


Managing Catertrax Website

  • Ensure all menus are accurate and up-to-date
  • Ensure marketing initiatives are accurately and attractively displayed
  • Ensure back-end reporting is accurate
  • Update website as needed
  • Ensure order system is working properly at all times


Miscellaneous

  • New menu concepts and development
  • Accomplish projects for the catering department in a timely manner and to high standard
  • Managing smallwares inventory and ordering
  • Managing liquor license
  • Developing standards and policies


Health and Safety:

  • Enforce Health and Safety regulations and policies
  • Review incident report documentation in the event of an accident
  • Receive updates from Catering Supervisor regarding companywide H&S policies and changes

title: Restaurant Manager
company: Big Smoke Burge | South Street Burger | La Diperie.
description:
Catering Operations Manager


This position oversees the entire Catering Department. It is the responsibility of this role to ensure all operations are running to their full potential, that sales goals are being met, and that quality of services are upheld. This position handles both internal and external catering sales (majorly focusing on the sales within the CAC Building), manages the catering budget and projects upcoming business, is responsible for marketing, menu development, custom quoting and standards. This position also handles all client invoicing, small wares inventory and ordering, as well as daily SPLH goals.

Responsible for: catering business operations, client relations, marketing, business development, food and beverages sales, menu creation, promotions and marketing, custom quoting, contract management, liaise with conference services, client invoicing, financial reporting, HR requirements, customer service, developing catering policies and standards, food quality management, communication between conference services and catering, managing CaterTrax website.


Reports to: Food Service Director

Manages: Assistant Catering Manager, Catering Supervisor, Set-Up Manager

Sales Management

  • Handle all catering sales calls
  • Meet with client to discuss catering requirements
  • Ensure all information acquired is accurately update din Catertrax
  • Advise clients on appropriate order, assist in planning, etc
  • Provide outstanding customer service
  • Utilize selling to encourage upgrades and add-ons
  • Completing custom quotes in conjunction with the Executive Chef


Event Contract Management

  • Collecting contracts on a daily basis from CaterTrax and Caterease
  • Ensuring both CaterTrax and Caterease copies are identical when it comes to Catering
  • Going over the logistics of an event with the Catering Manager and/or the conference office
  • Contacting the conference office if unsure about information on a room booking contract
  • Attend weekly meeting with the conference office and catering team


Daily Event Management

  • Contacting the conference office if unsure about information on a contract
  • Following up with the Assistant Catering Manager and Catering supervisor to ensure that everything is running smoothly and ensure that a quality check is done with them regarding any food and beverage if it is provided
  • Managing catering supervisor to ensure all details of the catering contract are executed correctly and on time


Financial Reporting and Management

  • Complete quarterly, monthly and weekly sales and labour projections
  • Complete any financial reports requested by the Food Service Director
  • Ensure team is working within the Catering Budget
  • Ensure expenses are accounted for
  • Ensure retail prices accurately reflect expenses and a reasonable profit margin

Marketing

  • Marketing catering business to both internal and external clients
  • Develop specials and LTOs to encourage ordering
  • Work with Conference Services to take part in Conference Centre marketing projects
  • Track success of marketing initiatives


Managing Assistant Catering Manager

  • Ensure he/she is fulfilling the requirements of their position
  • Training management in sales and conference centre standards
  • Take disciplinary action when needed
  • Implement and train new standards and systems with management team
  • Ensure health and safety standards are being met by managers


Managing Catertrax Website

  • Ensure all menus are accurate and up-to-date
  • Ensure marketing initiatives are accurately and attractively displayed
  • Ensure back-end reporting is accurate
  • Update website as needed
  • Ensure order system is working properly at all times


Miscellaneous

  • New menu concepts and development
  • Accomplish projects for the catering department in a timely manner and to high standard
  • Managing smallwares inventory and ordering
  • Managing liquor license
  • Developing standards and policies


Health and Safety:

  • Enforce Health and Safety regulations and policies
  • Review incident report documentation in the event of an accident
  • Receive updates from Catering Supervisor regarding companywide H&S policies and changes

title: Catering Sales Manager
description:
Catering Operations Manager


This position oversees the entire Catering Department. It is the responsibility of this role to ensure all operations are running to their full potential, that sales goals are being met, and that quality of services are upheld. This position handles both internal and external catering sales (majorly focusing on the sales within the CAC Building), manages the catering budget and projects upcoming business, is responsible for marketing, menu development, custom quoting and standards. This position also handles all client invoicing, small wares inventory and ordering, as well as daily SPLH goals.

Responsible for: catering business operations, client relations, marketing, business development, food and beverages sales, menu creation, promotions and marketing, custom quoting, contract management, liaise with conference services, client invoicing, financial reporting, HR requirements, customer service, developing catering policies and standards, food quality management, communication between conference services and catering, managing CaterTrax website.


Reports to: Food Service Director

Manages: Assistant Catering Manager, Catering Supervisor, Set-Up Manager

Sales Management

  • Handle all catering sales calls
  • Meet with client to discuss catering requirements
  • Ensure all information acquired is accurately update din Catertrax
  • Advise clients on appropriate order, assist in planning, etc
  • Provide outstanding customer service
  • Utilize selling to encourage upgrades and add-ons
  • Completing custom quotes in conjunction with the Executive Chef


Event Contract Management

  • Collecting contracts on a daily basis from CaterTrax and Caterease
  • Ensuring both CaterTrax and Caterease copies are identical when it comes to Catering
  • Going over the logistics of an event with the Catering Manager and/or the conference office
  • Contacting the conference office if unsure about information on a room booking contract
  • Attend weekly meeting with the conference office and catering team


Daily Event Management

  • Contacting the conference office if unsure about information on a contract
  • Following up with the Assistant Catering Manager and Catering supervisor to ensure that everything is running smoothly and ensure that a quality check is done with them regarding any food and beverage if it is provided
  • Managing catering supervisor to ensure all details of the catering contract are executed correctly and on time


Financial Reporting and Management

  • Complete quarterly, monthly and weekly sales and labour projections
  • Complete any financial reports requested by the Food Service Director
  • Ensure team is working within the Catering Budget
  • Ensure expenses are accounted for
  • Ensure retail prices accurately reflect expenses and a reasonable profit margin

Marketing

  • Marketing catering business to both internal and external clients
  • Develop specials and LTOs to encourage ordering
  • Work with Conference Services to take part in Conference Centre marketing projects
  • Track success of marketing initiatives


Managing Assistant Catering Manager

  • Ensure he/she is fulfilling the requirements of their position
  • Training management in sales and conference centre standards
  • Take disciplinary action when needed
  • Implement and train new standards and systems with management team
  • Ensure health and safety standards are being met by managers


Managing Catertrax Website

  • Ensure all menus are accurate and up-to-date
  • Ensure marketing initiatives are accurately and attractively displayed
  • Ensure back-end reporting is accurate
  • Update website as needed
  • Ensure order system is working properly at all times


Miscellaneous

  • New menu concepts and development
  • Accomplish projects for the catering department in a timely manner and to high standard
  • Managing smallwares inventory and ordering
  • Managing liquor license
  • Developing standards and policies


Health and Safety:

  • Enforce Health and Safety regulations and policies
  • Review incident report documentation in the event of an accident
  • Receive updates from Catering Supervisor regarding companywide H&S policies and changes

title: Catering Manager
description:
Catering Operations Manager


This position oversees the entire Catering Department. It is the responsibility of this role to ensure all operations are running to their full potential, that sales goals are being met, and that quality of services are upheld. This position handles both internal and external catering sales (majorly focusing on the sales within the CAC Building), manages the catering budget and projects upcoming business, is responsible for marketing, menu development, custom quoting and standards. This position also handles all client invoicing, small wares inventory and ordering, as well as daily SPLH goals.

Responsible for: catering business operations, client relations, marketing, business development, food and beverages sales, menu creation, promotions and marketing, custom quoting, contract management, liaise with conference services, client invoicing, financial reporting, HR requirements, customer service, developing catering policies and standards, food quality management, communication between conference services and catering, managing CaterTrax website.


Reports to: Food Service Director

Manages: Assistant Catering Manager, Catering Supervisor, Set-Up Manager

Sales Management

  • Handle all catering sales calls
  • Meet with client to discuss catering requirements
  • Ensure all information acquired is accurately update din Catertrax
  • Advise clients on appropriate order, assist in planning, etc
  • Provide outstanding customer service
  • Utilize selling to encourage upgrades and add-ons
  • Completing custom quotes in conjunction with the Executive Chef


Event Contract Management

  • Collecting contracts on a daily basis from CaterTrax and Caterease
  • Ensuring both CaterTrax and Caterease copies are identical when it comes to Catering
  • Going over the logistics of an event with the Catering Manager and/or the conference office
  • Contacting the conference office if unsure about information on a room booking contract
  • Attend weekly meeting with the conference office and catering team


Daily Event Management

  • Contacting the conference office if unsure about information on a contract
  • Following up with the Assistant Catering Manager and Catering supervisor to ensure that everything is running smoothly and ensure that a quality check is done with them regarding any food and beverage if it is provided
  • Managing catering supervisor to ensure all details of the catering contract are executed correctly and on time


Financial Reporting and Management

  • Complete quarterly, monthly and weekly sales and labour projections
  • Complete any financial reports requested by the Food Service Director
  • Ensure team is working within the Catering Budget
  • Ensure expenses are accounted for
  • Ensure retail prices accurately reflect expenses and a reasonable profit margin

Marketing

  • Marketing catering business to both internal and external clients
  • Develop specials and LTOs to encourage ordering
  • Work with Conference Services to take part in Conference Centre marketing projects
  • Track success of marketing initiatives


Managing Assistant Catering Manager

  • Ensure he/she is fulfilling the requirements of their position
  • Training management in sales and conference centre standards
  • Take disciplinary action when needed
  • Implement and train new standards and systems with management team
  • Ensure health and safety standards are being met by managers


Managing Catertrax Website

  • Ensure all menus are accurate and up-to-date
  • Ensure marketing initiatives are accurately and attractively displayed
  • Ensure back-end reporting is accurate
  • Update website as needed
  • Ensure order system is working properly at all times


Miscellaneous

  • New menu concepts and development
  • Accomplish projects for the catering department in a timely manner and to high standard
  • Managing smallwares inventory and ordering
  • Managing liquor license
  • Developing standards and policies


Health and Safety:

  • Enforce Health and Safety regulations and policies
  • Review incident report documentation in the event of an accident
  • Receive updates from Catering Supervisor regarding companywide H&S policies and changes

title: Gérant.e de Restaurants
description:
Catering Operations Manager


This position oversees the entire Catering Department. It is the responsibility of this role to ensure all operations are running to their full potential, that sales goals are being met, and that quality of services are upheld. This position handles both internal and external catering sales (majorly focusing on the sales within the CAC Building), manages the catering budget and projects upcoming business, is responsible for marketing, menu development, custom quoting and standards. This position also handles all client invoicing, small wares inventory and ordering, as well as daily SPLH goals.

Responsible for: catering business operations, client relations, marketing, business development, food and beverages sales, menu creation, promotions and marketing, custom quoting, contract management, liaise with conference services, client invoicing, financial reporting, HR requirements, customer service, developing catering policies and standards, food quality management, communication between conference services and catering, managing CaterTrax website.


Reports to: Food Service Director

Manages: Assistant Catering Manager, Catering Supervisor, Set-Up Manager

Sales Management

  • Handle all catering sales calls
  • Meet with client to discuss catering requirements
  • Ensure all information acquired is accurately update din Catertrax
  • Advise clients on appropriate order, assist in planning, etc
  • Provide outstanding customer service
  • Utilize selling to encourage upgrades and add-ons
  • Completing custom quotes in conjunction with the Executive Chef


Event Contract Management

  • Collecting contracts on a daily basis from CaterTrax and Caterease
  • Ensuring both CaterTrax and Caterease copies are identical when it comes to Catering
  • Going over the logistics of an event with the Catering Manager and/or the conference office
  • Contacting the conference office if unsure about information on a room booking contract
  • Attend weekly meeting with the conference office and catering team


Daily Event Management

  • Contacting the conference office if unsure about information on a contract
  • Following up with the Assistant Catering Manager and Catering supervisor to ensure that everything is running smoothly and ensure that a quality check is done with them regarding any food and beverage if it is provided
  • Managing catering supervisor to ensure all details of the catering contract are executed correctly and on time


Financial Reporting and Management

  • Complete quarterly, monthly and weekly sales and labour projections
  • Complete any financial reports requested by the Food Service Director
  • Ensure team is working within the Catering Budget
  • Ensure expenses are accounted for
  • Ensure retail prices accurately reflect expenses and a reasonable profit margin

Marketing

  • Marketing catering business to both internal and external clients
  • Develop specials and LTOs to encourage ordering
  • Work with Conference Services to take part in Conference Centre marketing projects
  • Track success of marketing initiatives


Managing Assistant Catering Manager

  • Ensure he/she is fulfilling the requirements of their position
  • Training management in sales and conference centre standards
  • Take disciplinary action when needed
  • Implement and train new standards and systems with management team
  • Ensure health and safety standards are being met by managers


Managing Catertrax Website

  • Ensure all menus are accurate and up-to-date
  • Ensure marketing initiatives are accurately and attractively displayed
  • Ensure back-end reporting is accurate
  • Update website as needed
  • Ensure order system is working properly at all times


Miscellaneous

  • New menu concepts and development
  • Accomplish projects for the catering department in a timely manner and to high standard
  • Managing smallwares inventory and ordering
  • Managing liquor license
  • Developing standards and policies


Health and Safety:

  • Enforce Health and Safety regulations and policies
  • Review incident report documentation in the event of an accident
  • Receive updates from Catering Supervisor regarding companywide H&S policies and changes

title: Food Service Supervisor (NOC 6311)
company: 2523029 Ontario Inc. o/a Quesada Burritos & Tacos
description:
One (1) permanent full-time position of Food Service Supervisor (NOC 6311) available at 2523029 Ontario Inc. o/a Quesada Burritos & Tacos located at 331 Bayfield Street, Barrie, ON, L4M 3C2.

 

Main Duties to be completed as per the lead statement of NOC 6311:

 

  • Supervise & coordinate the kitchen staff and schedule their activities
  • Estimate and order ingredients and supplies required for food preparation
  • Establish & implement methods to meet work schedules given by the company.
  • Maintain records of stock manually & electronically
  • Equipment repairs every month or as & when required.
  • Prepare & submit Sales, Inventory, Cleaning, pay-outs reports to the Manager.
  • Train staff in job duties and train them to follow sanitation and safety procedures
  • Supervise and check assembly of food order, delivery of food to the customers accordingly.
  • Resolving customer complaints on time like employee behaviour, sanitation, product lack etc.
  • Make sure that food and service meet quality control standards set by the company.
  • Assisting Manager in hiring food service staff and assist in the development sales.

 

Requirements:

Minimum Six (6) months of work experience.

Completion of Secondary School required.

 

Wage Rate : $16.00/hour

Hours : 40 Hours/week

title: Bar Manager - Food and Beverage Serving Workers
description:
Description

Are you fuelled by a good challenge? Do you love working with people? Excited about finding new ways to bring in customers? Do you have experience running a bar and/or licensed restaurant? If yes, the Rack & Rally Social Hub is looking for YOU.

 We are a fun lounge offering karaoke 3 nights a week, 10 pool tables and a complete fitness experience with a fully equipped gym and three squash courts. We’re located in the heart of Port Alberni on beautiful Vancouver Island.

 Port Alberni is not only one of BC's most affordable communities, it is surrounded by the natural beauty of forest and ocean, full of opportunities for outdoor activity and very liveable.

 We’re seeking an experienced Bar Manager to help us step up our game. If you’re dedicated and ambitious, this is an great opportunity to grow your career.

Responsibilities

Reporting to the business owner, you will be expected to plan, direct and oversee all bar operations including:

· Hiring, training, scheduling and motivating staff.

· Maintaining excellent product and service standards.

· Providing input on marketing and social media and manage special events

· Selecting and controlling inventory.

· Creating and implementing quality, health, safety, and loss prevention procedures.

· Maintaining appropriate cash and inventory control and accounting procedures.

· Creating and documenting bar menus and pricing strategies.

 

We are adding a pub-style kitchen in the near future. Preferred candidates will have the experience and ability to:

· Recruit and hire appropriate cooking staff.

· Help create an appropriate menu including signature dishes.

Knowledge and Skills

You have:

· Amazing leadership and communication skills for dealing with diverse staff, guests and others.

· Ability to remain calm under pressure.

· Enthusiasm and lots of energy.

· Prior experience managing a bar with food service or a licensed restaurant.

· Serving It Right certificate.

· Applicants with post-secondary education in hospitality management are preferred.

 

This position requires the ability to walk, stand and occasionally carry up to 50 lbs.

You must be willing to work during peak hours including nights, weekends and holidays.

 Must consent to background and credit checks.

 Compensation: Commensurate with experience; free gym/squash membership; group benefits; relocation allowance for the right candidate.

Employee Benefits

Free gym/squash membership; group benefits; relocation allowance for the right candidate.

title: Restaurant Manager
description:
The Epicurean restaurant is located at 84 Queen Street, Niagara-on-the-Lake, Ontario L0S 1J0. In April 2016, new ownership and a new staff embarked on the reopening of “The Epicurean”. The restaurant is renovated with a contemporary look and a new concept which includes serving breakfast, lunch and dinner.

Our restaurant is dedicated to providing our clientele great seasonal foods and phenomenal local wines from Niagara’s region.  Our cuisine is mainly Mediterranean based on fresh food locally produced and cooked by a very talented culinary team. It has a warm ambiance and our goal is to meet all your dining needs.

The restaurant is seeking to hire a restaurant manager to add to our talented team. This is a full time, permanent position for 35-55 hours per week. $60,000 annual salary.  Related post-secondary education is required. Minimum 3-5 years experience is required.

Job duties are described below:

  • Must work in a team setting
  • Drive sales
  • Responsible for scheduling a busy seasonal restaurant
  • Must show leadership skills and build the team's vision for an unparalleled dining experience for our customers
  • You must have previous restaurant management experience and must work well with owners
  • Knowledge and experience in training, serving, Bar, Reservations, all FOH etiquette, proper communication with staff, customers and BOH
  • Performing opening and closing duties of the restaurant
  • Ensuring completion of daily checks
  • Interacting with guests to ensure guest experience is satisfactory
  • Monitoring every form of service that is being rendered to guest within the steps of service
  • Addressing all guest issues, and satisfaction with guests always
  • Assist with recruiting and training new staff

Apply by Email: epi.hires@gmail.com

title: Taproom Manager
description:
Moody Ales & Co is one of the original craft breweries located on Brewers Row in Port Moody. Established in 2014, we have grown to be a mid-size brewery with distribution throughout British Columbia and into Alberta. We are seeking an organized, detail-oriented individual to join our team in Port Moody. The candidate will work closely with members of our production, sales, distribution, and management teams.

 

Position Summary

 

We are looking for an experienced leader to manage the Moody Ales & Co Taproom and lead its dedicated team. The successful candidate will execute a broad range of responsibilities to drive revenue growth, overseeing all Taproom operations as well as maintaining our core focus of outstanding customer experience. We are looking for a passionate professional who is:

 

•        Results driven with a customer centric focus.

•        Organized, detail oriented, takes initiative, and has the ability to make decisions independently.

•        Passionate and knowledgeable about craft beer.

•        Possesses a strong food and beverage background.

 

Key Responsibilities

•        Leads and manages the Taproom team’s day-to-day operations.

•        Prepares employee work schedules.

•        Provides Taproom staff with the training required to perform their roles effectively. This involves creating Standard Operating Procedures for certain work tasks/activities, where required.

•        Supervises and evaluates the Taproom team's performance; including but not limited to: instruction and direction on tasks, performance management, and assignment of work.

•        Creates innovative ways to increase and diversify revenue streams for the Taproom.

•        Acts as the main liaison with event hosts, food trucks, and other food vendors.

•        Manages inventory and ordering supplies.

•        Acts as the primary point of contact for post-event feedback and any necessary conflict resolution.

•        Ensures Taproom remains in line with budget, reviews monthly P&L with ownership.

•        Serves retail or draught beer to customers with knowledge of product offering.

 

The successful candidate will have:

•        3+ years in a similar role in hospitality, with at least 2 years in a supervisory capacity.

•        Flexibility on shifts; evenings, weekends, holidays as required.

•        Serving It Right certification.

•        Excellent interpersonal and communication (written and verbal) skills.

•        Rigorous and efficient planning, organizational, and time management skills with the ability to multi-task.

•        Excellent conflict management skills.

•        Ability to lead a team and be able to provide instructions and support on tasks/projects/events.

•        Ability to be flexible and work well under pressure.

•        Reliability and punctuality.

•        Basic computer skills (Google Workspace).

•        The ability to lift and change a 60kg keg.

 

 

All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, age, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin or disability. We encourage anyone interested and qualified to apply.

title: Restaurant Manager (NOC 0631)
company: 2695201 Ontario Ltd. o/a Piper Arms Pub
description:
One (1) permanent full-time position of Restaurant Manager (NOC 0631) available at 2695201 Ontario Ltd. o/a Piper Arms Pub located at 4391 King St East, Kitchener, ON, N2P 2G1.

 

Main Duties to be completed as per the lead statement of NOC 0631:

  • Plan the daily operations of restaurant, organize the employees’ hierarchy & distribute the work, control the food cost & waste, evaluate the employees’ performance, customer service & operations of the business.
  • Determine the types of services like dine-in, catering orders, takeout & deliveries etc.
  • Contacting various organizations in the neighborhood to enhance the business.
  • Implementation & follow operational procedures (reports, weekly ordering etc) for smooth functioning.
  • Recruitment of new staff as per the requirement, training of new staff & training of old staff whenever there is a change in menu or procedures.
  • Scheduling of staff members & setting work schedules according to days & sales, monitoring staff performance on daily & weekly basis & submit the reports to the General Manager.
  • Ensure the front area & seating arrangements are meeting the hygiene standards.
  • Inventory control on manually & electronically, monitoring revenue generation and modifying prices online & updating menu as needed.
  • Resolving customer complaints and ensuring all health and safety procedures are followed as per the set standards.
  • Settling & negotiating arrangements with suppliers for food and other supplies

 

Requirements:
Minimum One (1) year of experience.
Completion of College Diploma or equivalent.


Wage Rate : $20.00/hour
Hours : 40 Hours/week

title: Assistant Restaurant Manager (NOC 0631)
description:
Company Information:

 

Opened in October 2020, Paramount BBQ Restaurant is located in the heart of Kingsway, the principal corridor between Metrotown and downtown Vancouver just steps away from public transportation. The culinary artists at Paramount BBQ restaurant take great pride in handcrafting each northeast Chinese BBQ style dish to ensure every visit to our restaurant is unforgettable. Guests rave about our diverse BBQ menu and our four treasure delicious dishes. Paramount BBQ restaurant has only been open for a couple of years, but with its innovative and authentic northeast Chinese BBQ, it has become known as a place that unites the culture and heritage of the Orient with rich memories of home, which evokes feelings of warmth and ease through its elegant and comfortable surroundings. Here, guests can relax and reminisce about cherished time spent with family and friends. The cuisine is reminiscent of its homeland that it will transport you to a simpler time where the focus was trained on exquisite taste, excellent service, and stellar presentation.

We are looking for a driven Assistant Restaurant Manager to assist the General Manager in overseeing all aspects of the restaurant operations and management during shift.

 

Key Responsibilities:

 

  • Assist the General Manager in maintaining operations by preparing policies and standard operating procedures, aiming for consistent productivity and quality.
  • Assist in purchasing, storage, preparation, handling, and serving all food beverage products to customers.
  • Act as a support system for all areas of the restaurant.
  • Assist in planning restaurant budget and generating financial reports.
  • Ensure health and safety regulations are strictly followed by staff.
  • Attend weekly meetings with the General Manager to review sales activities and suggest ways of increasing revenue and increasing customer service.
  • Maintain spotlessly clean, safe restaurant at all times.
  • Monitor inventory and ensure that all food supplies and other restaurant essentials are adequately stocked.
  • Resolve customer complaints in a professional manner.
  • Participate in marketing plans and implementation.
  • Act with integrity, honesty, and knowledge that promote the culture and values of our restaurant.
  • Perform other essential duties as required, including assisting in all banquet arrangements and events and relieving staff in case of emergencies.

Preferred Qualifications:

 

·         A College Diploma plus five years of working experience in a service or hospitality industry management position is preferred.

·         Knowledge of Chinese cuisine is a plus!

·         Excellent leader with great people skills

·         Proactive – sees life as choices and chooses to make a positive impact

·         People-oriented – enjoys working with our guests and associates; possesses good communication and interpersonal skills.

·         Growth-oriented – knows that learning and growth are keys to personal and professional success and is willing and able to share learning with others.

·         Results Oriented - focuses on getting results without compromising guests, people and financial areas.

·         Good attention to detail and take personal pride in all that you do

·         Must be able to lift to 30 lbs and frequently bend and twist from the waist

·         Must be willing to work some weekends and evenings, if required.

·         Well-organized with excellent time management

·         Must be responsible and accountable

·         Excellent customer service and relationship skills are required

·         Problem-solving skills and customer-savvy

If you are interested in the assistant restaurant manager position, please send your resume by email to paramountbbq2022@gmail.com. We welcome qualified candidates to contact us by email and submit resumes. Please note that only selected candidates will be contacted.

title: Kitchen Manager
description:
Who You’ll Work For

REEF’s mission is to connect the world to your block. 

We transform underutilized urban spaces into neighborhood hubs that connect people to locally curated goods, services, and experiences.

With an ecosystem of 5,000 locations and a team of 18,000 people, REEF is the largest operator of mobility, logistics hubs, and neighborhood kitchens in United States, Canada, and has a growing presence in Europe.

Together we are leveraging the power of proximity to keep our communities moving forward in a sustainable and thoughtful way. 

What You’ll Do

REEF Kitchen Vessel Captains (Kitchen Managers) will oversee the operations of REEF’s business at their respective location. This position will manage all kitchens employees with a single vessel to ensure food safety compliance, excellent food quality, on time delivery, cost effective performance and people leadership.

This role will play a key role in REEF’s success on a site through being a champion of their specific vessel—knowing how to be sure all the various Applications function successfully as REEF continues to build the ecosystem that connects the world to your block. The role requires inventory management, interpretation of performance data, and personnel oversite.

Key Relationships

Reports to: NBRHD General Manager, MSA General Manager or Site Manager

Direct reports: Kitchens supervisors and line cooks within a vessel.

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage a diverse team of line cooks and Kitchens Supervisors.
  • Responsible for the end-to-end employee life cycle of team members in their vessel. This includes support of hiring process, development, scheduling, performance management and engagement of our team members.
  • Meet or exceed food and vessel safety, sanitation, quality, delivery and particularly food beverage health code compliance.
  • Accountable for vessel KPI performance in coordination with local leaders and company direction.
  • Create a work environment that makes REEF a great place to belong.
  • Understand how to manage costs and maximize revenue at vessel level.
  • Ensure the safety of all operations, particularly food and beverage health code compliance.
  • Ensure the operational efficiency of the vessel, including maintenance, security and utilities oversight.

What We Want From You:

Background/Experience

  • Operational experience preferably at hospitality, food and beverage.
  • Excellent understanding of various cooking methods, ingredients, equipment and procedures to lead a team of line cooks and kitchens supervisors.
  • Strong organization and communication skills; experience managing people and working collaboratively across multiple levels, and functions.

Style/Culture

  • A team player with high EQ and collaborative approach to leadership.
  • Tolerance for uncertainty and a rapidly changing environment.
  • High intensity execution mindset, able to operate at pace.
  • Gravitas and presence, capable of leading a diverse team.
  • Need to be a believer, devoted to the mission and excited about the company’s potential.
  • Embody and lead using the REEF core values: ability to show up, be bold, show grit, be curious and be true

What We’ll Provide

(Full-Time Employee Only)
Medical
Dental
Vision

Life and Disability
RRSP Match Program
Paid Time Off (PTO)

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

  • While performing the duties of this job, the incumbent is regularly required to use hands and fingers to handle or feel.
  • Incumbent is occasionally required to taste or smell
  • Push, pull, and lift up to 50lbs on a weekly basis.
  • Be able to reach, bend, stoop and work in a standing position for a long period of time

WORKING CONDITIONS

  • Must be comfortable working in a shared space, with constant noise, without the use of a private office
  • Must be able to cope with frequent changing priorities and deadlines with a high degree of optimism, professionalism & collaboration
  • Schedules may vary from week to week based on business demands in excess of 40 hours with or without notice including weekends, nights, holidays

REEF Technology is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity at our company. REEF does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, national origin, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. REEF complies with all applicable equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction in which it operates.

title: Kitchen Supervisor - $19/hr + Benefits
description:
Kitchen Supervisor

Full Time (35 - 40hrs/week) - 8 hr Shifts

**$19/hr + Benefits**

Who You’ll Work For?

REEF’s mission is to connect the world to your block. 

We transform underutilized urban spaces into neighborhood hubs that connect people to locally curated goods, services, and experiences.
With an ecosystem of 5,000 locations and a team of 18,000 people, REEF is the largest operator of mobility, logistics hubs, and neighborhood kitchens in North America.

Together we are leveraging the power of proximity to keep our communities moving forward in a sustainable and thoughtful way.

What You'll Do

You are a self-starter with leadership qualities who thrives in a fast paced, growing environment with the ability to build relationships with internal and external Clients.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities

  •  Sets up stations with all necessary supplies
  •  Handles, stores and rotates all products properly
  •  Cooks menu items in cooperation with the rest of the kitchen staff
  •  Always follows supervisors’/captains' direction
  •  Follows proper cooking techniques for all dishes
  •  Ensures food quality and timeliness
  •  Practices correct food handling and food storage procedures according to company and state regulations
  •  Complies with all nutrition, sanitation and safety regulations and standards
  •  Maintains a positive and respectful approach with everyone

  •  Labour management
  •  COGS management

  •  M&R

What We Want From You:

  •  Leadership skills
  •  Business acumen
  •  Knowledge of COGS and Inventory
  •  Previous cooking and management experience 3 to 4 years experience.
  •  Open availability
  •  Team-player
  •  Reliability
  •  Integrity
  •  Operational knowledge of hospitality equipment
  •  Ability to multi-task and prioritize
  •  Ability to perform under pressure
  •  Accuracy and speed in executing assigned tasks
  •  Excellent understanding of various cooking methods, ingredients, equipment and procedures
  •  Familiar with industry's best practices
  •  While performing the duties of this job, the incumbent is regularly required to use hands and fingers to handle or feel.
  •  Incumbent is occasionally required to taste or smell

  • While performing the duties of this job, the incumbent is regularly required to use hands and fingers to handle or feel.
  • Incumbent is occasionally required to taste or smell
  • Push, pull, and lift up to 50lbs on a weekly basis.
  • Be able to reach, bend, stoop and work in a standing position for a long period of time

WORKING CONDITIONS

  • Must be comfortable working in a shared space, with constant noise, without the use of a private office
  • Must be able to cope with frequent changing priorities and deadlines with a high degree of optimism, professionalism & collaboration
  • Schedules may vary from week to week based on business demands in excess of 40 hours with or without notice including weekends, nights, holidays
  • Must have reliable transportation at all hours

 

REEF Technology is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity at our company. REEF does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, gender, national origin, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. title: Restaurant Manager- Tim Hortons Locations in Fredericton
description:
Job Title: Restaurant Manager

Restaurant Location: Recruiting for Multiple Locations in the Fredericton and Minto Area
Availability: Must be available from 6am-5pm Monday-Sunday, occasionally may be needed for shifts outside of these hours.
Typically the schedule rotates for every other weekend off.
Job Status: Full Time, Permanent (Not suitable for Students)
Number of Vacancies: 1

Position Description:

As a Restaurant Manager you empower and lead your team to deliver exceptional guest experiences. You promote a respectful team environment and manage team members with open communication and understanding. You have the knowledge, skills and long term vision to support the Restaurant Owner in running a successful business. You are an expert at recruiting, training, and coaching a diverse team to achieve and maintain Tim Hortons' high standards of operation. Your high standards for operational excellence allow you to easily plan and execute methods of increasing sales and achieving targeted costs. You thrive in the fast paced atmosphere and love coming to work every day!

Your 3 -5 years of quick service experience in a supervisory role combined with your practical knowledge of recruiting, training and coaching team members makes you an ideal candidate for this role.

Apply to this opportunity if you:

  • Demonstrate a passion for guest service and creating exceptional guest experiences
  • Pride yourself on building relationships with guests and your team
  • Have strong operational experience
  • Have a passion for coaching and mentoring and are comfortable delegating tasks
  • Are ready to take on the full responsibility of running a Tim Hortons restaurant
  • Enjoy leading a diverse team in a fast-paced environment
  • Are able to engage others and develop high performance within your team
  • Must have previous Management Experience in Retail or Food Service

As part of our team we offer you:

  • Comprehensive training
  • Affordable Health & Dental Benefits (Over 20 hrs/week)
  • Incentive and recognition programs
  • Team Tim Hortons Scholarship Program
  • Advancement opportunities
  • Community involvement
  • Team Member Meal Discounts
  • Well Being Benefit Program
  • Free Uniforms
  • Annual Company Organized Events
  • Shift Premiums
  • Management Bonus Program
  • Scheduling in Advance and Flexibility in Schedules including mainly a Day Shift Schedule

If you are interested in this opportunity, please Apply Now.

title: Restaurant General Manager
description:
A&W Restaurants in West Kelowna, BC, is looking for a permanent full-time Restaurant Manager to start immediately at our Gellatly Road location at 3640 Gellatly Road, West Kelowna, BC.

Salary:  $52,000  Plus, up to 15% base salary bonus paid quarterly depending upon the restaurantâ€™s results.

Benefits which include an extensive single or family Medical/Dental Benefit comprised of Pharmaceuticals, Hospital Care, Paramedical, Medical Equipment, Travel, Visioncare, Basic and Optional Life, AD&D, along with an optional Group RRSP.

The McMurray Group is a franchise company with 40 A&W restaurants extending across British Columbia and the Yukon Territories. Our working environment is based on respect and listening. Everyone's efforts and results are recognized and celebrated.

ROLE

The Restaurant Manager is responsible for all aspects of restaurant operations including the quality and consistency of the customer experience, adherence to A&W standards, Provincial WCB, Employment and Health Regulations, the development of a motivated and productive team of employees, and ultimately, the growth and profitability of the business.  The Manger will be scheduled in positions, working â€˜hands-onâ€™ alongside the team members.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Operations

  • Balance key goals â€“ high quality, speed of service and cost control through effective management of the operating system.
  • Responsible for weekly P&L statement of cost of goods, labour costs and direct expenses.
  • Maintains A&W standards and conducts Performance reports regularly; recognizes areas for improvement and acts where improvement is needed.
  • Schedules staff, including self, to operational positions and shift roles.
  • Makes sure all equipment and facilities are in good condition, and plans for maintenance and repairs.
  • Working knowledge of climate goals, ensuring they are practiced daily.

    Human Resources

  • Recruits and hires hourly staff (Makes hiring decisions for supervisory and assistant manager positions in conjunction with the Area Manager and HR).
  • Trains, develops, confronts poor performance and terminates staff.
  • Leads meetings.
  • Ensures staff safety and a healthy, motivating work environment applying Daily Climate.
  • Documents critical incidents and reports them to key individuals.
  • Ensures monthly Health and Safety meetings walk through are completed and takes corrective action.
  • Has knowledge of HR policies and makes sure they are enforced.

    Financial

  • Completes daily, weekly, and period accounting administration.
  • Manages inventory control, ordering, cost control and weekly inventory counts.
  • Applies cash and food cost management principles.
  • Ensures restaurant profitability by managing costs to set thresholds and goals for profitability.

   Customers

  • Ensures that cleanliness standards and safe food handling practices are met.
  • Ensures high level of service to guests through efficient preparation, stocking, and staff positioning, including self.
  • Responsible for all local store marketing.
  • Manages accidents or complaints, implementing service recovery program.
  • Ensures teams appearance is to standard.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Strong interpersonal skills and proven leadership with supervisory experience
  • Expertise in all restaurant positions
  • Knowledge of restaurant Operating Systems
  • Complete knowledge of Operating Standards
  • High interest in developing others
  • Ability to do accounting and manage administrative aspects of the operation

PREFERED SKILLS

  • Acceptable oral and written business communication skills
  • Competency in Windows 10 and Microsoft Office applications, including Word, Excel, and Outlook
  • Ability to give presentations
  • Ability to build and maintain positive relationships with colleagues and suppliers

ADDITIONAL NOTES

Physical Demands

  • Standing and walking for extended periods
  • Some heavy lifting

Job Posted: February 16, 2022

 

How To Apply

Please ensure that you are providing a current, relevant, resume with pertinent work experience and references. Anyone who can legally work in Canada can apply for this job. If you are not currently authorized to work in Canada, the employer will not consider your job application.

We strongly encourage Candidates to apply to this job posting through the available links first for priority processing, otherwise, in the case that the link is not working, you may apply with your resume,

  • by email: recruitment@mcmurraygroup.ca
  • by mail: Recruitment - A&W McMurray Group, 2739 30th St., Vernon, BC, V1T 5C6, or
  • by fax: 250-275-6707, or
  • through our Career Page https://bit.ly/2J7m6ki

For further information regarding this posting, or others, please visit https://bit.ly/2J7m6ki or call 250-275-6706 x322 during business hours (10am - 4pm Pacific Time). If you are viewing this ad, the position has not been filled. Only qualified applicants will be contacted for assessments and interviews.
