title: Operations Supervisor (Contract)
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">The Operations Supervisor (Contract) will work with the Auto Transport Service, Operations Manager and lead, direct and control the activities of ATS private fleet of auto haul trucks. 

Responsibilities will include planning and scheduling work assignments to conform to shipping requirements and workload priorities; analyzing transportation requests received from plant and vendor shipping and receiving supervisors to determine equipment best suited for specific jobs; instructing drivers and lead transportation equipment as needs dictate; rerouting equipment to conform with corporate transportation requirements; established city and state routes; load, traffic and safety regulations when necessary, ensuring through analysis of trip sheets and contact with supervisor that drivers make no unnecessary or unauthorized stops while enroute to accomplish continuous movement of vehicles; and, ensuring expedited services are performed on a timely basis. ATS is a subsidiary of FCA Group Inc. and is a fully F.A.S.T. and C-TPAT approved operation. ATS, located in Windsor, Ontario, utilizes top of the line equipment and employs over 50 employees. 

This position is needed for our Windsor Terminal to support same day deliveries of finished vehicles throughout Michigan, Ohio and Ontario. 

The contract is expected to be for a duration of 9-months to a year. 

FCA Canada Inc. is committed to providing accommodation for people with accessibility needs due to disabilities in all aspects of the hiring process. If you request an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs due to disability. 

All FCA Canada Inc. employees are required to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment in accordance with the FCA Canada Inc. Covid-19 Vaccination Policy. 

 



Basic Qualifications: 

 
* Bachelor's degree 
* Minimum THREE (3) years of practical experience in supply chain management, logistics, transportation or manufacturing 
* High degree of resourcefulness, flexibility and adaptability 
* Knowledge of MTO and DOT laws and regulations 
* Exceptional time management, organizational and mediation skills 
* Advanced computing skill sets 
* Must be legally authorized to work in Canada 

Preferred Qualifications: 

 
* Post Graduate degree 
* Communication skill set that not only motivates but conveys a convincing command of written, verbal and listening capabilities 
* Willingness to work in a team environment 
* Experience with labour agreements and labour relations 
* Knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, leadership techniques, and coordination of people and resources 
* Must be willing to work all shifts and weekends as needed 

 

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled</section>

title: Directeur de service
description:
Établi au Québec depuis près de 25 ans, notre client est une entreprise familiale spécialisée dans la distribution d’équipement industriel. Nous recherchons actuellement un Directeur de service pour son usine située à Drummondville.


Ce que notre client vous offre :

  • Une carrière stimulante dans une entreprise dynamique et humaine;
  • Une ambiance amicale et stimulante;
  • Des équipements à la fine pointe de la technologie;
  • Des assurances médicales et voyages;
  • Possibilité de cotiser au REER et de recourir à un système de bonification;
  • Des vacances payées par l'employeur.

DESCRIPTION DU POSTE

Relevant de la directrice générale, le titulaire du poste, en collaboration avec son équipe, verra à la planification, l’organisation et la gestion des activités opérationnelles du département technique.

Principales responsabilités :

  • Gérer et/ou développer l’ensemble des activités du département technique, justifier les résultats, documenter à l’aide de rapports ou documents de suivis;
  • Faire des recommandations à la direction sur les améliorations possibles à apporter au département;
  • Planifier, organiser, diriger, prioriser et optimiser les activités de son département afin d’atteindre l’autonomie et la rentabilité de ce dernier;
  • Développer et utiliser des outils de travail permettant la lecture des résultats et permettant une amélioration continue des processus;
  • Participer à la décision des objectifs de l’entreprise;
  • Vérifier, approuver et acheminer la facturation de main-d’œuvre auprès des clients;
  • Préparer et acheminer aux clients les devis de formation et les offres de service.

PROFIL RECHERCHÉ

Pour mobiliser, développer et faire grandir son équipe, le candidat devra faire preuve d’un fort leadership, posséder d’excellentes habiletés de communication et de relations interpersonnelles. Gestionnaire éprouvé, le titulaire du poste démontre une grande capacité décisionnelle et est orienté à trouver des solutions aux problèmes tout en gardant un équilibre entre l’atteinte des résultats, la mobilisation des employés et les compétences techniques.

La nature de son travail demande une très grande capacité à gérer différents dossiers à la fois et à bien gérer le stress. Avec une attitude axée sur le service client, le candidat devra aussi faire preuve de professionnalisme, de rigueur et d’un sens de l’organisation élevé.

Qualifications :

  • Formation dans un domaine connexe;
  • Expérience d’au moins 5 ans en gestion de personnel;
  • Expérience dans la gestion d’un département technique;
  • Bilinguisme (français et anglais).

Le genre masculin a été utilisé dans le seul but d’en alléger le texte. Toutes les candidatures reçues seront traitées confidentiellement. Seules les candidatures retenues seront contactées.

title: Director of Service (Contract, Full Time)
description:
Director of Service

Are you looking for an inviting and exciting career opportunity? Do you want to positively contribute to an organization that serves the community? If the answer is “Yes!" this is the job for you!

Catholic Social Services is currently recruiting for a contract,full time, forty (40) hours per week, Director of Service to join our Immigration & Settlement Service in Edmonton, AB.

This position is a one (1) yearcontract (benefits eligible). Contract ending August 2023.

You will be joining an established Agency that is guided by faith to care for and bring hope to people in need with humility, compassion and respect. With more than 60 years of service delivery, Catholic Social Services is one of the largest multi-function social services agencies in Canada, with more than 1800 staff, and hundreds of volunteers delivering 100+ programs throughout Edmonton and Central Alberta.

Job Summary:

Reporting to the Vice President of Service, the Director plans, organizes, and directs the activities of the various departments. This position is part of the Service senior leadership team that carries out the overall strategy to develop, implement, monitor and evaluate programs. The Director will promote traditional and non-traditional partnership approaches implementing initiatives designed to integrate services and utilize funding to maximize resources and service impact within the community. The Director ensures delivery of quality of services and compliance with regulatory and funding requirements. This includes planning and development of programs and procedures in accordance with the Agency mission. The Director will manage budgets, quality assurance and will play a large role in the ongoing support and development of the staff.

Job Duties

  • Proactively build and maintain strategic collaborations and coalitions of stakeholders beneficial to the Agency based on a strategic understanding of the Agency’s mandate and challenges.
  • Take a long-term view of the needs of the Agency when focusing on potential alignments.
  • Identify interdependencies, define priorities and drive resolution of issues across groups, as appropriate.
  • Create and participate in strategic alliances and partnerships with key stakeholders to better meet emerging and future client needs and enhance the Agency and/or sector’s long term strategy.
  • Work with funding agencies and representatives to ensure ongoing and sustainable funding for programs. Foresee obstacles, risks and opportunities for the Agency (with a long-term horizon) and act accordingly.
  • Defines issues, generates opinions and selects solutions that are consistent with the strategy and vision.
  • Scan, seek out and assesses information on potential future directions.
  • Oversee the general management and accountability requirements of a comprehensive group of programs, which includes program development, delivery and evaluation as well as budget preparation and setting and knowledge management.
  • Maintain awareness of the external and internal social/human service, political and economic landscapes.
  • Stays knowledgeable about current legislation and policies affecting newcomers, including refugees, immigrants, temporary foreign works and others.
  • Collaborate with other members of the Service Leadership team to promote the Agency’s mission by identifying and developing programs/services to meet current and future needs of newcomers and communities.
  • Engage others in order to accomplish organizational goals and strategies, with a commitment to succession planning.
  • Attract, develop, coach, and retain high-performance team members, empowering them to elevate their level of responsibility, span of control and performance.
  • Delegate full authority and responsibility with the latitude to do a task in their own way in order to develop specific characteristics, including the opportunity to make and learn from mistakes in a non-critical setting.
  • Encourage others to assess their strengths and weaknesses, career goals, and strategies for achieving them.
  • Together with the Vice President, will have overall responsibility for the Service resource allocation, including staffing, financial and property.
  • Develop the necessary systems, processes, protocols and tools to better support the facilitation, collection and sharing of knowledge that is generated by the programs.
  • Ensure Service activities comply with organizational requirements for quality management, legal compliance and client services.
  • Recognize the inherent risks involved in the delivery of social service programming and able to identify, evaluate and develop strategies to mitigate risk while maintaining quality service delivery and care.
  • Keep the Vice President informed of the department’s operations, including strategies to respond to emerging and evolving program and operation needs.
  • Participate in the recruitment and appointment of Service Program Managers.
  • Convene, conduct and ensure serious occurrences and internal investigations are completed in accordance with Agency protocols and expectations.
  • Manage high-risk, complex, sensitive and multidisciplinary issues.
  • Prepare/coordinate multiple funding proposals and applications and interim and final reports.
  • Be familiar with funding, contract and accountability obligations and requirements.
  • Have experience with the management of multiple immigrant and refugee services.
  • Contributing to a communication strategy, supporting website updates/development and social media promotion.
  • Commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion development initiatives.

Requirements

Education & Experience

  • Master degree in related human services discipline or equivalent.
  • An experienced leader with 7 years or more of progressive leadership in a social services organization, with multi-site programs and services, multiple funders, including the immigrant settlement and refugee serving sector.
  • Experience working in a fast-paced cross-cultural and diverse environment.

Skills and Abilities:

  • The ideal candidate will have a track record of effectively leading a performance-based and outcomes based multiple program and staff. The individual will demonstrate maturity, self-awareness and insightfulness and possesses high ethical standards and an uncompromising sense of integrity.
  • Strategic thinker who is able to analyze internal and external environmental factors in order to identify current and future opportunities, challenges and risks and ensure ongoing service excellence
  • The ideal candidate will be passionate about the mission of the Catholic Social Services and understands the intricacies of the nonprofit sector, including the immigrant settlement sector.
  • Be a voice/advocate for Catholic Social Services, is a persuasive, credible and an effective communicator, including experience with public speaking and media relations
  • Be a strong negotiator, problem solver and possess excellent conflict resolution skills and have experience in solving complex issues.
  • Knowledgeable about immigration, settlement and adjustment issues affecting newcomers.

Please apply online at www.cssalberta.ca/careers to competition number 2745.

Closing date for Applications: May 11, 2022

The successful candidate must be able to travel to various locations, have a valid driver’s license and possess a vehicle. They will have ability to travel, with some overnight stays, if required.

If you are a strategic leader who consistently provides high quality and effective results, please submit your application today.

We offera competitive salary, comprehensive benefits package and a supportive working environment.

Police Information Check, Intervention Record Check and/or summary of driving record are conditions of employment and the financial responsibility of the candidate.

We embrace diversity and offer equal opportunities to all qualified applicants regardless of origin, culture, ethnicity, age, ability, gender identity, sexual orientation, and people of faith or no faith.

We thank all applicants. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Deli Supervisor
description:
Company Description

At Farm Boy, it is our mission to create a fun, fresh experience for all! Whether you are a team member or a customer, Farm Boy is passionate about creating a unique fresh food shopping experience and ensuring that we deliver on our commitments.

As we continue to grow within Ontario, Farm Boy is excited to welcome new team members that share our passion for providing the best fresh shopping experience!

Job Description

This position is responsible for assisting the Department Manager in the achievement of company, store and department goals as communicated by the Store Manager and Department Manager. The performance of the duties must ensure a quality service approach to all employees, customers and suppliers. All responsibilities must be performed in a manner consistent with the Farm Boy Way.

Major Responsibilities:

  • Provide superior customer service and support Farm Boy’s vision of the best fresh shopping experience.
  • Have a passion for food and knowledgeably handle all customer questions or comments confidently.
  • Utilizing Farm Boy Service Standards, welcome, greet and offer customer assistance as required.
  • Lead by example and promote corporate policies, customer service standards, departmental cleanliness and opening and closing procedures.
  • Assist the management team in supervising and performing departmental procedures (e.g. packaging, stocking, rotation, quality checks, finesse).
  • Assist, relieve and train department personnel as requested by the management team.
  • May be requested to undertake other related duties on a periodic basis.
Qualifications

  • Typically requires partial completion of a post-secondary program, plus a minimum of 1 year of progressively responsible experience in a similar role, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Superior customer service, organizational and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to work with little supervision with a high standard for quality, attention to detail and cleanliness.
  • Ability to work in a team environment with clear and effective communication style, both written and oral.
  • Flexible schedule, including weekends, evenings and holidays.
  • Fluency in English and French shall be considered an asset.

Work & Sensory Environment:

  • Required to stand for long periods of time during shift.
  • Required to lift, carry or handle heavy objects.
  • May be required to perform repetitive and/or precise hand/finger movements.
  • Required to adapt to temperature changes on occasion (working on the retail floor as well as in coolers, freezers, and outside).


Additional Information

Accommodation is available upon request for applicants and employees with disabilities.

title: Operations Supervisor
description:
Waste Connections of Canada is looking for a full-time Operations/Route Supervisor. We are looking for a SAFETY inclined, energetic, independent thinker, and a proactive Servant Leader capable of making, and creating change using our 5 core values. Our Brampton - Peel District, has an immediate opening for an Operations/Route Supervisor to lead a team of Residential Drivers within an overall group of 4 Supervisors. The Operations/Route Supervisor will have approx. 15 - 20 Driver/Loaders under their direct supervision, and will oversee 15 - 18 routes in the Peel Residential collection contract. The Supervisor will also assist the Operations Manager with daily route scheduling.




Previous experience managing a group of Drivers is required.




Position Summary:


Operations/Route Supervisor is responsible for managing the Residential Drivers within their assigned line of business. The Operations/Route Supervisor ensures that Residential Collections operations are running safely by performing driver observations and monthly safety meetings. This is a leadership role in our collections unit. The key responsibilities will be to ensure that our #1 value – safety, will be your focus at all times; also that Waste Connections is meeting, or exceeding the requirements of the collection contract.




Duties and Responsibilities:



+ Ensures that Drivers completing daily collections safety.


+ Assists Maintenance staff on truck issues from drivers, and checks on VCR’s when requested.


+ Plans and monitors employee schedules and route scheduling including regular communication throughout the day until all routes are completed.


+ Assists other Supervisors with collection issues on other LOBs.


+ Performance Management of employees through the progressive discipline process.


+ Conducts accident investigations including scene management, first accident report and assist with final analysis of the root cause and preventative measures. Maintaining adherence to company safety policies and MTO regulations.


+ Conducts field inspections and audits of all site personnel to ensure proper work procedures.


+ Works closely with Region Inspectors to ensure service issues or missed pickups are reported and resolved.


+ Additional requirements as requested by Operations or District Managers.





Qualifications:



+ Minimum 3 – 5 years managing Drivers in a unionized environment.


+ Knowledge of OSHA, MOL, and MOE guidelines.


+ Knowledge using Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook.


+ Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills.


+ Must be detail-oriented, highly accountable and able to prioritize tasks.


+ Minimum DZ Driver’s License.


+ ·Prior waste collection experience is an asset.





What’s In It for You?




You will be joining and serving in a team environment with colleagues who embrace a “work hard, play harder” culture. Our compensation package is competitive, and comes with excellent benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, RRSP plans. You’ll also be associating yourself with a company that likes to lead by example, through a strong presence in our local communities, charitable giving, sustainability initiatives and more.




Waste Connections of Canada/Enviro Connexions is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Supervisor Food Svcs I
description:
Supervisor Food Svcs I


Location:

Moncton, NB, CA, E1H 2R6


Requisition ID: 9160


IGT (NYSE:IGT) is a global leader in gaming. We deliver entertaining and responsible gaming experiences for players across all channels and regulated segments, from Lotteries and Gaming Machines to Sports Betting and Digital. Leveraging a wealth of compelling content, substantial investment in innovation, player insights, operational expertise, and leading-edge technology, our solutions deliver unrivaled gaming experiences that engage players and drive growth. We have a well-established local presence and relationships with governments and regulators in more than 100 countries around the world, and create value by adhering to the highest standards of service, integrity, and responsibility. IGT has approximately 10,500 employees. For more information, please visit www.igt.com (https://c212.net/c/link/?t=0&l=en&o=3466342-1&h=1955860405&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.igt.com%2F&a=www.igt.com) .


Responsibilities


Supervises cafés day to day needs, set standards. Keeps employees up to speed with information needed for daily operation to run efficiently. Interacts with Manager to ensure that site has all product needed for daily Café operations. Notifies manager of any problems or questions that may arise. General Role Ensures cafes are staffed and are up and running. Prepares for each day ensuring that the product is ready for all customers internal and external. Fills in wherever needed, work after hour events.


Supervises:


+ 2 Employees

+ Deals with any question or concerns of employees and customers

+ Handles special requests

+ Fixes any problems or concerns

+ Maintains equipment


Supervisor task:


+ Internal billing

+ Petty cash log

+ Work with Management to plans weekly menu

+ Deals with vendors

+ Purchases products

+ Maintains equipment


General Tasks:

Assists/prepare food each day as needed:


Breakfast:


+ Fruit Cups

+ Parfaits

+ Muffins Scratch Made

+ Assorted Bagels

title: Service Manager - Pickle Barrel (Sherway Gardens)
description:
Overview:

The Pickle Barrel is looking for a Service Manager at our 25 The West Mall, Etobicoke, ON M9C 1B8 location.

 

The Pickle Barrel began with a mission. We believed that amazing dining experiences didnâ€™t need to be elitist, so we began a restaurant that combined â€˜qualityâ€™ with â€˜incredible valueâ€™. Today we have restaurants all across the Greater Toronto Area, with a menu that offers over 200 items brought to you by over 1,000 employees- with no shortcuts. We promise to put real fresh food on the table every time!

 

We are looking for individuals that are passionate about food, hospitality, and providing their Guests with a Perfect Dining Experience to join our Pickle Barrel family!  

 

 

What you will do in this role:

  • Train and supervise staff
  • Ensure all food safety procedures are strictly adhered to according to regulations
  • Work closely with management to meet revenue objectives
  • Maintain safe working conditions for associates and Guests
  • Audit inventory levels to ensure product availability, and order products as necessary
  • Demonstrate ability to attract and retain excellent performers and develop high performing team mates
  • Promote a culture of dialogue, role model the values and practices of Recipe and possess developmental leadership skills  
  • Assist teammates whenever necessary  

 

What we are looking for:

  • 3-5 yearsâ€™ experience as a Manager in an upscale dining environment with similar sales volume
  • Post-secondary education, bonus points for hospitality and/or a business related field
  • Exceptional business acumen, including an understanding of budgets and operating costs
  • Extensive knowledge of upscale dining operations, food and beverage and long term sales growth
  • Demonstrated ability to motivate and direct others.
  • Possess an entrepreneurial spirit through having presence "on the floor" and in the community
  • Ability to work well independently and as part of a team

 

Whatâ€™s in it for you:

  • 20% employee discount dining card valid at participating Recipe brands
  • Flexible scheduling
  • Chance to be part of an energetic and dynamic team
  • Competitive wages
  • Fun working environment founded on respect  
  • Growth and development opportunities within the restaurant
  • Career advancement opportunities with a company that owns some of Canadaâ€™s most iconic restaurant brands  

 

Did you know Pickle Barrelâ€™s very own President started off as a busboy? If you are interested in this fantastic opportunity and growing your career, apply online today!

 

 

Recipe is committed to providing a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace. Celebrating people, being passionate and curious, owning it, and doing the right thing are the values that guide how we build our teams, support our franchisees and create a company that unlocks the full potential of everyone.  


Recipe is dedicated to providing accommodations in accordance with applicable human rights and accommodation legislation. For individuals that require accommodations please contact

title: Full Time Seasonal Operations (Stock) Supervisor,Toronto, ON
description:
SMCP - Sandro, Maje, Claudie Pierlot

Since our U.S. debut in 2011, SMCP – Sandro, Maje, Claudie Pierlot has masterfully led the way in the affordable luxury space across North America consisting of free-standing boutiques, leased concessions, and outlet in several key markets.   

A global Company supported by HQs in Paris, NYC, and Hong Kong with points of sale in 41 countries, SMCP has successfully developed a business model that blends elements of luxury and fast fashion together.  If you possess the profile that we are seeking and would be interested in joining us on our exciting journey as we seek to spread Parisian Chic around the world, please apply.

What you'll be doing...

  • Receipt and processing of shipments
  • Store-to-store transfers
  • Visual merchandising roll-outs
  • Inventory
  • Markdowns
  • RTV's
  • Asset protection
  • Safety
  • Stockroom & Selling floor maintenance
  • Participation in the selling process as needed
  • Performance of other duties as assigned.

PROFILE:

  • 1+ years of prior support experience.
  • Possesses strong service orientation
  • Subscribes to our core Company values of: Passion, Entrepreneurship, Creative, Worldly, Humility.
  • Strong organization skills and ability to work within established timelines.
  • Strong attention to details.
  • Consistently displays positive enthusiasm & energy, is friendly and charming to all.
  • Solid problem-solving skills
  • Brand appropriate personal presentation
  • Strong communication skills
  • Flexibility with scheduling needs of the business.
  • Bilingual in certain key markets.

KEY PERKS & BENEFITS:

  • Competitive Base Hourly Pay
  • Generous Shopping Discount - 50% off retail
  • Career growth opportunities for advancement
  • Wonderful team + colleagues!

title: Operations Supervisor
description:
Overview

Lynden International Logistics Co., a leader in the field of 3rd party logistics for the healthcare & consumer goods industries. As a leading advocate of operational efficiencies, we take pride in developing customized solution protocols within our systems, to meet the needs of our client partners within the healthcare industry. This is an afternoon shift role.

We encourage our employees to grow and develop within the company and believe our diverse workforce contributes tremendously to our success. Lynden offers many benefits for full-time employees including: Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance; an Employee Assistance Program; and Retirement Plans.

Why Lynden?

We offer a competitive salary, after 1 year of service employees will be eligible to participate in a pension plan. We offer Health, and Dental benefits after 3 months which are paid for by the company! Overtime is available.

Responsibilities

POSITION DESCRIPTION:

  • Schedule and allocate work to the hourly employees to ensure orders will be picked, packed and shipped in an efficient manner. This involves setting procedures to decide which orders to be dealt as a priority, which carrier to use, the time table for trucks coming in and out etc.
  • In the case of returns, ensures that they are checked and stocked in accordance with clients’ instructions.
  • Maintain employees’ attendance records. Makes sure the employment standards comply with the legislation, and conduct performance reviews.
  • Train employees. Whenever necessary, conduct counseling with employees and maintain discipline.
  • Plan staff requirements to meet future operational needs.
  • Participate in improving the efficiency of the warehouse operations, i.e. reviews procedures, modifies equipment.
  • Oversee the housekeeping of the warehouse, i.e. safety, security, machine maintenance, layout, stocking, inventory control of warehouse materials etc.
  • Deal with unforeseen situations, i.e. requests for shipment of life saving drugs under emergency.
  • On call 24 hours per day, 7 days a week for emergencies

Qualifications

Skills and Training Required:

  • Good verbal communication with staff, giving clear and concise instructions. Ability to write clearly.
  • Good labor relations skills to deal effectively with associates.
  • Ability to make decisions within well-defined standard practices and procedures.
  • Good analytical skills to solve inventory discrepancies.

Education and Experience:

  • Secondary school diploma
  • 2 years warehouse operations experience plus 1 year supervisory experience.

Lynden International Logistics is dedicated to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). During the hiring process if you require accommodation for disability, please advise Human Resources during the recruitment process.

title: Food & Beverage/Events Supervisor (FT)
description:
Position Summary:
 
The Food & Beverage/Events Supervisor is responsible for overseeing the front-of-house food and beverage operation including special events in cooperation with the Food & Beverage/Events Manager and Executive Chef. This includes coordinating all required activities, administrative duties, purchasing and receiving, inventory control, and compliance with all legislated regulations in cooperation with the Food & Beverage/Events Manager. Other duties will be assigned as necessary. 
 
Responsibilities
  • Idylwylde Golf & Country Club is seeking a team player who comes with food & beverage as well as event operations experience.
  • Assist the Food & Beverage/Events Manager with the administration of the department to ensure departmental effectiveness, efficiency, and a high standard of quality and customer service. 
  • Act as the Food & Beverage/Events Manager when they are not on-site to ensure all issues are dealt with expediently. 
  • Create and uphold a high service standard consistent with a private club environment.
  • Assist with the planning and execution of events from start to finish when assigned. Events include weddings, corporate meetings, social events, and golf tournaments.
  • For weddings, assist the Food & Beverage/Events Supervisor with day-of coordination as required, to ensure smooth and accurate execution, and act as event lead in the absence of the Food & Beverage/Events Manager. 
  • Manage the food and beverage staff including, scheduling, approving payroll, training, and serving.
  • Assure applicable function sheets are followed to accurately facilitate successful event facilitation.

Qualifications
  • The ideal candidate will have a minimum of three years of previous experience in a similar role.
  • Planning events and wedding planning experience are considered an asset. 
  • A diploma or degree in Hospitality and Tourism or Event Planning would be considered an asset.
  • Must have previous experience working in the food and beverage service industry.
  • Strong ability to deal with demanding customers. 
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment. 
  • Excellent written and verbal communication, organizational, and time management skills are a must.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office: Word, Excel, and Outlook.
  • Jonas knowledge is an asset.
  • The ability to pick up and become proficient in new software and technology systems.
  • Must be able to work both independently and within a team environment.
  • Must be available to work evenings and weekends.

This is a year-round position although the golf course is closed during the winter months. During the winter months, the focus will be on servicing our curlers, creating member events, assisting with events, and any other planning as required. Our busiest season is from May to October. Salary is $40,000/yr plus gratuity opportunity. 

The deadline to apply is April 22nd.

title: Operations Supervisor 2
description:
At EVRAZ, our strength starts with our people! As a team we collaborate to solve problems, contribute ideas and challenge each other to ensure growth and ultimately success for the business and our employees.

In this challenging role you will be responsible for scheduling, providing direction, coordinating, training, and leading your crew to achieve or exceed planned safety, production, quality, and recovery targets while minimizing costs and labour relations issues.

Job Description and Responsibilities:

  • Plan and direct daily production activities, to ensure daily production requirements are met and/or exceeded and conformance with the monthly shipping plan is assured;
  • Provide or arrange training for employees to meet the standards of the job they are performing;
  • Due diligence – make every reasonable effort to ensure the safety the employees;
  • Conduct monthly safety meetings;
  • Support all company and regulatory requirements;
  • Effectively report mechanical/electrical concerns immediately and contribute to failure analysis;
  • Engage employees in continuous improvement to identify and eliminate waste;
  • All other duties as required or assigned.

Requirements:

  • College Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in a related field (candidates with an engineering degree preferred) or a combination of education and equivalent experience;
  • Minimum two years’ industrial operations experience, preferably within a steel/pipe manufacturing facility;
  • Previous experience leading and overseeing unionized work team;
  • Demonstrated business operations and process improvement experience;
  • Ability to work on a 24/7 continuous operations schedule, including night shifts;
  • Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of the application of lean manufacturing principles;
  • Familiarity with occupational health and safety (OH&S) legislation, regulations and safety standards;
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills;
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office applications including Word, Excel, Outlook;
  • Familiar with time management software including Kronos.

Our total compensation package includes amazing benefits!

  • Competitive wages and bonus opportunities
  • Family medical, dental, and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost
  • Short and long term disability programs
  • Competitive retirement plans
  • Paid vacations and statutory holidays
  • Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company
  • Tuition reimbursement

All applicants must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship.

While we thank all those who apply, only those being actively considered for employment will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

EVRAZ North America is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

 

EVRAZ North America is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail

careers@evrazna.com

or call: (312) 533-3577. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

Join a team that manufactures excellence, drives success and builds careers!

title: Wendy's Kitchen Supervisor
description:
KITCHEN SUPERVISOR

Location: 325 Front Street West and 291 College St, Toronto, ON

 

Who You'll Work For?

REEF's mission is to connect the world to your block. 

We transform underutilized urban spaces into neighborhood hubs that connect people to locally curated goods, services, and experiences.
With an ecosystem of 4,500 locations and a team of 15,000 people, REEF is the largest operator of mobility, logistics hubs, and neighborhood kitchens in North America.

Together we are leveraging the power of proximity to keep our communities moving forward in a sustainable and thoughtful way.

What You'll Do

You are a self-starter with leadership qualities who thrives in a fast paced, growing environment with the ability to build relationships with internal and external Clients.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities

  •  Sets up stations with all necessary supplies
  •  Handles, stores and rotates all products properly
  •  Cooks menu items in cooperation with the rest of the kitchen staff
  •  Always follows supervisors' direction
  •  Follows proper cooking techniques for all dishes
  •  Ensures food quality and timeliness
  •  Practices correct food handling and food storage procedures according to company and state regulations
  •  Complies with all nutrition, sanitation and safety regulations and standards
  •  Maintains a positive and respectful approach with everyone
  •  Reports all unsafe working conditions, operational needs and equipment or aspects of the kitchen in need of repair to management
  •  Scheduling
  •  Labor management
  •  COGS management
  •  Training & People Development
  •  Inventory
  •  M&R

What We Want From You:

  •  Positive demeanor
  •  Leadership skills
  •  Business acumen
  •  Knowledge of COGS and Inventory
  •  Previous cooking and management experience 3 to 4 years experience.
  •  Servesafe certified
  •  Open availability
  •  Team-player
  •  Reliability
  •  Integrity
  •  Operational knowledge of hospitality equipment
  •  Ability to multi-task and prioritize
  •  Ability to perform under pressure
  •  Accuracy and speed in executing assigned tasks
  •  Excellent understanding of various cooking methods, ingredients, equipment and procedures
  •  Familiar with industry's best practices
  •  While performing the duties of this job, the incumbent is regularly required to use hands and fingers to handle or feel.
  •  Incumbent is occasionally required to taste or smell

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

  • While performing the duties of this job, the incumbent is regularly required to use hands and fingers to handle or feel.
  • Incumbent is occasionally required to taste or smell
  • Push, pull, and lift up to 50lbs on a weekly basis.
  • Be able to reach, bend, stoop and work in a standing position for a long period of time

WORKING CONDITIONS

  • Must be comfortable working in a shared space, with constant noise, without the use of a private office
  • Must be able to cope with frequent changing priorities and deadlines with a high degree of optimism, professionalism & collaboration
  • Schedules may vary from week to week based on business demands in excess of 40 hours with or without notice including weekends, nights, holidays

 

REEF Technology is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity at our company. REEF does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, gender, national origin, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. REEF complies with all applicable equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction in which it operates.

title: Operations Supervisor
description:
Company Description

We are SGS. The world’s leading testing, inspection and certification company. We are recognized as the global benchmark for quality and integrity. Our 89,000 employees operate a network of 2,600 offices and laboratories, working together to enable a better, safer and more interconnected world.

Job Description

  • Our Company operates on a 24/7 basis. The position requires to work on rotating shifts ranging from 8 - 12 hours in length on a schedule of days, afternoons, nights and weekends. 
  • This position requires you to have a valid driver’s license along with a vehicle to transport samples. 

This position is expected to direct, plan, organize and motivate staff in the performance of their responsibilities and functions. Ensure Operational targets and customer expectation are met in timely and efficient manner, while observing corporate quality, environmental and health and safety requirements.

1.    Accountable for the delivery of data to achieve client satisfaction by maintaining production and specified turnaround targets.

  • Monitors production and ensures optimum staff levels/shifts to achieve standards for production, quality and financial performance.  Monitors throughput and performance.
  • Manages supplies to achieve optimum production and cost effectiveness.
  • Monitors and reports weekly production status. Maintains production targets and takes proactive measures to sustain these targets.
  • Provide authoritative opinions in their area of expertise and finds new and innovative ways of improving production efficiencies.
  • Works toward continuous improvement in production and efficiency, delivery of quality data promptly, adhering to predetermined schedules.
  • Responsible for managing production by providing client services and internal operations with scheduling of sample analysis and accurate information on completion dates to meet client satisfaction.
  • Review results for accuracy prior to release to customers

2.    Complies and ensures that all work follows Quality systems and that quality targets are maintained.

  • Accountable for ensuring that the quality of data, current methodologies and the execution of the methods are in compliance with the current accreditation under ISO 9001.
  • Accountable for familiarizing oneself with the Quality Manual and ensuring appropriate documentation is current and reliable.
  • Coordinate H&S activities assigned for the location
  • Visiting work sites to evaluate field staff for compliance to SOP’s and H&S regulations.
Qualifications

  • Education: Diploma in a related discipline or equivalent experience; preference in a science field
  • Experience: Over 3 years of previous experience in Agriculture or a related field.
  • Previous supervisory in a union environment an asset
  • Specific technical skills: 
  • Must be able to read, understand and follow work instructions in a safe, accurate and timely manner. 
  • Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals.  
  • Detail orientated and has the ability to take accurate notes.
  • Candidates must be proficient in using various type of computer software (Word, Excel, etc.).
  • Proven ability to manage and coordinate multiple projects in a fast-paced, highly professional environment.
  • Demonstrates excellent verbal and written communication skills including grammar and composition.
  • Ability to work well with others & independently. 
  • Proven time management skills and a strong attention to detail.
  • Works well under pressure.
  • Extended hours may be required from time to time.
  • Possess and maintains a valid driver’s license.
  • Travel to other SGS locations may be required from time to time.
  • Ensures full compliance with the company’s Health & Safety, Code of Integrity, and Professional Conduct policies.


Additional Information

SGS Canada is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to achieving greater accessibility by providing accommodation for people with disabilities during our hiring process. Accommodations are available on request for qualified candidates during each stage of the recruitment process.

Please note that candidates applying for Canadian job openings should be authorized to work in Canada.

title: Operations Supervisor
description:
At Clutch, we are reinventing the way Canadians buy and own cars. We had enough of traditional dealerships that took advantage of customers and knew that we could build an incredible car-buying experience while leaving a positive impact on the communities we serve. 

Recently named one of the Fastest Growing Canadian Companies by the Globe & Mail and one of the Top Canadian Startups by LinkedIn, we're looking to add to our great team of people who embrace hard things, think like owners, and love to help their teammates. 

We pride ourselves on our high-quality certified vehicles, great prices, and customer experience. By visiting clutch.ca, customers can browse a large selection of high-quality vehicles, buy a car that's right for them, and enjoy seamless delivery - all from the comfort of their home.

Founded in 2016, Clutch is headquartered in Toronto and services Alberta, British Columbia, Nova Scotia, New Brunswick, Ontario, and Prince Edward Island. It is backed by a number of world-class investors including D1 Capital Partners, Canaan, BrandProject, Real Ventures, Upper90, FJ Labs, Global Founders Capital, and Azure Capital Partners.

We have a deep passion for building and bringing teams together. We value individuality, diversity of thought and embrace a problem-solving culture.

About the role and opportunity:

As Clutch continues to scale, we're looking to bring on an Operations Supervisor - Mech as a critical member of our team. Working within the Vehicles Operations Group, the Operations Supervisor - Mech will own Clutch's mechanical production function and be responsible for the team's output quality and volume.

Your team's tasks include the inspection, repair, and safety certification of vehicles. Additionally, you will be responsible for the planning and execution of strategies that will allow this function to scale as Clutch's mechanical production requirements grow.

Being highly organized, having strong communication skills, and excellent attention to detail are all necessities due to the high volume of vehicles that are bought, reconditioned, and sold week to week!

What you'll do: 

  • Lead and motivate the production team
  • Build and maintain relationships with external vendors
  • Coordinate repairs and other work with external vendors  
  • Ensure plans for repairs are executed on time and that all issues are communicated and tracked
  • Enable Clutch to scale production volume while ensuring inspections and repairs meet Clutch's quality standards
  • Ensure production deficiencies are tracked and actioned, with a goal of continuously improving customer experience
  • Achieve daily, weekly and monthly mechanical production targets set by the General Manager
  • Lead process improvement initiatives and projects
  • Work with other teams to keep vehicle information up-to-date (communication is key)

We're looking for: 

  • Tech-savvy: you're comfortable in spreadsheets on Excel or G-Sheets
  • An interest in the automotive industry and feel comfortable troubleshooting basic vehicle issues
  • Experience in operations management, bonus points if this experience was in the automotive sector
  • People leadership experience or mentorship - you're a team player above all else
  • Entrepreneurial spirit with a get-it-done, bias-towards-action attitude 
  • High attention to detail while being able to multitask and manage competing priorities
  • Valid Driver's License (Clean Driver's Abstract)
  • Post-Secondary Education

Nice to have: 

  • Previous automotive experience
  • Previous experience working in a production environment and/or project management
  • Passion for automotive

Why you'll love it at Clutch: 

  • Autonomy & Ownership -- create your own path, and own your work
  • Competitive Compensation and Equity Incentives!
  • Generous Time Off Program
  • Learning Budget -- for whatever YOU want to learn
  • Health & Dental Benefits 

Clutch is committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where all individuals have an opportunity to succeed. If you require accommodation at any stage of the interview process, please email

talent@clutch.ca

.

title: Golden Skybridge, Operations Supervisor $25/hr
description:
What will be your daily pursuit?

Supporting and leading the Operations Team, to ensure they provide safe and professional hospitality

What perks can you expect?

  • Work in a dynamic, culturally diverse team from around the globe 
  • Work experience in an iconic, unforgettable, and inspiring location 
  • Free access to Pursuit attractions for staff and family, send a friend at half the price!
  • Discounted hotel stays under Pursuit’s lodging offerings, and discounted food & beverage and retail experiences
  • A safe work environment with structured COVID procedures and vaccination policies
  • The chance to work in an inclusive culture and make life-long friends 
  • Access to subsidized mental health and wellness resources
  • Opportunities for career growth or future work at other Pursuit locations 
  • Access to one of the world’s most beautiful and iconic National Parks 

What will you do in this job?

  • Assist in the day-to-day management of the Attraction team and ensure they provide upbeat and professional hospitality. Attraction team is responsible for Zipline, Challenge Course, Giant Swing, , mountain coaster, ticket validation, trail monitoring, interpretative programing and guiding
  • Responsible for supporting the daily work assignments (including meal breaks) of Adventure Guides
  • Training of new and existing Adventure Guides and provide ongoing coaching and feedback
  • Plan and facilitate emergency response drills and lead rescue procedures as needed
  • Create a positive and encouraging team environment and motivate team to deliver exceptional guest experience
  • Equipment inventory and upkeep
  • Responsible for opening and closing procedures, including conducting safety and maintenance inspections
  • Maintain high standards for employee appearance, customer service, safety and the environment
  • Upkeep and cleaning of work zone to ensure all areas meet expectations for cleanliness
  • Serve as the escalation point for customer service issues and handle customer concerns by reacting quickly and professionally
  • Execute all work in a safe, professional manner in compliance with H&S and our Always Honest Policy
  • Perform the duties of an Adventure Guide as required

What skills and experience do you need for this job?

  • A minimum of one-year supervisory experience with proven ability to manage a team
  • Strong physical stamina and conditioning. Physical demands of the position include: working outdoors in all weather conditions, repetitive actions and speaking, sitting/standing for extended periods of time, frequent bending/twisting, and ability to lift, push, and pull up to 50 lbs
  • Understanding the concept of mandatory safety at heights – previous climbing experience an asset
  • Experience working as a ropes course or zipline attendant with high/low elements considered an asset
  • Experience facilitating groups of all ages and diverse backgrounds
  • Strong organizational skills and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong customer focus providing friendly, professional, and efficient service
  • Effective problem solving and critical thinking skills
  • Demonstrate high levels of positive energy and a willingness to take on new challenges
  • Meet and set a strong example for Pursuit grooming standards
  • Strong communication and listening skills with local and international guests and staff, second language skills highly advantageous
  • First Aid Training an asset

What will your work environment be like?

  • Beautiful. You’ll work in an iconic, unforgettable and inspiring location. You’ll see amazing scenery and wildlife. You’ll participate in team events – and fun! 
  • Independent. You’ll spend your days in and around national parks
  • Remote. Our home is filled with trees, lakes and blue-bird skies; rather than buildings, freeways and smog. Connect with friends around a bonfire instead of through WiFi 
  • Busy. You need to be prepared for a physical working environment with walking, stair climbing, bending, reaching, lifting (up to 50 pounds with assistance) required  

This job description describes the role at a high level, but no document can anticipate every single task, issue or project that could come up. We work as a team and believe that we succeed together – these job duties may change based on the needs of the team and company as a whole. 

 

To handle this job successfully, any person hired must be able to perform responsibilities as described. Pursuit will make any reasonable accommodation to help a person with disabilities perform their job. This job is based in Golden, British Columbia, Canada. Relocation to the area and the legal ability to work in Canada is required. 

 

#HKAB

EEO Information

Pursuit is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, religion, gender, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

title: Food Service Supervisor (NOC 6311)
company: Mah Food Corporation o/a Fresh Burrito
description:
One (1) permanent full-time position of Food Service Supervisor (NOC 6311) available at Mah Food Corporation o/a Fresh Burrito located at 8970 Chinguacousy Road, Unit 2, Brampton, ON, L6Y 5X6.

 

Main Duties to be completed as per the lead statement of NOC 6311:

 

  • Supervise & coordinate the kitchen staff and schedule their activities
  • Estimate and order ingredients and supplies required for food preparation
  • Establish & implement methods to meet work schedules given by the company.
  • Maintain records of stock manually & electronically
  • Equipment repairs every month or as & when required.
  • Prepare & submit Sales, Inventory, Cleaning, pay-outs reports to the Manager.
  • Train staff in job duties and train them to follow sanitation and safety procedures
  • Supervise and check assembly of food order, delivery of food to the customers accordingly.
  • Resolving customer complaints on time like employee behaviour, sanitation, product lack etc.
  • Make sure that food and service meet quality control standards set by the company.
  • Assisting Manager in hiring food service staff and assist in the development sales.

 

Requirements:

Minimum Six (6) months of work experience.

Completion of Secondary School required.

 

Wage Rate : $16.50/hour

Hours : 40 Hours/week

title: Gérante
description:
Description de l'entreprise

Laura Canada est une entreprise familiale iconique et innovatrice qui exploite Laura et Melanie Lyne, deux grandes bannières de vêtements pour femmes. Établie à Laval, au Québec, Laura Canada conçoit, produit, commercialise et distribue des vêtements de qualité partout au Canada. Nous sommes fiers d’employer plus de 2 000 collègues dévoués et d’exploiter plus de 140 magasins et deux boutiques en ligne. Notre succès repose sur l’engagement inconditionnel de notre équipe à offrir une expérience client exceptionnelle tout en incarnant nos valeurs d’intégrité, de respect, d’esprit d’équipe, de performance et de passion.

Nous croyons qu’une expérience client exceptionnelle est motivée par notre engagement à offrir une expérience exceptionnelle à nos employés.

Le genre masculin est utilisé comme générique, dans le seul but de ne pas alourdir le texte

 

Laura Canada is an iconic and innovative family-owned retailer housing two leading women’s fashion apparel brands, Laura and Melanie Lyne. Based in Laval, Quebec, we design, produce, market and distribute quality apparel across Canada. We proudly employ over 2,000 dedicated team members and operate more than 140 locations and two online stores. We attribute our success to the unwavering commitment of our team to delivering outstanding customer experiences while embodying our shared values of integrity, respect, teamwork, performance, and passion.

At Laura Canada, we believe that delivering an outstanding customer experience is driven by our commitment to an outstanding employee experience.

title: Regional Manager
description:
About Us

Dropit is a SaaS multichannel digital platform with solutions for shopping centers, retailers, and consumers. Founded in 2016 with the launch of Handsfree Shopping in London’s West End, we are present in over 500 stores across more than 350 brands throughout the US, Canada, UK, Ireland, and Belgium. For brands and shopping centers, our omnichannel fulfillment Platform and industry-first Marketplace unifies retail in-store and online.

Our vision is to enable the entire retail ecosystem to work together and meet the needs of the shared consumer in a way that’s collaborative and sustainable.

About the role

Dropit is looking for a Regional Sales Manager to be responsible for onboarding stores and retailers to Dropit’s suite of services. In this role, you will form connections and build relationships with stores and key retailers at mid/senior levels across multiple market segments. This role will require selling/closing skills, business credibility, and the gravitas to deal with complex business offerings. You'll work closely with our retail partners to educate them on how Dropit’s services can benefit their stores, business operations, and customers. This is an active and engaging senior role with a fast-growing tech start-up.

About you

In this position, you will be both a consultant and Dropit retail expert and will be continually focused both on new sales and on helping our B2B customers improve engagement of the Dropit service. You will be familiar with the major retail players throughout the ecosystem and comfortable dealing with new concepts and services.

What you will do

  • Generate, develop, and execute a pipeline with viable opportunities, Onsite and corporate levels.
  • Develop a bottom-up sales cycle: from store managers up to c-levels
  • Develop sales plans and solutions based on excellent business and functional analysis during the sales cycle that results in the successful closing of enterprise-level deals
  • Customer service, building relationship with brands, training, onboarding
  • Create business plans to drive new revenue within the enterprise and corporate accounts
  • Work closely with on-site teams to expand their local relationships with the retailers to establish HQ relationships
  • Prospecting, forecasting, presenting, and negotiating with Dropit strategic partners
  • Attend industry events and stay up to date with current industry trends

You’ll be great for this role if you

  • 5+ years of sales experience in the B2B tech industry – a must!
  • 2+ years of managing complex partners, negotiating with senior leaders, and closing complex, long term deals - ideally within retail
  • Process-driven and knowledge of data management platforms (DMPs)
  • Ability to travel across the country
  • Strong relationship building ability
  • A true collaborator and ability to liaise with Product and Marketing to drive success
  • Excellent people skills - including skills required to build and maintain excellent client relationships
  • Excellent communication, analytical, problem-solving, and cross-functional collaboration skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills for both external partners' management as well as internal stakeholder
  • A Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or any other related field.
  • Adaptable and able to work in a fast-paced start-up environment with changing and evolving responsibilities
  • Understanding of the fashion & retail industries - a big advantage

title: Operations Supervisor - 1st Shift
description:
Logistics at full potential.

At GXO, we're constantly looking for talented individuals at all levels who can deliver the caliber of service our company requires. You know that a positive work environment creates happy employees, which boosts productivity and dedication. On our team, you'll have the support to excel at work and the resources to build a career you can be proud of.

1st Shift, Monday - Friday, 8:00am - 5:00pm

We're seeking an Operations Supervisor who can bring out the best in his/her team. If you know how to encourage people to continually raise the bar while taking responsibility for all day-to-day warehouse operations, you might be an ideal fit for our growing company. As a member of our team, you'll have the committed support to excel at your job and the resources to build an exciting career.

Pay, benefits and more.

We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), life insurance, disability and more.

What you'll do on a typical day:

  • Ensure efficient daily operations of the warehouse
  • Prepare schedules
  • Supervise the team and provide training and coaching to improve performance
  • Monitor work quality to consistently deliver exceptional customer service
  • Demonstrate an understanding of the company quality policy
  • Adhere to the GXO 7S program
  • Maintain a clean environment at all times
  • Communicate well with leadership, team members and other departments
  • Implement continuous improvement action plans
What you need to succeed at GXO:

At a minimum, you'll need:

  • 2 years of relevant work experience
  • Experience with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel and Outlook) and computerized scanner equipment
  • Availability to work a flexible schedule as needed, including planned and unplanned overtime, which may include weekends
It'd be great if you also have:
  • Bachelor's degree in Logistics or a related field
  • 2 years of managerial or supervisory experience
  • Bilingual English/Spanish
  • Experience in an AS9100 or ISO environment
  • Warehousing or Third-Party Logistics (3PL) experience
This job requires the ability to:
  • Lift objects of various shapes, sizes and weights
  • Stand, sit or walk for extended periods of time
  • Reach (including above your head), bend, climb, push, pull, twist, squat and kneel
  • Handle or manage tools or equipment
  • Tolerate hot or cold warehouse environments
We engineer faster, smarter, leaner supply chains.

GXO is a leading provider of cutting-edge supply chain solutions to the most successful companies in the world. We help our customers manage their goods most efficiently using our technology and services. Our greatest strength is our global team - energetic, innovative people of all experience levels and talents who make GXO a great place to work.

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, record of offences, marital status, family status, disability or other protected status.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They should not be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. All employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time as needed. Review GXO's candidate privacy statement here.

If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, please contact us by sending an email to accommodations@gxo.com. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting and a description of the position for which you are applying.

Accommodation email must include:
• Your name
• Job title with location (city/province) and requisition ID
• A clear description of the disability accommodation that you are seeking

title: Food and Beverage Supervisor
description:
Job Title: Food and Beverage Supervisor

Department: Revenue

Division: Food & Beverage Service

Category: Seasonal

Reports to: Director of Revenue

Availability: All operational hours, Monday-Sunday including holidays

JOB PURPOSE: The Food & Beverage Area Supervisor is responsible for all operational aspects of all food and beverage units in their respective area.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Communicate with the Director of Revenue on all aspects of the Food & Beverage Department.
  • Assist Team members in all phases of Unit operation.
  • Opening areas are to make sure all stands, and carts have their money bags.
  • Opening areas are to make sure all stands are ready to operate at the proper opening times.
  • Closing areas will make sure that all money bags are returned to the vault.
  • Closing areas are to make sure all units are properly shut down and all equipment is turned off.
  • Closing areas will be responsible for making sure all paperwork is completed correctly and turned in to its appropriate place.
  • Be aware of all equipment failures and malfunctions.
  • Monitor team member grooming and uniform codes.
  • Check all unit equipment before you leave at night to make sure everything is turned off.
  • Maintain budget boundaries.
  • Ensure staff takes required breaks and shift changes are executed.
  • Comply with Parameters set out by the Ministry of Labor and Local Public Health
  • Help maintain a quality and portion control standard on all food and beverage items.
  • Work on continuously training and coaching all team members.
  • Must be available to work all shifts whether they are morning, afternoon, or evening hours.
  • Must be available to work Monday through Sunday.
  • All other duties assigned or necessary to support the park as a whole and the Food Service department. Management reserves the right to add or remove duties when circumstances
  • Responsible for maintaining all park standards and enforcing all park policies and procedures
  • Responsible for monitoring equipment and facilities to ensure proper maintenance
  • Responsible for making sure all team members comply with the company values and are completing our mission.
  • Responsible for maintaining clean patios, counters, and units at all times.
  • Supervisors are expected to direct and assist in food production, service, sanitation and guest service.

QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS

  • Supervisory experience
  • Guest focused
  • Team player
  • Good communication skills
  • Trustworthy
  • Goal oriented
  • Self-starter
  • Smart Serve Certification
  • Food Handlers Certification

OTHER FUNCTIONS:

Any and all other duties that is assigned or necessary in order to support the Revenue Department and the park as a whole. While this job description is intended to be an accurate reflection of the requirements of the job, management reserves the right to add or remove duties when circumstances (e.g., emergencies, changes in workload, rush jobs, staff levels, or technical developments) arise.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Must be able to sit and/stand/and walk for long periods of time throughout the day

Must be able to work outdoors at various times throughout the year

Requires manual and bi-manual dexterity, fine and gross motor skills, hand/eye coordination, near vision, hearing and speech

Requires occasional kneeling and bending

Requires occasional walking, reaching above shoulder, pushing and pulling

Requires occasional lifts and carries up to 60 pounds

Requires occasional carries up to 100 pounds with the assistance of a two-wheel hand truck

Work environment: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is exposed to weather conditions prevalent at the time. This position requires occasional work in or around wetness, confined spaces-cramped quarters, heights, noise, detergents/chemicals, mechanical hazards, moving objects, fumes/odors, dust, mists, gases, heat, cold or vibrations. The noise level is generally moderate

title: Regional Manager, Toronto & East Ontario
description:
Join a team that is changing millions of lives. 

 

Transforming smiles. Changing lives.


Transforming an industry.


At Align Technology, we are an industry leader and innovator in medical devices revolutionizing general practice dentistry with Invisalign® system and iTero® intraoral scanners. Our teams continue to push the boundaries of what is possible, never losing sight of who our customers are and how we can change their world through innovation.
After more than 15 years of providing products and services across the country, Align Canada opened its first office in the heart of downtown Toronto in 2017, and was certified as a Great Place to Work in 2019, again in 2020 and included on their Best Companies list in 2021.


Ready to join us? 


About this opportunity


We are looking for a Regional Manager, Dental to lead a team of Territory Managers (sales representatives). You will manage and direct a group of 8 to 14 Territory Managers, including recruitment, training, setting targets, assisting with professional development, and removing obstacles to success. You will design and apply strategies for key accounts to accelerate revenue and higher case volume. You will coach and motivate the team, to help our customers deliver superior clinical outcomes with an enhanced patient experience fueling their continued business growth through digital transformation.


What’s in it for you


Impact. Our cutting-edge technology has helped create over 10 Million Smiles. Dentists are an integral part of our doctor-driven business. Our continued growth and success depend on enabling doctors to thrive. Joining us now is a chance to be part of the collaborative culture of the Align Canada team, working to grow the business by selling directly to practice owners, transforming workflows from an analogue process to innovative digital solutions that help practitioners grow their business and increase patient satisfaction and standard of care.


Ownership. This is an opportunity to take a strategic lead and expand new business in a market that has been disrupted. You will be the foundational voice and strategist, creating solutions that meet the needs of dentists seeking practice growth and digital solutions for patients. You will guide decisions as you form relationships and earn trust, providing advice on the benefits of a sizable financial commitment. And you will earn a rewarding commission in doing so.


Career growth. Align Technology is growing year over year from 5,000 employees five years ago to over 20,000 today. As we continue to innovate products and expand globally, the opportunities for advancement and leadership positions may include building out an inside sales or special marketing team and a Regional Director.


In this role, you will…

  • Nurture a team. You will provide leadership to a team of sales professionals to achieve weekly, quarterly and annual regional sales targets in one-on-one and group settings. You will hire, coach, manage and develop all Territory Managers within the region to develop a high-performance team. You will provide training in product knowledge, a consultative in-person and virtual approach, and territory management. You will, through observation during co-travel, frequent feedback and the analysis of data, evaluate Territory Managers and ensure they are on track to fulfill their objectives.

 

  • Build relationships. You will use data and provide insights to customers regarding industry trends and consumer profiles to inspire them to modernize and grow their business; assisting them in implementing digital technology and refining office processes. You will facilitate cross-functional communications to develop an in-depth understanding of the customer’s business needs to clearly articulate fit with the specific Align products, digital platform, and solution capabilities.

 

  • Report and optimize. You will provide all appropriate reporting, with insights as to opportunities and risks to the National Sales Director, including feedback from customers and Territory Managers. You will work with other corporate teams to build out sales collateral and marketing tools to further engage prospects and close deals.


In this role, you’ll need …

  • The expertise and industry knowledge. You have 3+ years in sales management and a history of proven success in B2B sales, meeting or exceeding your targets. You have experience recruiting, coaching and leading a sales team. You know how to recruit, train, guide and influence sales representatives to build a competitive, collaborative, high-performing team. You have worked in the healthcare equipment, medical device or vision care industry. You can read, analyze, and interpret common scientific and technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents. You can confidently discuss financial business considerations and demonstrate ROI.

 

  • The strategic sales approach. You have a proven capability to navigate through change and operate with speed and agility. You can prioritize and maximize business opportunities, acting with integrity. You are results-focused with the initiative to build out highly effective territory plans and account management strategies. You have hands-on expertise with a CRM for lead and account management. Additionally, you have shown yourself to work well with internal cross-functional stakeholders to align on shared plans on how to pull through sales opportunities. You can act as a point of escalation, swiftly addressing next-level inquiries or complaints from customers, regulatory agencies, or members of the business community.

 

  • The interpersonal skills. You are collaborative and can influence decision-makers. You can gain trust, build relationships, and leverage insights to prioritize customer service and maximize growth opportunities. You have effective communication skills and can adjust your approach for diverse audiences.

 

  • The flexibility. You embrace change and are comfortable adapting to changing market dynamics and new ways of doing things. Finally, you have a valid driver's license, a clean driving record, and access to a vehicle. You are willing and able to drive to various customer sites daily within your assigned geographical territory. You understand that infrequent overnight travel is required, including travel to the US occasionally.


Sound like a good fit?   
 
Great! Click the "Apply" link to let us know you are interested. Not the right fit? Don’t worry, Align is quickly growing so we are creating more opportunities to expand our Align family. Please consider joining our Talent Network to receive notifications about future jobs or sharing this opportunity with others in your network.    

 

About Align  

 

Guided by our values of Agility, Customer, and Accountability, we foster a vibrant and inclusive employee culture that drives innovation and professional development.
Our beliefs, our actions. Both teams and individual employees participate in a number of volunteer and community-focused activities, and other initiatives, including Operation Smile that provides access to cleft lip and palate corrective surgery for children.


Your growth and ours. As we continue to expand, employees are provided with opportunities in their career journey. We have extensive continuous learning through our online education platform and support for development opportunities.


Our teams and our communities. Every employee is as unique as their smile.We foster an environment across all of our locations and remote teams that is respectful, open-minded, and supports our core values.


Your benefits. Our competitive compensation, benefits, health, and wellness programs are locally relevant and designed to meet you and your family's immediate and long-term needs. In addition, the Employee Invisalign® Discount Program serves as an additional perk for full-time employees and eligible dependents.

 

Join us


At Align, we live our company values by promoting healthy people and healthy communities, and we continuously pursue innovation that will benefit our customers - all with the intent of transforming smiles and changing lives. If you believe you possess most of these qualifications, we encourage you to express your interest here. We can't promise it will be a fit, but we do promise to consider your experience.


Global Diversity Statement


At Align, we believe in the power of a smile, and we know that every smile is as unique as our employees. As we grow, we will continue building a workforce of diverse cultural backgrounds and life experiences and fostering a culture of open-mindedness and compassion for all our employees. We live our company values by promoting healthy people and healthy communities. All with the intent of changing millions of lives, one unique smile at a time.
We welcome and encourage applications from people of all abilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

 

Equal Opportunity Statement


It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunity in all of our employment practices without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran status, age, individuals with disabilities, sexual orientation or gender identity or expression or any other legally protected category. Applicants for positions with Align must be legally authorized to work in the country which they are applying for and verification of employment eligibility will be required as a condition of hire.
