title: Food and Beverage Supervisor â€“ Playland
description:
Job Description:

Food and Beverage Supervisor â€“ Playland

Part Time Contract (June 4th â€“ September 5th)

32 - 40 hours per week

Date Posted: March 17th, 2022

 

 

Who we areâ€¦  

The Pacific National Exhibition is an iconic institution in BC, famous for bringing generations of people together to celebrate and build memories. This 112-year old, non-profit organization has an annual operating budget of approximately $58 million dollars and generates revenue through four activity streams:   the 15 day annual summer Fair which averages 800,000 guests each year, Playland amusement park which welcomes 375,000 guests annually including Fright Nights, year-round events including concerts, trade shows and film, cultural and community events.   The fourth activity stream is park care and facility maintenance.   The PNE is proud of the work it does at Hastings Park and has a vibrant team that is passionate about events, guest experience and being the best we can be.

At the PNE, we strive to create an environment that reflects our organizationâ€™s core values: Enthusiasm, Excellence and Evolution.   With a focus on these core values, we are committed to achieving our mission which is to â€œDeliver Memorable Experiencesâ€ for all who interact with the PNE whether it is our guests, our employees or the community.

We are seeking a hardworking and motivated individual who has a passion for the Food & Beverage Industry and the Pacific National Exhibition (PNE). The Food and Beverage Supervisor will work within the Playlandâ€™s Food & Beverage department.

Why join our Team?

  • Exhilarating and fun-loving culture
  • Flexible work hours
  • Opportunity for free or discounted tickets to shows, events, sports games, and much more
  • Staff discounts for Playland, The Fair, and Fright Nights, as well as all PNE Food Stands
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunity to create lasting memories and friendships!

What will you do this year?

In your role as a Food & Beverage Supervisor, your primary accountabilities will be to:

  • Assist with the planning and execution of all Playland food and candy outlets, catered events, and other functions, ensuring that all guest requirements and needs are met.
  • Assist with the execution of corporate picnics; oversee the set-up and tear down of the event area and supervise and assist in various capacities during these events.
  • Assist in scheduling and staffing Playland F&B staff; help recruit, orient and train new employees on an as needed basis.
  • Assist with inventory administration, including but not limited to planning, forecasting, ordering, receiving, and inventorying a large variety of food and beverage products.
  • Help Food & Beverage staff in resolving food and beverage related problems during event and Playland operating days.
  • Follow up on any guest issues or concerns and ensure that issues are dealt with efficiently and effectively.
  • Enforce both corporate and internal Food & Beverage departmental policies and procedures; ensure all staff perform work in a safe, clean, and professional manner and in compliance with corporate policies.
  • Ensure adherence to established transaction procedures, identify shortages, and take corrective action on any issues that arise.
  • Assist in ensuring that all operating equipment and supplies are properly cared for, stored, and secured.
  • Perform other related F&B duties as required.

What else?

  • Must have either graduated or currently be enrolled in a post-Secondary program in Hospitality, Business Administration, or other relevant discipline; or have an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Must have a minimum of 2 years supervisory experience within the Food & Beverage Industry, preferably at a reputable, high-volume venue.
  • Must have Food Safe Level 1 and Serving it Right.
  • Must have advanced knowledge of the Food & Beverage industry and food outlet operations, and a strong understanding of legislation, regulations and standards on hygiene and liquor licensing.
  • Must possess excellent communication & interpersonal skills in order to establish effective working relationships with staff, guests and clients.
  • Must have excellent leadership and people management skills to effectively motivate team members and address performance concerns with staff.
  • Must have superior time management and multitasking skills, with the proven ability to prioritize tasks and manage various deadlines.
  • Must have a proven track record of implementing and maintaining superior service standards.
  • Must have strong administrative capabilities including working knowledge of Microsoft Office suite applications (word, excel, PowerPoint), POS systems and electronic and hard copy file management.
  • Ability to interact positively with public and present a pleasant customer friendly image.
  • Ability to exercise sound judgement and remain calm under pressure while effectively managing various guest situations.
  • Ability to work extended hours and weekends during peak periods is required.
  • Candidates must undergo a Criminal Record Check.

 

Who are you?

  • Passionate
  • Skillful communicator
  • Proactive
  • Committed

 

Where and when to APPLY?

Applications can be submitted via the PNE website at www.pne.ca/jobs and will be accepted until the role is filled.

 

We look forward to hearing from you!

 

The PNE is proud to be an  equal  opportunity  employer, committed to creating an inclusive workforce that reflects the diverse community we proudly serve. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, national or ethnic origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or age. If you require any support or accommodations throughout any stage of the recruitment process, please contact the People & Culture Department at  

hr@pne.ca

title: Food Service Supervisor
description:
A&W in Armstrong, BC, is seeking  full-time, permanent, Food Service Supervisors,  to start immediately. 

The Company Operating Name: The Blazingly Fast Burger Corp  O/A A&W 

Title of Position: Food Service Supervisor 

Business Address: 3130 Smith Drive, Armstrong BC V0E 1B1

No# of Positions: 2

Terms of Employment: 2 years permanent 

Language Requirement(s): English

Wage: 17.00 per hour 

Benefits Package (if applicable): Dental benefits, Group insurance benefits, Life insurance benefits, Vision care benefits 

Hours (each week): 32

Location of work: 3130 Smith Drive, Armstrong BC V0E 1B1

Education: Secondary school

Work Experience: Minimum 3 years experience in food preparation. 

Job Duties: 

  • Supervise, co-ordinate and schedule the activities of staff who prepare, portion and serve food to serve to guests
  • Estimate and order ingredients and supplies required for meal preparation
  • Establish work schedules and ensure staff follow procedures
  • Maintain records of stock, sales and wastage and report to management
  • Train staff in job duties, and sanitation and safety procedures and ensure skill transfer to new employees
  • Ensure that food and service meet quality control standards and corporate brand standards
  • Deal with cash, opening and closing procedures with accuracy
  • Ensuring customer satisfaction and resolving issues as required
  • Maintain climate relationship between team members 

 

Apply for this job if you:

 

  • Have a passion for guest service and creating exceptional guest experiences;
  • Enjoy working in a fast-paced environment
  • Have excellent communication skills;
  • Enjoy learning new things;
  • Have a ready smile and a warm personality;
  • Are available to work 32-40 hours/week. 

Posted Date: March 9th, 2022

We strongly encourage candidates to apply directly to this post the links, otherwise, if the link is not working, email your resume to: HR-MCM-BC@outlook.com

 

How To Apply

Please ensure that you are providing a current, relevant, resume with pertinent work experience and references. Anyone who can legally work in Canada can apply for this job. If you are not currently authorized to work in Canada, the employer will not consider your job application.

We strongly encourage Candidates to apply to this job posting through the available links first for priority processing, otherwise, in the case that the link is not working, you may apply with your resume,

  • by email: recruitment@mcmurraygroup.ca
  • by mail: Recruitment - A&W McMurray Group, 2739 30th St., Vernon, BC, V1T 5C6, or
  • by fax: 250-275-6707, or
  • through our Career Page https://bit.ly/2J7m6ki

For further information regarding this posting, or others, please visit https://bit.ly/2J7m6ki or call 250-275-6706 x322 during business hours (10am - 4pm Pacific Time). If you are viewing this ad, the position has not been filled. Only qualified applicants will be contacted for assessments and interviews.

title: Gérant
description:
Sommaire du poste

Sous la responsabilité du Directeur de restaurant, le Gérant de restaurant est quelqu’un de passionné par la nourriture et le service aux clients. Il est capable de résoudre les problèmes, s’appuyant sur une solide éthique de travail et un fort leadership. Le gestionnaire comprend que la satisfaction des clients reste prioritaire et requiert une gestion des opérations du restaurant efficace.

Rôles et Responsabilités

  • Gérer les opérations du restaurant avec passion, intégrité et connaissance.
  • Créer une expérience client positive en garantissant un haut niveau de service et en s’assurant que tous les membres de l’équipe s’engagent à comprendre les besoins des clients et dépasser leurs attentes.
  • Répondre aux plaintes des clients, en prenant toutes les actions appropriées pour transformer des clients insatisfaits en clients qui reviennent.
  • Gérer les activités de restauration afin de répondre et dépasser les normes de qualité des aliments, de sécurité et d’hygiène.
  • Fournir des directives aux membres de l’équipe concernant les questions opérationnelles et de procédure.
  • Développer les membres de l’équipe en fournissant du feedback continu, en établissant des objectifs et en conduisant des évaluations de rendement.
  • Constamment examiner les activités de restauration afin d’identifier les possibilités d’amélioration.
  • Tenue et animation des réunions quotidiennes précédant les quarts de travail.
  • Constamment surveiller et mesurer les coûts du produit et du travail afin de rester dans les objectifs budgétisés.
  • Respecter les politiques et procédures des 3 Brasseurs.
  • Veiller à ce que les procédures de sécurité appropriées soient en place pour protéger les membres de l’équipe, les clients et les actifs de la société.
  • Supporter le gérant général dans diverses fonctions administratives tel que les commandes auprès des fournisseurs, horaires, prévisions de ventes et autres fonctions.

Compétences

  • Expérience dans la restauration. L’expérience dans une chaîne de restauration est un atout.
  • Les candidats qualifiés doivent être grandement motivés, capables d’initiatives et doivent posséder de fortes compétences organisationnelles ainsi qu’un grand souci du détail
  • Disponible pour des quarts de travail flexibles, y compris les soirs, fins de semaine, et jours fériés.
  • Capacité de communiquer (verbal et écrit) et lire en français et en anglais.
  • Capacité à travailler à un rythme soutenu, dans un environnement en constant évolution
  • Doit posséder de bonnes aptitudes de communication pour faire face à une équipe diversifiée.
  • Maintenir les informations confidentielles, adhérer et imposer les politiques de la compagnie, les programmes ainsi que les questions de conformité.
  • Détenir des compétences de base en informatique (Connaissance du courriel, internet, Word et Excel) et de la suite Maitre D – Un atout
  • Certification de manipulation des aliments, Educ’alcool et RCR – Un atout

title: Supervisor, Operations (Afternoon Shift)
description:
Operations Supervisor


You will be responsible for organizing and directing the activities of production employees in the aerospace/defence manufacturing industry, under the guidance of the Manager, Operations in a unionized environment.


Location: Mississauga, ON


Your Challenge:


+ Ensure all direct reports work according to the Quality Management System (QMS), company safety policy, and OHSA requirements.

+ Supervise team members across multiple functional workgroups on 2 nd shift (4 x 10 hour, 3:00 pm -- 1:30 am, Monday to Thursday).

+ Assign and manage all shop work assignments and activities.

+ Direct and listen to employees in a manner that will promote good employee relations and produce a well-motivated and productive workforce.

+ Conduct regular communication and safety meetings within departments.

+ Provide career development for department staff in a team-oriented atmosphere.

+ Actively engage in continuous improvement program by identifying and championing improvements to work processes methods, equipment, fixtures, and tooling.

+ Provide input to the Manager for the preparation of departmental budgets.

+ Monitor all hours worked, track attendance and balance overtime of direct reports.

+ Ensure all trade qualifications are up-to-date and records maintained.

+ Willing and able to work overtime and occasional Saturdays.

+ Take every reasonable precaution to protect the health and safety of direct reports


Your Expertise:


+ Minimum 5 years related experience in a production environment.

+ A sound knowledge of occupational health and safety, plus a willingness to achieve "competence" as a supervisor as per the Ontario OHSA.

+ Experience in a lean manufacturing environment and willing to participate in continuous improvement program, training and mentorship.

+ A strong technical background in machining, hydraulics, mechanical assembly, electrical/electronic controls plus hands on experience in the operation of these types of equipment is highly desired.

+ Excellent leadership skills and supervisory experience

+ Strong oral and written communications skills

+ Strong computer skills (MS Office, Word, Excel and Powerpoint)


All employees must be eligible to meet the requirements for the Canadian Controlled Goods Program (CGP) and/or a Canadian Government security clearance.


Curtiss-Wright values diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If you require accommodation due to a disability at any time during the recruitment and/or assessment process, please contact ta_coe@curtisswright.com and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Operations Supervisor

You will be responsible for organizing and directing the activities of production employees in the aerospace/defence manufacturing industry, under the guidance of the Manager, Operations in a unionized environment.

Location: Mississauga, ON

Your Challenge:


* Ensure all direct reports work according to the Quality Management System (QMS), company safety policy, and OHSA requirements.
* Supervise team members across multiple functional workgroups on 2nd shift (4 x 10 hour, 3:00 pm -- 1:30 am, Monday to Thursday).
* Assign and manage all shop work assignments and activities.
* Direct and listen to employees in a manner that will promote good employee relations and produce a well-motivated and productive workforce.
* Conduct regular communication and safety meetings within departments.
* Provide career development for department staff in a team-oriented atmosphere.
* Actively engage in continuous improvement program by identifying and championing improvements to work processes methods, equipment, fixtures, and tooling.
* Provide input to the Manager for the preparation of departmental budgets.
* Monitor all hours worked, track attendance and balance overtime of direct reports.
* Ensure all trade qualifications are up-to-date and records maintained.
* Willing and able to work overtime and occasional Saturdays.
* Take every reasonable precaution to protect the health and safety of direct reports



Your Expertise:


* Minimum 5 years related experience in a production environment.
* A sound knowledge of occupational health and safety, plus a willingness to achieve "competence" as a supervisor as per the Ontario OHSA.
* Experience in a lean manufacturing environment and willing to participate in continuous improvement program, training and mentorship.
* A strong technical background in machining, hydraulics, mechanical assembly, electrical/electronic controls plus hands on experience in the operation of these types of equipment is highly desired.
* Excellent leadership skills and supervisory experience
* Strong oral and written communications skills
* Strong computer skills (MS Office, Word, Excel and Powerpoint)



All employees must be eligible to meet the requirements for the Canadian Controlled Goods Program (CGP) and/or a Canadian Government security clearance.



Curtiss-Wright values diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If you require accommodation due to a disability at any time during the recruitment and/or assessment process, please contact ta_coe@curtisswright.com and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

#IND#LI-YA1

title: Chef de cuisine
description:
Sommaire du poste

En tant que Chef de cuisine, vous serez entièrement imputable de tous les volets de votre cuisine. Vous veillerez constamment à ce que les plats que nous servons respectent le gage de qualité de la marque. Vous incarnerez et veillerez à l’application des normes de la compagnie en tout temps. Vous aurez une vision d’ensemble des sphères d’hygiène et salubrité alimentaire, organisation de votre cuisine, qualité des produits, coaching de votre équipe et de gestion des coûts.

Responsabilités principales

  • S’assurer que votre équipe connaisse et mette en application les divers standards en matière de qualité des aliments et de réalisations des plats;
  • Être constamment proactif en matière de salubrité alimentaire : promouvoir et maintenir les bonnes pratiques, suivi de la température des aliments et des lieux d'entreposage;
  • En collaboration avec votre Sous-Chef, vous participerez au recrutement, formation et suivi disciplinaire de tous les membres de l'équipe de la cuisine;
  • Inventaire des aliments, préparation hebdomadaire de l'inventaire, rotation des stocks, gestion conforme aux normes de la société;
  • En étroite collaboration avec votre Sous-Chef : gestion du coût des aliments, respect des recettes, gestion des déchets, élaboration et implantation de mesures lors de présence d’écart entre les quantités en inventaire réelles et théoriques;
  • Élaborer les horaires de travail de votre équipe, prévoir et gérer les coûts de main-d'œuvre en tenant compte des objectifs établis;
  • Promouvoir et maintenir les bonnes pratiques visant la sécurité des membres de votre équipe : entretien de l'équipement, la formation de vos employés sur la façon d'utiliser l'équipement de manière sécuritaire;
  • Suivi de votre équipement de cuisine : propreté, entretien préventif et coordination des réparations avec les tiers, au besoin;
  • Propreté de la cuisine, entretien de la cuisine pendant les différentes périodes de travail et respect des listes de vérification quotidiennes, hebdomadaires et mensuelles en matière de nettoyage;
  • Participation aux réunions hebdomadaires de la direction, ainsi qu'aux réunions mensuelles Chefs de cuisine;
  • Surveiller les réactions des invités.

Votre profil

  • Votre expérience de management dans un concept à haut volume;
  • Vos capacités analytiques : analyse des coûts des aliments et planification des mesures;
  • Votre leadership incontestable : capacité d'embaucher, de former, d'encadrer et coacher votre équipe;
  • Vous êtes toujours disponible pour votre équipe lors des périodes achalandées : le soir, le week-end et les jours de congé lorsque l’achalandage du restaurant l’exige;
  • Vous disposez d’une certaine aisance à communiquer verbalement et de lire en anglais et en français lors des réunions impliquant les Chefs des provinces de l’Ontario et du Québec;

Remarque

  • - Le genre masculin est utilisé sans discrimination et dans le seul but d’alléger le texte.
skills: ['Vous disposez d’une certaine aisance à communiquer verbalement et de lire en anglais et en français lors des réunions impliquant les Chefs des provinces de l’Ontario et du Québec;', "Votre leadership incontestable : capacité d'embaucher, de former, d'encadrer et coacher votre équipe;"]

title: Operations Supervisor - Moncton
description:
Evening Operations Supervisor ST - Moncton

 

GardaWorld Cas Services is currently hiring an Evening Operations Supervisor ST (4:30pm - 1:00am subject to change) in Moncton, New Brunswick for our Cash Logistics business line:

 

Your mission at GardaWorld:

 

Reporting directly to the Branch Manager, you will be in charge of the Secured Transport team within our Cash Services Division. On a daily basis, you will be responsible for planning, organizing, and managing the work of your team and ensuring customer satisfaction.

We are looking for a passionate leader who will be able to establish great relationships with his/her employees. 

GardaWorld, Cash Services, is the #1 supplier of cash services in North America and offers you the opportunity of an exciting career.

 

 

Job description

  • Plan, organize and manage the work of unionized employees within the CBA to ensure that the work is accomplished in a manner consistent with organizational requirements
  • Direct investigations to verify and resolve customer or shipper complaints
  • Serve as contact person for all workers within assigned territories
  • Implement schedule and policy changes
  • Collaborate with other supervisors and staff members in order to formulate and implement policies, procedures, goals, and objectives
  • Monitor operations to ensure that staff members comply with administrative policies and procedures, safety rules, union contracts, and government regulations
  • Promote safe work activities by conducting safety audits, attending company safety meetings, and meeting with individual staff members
  • Monitor spending to ensure that expenses are consistent with approved budgets
  • Direct and coordinate the activities of the operations department in order to obtain use of equipment, facilities, and human resources
  • Conduct investigations, when necessary, in cooperation with internal or external agencies to determine causes of transportation accidents and to improve safety procedures
  • Conduct employee training sessions on subjects such as material handling, employee orientation, quality improvement and computer use
  • Participate in disciplinary process or settlements of grievances
  • Monitor and audit employee and company compliance with current legislation

 

 

Requirements

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English)
  • Good knowledge in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook
  • Must possess a valid driver’s license with an acceptable driving record
  • Be driven by customer and personal service
  • Firearm training / license: If none, contingent of passing all necessary security clearance + courses provided.
  • Strong capacity to manage unionized employees
  • Must be prepared to carry a firearm at all time while on duty
  • Experience in Cash Services or parcel delivery services an asset
  • Able to work unsupervised and provide proper direction other employees
  • Have good credit and no criminal convictions

 

Qualifications

  • Very good sense of leadership, structuring, execution, negotiation and judgment
  • Strong teamwork and partnership orientation
  • Sense of urgency, outstanding communication and problem solving
  • Strong critical thinking and active listening
  • Good decision making skills

 

We offer

  • Competitive salary
  • Full benefits
  • The opportunity to join a growing business with multiple career opportunities TV20

title: Operations Supervisor - 1st Shift
description:
Logistics at full potential.

At GXO, we're constantly looking for talented individuals at all levels who can deliver the caliber of service our company requires. You know that a positive work environment creates happy employees, which boosts productivity and dedication. On our team, you'll have the support to excel at work and the resources to build a career you can be proud of.

1st Shift, Monday - Friday, 7:00am - 5:00pm

We're seeking a Supervisor, Supply Chain Operations, who can bring out the best in his/her team. If you know how to encourage people to continually raise the bar while taking responsibility for all day-to-day warehouse operations, you might be an ideal fit for our growing company. As a member of our team, you'll have the committed support to excel at your job and the resources to build an exciting career.

Pay, benefits and more.

We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), life insurance, disability and more.

What you'll do on a typical day:

  • Ensure efficient daily operations of the warehouse
  • Prepare schedules
  • Supervise the team and provide training and coaching to improve performance
  • Monitor work quality to consistently deliver exceptional customer service
  • Demonstrate an understanding of the company quality policy
  • Adhere to the GXO 7S program
  • Maintain a clean environment at all times
  • Communicate well with leadership, team members and other departments
  • Implement continuous improvement action plans
What you need to succeed at GXO:

At a minimum, you'll need:

  • 2 years of relevant work experience
  • Experience with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel and Outlook) and computerized scanner equipment
  • Availability to work a flexible schedule as needed, including planned and unplanned overtime, which may include weekends
It'd be great if you also have:
  • Bachelor's degree in Logistics or a related field
  • 2 years of managerial or supervisory experience
  • Bilingual English/Spanish
  • Experience in an AS9100 or ISO environment
  • Warehousing or Third-Party Logistics (3PL) experience
This job requires the ability to:
  • Lift objects of various shapes, sizes and weights
  • Stand, sit or walk for extended periods of time
  • Reach (including above your head), bend, climb, push, pull, twist, squat and kneel
  • Handle or manage tools or equipment
  • Tolerate hot or cold warehouse environments
We engineer faster, smarter, leaner supply chains.

GXO is a leading provider of cutting-edge supply chain solutions to the most successful companies in the world. We help our customers manage their goods most efficiently using our technology and services. Our greatest strength is our global team - energetic, innovative people of all experience levels and talents who make GXO a great place to work.

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, record of offences, marital status, family status, disability or other protected status.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They should not be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. All employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time as needed. Review GXO's candidate privacy statement here.

If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, please contact us by sending an email to accommodations@gxo.com. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting and a description of the position for which you are applying.

Accommodation email must include:
• Your name
• Job title with location (city/province) and requisition ID
• A clear description of the disability accommodation that you are seeking

title: Operations Supervisor
description:
Overview:

Lynden International Logistics Co.,  a leader in the field of 3rd party logistics for the healthcare & consumer goods industries. As a leading advocate of operational efficiencies, we take pride in developing customized solution protocols within our systems, to meet the needs of our client partners within the healthcare industry. This is an  afternoon  shift role.

We encourage our employees to grow and develop within the company and believe our diverse workforce contributes tremendously to our success. Lynden offers many benefits for full-time employees including: Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance; an Employee Assistance Program; and Retirement Plans.

Why Lynden?

We offer a competitive salary, after 1 year of service employees will be eligible to participate in a pension plan. We offer Health, and Dental benefits after 3 months which are paid for by the company! Overtime is available.

Responsibilities:

POSITION DESCRIPTION:

  • Schedule and allocate work to the hourly employees to ensure orders will be picked, packed and shipped in an efficient manner. This involves setting procedures to decide which orders to be dealt as a priority, which carrier to use, the time table for trucks coming in and out etc.
  • In the case of returns, ensures that they are checked and stocked in accordance with clientsâ€™ instructions.
  • Maintain employeesâ€™ attendance records. Makes sure the employment standards comply with the legislation, and conduct performance reviews.
  • Train employees. Whenever necessary, conduct counseling with employees and maintain discipline.
  • Plan staff requirements to meet future operational needs.
  • Participate in improving the efficiency of the warehouse operations, i.e. reviews procedures, modifies equipment.
  • Oversee the housekeeping of the warehouse, i.e. safety, security, machine maintenance, layout, stocking, inventory control of warehouse materials etc.
  • Deal with unforeseen situations, i.e. requests for shipment of life saving drugs under emergency.
  • On call 24 hours per day, 7 days a week for emergencies
Qualifications:

Skills and Training Required:

  • Good verbal communication with staff, giving clear and concise instructions. Ability to write clearly.
  • Good labor relations skills to deal effectively with associates.
  • Ability to make decisions within well-defined standard practices and procedures.
  • Good analytical skills to solve inventory discrepancies.

 

Education and Experience:

  • Secondary school diploma
  • 2 years warehouse operations experience plus 1 year supervisory experience.

Lynden International Logistics is dedicated to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). During the hiring process if you require accommodation for disability, please advise Human Resources during the recruitment process.

title: Operations Supervisor
description:
What makes DHL great?  Our People!  We know each employee’s individual contributions make us the #1 Express Delivery and Logistics Company in the world.

DHL Express is committed to maintaining an environment that empowers every team member to make the greatest possible impact on our business.  Our corporate culture is about personal commitment – to our business, to each other and to our global communities.  DHL is dedicated to being a great place to work. In addition to competitive compensation packages, our employees enjoy a range of programs, services and benefits that bring the best to their personal lives.

Start YOUR career with DHL today…

DHL Express currently has an opening for an Operations Supervisor (Pick up & Delivery) in our facility in Winnipeg, MB.  The Operations Supervisor provides “hands-on” proactive management of the employees engaged in the daily package sort, pickup and delivery operation as well as the transit of packages and freight, within prescribed standards of cost, efficiency, accuracy and on-time distribution.  The supervisor implements new procedures to improve operational effectiveness and provides performance reports for management as required.  Responsible for activities related to timely, safe loading and dispatch of DHL Couriers in compliance with all company and regulatory requirements.

How will you contribute to the success of DHL?
 

  • Recruits, orients, trains, schedules, manages and recommends discipline for the operations staff.
  • Establishes/implements productivity, quality and cost measurements & strategies to achieve desired operational results.
  • Ensures timely and accurate distribution of inbound and/or outgoing freight daily, in accordance with established standards and procedures.
  • Ensures compliance with Regulatory bodies and regulations related to Air Transportation of goods
  • Ensures Load planning and security of all equipment and Aircraft used
  • Ensures Staff permits and Air operation audits area up to date
  • Completes accurate and timely reports for management as required (staff schedules, attendance records, recruitment/ payroll documentation, dangerous goods incidents, CNESST reports.
  • Ensures successful implementation & continued application of scanning technology.
  • Applies appropriate leadership/management style with open communication (i.e., communicates Corporate strategic plan, recognition of individual/team contributions) to motivate staff.
  • Ensures sufficient staff resources, materials and supplies on hand at all times.
  • Ensures warehouse is organized and set up for next shift.
  • Maintains equipment, in safe, efficient operating condition at all times.
  • Establishes/maintains a proactive safety program in compliance with legislative requirements and the collective agreement.
  • Implements & follows up on Customer Service solutions as determined by Sales resource team.
  • Addresses Customer complaints and escalated items in a professional, expedient manner
  • Performs other assignments (i.e., assists Gateway Manager) as required.

Qualifications - External

Do you have what it takes?

  • Experience working with Canada customs.
  • Experience managing operations with components of aviation regulations.
  • 3 years’ warehouse/on road operations experience in courier industry.
  • Knowledge & compliance with Dangerous Goods
  • Prior working experience with lean / process improvement initiatives.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills.                            
  • Proven communication skills - written & oral
  • Working knowledge/interpretation of Collective Agreements & Occupational Health & Safety Act.
  • Demonstrated drive, initiative & flexibility to ensure task completion.
  • Demonstrated time management & organization skills.
  • College or University designation.
​

We are an equal opportunity employer and believe we will gain through the recruitment and development of staff who represent the broad diversity of the Canadian workforce.



About DHL Express:

What makes DHL great? Our People! We know each employee’s individual contributions make us the #1 Express Delivery and Logistics Company in the world.DHL Express is committed to maintaining an environment that empowers every team member to make the greatest possible impact on our business. Our corporate culture is about personal commitment – to our business, to each other and to our global communities. DHL is dedicated to being a great place to work. In addition to competitive compensation packages, our employees enjoy a range of programs, services and benefits that bring the best to their personal lives.

title: Operations Supervisor
description:
Overview:

Why Valvoline?

Weâ€™ve been in the car business for more than 150 years, starting with the invention of the worldâ€™s first motor oil. Today, weâ€™re a global leader in automotive services and lubricants, driven every day by a people-centered focus on innovation and service excellence.

 

As we often say, it starts with all of our people â€” and thatâ€™s where you come in. Weâ€™re looking for humble, hungry and smart people to help us power the future of mobility. If youâ€™re looking for a collaborative and flexible work environment that invests in your growth and success, youâ€™ve come to the right place.

 

Careers for the Driven  

Valvoline has a rewarding opportunity as an Operations Supervisor. We whole-heartedly adopt a â€˜never idle' mindset. We also know that outstanding service begins and ends with our employees. So, weâ€™re looking for good people to join our team. You bring your skills, talents and drive. We will give you a great place to work, a competitive salary and benefits, and the resources and support to develop and advance within our global company.

 

How Youâ€™ll Make an Impact

Reporting to the Plant Manager, the Operations Supervisor has day-to-day oversight of production, private fleet staff and maintenance. Responsibilities include production department output and efficiencies, routing of private fleet deliveries, support on capital projects, coordination of site management of change process, site training coordination, and EHS incident and internal audit lead. In the role, you would be responsible for:

  • Managing day-to-day routing, bulk requirements and planning, equipment maintenance and channel partner fulfillment
  • Supervision of plant production and maintenance teams to ensure operations efficiencies
  • Administering and supporting compliance of regulatory requirements including training and joint health and safety committee
  • Coordinating MOC program/support on capital and other projects as required
  • Organizing and supporting EHS with safety audits, findings and incident investigations
  • Maintaining up-to-date documentation on internal repository system-GQMS
  • Working with outside contractors to ensure corporate safety guidelines are followed
  • Administrative support as required  

What Youâ€™ll Need

  • Minimum of five years' supervisory experience in a manufacturing/private fleet environment
  • Bachelor of Engineering (Chemical/Mechanical/Industrial), Bachelor of Science or equivalent
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills

What Will Set You Apart

  • SAP experience
  • Experience with private fleet management/routing software/ELDS
  • Forklift experience
  • Experience leading JHSC  

Benefits That Drive Themselves

  • Health insurance benefits
  • Group RRSP account
  • Incentive opportunity*
  • Life insurance
  • Short and long-term disability insurance
  • Paid vacation and holidays*
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Tuition reimbursement*

*Terms and conditions apply and benefits may differ depending on position.

 

Females and minorities encouraged to apply.

 

Valvoline, LLC (the "Company") is an equal opportunity employer and affords equal opportunity to all applications for all positions without regard to race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citzenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, record of offences, martial status, family status or disability or any other status protected by applicable laws.   The Company complies with applicable statuses, common law and other regulatory requirements.

 

The Company endeavors to make its recruitment process accessible to any and all users.   Reasonable accommodations will be provided, upon request, to applicants with disabilities in order to facilitate equal opportunity throughout the recruitment and selection process.   Please contact Human Resources at 1-800-Valvoline or email 1800Valvoline@valvoline.com to make a request for reasonable accommodation during any aspect of the recruitment and selection process.   This contact information is for accommodation requests only; do not use this contact information to inquire about the status of applications.

title: Operations Supervisor in Winnipeg (AM/PM Shifts available)
description:
Summary:

This position involves full operational management of a Final Mile facility and independent Owner Operators in a fast-paced environment.

We offer an extremely high level of service delivery to our online retailers and other firms requiring Final Mile Deliveries.

The successful incumbent will report to the Terminal Manager located in Winnipeg, MB

Responsibilities:

Â· Review volumes in established routes daily to balance workload, audit drivers and hub processes

Â· Occasionally ride with drivers for audits and/or perform deliveries directly

Â· Maintain relationships with key customer contacts involved in the day to day operations of their business

Â· Maintain regular reporting to head office

Â· Provide metrics to Customers daily to maintain the highest level of performance

Â· Contribute and maintain a successful, safe, team environment

Â· Motivate and develop team, identifying the best people for the job

Â· Hold IOOs/Drivers to all our processes

Â· Assisting in assessing problem areas or areas for improvement and identifying solutions, and clearing roadblocks with other departments and management;

Â· Run continuous improvement initiatives to offer "Best-in-Class" services

Â· Resolve complaints and answer questions of customers regarding services and procedures

Â· Provide timely, accurate, and thorough Performance reviews

Shift Availability:

AM Shift: Wed to Sat (2:00 AM to 12:00 PM)

PM Shift: Wed to Sat (12:00 PM to 10:00 PM)

Skills Required:

Â· Must have previous experience in courier or small parcel deliveries.

Â· Must have strong leadership and motivational skills

Â· Goal-oriented, with a strong desire to achieve results

Â· Strong communications skills (written & verbal)

Â· Ability to plan/organize, prioritize and multi-task in a fast pace environment

Â· Ability to effectively troubleshoot through problems/issues and perform tasks in a cohesive manner.

Â· Detail oriented and excellent organization and planning skills

Â· Proficient with MS applications (Word, Excel, Outlook).

title: Regional Manager (South)
description:
REGIONAL MANAGER

Startec Refrigeration Services Ltd. is a thriving privately owned company headquartered in Calgary that produces custom mission critical compression and refrigeration systems for a variety of industries. Startec devotes their industry leading expertise in refrigeration & compression technologies to solve their clientsâ€™ most technically challenging needs.  We create reliable solutions for extreme operating conditions and provide exceptional service, which is a cornerstone of our business.

BEHAVIORAL ASSESSMENT:

It is mandatory for all applicants to complete the Profile People Survey below when submitting their application. Please proceed using the link below:

http://www.profileperformancesystem.com/survey.html?SL=58783

REPORTS TO:

           VP, Operations

SUMMARY:

The Regional Manager is responsible for directing and coordinating Startec customer service activities for the Southern AB region. This role covers a range of responsibilities; including customer care, relationship management and human resource management. Duties include reporting and tracking relevant metrics and maintenance of client databases. 

JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:                                                                

  • Provide consistent feedback on technician job performance and ensure accountability is held for work performed in the Southern region
  • Provide guidance to the coordinator and field technicians to utilize non-billable hours in the most beneficial way possible for the organization
  • Provide day-to-day leadership and direction to journeyman and apprentice mechanics, the service coordinator, and the office administrators
  • Ensure that all requirements for the corporate safety program are met on an ongoing basis in the Southern region
  • Maintain an excellent oversight of industry trends, opportunities and competitor situation in order to maximize the Startec advantage in the industry
  • Participate in tradeshows, seminars and other sales opportunities as required
  • Participate in job turnover meetings with the Service Coordinator and the mechanics prior to job start when required
  • Participate in post job meetings with the Service Coordinator and the mechanics involved when required
  • As required, travel to current job sites to ensure client satisfaction and provide support to Startec staff as required
  • Work collaboratively with engineering and design to produce best fit innovative solutions to customer needs with a focus on operational efficiency
  • Meet with other managers as required in pursuit of strategic planning objectives and continuous improvement
  • Responsible for the profitable operations of the Southern region
  • Participate in the development of annual budgets to evaluate capital requirements, plan head counts and determine annual expenses
  • Manage the training and development of Service Mechanics to obtain additional knowledge and skills
  • Provide help and advice to customers either directly or through use of internal resources
  • Investigate and solve customers' problems
  • Handle customer complaints or any issues that arise with the customer involving the Service Operations Manager when required
  • Keep accurate records of discussions or correspondence with customers
  • Interviewing, hiring, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems
  • Develop and maintain mutually beneficial relationships with customers
  • Communicate on a regular basis with all current clients to ensure services being provided by Startec meet client requirements, identify any shortfall, recognition and opportunities, etc. and to ensure customer complaints and issues are addressed
  • Works with the Service Coordinator and the Office Administrator to ensure invoices are reviewed for accuracy against original quotations prior to being issued. Works with Office Administrator to ensure outstanding client accounts receivable are followed-up as required
  • Review and make recommendations to management for issuing refunds or compensation to customers
  • Managing billing in pursuit of a ten-day average from end of task to generation of invoice
  • Manage fleet vehicle repair and expense and provide acquisition recommendations

QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS:

  • 5 years previous experience in a supervisory or management role in the Refrigeration Industry is an asset
  • Red Seal Journeyman Refrigeration Mechanic with ammonia refrigeration experience is required, or equivalent such as a Millwright ticket.
  • A minimum of 3 - 5 years sales experience is considered an asset
  • Microsoft Windows; Microsoft Office Suite experience required
  • Dynamics 365 experience considered an asset

We offer competitive wages, training, flexible, dynamic, and exciting work environment.

We thank you for your application and interest in our organization. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Food and Beverage Area Supervisor - 2022
description:
Overview:

Ensure the efficient day-to-day operation of the restaurants in assigned area while ensuring quality and guest service standards are met.

This position pays $18.50-$20.00 per hour.

Responsibilities:
  • Ensure the efficient day-to-day operation of the area (i.e.; restaurants or office) while ensuring quality and guest service standards are met
  • Ensure all documentation is complete for all associates which may include; equipment, production methods, chemical and sanitation procedures, cash handling, seasonal payroll, data entry, filing and subsequent reporting
  • Participate in training, development and performance management of all associates within assigned area
  • Establish goals and work with the team to achieve these goals and measure their results
  • May be responsible for monitoring ESA violations, inventory analysis, product ordering system, audits or cash variances
  • Oversee Health and Safety in the area and track accident reports while acting as a liaison with the Health and Safety Dept.
  • Investigate equipment problems and ensure that repairs or replacements are made; complete applicable forms
  • Monitor the Time and Attendance system and ensure your team is properly trained and accurately records shift information
  • Communicate effectively to your team and upper Management in order for your area to operate smoothly
  • Prepare seasonal schedule on a weekly basis and ensure hours are within budget requirements
  • Create and execute motivational events for your team
  • Fulfill other duties as assigned
Qualifications:
  • Detail oriented, able to multi-task and meet deadlines
  • Possess strong MS Office computer skills and written/verbal communication skills
  • Currently enrolled in a post-secondary Hotel and Restaurant Management, Business Management or related course or possess relevant past work experience
  • Previous supervisory experience is required
  • Must have current Smart Serve certification; cost will be covered upon successful completion of contract period
  • Possess an outgoing, enthusiastic, service oriented personality including good; planning, organization, problem solving and follow up skills
  • Available to work part-time shifts starting in February and full-time shifts starting in May through Labour Day, and on weekends until the end of December
  • Able to work flexible shifts including evenings, on weekends and holidays
  • Thorough understanding of food and beverage controls relating to food cost and labour (for Restaurant locations only)
  • Reliable source of transportation outside of public transit due to weekly late shift requirements
  • Able to wear personal protective equipment deemed necessary to perform this job safely (may include; gloves, mask and/or face shield, non-slip shoes etc)

title: Regional Manager
description:
Peterbilt Atlantic is seeking a Regional Manager to join the team at our office in Nova Scotia, New Brunswick and PEI

At Peterbilt Atlantic we are driven each day by one simple line: “At Home on the Road”.  We insist that every interaction within our company receives the same level of friendly hospitality that anyone would expect in their own home. “At Home on the Road” isn’t just a customer service slogan, our staff treat their workplace and workmates as a large family.

Reporting directly to the Vice-President Operations, the Regional Manager will assist in overseeing parts and service departments at Peterbilt Atlantic locations in five provinces. The Regional Manager will play a key role in delivering the “At Home on the Road” brand. A hands-on, roll-up your sleeves attitude is a must.  Take your career to the next level by joining an industry leading team with state of the art facilities as we represent the iconic Peterbilt brand in Eastern Canada.

Benefits 

  • Blue Cross Insurance 
  • RRSP Contributions 
  • Paid time off and vacation
  • Long Term Disability
  • Growth opportunities 
  • Paid Training
  • Family owned and operated
  • Long term job security
  • Discounts on products and services

 

Qualifications & requirements

  • Experience in heavy truck or automotive sector
  • Experience in team management
  • Ability to understand and achieve corporate objectives
  • Ability to create and follow budgets
  • Ability to read Customer Satisfaction Index 
  • Experience with Dealer Management Software (ideally CDK) an asset. 
  • Competence in Microsoft Office technology
  • Appetite for frequent travel
  • Team player with ambitious, customer-centric attitude 

We are an equal opportunity employer and prohibit discrimination/harassment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, provincial or local laws.

title: Food Service Supervisor - PPT - Food Services
description:
Posting #: 2021-889368

Non-Union

Position: Food Service Supervisor

Department: Food Services

Status:Permanent Part-time (must provide availability of up to 0.3 FTE)

Hours: Monday to Sunday, Days and Evenings;6:00am-2:00pm, 12:30pm-8:30pm; 8 hour shifts and every other weekend (subject to change based on operational requirements)

Site: Oakville

Halton Healthcare takes great pride in providing quality, compassionate healthcare services to our rapidly growing communities. As a progressive and vibrant healthcare organization, we take healthcare to a new level to meet the urgent needs of ourcommunity's growing and aging population. We are adistinctive centre of healthcare excellence that offers first-rate care in an innovative environment that supports the physical, mental, emotional and spiritual needs of the community.

Halton Healthcare’s vision of Exemplary patient experiences, always , goes beyond just the patient experience; it has shaped our entire culture and remains at the core of every interaction in our organization, from our patients & families to our staff, physicians and volunteers. We believe in exemplary PEOPLE experiences always!

This is what you'll be doing:

Successful candidate is a member of the Clinical Nutrition and Food Services Management Team, working with the Director, and Manager to ensurethe smooth operation of the Department. As a member of our team, you will be responsible for providing direct supervision of all staff in Patient Food Services and will provide leadership in the development of a superior customer service culture in Food Services. The successful incumbent will supervise the daily operations of the Food Services Department, including meal service to patients,sanitation, warewashing and security. You will ensure that all work practices are in keeping with Hospital, Departmental,and legislated standards (e.g. HACCP, Public Health, Canadian Food Inspection Agency Act, Workplace Safety and OH&S Act).

This is what you’ll need to do it:

Halton Healthcare endeavors to hire individuals who are competent in their chosen profession and who exemplify our mission, vision and values of accountability, respect and compassion which guide our individual behaviours and attitudes.

  • Successful completion of a Food Service Supervisor diploma required
  • Canadian Society for Nutrition Management Membership required
  • Serve Safe Certified- Advanced required
  • A minimum of 3years experience working as a Food ServicesSupervisorrequired
  • Previous experience working as a Food Services Supervisor in a hospital setting preferred
  • Working knowledge of WHMIS and HACCP required
  • Action oriented approach to problem solving and trouble shooting
  • Experience in large scale food production and service required
  • Excellent time management skills and proven initiative
  • Must beself-directed with excellent organizational skills
  • Proven ability to effectively supervise staff
  • Excellent communication skills both written and verbal
  • Proficient in the use of a computerfor data entry
  • Experience usingFood Service computer systems
  • Must be able to meet the physical demands of the position.
  • Satisfactory employment and attendance record required

Date Posted: November 30, 2021

Application Deadline for Employees:December 7, 2021

If you are passionate about what you do, motivated by a job well done, and as committed to excellence, quality and patient satisfaction as we are, we'd like to hear from you. Please submit your application via our website at www.haltonhealthcare.com directly to this posting and include a current copy of your resume.

We thank all those who apply but only those individuals selected for further consideration will be contacted.

In accordance with Directive #6, Halton Healthcare has implemented a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy. All new hires must be fully compliant with our Policy as a condition of employment with Halton Healthcare. Successful applicants will be required to provide proof of vaccination or proof of a documented medical exemption as part of the hiring process.

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code, Halton Healthcare will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your accommodation needs to ensure your equal participation.

All personal information is collected under the authority of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act.

Halton Healthcare is a smoke free facility in and around all three sites. Smoking is not permitted on hospital properties. We thank everyone who works at or visits our hospitals for respecting this healthy initiative. We are also a scent-free environment for all employees and visitors to accommodate individuals’ health concerns arising from exposure to scented products, We ask for everyone's cooperation in our efforts to accommodate health concerns.

title: Service Manager
description:
Welcome to The Canadian Brewhouse, Canada's fastest-growing independent restaurant group!  We are proud of being the only Canadian-themed sports bar in town, and we know that without our incredible teams we wouldn't be a fraction of where we are today.  Our teams live and breathe our Core Values; these are 6 key principles that influence all of our decisions as an organization.

  • Take Care of Each Other and Yourself
  • Think Like a Customer
  • Support Your Community
  • Hurry, Donâ€™t Rush
  • Embrace Innovation
  • Be Persistent

When not at work, you may catch us out in the community volunteering, raising funds for The Canadian Mental Health Association or the local Children's Hospital, or having a couple of drinks with friends. The Brew Crew is a team of devoted, compassionate, and ambitious individuals that are hungry for what the future holds. We believe it's our duty to provide all of our employees with a safe, fun-filled work environment with endless advancement opportunities. Let us tell you more about why you should join the best team in Canada, today!

 

Letâ€™s talk about the Service Manager Position!

What will be your responsibilities?

  • Support and involve yourself with a high energy, passionate team 
  • Handle difficult situations and tackle them with the tools that we provide or that you choose to bring to the table
  • Table touching, ensuring all guests are receiving that â€˜wowâ€™ experience
  • Lead, coach, and mentor your team to embrace the Canadian Brewhouse values and culture
  • Working closely with your Assistant and General Manager to ensure all ordering and tasks are completed to successfully run the store
  • Support yourself and your team to grow to their full potential within our company!

What do you need?

  • Passion for people - experience in a supervisor role is necessary, food industry is a perk!
  • Willingness to learn and expand your knowledge, as well as grow as an individual
  • Dedication to learning a large database of many Brewhouse procedures - including food, drinks, policies, training programs, values, processes, the list goes on!
  • Strong ability to communicate effectively
  • Ambition and drive to create the best experience for your team and guests
  • A drive to find solutions rather than point out problems
  • Flexibility to work long hours (Days and/or Nights)

Benefits to Joining Our Team:

  • A company Health Spend Account after 3 months
  • A staff discount that we extend to your friends and family - show off your workplace, our house is your house!
  • Advancement opportunities are endless with the right attitude and passion - our CEO started out as a dishwasher!
  • The opportunity to Support Your Community - one of our core values, a great experience to volunteer with causes youâ€™re passionate about. 
  • Working with a team of like-minded individuals who have your interests at heart.  Our team is our family - We Are Brew Crew

â€‹

title: GÉRANT(E)
company: Boutique La Vie en Rose Inc
description:
GÉRANT(E)

00031-Place Ste-Foy, 2450, BOUL. LAURIER, SAINTE-FOY, Québec, CanadaNuméro de demande 5649
21 juin 2021

Fondée en 1985, la Vie en Rose a su se démarquer comme leader canadien dans le domaine de la lingerie et des maillots avec plus de 3000 employés. L’entreprise compte plus de 230 magasins à travers le Canada, et notre but ultime est de vous faire sentir belle et confortable dans notre lingerie et nos maillots de bain et de vous offrir un service à la clientèle remarquable. De plus, depuis 2006 nous avons percé le marché International et notre marque est désormais représentée dans 18 pays.

À la Vie en Rose, les employés sont l’actif le plus important de la compagnie. Il est important pour nous que les employés se sentent appréciés dans leur travail. C’est pourquoi nous encourageons les promotions à l’interne et offrons les meilleures formations possibles à nos employés afin qu’ils développent tous une belle et longue carrière à la Vie en Rose.

Rôle

Sous la supervision de la gérante régionale des ventes, la gérante a la responsabilité d’assurer le bon fonctionnement de la boutique ainsi que l’excellence du service à la clientèle. Elle est l’ultime responsable de l’atteinte des objectifs globaux et du maintien des standards en terme de service à la clientèle, des ventes, du contrôle des salaires, de la présentation visuelle aussi bien que d’assurer un haut niveau de performance de son équipe à travers un recrutement judicieux de candidates très motivées, de formation, de développement et d’évaluation de son personnel.

Description


Ventes:•Maximiser le rendement et la profitabilité de la boutique; •Mettre en place des objectifs de vente, les planifier et s’assurer de les atteindre ou de les dépasser. Bien communiquer les informations nécessaires afin d’atteindre ces objectifs de vente à toute l’équipe de vente; •Former les employés sur les meilleures techniques de vente et sur les produits; •Analyser les résultats de vente et développer des plans d’actions afin d’améliorer les résultats; •Analyser les ventes par département sur une base hebdomadaire; •Gérer de façon efficiente la masse salariale à travers une bonne planification des horaires et des employés performants; •Respecter les procédures administratives et politiques; •S’assurer que la gérante régionale soit mise au courant de toute action relative aux opérations en magasin.Marketing :•Être à l’affût de ce que fait la compétition et de l’activité du marché; •Bâtir une clientèle régulière en publicisant l’image de marque et en développant des contacts dans le domaine du commerce au détail; •Identifier le type de clientèle, leurs besoins, leurs demandes…; •Participer et travailler de concert avec l’administration du centre commerciale.


Ressources Humaines:•Contribuer à bâtir une équipe performante; recruter, préparer et former la relève en identifiant les meilleures candidates potentielles aux divers postes; •Motiver l’équipe : créer un environnement de travail positif à la recherche de l’excellence et développer le sentiment d’appartenance et la fierté de travailler pour La Vie en Rose. Transmettre la vision et la mission de l’entreprise à son équipe; •Gérer les conflits de travail et appliquer progressivement les mesures disciplinaires nécessaires incluant les congédiements conformément aux lois et aux procédures et politiques de la compagnie; •Effectuer les évaluations de rendement de tout le personnel de son magasin; •Planifier les horaires de travail, les communiquer aux employés et contrôler les absences et les retards; •Agir en tant que modèle en tout temps.Présentation visuelle:•Connaître la marchandise et les particularités techniques des produits; •Créer une boutique attrayante et invitante selon les planogrammes de la compagnie; •Développer un plan d’action afin d’améliorer les résultats du contrôle des inventaires; •Planifier la réception de marchandise et assurer la mise en place du visuel rapidement; •Gérer l’image visuelle de la boutique, la maintenance de la boutique et de l’arrière-boutique.Administration:•Comprendre et être en mesure d’utiliser toutes les fonctions et rapports de notre programme informatique; •Connaitre, comprendre et utiliser le manuel de procédures des différents départements du siège social; •Procéder à l’ouverture et à la fermeture de la boutique; s’assurer que les gestionnaires du magasin la seconde dans cette action; •Transmettre des rapports de qualité au siège social en respectant les échéanciers; •Gérer efficacement toutes les dépenses contrôlables du magasin; •Travailler en respectant les politiques et procédures de la compagnie en matière de prévention des pertes et de sécurité; •Effectuer, sur demande, toute autre tâche connexe.


Exigences


•Expérience en tant que gérante dans le commerce au détail; •Reconnue en tant que leader et ayant des habiletés à motiver; •Entregent et esprit d’équipe; •Passion pour la vente, la gestion et le domaine de la mode; •Bilinguisme fonctionnel (atout); •Orientée vers les résultats et à l’écoute des besoins; •Proactive et diplomate; •Disponibilité durant les congés fériés et de travailler au-delà du plafond d’heure pendant les périodes achalandées; •Capacité à travailler dans un environnement en constante évolution.

Les informations sur ce site sont uniquement à des fins d'information et ne sont pas destinées à avoir des conséquences juridiques. La Vie en Rose s'est engagée envers l'équité en matière d'emploi. La Vie en Rose a mis en place un processus d'adaptation prévoyant des mesures d'adaptation pour les candidats sélectionnés pour une entrevue.

Autres détails

  • Type de paieSalaire

title: Service Manager (Planet Ford)
description:
Drive for Excellence


When its comes to Fords, Planet Ford is a king in the industry. Rated one of the top 25 dealerships in Canada, we have a proven track record for quality and service for the last 15 years.

Part of the Performance Auto Group, a leading automotive group, we are committed to integrity, believe in employee empowerment, passionate about innovating, care about a great guest experience and giving back.

Planet Ford is looking for an experienced Service Manager to join their Dynamic Team.

About you.

You are friendly, hard-working and motivated to join our high volume dealership. Planet Ford works together at being the best while maintaining a happy, family like environment. You are positive, empathetic and a problem solver when dealing with guests. Joining our team will give you the chance to be coached by the best and celebrated for your successes.

Here’s what you’ll deliver:

  • Establish and maintain good relationships with customers and to exceed their expectations.
  • Develop and maintain a culture that values excellent customer service through effective training, supervision, coaching and performance management.
  • Review and implement Service Centre policies and procedures that improve the Customer Experience through high quality repairs and building customer relationships.
  • Develop and implement a long-term strategy and action plan to attract and retain customers.
  • Coach team members to provide excellent customer service.
  • Recruit, develop, motivate, recognize and hold accountable a Service team that will meet established objectives and targets for sales and profitability.
  • Improve sales and profitability for the Service Department.
  • Conduct monthly meetings with department employees to discuss activities and problems of mutual interest.
  • Review the previous month’s sales/profit to determine where improvements can be made.  
  • Establish and enforce product-knowledge standards.
  • Actively support, encourage, and motivate sales personnel daily to maintain high morale.
  • Monitors the operating budget by tracking sales and expenses.
  • Promotes service safety and security procedures.
  • Uphold all rules and procedures (i.e., support enforcement, including disciplinary action as necessary).
  • Work in strict compliance with the Laws of the Province of Ontario and Canada including, but not limited to, the Employment Standards Act (ESA), the Motor Vehicle Dealers Act (MVDA) and the Accessibilities for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).
  • Understand and comply with all federal, provincial and local regulations that affect service operations, such as the Occupational Health and Safety Act (OHSA), waste disposal regulations, etc.
  • Comply with all company policies, standards and procedures. 
  • Other duties as required by management.

What you need to succeed:

  • Post Secondary Degree/Diploma in Business Administration. 
  • Minimum 5 years experience in the automotive service industry.
  • Minimum of 3 years of management experience in the automotive industry.
  • Previous experience as an Assistant Service Manager or Service Advisor is recommended. 
  • CDK experience preferred. 
  • Strong communication skills are required to work with customers, employees and vendors. 
  • Required to maintain the profitability of their department while controlling expenses and maintaining customer satisfaction.
  • Ability to support the organization’s goals and objectives. 
  • Excellent interpersonal and team building skills.
  • Demonstrate effective verbal, listening, and written communication skills. 
  • Attention to detail and ability to maintain a high level of accuracy.
  • Exceptional customer service orientation.
  • Excellent time management skills, ability to multitask and work well under pressure.
  • Ability to manage stress and work with tight deadlines.
  • Highly self motivated and directed.
  • Must be willing to be flexible with work schedules. 
  • Must have valid Class ‘G’ Ontario driver's license and clean drivers abstract.
  • Automotive Technician’s License is an asset.
  • Ability to work flexible hours and work around a changing schedule.

What’s in it for you?

  • Excellent management support and guidance
  • Opportunities through our Internal career mobility program
  • Access to health, dental and vision insurance
  • Disability, critical illness and life insurance for the unexpected
  • Our Employee Assistance Plan (EAP) for you and your family's wellness
  • Discount on vehicles, service and parts for you and your family
  • Discounts to retailers and service providers across the country
  • Free and engaging employee events 
  • Did we mention we love giving back to our communities?! 

We thank all applicants, however only those contacted for an interview will be considered. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome  applications from people with special needs. Accommodations will be provided throughout the selection process as requested. For any inquiries please email us.

title: Service Manager
description:
• Overseeing the day-to-day operations of both Plumbing and HVAC business units to ensure the consistency of service delivery.
  • Managing, planning, and executing Planned Maintenance Agreements, Projects, and Jobs
  • Surveying, taking off, and completing medium to large sales quotations and Planned Maintenance Agreements
  • Build and maintain excellent customer relations, resolving issues and concerns including proactive onsite visits.
  • Act as a technical resource to customer and field employees
  • Develop any potential sales or customer service opportunities to maximize portfolio growth
  • Overseeing quality control and ensuring regulatory compliance
  • Supervising, motivating and coaching field technicians and contractors
  • Ensuring health and safety policies and company policies are adhered to
  • Ensure the supply of parts in both warehouse and on team members vehicles are sufficiently stocked and organized
  • Ensure team members are equipped with well-maintained and functioning tools, equipment, and gear so they may execute their day-to-day tasks completely and efficiently
  • Audits the effectiveness of service operations and makes changes to improve performance.
  • Ensures that contractual obligations are delivered, and customer satisfaction is achieved
  • Perform other job-related duties as assigned.
  • A minimum of 2 years experience as a Service Manager for a Plumbing or HVAC company
  • Plumbing 306A, or G1 TSSA, or Refrigeration 313A Licence
  • $80,000 - $150,000 / Year
  • Dental
  • Extended Health
  • Life Insurance
  • Vision Care
  • Company Vehicle & Phone
  • Life Time Gym Membership
  • Gear and Tools
  • Paid Training
  • WFH Days

title: Service Manager
description:
About Clutch:

At Clutch, we are reinventing the way Canadians buy and own cars. We had enough of traditional dealerships that took advantage of customers and knew that we could build an incredible car-buying experience while leaving a positive impact on the communities we serve. 

Recently named one of the Fastest Growing Canadian Companies by the Globe & Mail and one of the Top Canadian Startups by LinkedIn, we're looking to add to our great team of people who embrace hard things, think like owners, and love to help their teammates. 

We pride ourselves on our high-quality certified vehicles, great prices, and customer experience. By visiting clutch.ca, customers can browse a large selection of high-quality vehicles, buy a car that's right for them, and enjoy seamless delivery - all from the comfort of their home.

Clutch, founded in 2016, is headquartered in Toronto and services Alberta, British Columbia, Nova Scotia, New Brunswick, Ontario, and Prince Edward Island. It is backed by a number of world-class investors including D1 Capital Partners, Canaan, BrandProject, Real Ventures, Upper90, FJ Labs, Global Founders Capital and Azure Capital Partners.

The Role

As Clutch grows its inventory, the Service Manager will play a vital role on the Clutch team. We're looking for a highly motivated self-starter to help ensure our vehicles are up to our high mechanical standard.You will be working closely with management to build Clutch Alberta's service/repair operations. You will play a leading role in the recruitment and management of our automotive service technician team. In the early days, you will also be responsible for performing vehicle inspections, maintenance work and minor repairs such as brakes, suspension, tires, batteries etc.

Our ideal candidate has experience working on European vehicles in addition to other foreign and domestic brands. They will also be highly organized, have strong communication skills, and excellent attention to detail:

What You'll Do:
  • Hire, manage and mentor a team of Automotive Service Technicians
  • Build a cutting edge automotive service operation
  • Assist in planning for future growth, including expanding shop infrastructure and helping build new processes
  • Ensure our mechanical reconditioning is industry leading, while continually finding new ways to reduce costs
  • Perform Clutch standardized vehicle inspections (stationary and road tests)
  • Diagnose and assess vehicle issues and damage, both internal and external
  • Make recommendations about vehicle repairs and the best course of action
  • Perform repairs and preventative maintenance, such as oil changes, suspension and brake work
  • Create documentation of repairs and estimates
  • Assist in the coordination of work with third parties when necessary
  • Adhere to and continually help improve Clutch's high mechanical standards
We're Looking For:
  • Hands-on Automotive Service experience and knowledge
  • Previous Shop Foreman or Service Manager experience is an asset
  • Red Seal certification is an asset
  • Experience working with a variety of car brands (domestic, import & European)
  • Team player above all else
  • Previous leadership experience
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Ability to multitask and prioritize competing demands
  • Desire to learn new skills
  • User of technology (Google Drive, Slack etc.)
  • Valid Driver's License (Clean Driver's Abstract)
Why You'll Love it at Clutch:
  • Competitive Salary & Equity Incentives
  • Health & Dental Benefits from day one
  • Generous Time Off Program
  • Learning Budget - for whatever YOU want to learn
  • Build and run a state of the art service operation from the ground up
  • Opportunity to work for an ambitious and fast-moving startup
  • Opportunity to be part of Clutch's fast growing service team
  • Job Type: Full-time

Clutch is committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where all individuals have an opportunity to succeed. If you require accommodation at any stage of the interview process, please email 

talent@clutch.ca

.
