title: Directeur Général
description:
Pourquoi se joindre à TC Transcontinental

  • Profiter d’un milieu de travail dynamique et hautement stimulant où vous pourrez faire votre marque et mener une carrière impressionnante.
  • Salaire compétitif
  • Prime annuelle en fonction de l'atteinte d'objectifs financiers et opérationnels prédéterminés
  • Avantages sociaux flexibles (santé, dentaire, vie, AD&D, ILD, bien-être, EAFP)
  • Régime de retraite à cotisations déterminées avec cotisations de l'entreprise en fonction de l'âge et des années de service
  • Cotisations professionnelles
  • Téléphone intelligent
  • Des occasions de perfectionnement où votre avis compte
  • Environnement de travail agréable – Atelier de conception

Description sommaire

Le Directeur Général assure la gestion globale des opérations et la coordination de l'unité d'affaires Prémédia située à Saint-Laurent. Il élabore un plan d'affaires stratégique en accord avec les orientations et les priorités de l'entreprise ainsi qu’en fonction des tendances du marché et des ressources disponibles.

Il effectue la planification budgétaire et en fait un suivi rigoureux. Il établit des politiques, des programmes et des procédures pour respecter les calendriers de production, les normes de qualité des produits et les coûts opérationnels. Il développe et maintient de bonnes relations d'affaires avec les clients actuels et potentiels.

Principales tâches et responsabilités

  • Responsable de l'atteinte des résultats d'exploitation, y compris les objectifs de profit, le contrôle des dépenses et la gestion des actifs et des dépenses en immobilisations.
  • Gestion de compte : présenter des idées innovantes à nos clients, augmenter la part du portefeuille, générer des revenus nouveaux et existants.
  • Contact client/client – expert en la matière pour Premedia – réunions avec les clients sur leurs sites et visites de ceux-ci, négociation de contrats et d'accords de service.
  • Responsable de la gestion et du développement de tous les employés, y compris le développement de la gestion, la planification de la relève, l'engagement, la santé et la sécurité et la formation de tous les employés.
  • Responsable de développer des stratégies pour soutenir la croissance des ventes et des revenus, et soutenir les opportunités de synergie avec d'autres groupes de l'industrie de l'imprimerie, ainsi qu'avec d'autres départements de l'entreprise.
  • Superviser le processus de planification des activités et de préparation du budget, en particulier dans les domaines des objectifs financiers, des opérations et des dépenses en immobilisations.
  • Gérer, par le biais d'une équipe, les processus commerciaux suivants, en fixant des objectifs clairs et mesurables pour l'entreprise :
  • Représentation commerciale en interne (Comptes Maison et Ventes Inter-Entreprises)
  • Service à la clientèle, y compris estimation, planification et gestion de projet
  • Opérations de production (mise en page graphique, traduction, rédaction, relecture, prestations numériques)
  • Opérations de studio créatif, photo et vidéo
  • Ressources informatiques, de développement d'applications et d’assistance technique
  • Finances et administration
  • Ressources Humaines et Santé & Sécurité
  • Appuyer un milieu de travail sain et sécuritaire et y contribuer en respectant la réglementation, les politiques et les initiatives du milieu de travail, notamment en déclarant toutes les blessures nécessitant des premiers soins, les accidents et les dangers en milieu de travail.

Étendue de vos responsabilités :

  • 144 employés (64 salariés, 80 horaires – une partie syndiquée)
  • 20M$ en ventes nettes
  • Clients de grande à moyenne taille (comptes nationaux et régionaux)

Qualifications requises

Formation

  • Diplôme universitaire, de préférence en administration des affaires
  • Un minimum de 10-15 ans d'expérience dans un rôle de gestion
  • 5 ans d'expérience dans les opérations de prépresse, de studio photo et vidéo, la conception et/ou la production de circulaires de vente au détail numériques
  • Expérience dans les ventes et le soutien à la clientèle dans l'industrie de l'impression (un atout)

Expérience professionnelle

  • Expérience avérée dans la direction et le développement d'un vivier de talents et de l'engagement des employés
  • Expérience en relations de travail – environnement partiellement syndiqué
  • Expérience avec le milieu des ventes, la gestion de client et le support à une équipe des ventes

Compétences

  • Compétences financières bien établies en utilisant un compte de résultat et un bilan pour gérer l'entreprise
  • Solides compétences en analyse et en résolution de problèmes, et capacité à gérer des détails complexes
  • À l’aise avec les technologies et la digitalisation
  • Maîtrise de l’environnement Windows et MS Office
  • Bilinguisme tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit (français et anglais)

Habiletés spécifiques

  • Stratégique et pragmatique
  • Capacité à collaborer avec une équipe interfonctionnelle pour élaborer et exécuter des plans d'affaires annuels et à moyen terme axés sur la croissance du chiffre d'affaires et des résultats
  • Leadership et bonne compétence de mobilisation d’équipe tout en donnant l’exemple
  • Bon communicateur avec une vision d’avenir
  • Excellent collaborateur qui démontre une grande ouverture
  • Agile et rigoureux
  • Habile négociateur et efficacité à résoudre les conflits
  • Dynamique, énergique et ambitieux avec un bon sens de l’initiative
  • Esprit entrepreneurial

À propos de TC Transcontinental

TC Imprimeries Transcontinental propose une offre de services intégrée pour les détaillants, incluant les services de Prémédia, l’impression de circulaires et de produits marketing sur le lieu de vente, et la distribution de porte en porte par l’entremise du Publisac au Québec, et de Targeo, un service pancanadien de courtage en distribution. Ce secteur offre aussi une gamme de solutions d’impression novatrices en matière de journaux, de magazines, de livres en couleurs et de produits marketing personnalisés et de masse.

Depuis plus de 30 ans, ils ont établi des partenariats avec certains des meilleurs et plus importants détaillants et marques au pays pour offrir du contenu qui engage et inspire. Quand vous êtes mis au défi par les meilleurs clients, votre propre équipe tire le meilleur d’elle-même et améliore son avantage sur les concurrents. Ils ont acquis un rôle de leader en nous adaptant, en évoluant au fil des changements technologiques et avec une clientèle en perpétuel changement afin de créer des stratégies multiplateformes gagnantes qui soient complètes et rentables. 

Depuis plus de 45 ans, l’histoire de TC Transcontinental se tisse sur une trame d’innovation et de transformation dans le but de répondre aux besoins évolutifs de nos clients. Nos valeurs familiales fortes, notre esprit entrepreneurial et notre vision à long terme ont toujours été au cœur de notre succès. 

Culture et Valeurs

Nos valeurs guident nos actions et reflètent notre engagement envers toutes nos parties prenantes. En faisant preuve de respect, en travaillant en équipe et en misant sur la performance et l’innovation, nos gens font vivre nos valeurs et les rendent plus vibrantes chaque jour. Ensemble, nous bâtissons une entreprise dont nous pouvons tous être fiers.

Chez TC Transcontinental, notre volonté de contribuer au développement de pratiques d'affaires durables est solidement ancrée dans nos valeurs.

En tant que société contrôlée et qu’entreprise citoyenne responsable, la volonté de créer de la valeur à long terme et d’assurer notre croissance profitable fait partie de notre ADN. Il s’agit là de notre engagement envers nos actionnaires, nos employés, nos clients et les collectivités au sein desquelles nous œuvrons.

Mission

Notre mission est simple : créer des produits et services de qualité permettant aux entreprises d'attirer, de joindre et de fidéliser leur clientèle cible. Dans la poursuite de nos objectifs, nous sommes fermement guidés par notre vision de devenir l’un des principaux chefs de file nord-américains en emballage souple tout en maintenant notre position de premier imprimeur au Canada et de plus important groupe canadien d’édition pédagogique de langue française. 


Suivez TALINKO sur LinkedInet visitez notre site web

Seules les personnes sélectionnées pour une entrevue seront contactées. Nous souscrivons au principe de l’équité en matière d’emploi.

TALINKO est une firme de recrutement de cadres intermédiaires et supérieurs offrant également l’accompagnement dans le recrutement de membres de conseil d’administration ou comité aviseur. Nous œuvrons dans différents secteurs d’activités.

Veuillez noter que le masculin est utilisé pour alléger le texte, et ce, sans préjudice pour la forme féminine.

En faisant preuve de respect, en travaillant en équipe et en misant sur la performance et l’innovation, nos gens font vivre nos valeurs et les rendent plus vibrantes chaque jour. Ensemble, nous bâtissons une entreprise dont nous pouvons tous être fiers.', 'Stratégique et pragmatique', 'Des occasions de perfectionnement où votre avis compte', 'TALINKO est une firme de recrutement de cadres intermédiaires et supérieurs offrant également l’accompagnement dans le recrutement de membres de conseil d’administration ou comité aviseur. Nous œuvrons dans différents secteurs d’activités.', "Responsable de développer des stratégies pour soutenir la croissance des ventes et des revenus, et soutenir les opportunités de synergie avec d'autres groupes de l'industrie de l'imprimerie, ainsi qu'avec d'autres départements de l'entreprise."]

title: Service Manager
description:
Requisition Number: 113757

Job Description

Cintas is seeking a Service Manager to directly manage our customer facing Service team. Responsibilities include hiring and performance management; managing the overall performance of a team; providing leadership by fostering a safe working environment; successful resolution of customer related issues; training a team on effective sales techniques; performing goodwill of customers at the customer site while maintaining a high level of customer satisfaction; achieving sales, profit, inventory and payroll goals; managing a budget and dealing with operational issues that affect service. Hands-on support of direct reports includes accompanying our service representatives or visiting customers alone when necessary, to assist in the pick-up and delivery of products or services; driving a company-owned vehicle to and from customer locations; lifting, carrying and walking Cintas products in and out of customer accounts while maintaining world-class service and goodwill to customers; performing managerial duties.

Skills/Qualifications

Required

  • The ability to meet the physical requirements of the position
  • High School Diploma/GED; Bachelor's Degree preferred

Qualified candidates must meet all Provincial requirements for driving a regulated vehicle weighing more than 10,000 lbs. In order to comply with Provincial requirements, qualified candidates must, prior to their first day of employment:

  • Possess a valid driver's license in good standing

 

Preferred

  • Management experience
  • Experience in industrial sales or customer service

Our employee-partners enjoy:

 

  • Competitive Pay
  • Weekly Pay Cheques
  • RRSP and DPSP Contribution
  • Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance Package
  • Disability & Life Insurance Package
  • Paid Vacation & Holidays
  • Career Advancement Opportunities

 

Headquartered in Cincinnati, Cintas is a publicly held company traded over the Nasdaq Global Select Market under the symbol CTAS and is a component of both the Standard & Poor’s 500 Index and Nasdaq-100 Index.

Cintas Corporation helps more than 900,000 businesses of all types and sizes get READY™ to open their doors with confidence every day by providing a wide range of products and services that enhance our customers’ image and help keep their facilities and employees clean, safe and looking their best. With products and services including uniforms, mats, mops, restroom supplies, first aid and safety products, fire extinguishers and testing, and safety and compliance training, Cintas helps customers get Ready for the Workday®.

To support our growth across North America, we’re seeking driven professionals with ambition to move up within our company. Our professional culture, our dedication to our employee-partners and limitless career opportunities—these are just a few benefits we’re proud to offer. Our employee-partners know every job is critical, and that teamwork drives innovation. Let’s talk about how you’ll fit into our team and how your hard work will be recognized through competitive pay, world-class benefits and ongoing career development. Are you Ready™ for limitless opportunities at Cintas?

In accordance with applicable laws (including human rights and accessibility legislation), accommodations will be provided in all parts of the hiring process. Applicants are required to make their needs known in advance.



Job Category: Service 
Organization: Rental
Employee Status: Regular
Schedule: Full Time
Shift: 1st Shift

In order to comply with\xa0Provincial requirements, qualified candidates must, prior to their first day of employment:']

title: Service Manager
description:
Overview:

Fountain Tire Fort McMurray Gregoire (242 Gregoire Dr) is searching for a friendly and knowledgeable  Service Manager  to manage the operations of the service department to drive productivity, quality assurance and to promote a high level of customer satisfaction.

 

What We Offer:

  • Competitive  market wages
  • Regular day shifts
  • Great discounts for you and your family on tires, parts and mechanical services
  • Health, Dental and Vision Benefits  for you and your family
  • RRSP matching program
  • The opportunity for growth that includes the potential to enter our management training program and own your own Fountain Tire store!

 As a Service Manager, your duties will include:

  • Overseeing and managing mechanical and tire services  
  • Setting quality standards and maintaining the  quality of all shop  activities
  • Ensuring completion of shop maintenance and repair work
  • Addressing customer complaints and inquiries in a courteous, professional manner
  • Advising technicians  of work that must be completed
  • Ensuring technicians compliance with company standards  regarding  quality, safety, and customer service
  • Managing the morale in the shop by setting and demonstrating a strong business ethic for dealing with employees, suppliers and customers
  • Maintaining the cleanliness of the shop

Our ideal candidate has/is:

  • 3-5 yearsâ€™ experience as a Service Manager or Service Advisor providing Service Estimation
  • Knowledge of mechanical services
  • Effective leadership skills, with a strong focus on operations and business processes
  • High level of integrity and accountability
  • A customer service focus
  • Ability to develop and maintain effective relationships with team members and customers
  • Strong communication, and interpersonal skills
  • Continuously looking to learn and use new skills and the demonstrated ability to recognize opportunities for improvements
  • Flexible, patient, and calm when working with tight schedules

Interested and qualified? Please apply on-line or in-store today.

title: Directeur Général
description:
Viandes Giroux est actuellement à la recherche d’un(e) directeur(trice) général(e) pour occuper un emploi permanent à nos installations d’East Angus en Estrie. Nous nous spécialisons dans l’abattage, la coupe et le désossage de porc.

Ce que nous offrons :

  • Salaire concurrentiel ;
  • Assurance collective ;
  • Programme RVER (régime volontaire d’épargne retraite);
  • Un environnement de travail stimulant et une entreprise en croissance,

Les tâches et responsabilités reliées au poste sont :

  • Garantir le bon fonctionnement et optimiser les opérations de l’usine pour les départements d’abattage et de découpe;
  • Gestion des superviseurs de production et du département de contrôle qualité;
  • S’assurer de la conformité de la pratique de travail et le port des équipements de sécurité dans les secteurs d’activité de l’usine;
  • S’assurer que les bonnes pratiques industrielles et les procédures opérationnelles standards sont respectées en tout temps et que tous les produits rencontrent de manière cohérente les spécifications;
  • Élaborer une méthodologie de travail et instaurer un suivi rigoureux;
  • Maîtriser toutes les étapes de la ligne de production;
  • Implanter une culture de performance;
  • Maximiser les ressources humaines, matérielles et financières;
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec le contrôleur financier pour s’assurer de respecter les objectifs de production et les coûts reliés;
  • Assurer la gestion des inventaires;
  • Gérer, encadrer, motiver, embaucher, former et évaluer les employés;
  • Assurer le développement des membres de son équipe, de leur motivation et de leur engagement;
  • Assurer une bonne relation avec la clientèle;
  • Établir une relation de confiance avec les autres services et les partenaires externe et interne.

Les exigences de l’emploi sont :

  • Expérience en gestion de production alimentaire;
  • Fortes habiletés de gestion/mobilisation d’équipe;
  • Avoir du leadership et une bonne organisation de travail;
  • Être rassembleur et bon communicateur;
  • La maîtrise de l’espagnol serait un atout.

Viandes Giroux est un établissement agroalimentaire de découpe et de transformation de viandes depuis plus de 60 ans. Notre entreprise est membre du Groupe Riendeau qui se spécialise principalement dans la transformation, l’entreposage et la distribution de viandes, en plus de détenir plusieurs usines et entrepôts dans les régions de Montréal, Laval, l’Estrie, Québec et Lanaudière.

Notre offre d’emploi comme DIRECTEUR(TRICE) GÉNÉRAL(E) chez Viandes Giroux à East Angus en Estrie vous interpelle? Alors, faites-nous parvenir votre candidature dès maintenant, nous sommes impatients de vous rencontrer!

Pour voir toutes nos offres d'emplois, visiter le :

title: Service Manager
description:
Brandt is currently seeking a Service Manager for our Sudburylocation.

The Service Manager will be responsible for managing the sales and delivery of heavy duty equipment after-market support services (component diagnostics, repair, and replacement). This includes managing all aspects of the service department and day-to-day activity of foremen, leadmen, service writers, and shop, field, and resident heavy duty mechanics.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Managing service workflow
  • Enforcing standards, policies, and reporting practices are followed to established standards
  • Development and management of the Service Department budget to meet financial and operational goals
  • Preparing quotes for customer work orders; opening & closing work orders
  • Inspect/operate customer equipment as part of resolving concerns/diagnostics
  • Monitor service revenue and expenses monthly
  • Ensure work is performed according to established safety and industry standards
  • Reviewing employee performance against goals on an ongoing basis
  • Able to communicate effectively and professionally with customers, employees, and branch personnel at all levels
  • Must be self-motivated in learning and applying new knowledge and skills and is willing to share knowledge with others
  • Must be able to travel to customer worksites, and as required, operator and work on or around heavy equipment
  • Must be proficient in using work-related desktop applications and web-based productivity applications
  • Has the confidence, critical thinking, knowledge, and technical skills to assess and solve customer, business, and personnel problems effectively and efficiently
  • A recent driver's abstract will be required
  • Demonstrates a strong commitment to occupational health and safety
  • 5-7 years’ progressive, combined experience in service, management and business (i.e. journeyperson heavy duty mechanic, combined with 3 years’ management/supervisory experience in the heavy duty equipment industry
  • Has a solid foundation of knowledge and skill in the operation of a heavy duty equipment dealership
  • Demonstrated ability to organize work, set priorities, and achieve work related objectives and goals
  • Demonstrates a strong customer service orientation, and exercises sound judgment when dealing with customers

title: Service Manager
description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Under the direction of the Branch or General Manager, the Service Manager is responsible for the day to day operational management of an assigned client portfolio within the branch operation. In a branch â€œstart-upâ€ operation, the Service Manager may report directly to a Regional Vice President and additionally be responsible for branch growth and start-up activities.

ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:   Those duties necessary to meet the minimum requirements of the position.   Other duties may be assigned:

  1. Act as the primary client contact for the assigned portfolio of accounts. Responsible for regular face to face client interaction and proactive resolution of any operational issues at assigned client base. Maintain ongoing and proactive client contact, including site visits, meeting attendance, timely response and follow-up, phone calls, lunches and other special events.
  2. Define, address and resolve all client issues including personnel/staffing concerns or requests, service issues or requests, execution of company programs, officer performance issues, or other service related items.
  3. Responsible for Service Manager duties for assigned portfolio of accounts, including setting up and managing weekly schedules, inputting payroll, tracking job openings on approved Operations reports, initiating open requisitions with Field Recruiting in the applicant tracking system, evaluating applicants, scheduling and conducting interviews, and hiring qualified applicants to fill open post positions.
  4. Ensure all positions are staffed according to contract requirements and effectively manage branch overtime through proper scheduling and staffing. Maintain a qualified, sufficient pool of rovers or contingent workforce for backfill of vacant positions as needed.
  5. Ensure all post requirements are current and complete at assigned portfolio, including current post orders, training and licensing compliance, staff training, vehicle policy compliance, uniform and appearance standards being met, and other staff and client relations policies being administered according to company standards.
  6. Ensure that policies regarding coaching and discipline are followed consistently, employee complaints are promptly reported, investigated and resolved, and compliance with all employee relations policies is followed consistently.
  7. May work closely with the Sales team assigned to region. May participate in sales presentations to potential clients, go on sales calls, and participate in sales events.
  8. May be responsible, with Branch/General Manager oversight, for new account startups and transitions, ensuring staffing levels are met, training and uniform issues are addressed, and physically participating in startup activities to ensure a smooth transition.
  9. Ensure oversight and regular use of financial reports to manage key branch measurements, such as overtime and scheduling efficiency for assigned client portfolio.
  10. Attend and actively participate in management meetings within region and at corporate. Observe operations and make suggestions for improved efficiency as appropriate, including providing ideas and plans for growth and improvements within the assigned portfolio, branch or company-wide.
  11. In a start-up operation, may also perform duties typically performed by Human Resource Coordinator or Receptionist on an as-needed basis, where such positions have not yet been added to the branch staff.
  12. Others duties as assigned by Branch/General Manager, Regional Vice President or corporate staff.

 

 

QUALIFICATIONS:   To perform this job successfully, the individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.   The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or experience required.   Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Bachelorâ€™s Degree in Sales, Marketing or Business preferred with a minimum of three (3) to five (5) years related experience with progressive managerial responsibilities.
  • Prior experience in the security or other service related industry, law enforcement and/or military is highly desired. Experience in scheduling, operations or other functions of the security industry a plus.
  • Demonstrated ability to take initiative, successfully handle and prioritize multiple competing assignments and effectively manage deadlines.
  • Energetic and focused personality with a demonstrated ability to take initiative, successfully handle and prioritize multiple competing assignments and effectively manage deadlines.
  • Must be highly proficient and fully functional in all Microsoft Office applications and able to effectively utilize all available office management technology.
  • Professional, articulate and able to use good independent judgment and discretion. Must have proven ability to maintain correspondence, discussions and materials in strictest confidence.   Must be able to work overtime as needed.
  • Current state driverâ€™s license, clean driving record (no points in prior 3 years), minimum level of insurance as required by Company policy, and ability to safely operate a vehicle required.
  • Professional, articulate and able to use good independent judgment and discretion.
  • Outstanding verbal and written communication skills required. Ability to successfully interact at all levels of the organization, including with clients, while functioning as a team player required.  

 

PHYSICAL/MENTAL REQUIREMENTS AND WORKING ENVIRONMENT:  

  • While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to use both hands, is frequently required to stand, sit, stoop, talk and hear (communicate verbally in person and via regular telephone equipment), and must be able to read computer screens, correspondence and reports in English.
  • The employee must constantly walk, stand, reach with both hands and arms, and must be able to drive a vehicle. The employee may occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.   May be required to climb stairs on an intermittent basis at client sites.  
  • The job is generally performed in an office setting; however, during site visits the employee may be subject to adverse conditions such as rain, cold or heat for short periods of time.
  • The ambient noise level is usually quiet, consisting of normal conversations, business machines (copiers, printers, etc.) and telephones, but occasionally may be above-normal for portions of the shift.
  • The employee must be able to concentrate on details, work under deadline pressures, apply sound logic and judgment, and prioritize tasks and responsibilities.
  • Must be able to focus and multi-task in a busy environment, with the ability to successfully handle stressful situations in a calm and professional manner. Includes being able to effectively manage multiple employees with diverse personalities and engage them to perform at optimum levels.
  • Must be able to clearly speak, read and write English.
Closing:

Allied Universal ®  provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider. Allied Universal delivers high-quality, tailored solutions, which allows clients to focus on their core business. For more information:  www.AUSecurity.ca.

title: Directeur General - Carrefour Laval
description:
À propos de Banana Republic


Banana Republic a été fondée avec l'envie d'explorer et de s'aventurer dans de nouveaux endroits, au-delà des limites du quotidien. Nos vêtements sont conçus pour une vie sans frontière.


Nous voyageons partout dans le monde pour trouver les matières les plus raffinées et les tissus les plus novateurs afin de créer un style qui a du caractère, parce que nous croyons que vos tenues devraient ouvrir une foule de possibilités. Et les gens qui composent l'équipe de Banana Republic partagent les mêmes qualités que notre marque : ils sont curieux et connectés, et n'ont pas peur de repousser les limites. Vous vous reconnaissez dans cette description? Joignez-vous à nous pour poursuivre l'aventure.


About the Role


In this role, you will set the tone for the store team and help bring our brand to life for our customers and employees. Your leadership role is critical in supporting the execution of the store strategy to achieve performance goals and drive profitable sales growth through all aspects of the store, including; customer and product operations, merchandising, and talent development. Through collaboration with your leadership team, your goal is to teach others and coach behaviors to cultivate a high performing team that meets or exceeds goals.


What You'll Do


+ Recruit, hire and develop people to drive a culture of high performance and engagement

+ Accountable for team performance through teaching, coaching and providing meaningful feedback to build capabilities

+ Support strategies and processes using a customer centric mindset to deliver results, drive store sales, and maximize efficiencies and productivity

+ Represent the brand and understand the competition and retail landscape

+ Promote community involvement

+ Adapt team priorities to respond to customer and business partner needs

+ Provide front line supervision to an operational, service or administrative team


Who You Are


+ Provides clear and direct communication of expectations and gives feedback while listening to learn in order to unlock personal and business results

+ Ability to lead and inspire others to learn and grow through coaching and mentoring

+ Proven ability to organize and utilize time management and prioritization skills to effectively manage multiple tasks in an environment with competing demands

+ Strength in driving metrics to deliver results that will meet or exceed business goals

+ Able to travel as required


Avantages offerts chez Banana Republic


+ Rabais sur la marchandise de nos marques : 50 % de rabais sur la marchandise à prix courant de Gap, Banana Republic, Old Navy et Athleta, 30 % de rabais dans nos entrepôts et 10 % de rabais sur les articles en solde de Gap, Banana Republic et dans nos magasins Entrepôt.

+ Programmes de congés payés compétitifs.*

+ La société double vos dons et votre temps de bénévolat*

+ Régime d’épargne-retraite enregistré

+ Programme d’actionnariat des employés.*

+ Assurances médicales, dentaires et vie.*

+ Soins de santé virtuels 24/7*

+ Complément aux congés de maternité et parental.*


_*Réservés aux employés admissibles._


La société Gap Inc. est un employeur qui souscrit au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi et est déterminée à fournir un lieu de travail sans harcèlement ni discrimination. Nous nous engageons à recruter, embaucher, former et promouvoir des personnes qualifiées de tous les milieux, et à prendre toutes les décisions relatives aux emplois sans égard aux statuts protégés. Nous avons reçu de nombreux prix pour notre engagement de longue date en faveur de l’égalité, et continuerons à promouvoir un milieu de travail inclusif et diversifié favorisant le développement du sentiment d’appartenance à l’entreprise. Cette année, Gap a été reconnue comme Un des meilleurs milieux de travail selon Human Rights Campaign (https://www.hrc.org/resources/best-places-to-work-for-lgbtq-equality-2022) pour la septième année consécutive et nommée à l’indice d’égalité des sexes de Bloomberg pour la quatrième année d’affilée.

title: Floor Manager
description:
Company Description

Are you a leader looking for a new challenge? Do you want to work for a brand that will invest in you and your career? Could you make the difference to a customer’s day?

If you answered yes - we would love to hear from you...

Here at COS we are recruiting a Floor Manager to join our amazing team in Robston Street - Vancouver, BC.

About COS...

COS is a fashion brand for women and men who want timeless, modern, functional and considered design. Offering reinvented classics and wardrobe essentials, we create pieces that are made to last beyond the season. Since launching in 2007 we have opened stores in over 40 countries worldwide, all in carefully considered locations, applying a design concept that preserves the buildings’ original features whilst creating a modern, contemporary space.

Job Description

Although every day will be different, some of the things that you will do regularly include:

About the role...

  • Offering customers a high level of service; starting conversations with them and helping them create outfits
  • Analyzing selling information and working with the store manager, maximize the sales performance of your department
  • Leading a team of sales assistants to achieve excellent standards of service
  • Supporting recruitment events and ensure all new colleagues are made to feel welcome and are well-trained.
  • Assisting the store manager to identify future talents and putting together development plans to support their progression
  • Being a COS brand ambassador and providing the best experience for our customers.
  • Stepping in for the store manager in his/her absence
Qualifications

About you...

To work as a Floor Manager you should have previous management/leadership experience plus the qualities below.

  • Approx. 1 year working as a manager within a retail environment.
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to lead, train and develop a team
  • Bilingual in both English and French 
  • Customer focused
  • Self-motivated & Positive
  • Adaptable
  • A genuine interest in others
  • Excellent planning and organizational skills
  • Good analytical and problem-solving abilities
  • Excellent commercial abilities and interest in fashion, retail
  • Ability to work a flexible schedule including early mornings, weekends and evenings when required


Additional Information

Why choose COS?

When you first join COS we will give you a full introduction, excellent training, and a mentor that will support you during your first days, weeks and months. In addition to this you will also receive lots of fantastic benefits including;

  • 25% staff discount 
  • Up to $1040 per year clothing allowance 
  • Start with up to 3 weeks vacation 
  • Company wellness pay 
  • Medical/Dental insurance benefits* 
  • Short term and long term disability benefits 
  • RRSP contribution plan 
  • Life Insurance 
  • Parental Leave of Absence 
  • Parental Leave Pay 

 

Our culture...

Over the last 10 years we have carefully built a culture where our people are supported, inspired and encouraged to be the best they can. Our brand is creative, forward thinking and modern; choosing longevity over passing trends.

We set the bar high at COS; we are committed to recruiting great people, offering an environment where talent is recognised and valued. We believe that a diverse workforce plays an important role in the success of COS. We celebrate individual differences and appreciate the contribution that all our colleagues make.

title: Service Manager
description:
Attention: Service Managers

 

Are You A Service Management Expert Who Wants to Work for a Thriving Company Where You Can Grow, 

Be Recognized, and Be Rewarded For Your Work?

 

WHO WE ARE

We can be your opportunity to grow a great career in the Residential Plumbing and HVAC World.  if you enjoy responsibility and building a diverse team of technicians. Clearview Plumbing & Heating has the commitment to growing YOUR Career!

WHAT WE DO

We want your passion and dynamic attitude to help us grow our Co-Workers. Your leadership and technical skills will add to our team and importantly to you & your family’s future.

THE BIG TASK

You will Be substantially charged with growing your Co-Workers to be Team Players. You’ll build trust with your expertise and attitude about great customer service. Sometimes, you’ll care more about their future than they initially care. The 

Big Task is to shine a light on their potential, then help them achieve it! You’ll be a Teacher, Coach, Manager & Mentor!

KEY SUB TASKS

Know the Clearview Customer Service process and HOW to help your team grow. 

Be practiced! You’ll review service tickets and customer encounters. to constantly improve the outcomes for both the Service Tech and the Customer! You’ll identify the Strengths and compliment them; you’ll identify areas of improvement and take the challenge to improve us!

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

While a technical background is a huge plus, a driven person who really cares about growing successful people may work. Do you fit with our core culture? Do you have Perseverance, Enthusiasm to serve, Solution Seeking Nature, Growth-Orientation, Ownership Thinking, and do you always attempt to make the lives of others easier? 

  • You can train, coach, and manage your team under you.

  • You can help your team to improve in skill sets to create greater efficiency and work performance.

  • Must follow the outline of company policies and procedures.

  • Communicate professionally and respectfully with customers, office staff, and coworkers.

  • Be able to work in a fast-paced environment and juggle multiple priorities.

  • Must have strong customer service skills.

  • Be able to remain calm while resolving customer complaints.

  • Must have a working knowledge of general industry standards.

  • Must have strong supervisory and computer skills.

  • Must have a good driving record and ability to pass a drug test.

  • Typical work week is 8-10 hour workdays, Monday–Friday, with some weekend shifts.

 

WHAT WE OFFER

We have amazing training experiences ;We have a  boatload of great benefit, great base pay, outstanding bonus opportunities. 

LEARN MORE ABOUT US


 

Join a winning company. Only motivated people should apply

 



To get started, click the “Apply” button now and send us your resume.

title: Service Manager (Access Control, Intrusion Detection, CCTV)
description:
*Please submit all application documents in PDF format*

We know the importance of stability during these unprecedented times and as an essential service, we've been steadily growing our employee numbers since March 2020. With many large projects on the horizon, it's an exciting time to join our team and become part of our stable, growing organization and industry.

About Houle:

At Houle, we are passionate about building resilient communities. From airports, shipping terminals, and water treatment facilities, to hospitals, universities, and shopping centres, we deliver integrated electrical solutions for our industrial, commercial, institutional and residential customers.

While we are leaders in electrical construction, we also specialize in a wide range of in-house technology solutions, including audio visual, building automation, healthcare systems, network systems, and security and life-safety. As a certified Great Place to Work, and one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, we take pride in our talented people and collaborative culture that bring our client's vision to life.

About the position:

Currently, we are looking for a driven and dedicated Service Manager for our Security team, based in Burnaby. This role requires in depth knowledge of technologies such as Access Control, Intrusion Detection, and CCTV.

Reporting to the Director, Technology, the Service Manager is responsible for managing customers, staff, financials, and core processes for the efficient and effective delivery of Security service (access control, CCTV, and intrusion detection) across the Lower Mainland.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Develop and lead the Security service team in the lower mainland
  • Lead a team of coordinators, dispatch, and field staff
  • Coach on preventative maintenance requirements and best practices
  • Create and manage SLA agreements with customers
  • Meet with key accounts and manage customer escalations and/or complaints
  • Participate on the leadership team
  • Manage the transition of Security projects to the Security service team
  • Manage team financials including annual budgets and quarterly forecasts
  • Maintain a strong GP% within work orders
  • Maintain a strong utilization rate
  • Schedule resources and ensure all safety protocols are being followed
  • Work closely with Field Management and other leaders
  • Assist with directing other technical experts as needed
  • Liaison with local technical colleges and universities on program development and Co-op programs
  • Manage, coach, and conduct performance management reviews of staff, including mentoring junior designers
  • Support Sales in the development and review of estimates and proposals

Experience and Skills:

  • Management and leadership experience
  • Experience in and knowledge of the security technology industry (Access Control, Intrusion Detection, CCTV) industry
  • Experience in a customer service leadership role
  • Superior interpersonal, communication and leadership skills
  • Electrical/electronic experience in designing systems
  • Working knowledge of Lenel, Genetec or Avigilon
  • Security qualifications preferred
  • Financial management and budgeting experience an asset
  • Sound understanding of industry and technology trends

Culture is important at Houle. You must be collaborative in nature. You are a solution focused team player and always willing to learn. You are a bright, ambitious, honest, and a straight forward professional. Your personable nature will fit well within the friendly working environment.

The salary for this position will be commensurate with experience. Houle offers an exciting, enjoyable work environment, competitive benefits package as well as a competitive incentive plan and many company sponsored events.

To apply, please visit https://www.houle.ca/current-career-opportunities/ and click on the listing for "Service Manager (Access Control, Intrusion Detection, CCTV)". Opportunity will remain open until filled.

*Please submit all application documents in PDF format*

title: Service manager
description:
Focused in Quebec for almost 25 years, our client is a family business specializing in the distribution of digital control equipment (CNC).


what our client offers you:

  • a stimulating career in a dynamic and human company;
  • a friendly and stimulating atmosphere;
  • equipment to The cutting edge of technology;
  • medical insurance and travel;
  • possibility of contributing to RRSP and resorting to a bonus system;
  • holidays paid by the employer;
  • Performance bonus.

Job Description

falling under the Executive Director , the holder of the position, in collaboration with his team, will see the planning, organization and management of the operational activities of the Technical Department.

In the first moments of his entry into service, the director will have The role of analyzing, learning and understanding each person's work at the internal of its department.

Key responsibilities:

  • Plan, organize, direct, prioritize and optimize the activities of its sector in order to reach the autonomy and profitability of the department;
  • ensure the management, development and mobilization of its team;
  • Develop new tools and see the continuous improvement of the procedures;
  • participate in the decision of the objectives of the company;
  • check , approve and route labor billing to customers;
  • Prepare and route to customers training quotes, preventive maintenance offers and laser calibration service offers.

Profile Wanted

To mobilize, develop and grow his team, the candidate will have to show a strong leadership, possess excellent skills communication and interpersonal relationships, in addition to being a player team with a good openness.

The nature of his work also requires good management of stress, an ease to make decisions and to solve problems by keeping a balance between the damage Results, employee mobilization and technical skills. With a customer service attitude, the candidate will also have to show professionalism, rigor and a sense of high organization.

Qualifications:

  • training in a related field;
  • Experience of at least 5 years in personnel management;
  • bilingualism (French and English).

The masculine genre has been used for the sole purpose of lightening the text. All applications received will be treated confidentially. Only the selected applications will be contacted.

title: Service Manager
description:
At Modern People Solutions, our Owner, Wilson takes a personable approach to understand candidates and clients. We believe in an efficient and personable recruitment process, for candidates and clients. Our interviews are conversations to understand your goals as a candidate, your experience and to connect you with employers, where both of you can be successful together. Wilson has worked for smaller businesses, to start ups and billion dollar equipment companies. Check out our website for more details: www.modernpeoplesolutions.com.

Our client has an great opportunity for an exceptional Service Manager in Dewberry, Alberta! Previous experience would be great, but our client will also consider someone with a technical background, great coaching skills, client satisfaction oriented, eager to learn and take on additional responsibilities.

What makes the role exciting and what does it involve?

  • Overseeing the operations of the service department for agriculture equipment
    • Leading and coaching the service team (A Service Writer, Shop Foreman and Service Technicians)
    • Motivating the team to achieve goals, financial and organizational objectives
    • Annual budgeting, in collaboration with the Branch Manager
    • Creating and driving marketing plans for the service department to contribute to achieving department goals 
  • Final reviews of work orders for accuracy
  • Submission of warranty claims as per OEM guidelines
  • Schedule and assigning work to Service Technicians, as appropriate  
  • Handling client concerns

What are we looking for?

  • Previous experience as a Service Manager, Operations Manager, technical leadership role or leadership role in the agriculture industry would be preferred
  • A degree or diploma in Agribusiness would be an asset, but not required
  • A technical background, certification as a Journeyperson, Agriculture Equipment Technician or Heavy Equipment Technician, understanding of agriculture equipment or experience working/growing up on a farm
  • An understanding of service department metrics and financials would be helpful, but it's something we can teach too
  • Great coaching skills and able to effectively motivate a team to achieve department goals
  • Client satisfaction focused, while also balancing the interests of the company

Why work for our client?

  • A competitive base salary, with a quarterly incentive program
  • A competitive benefits package
  • An RRSP matching program
  • A great company culture, you'll get to work with a lot of amazing people!
  • Tenure bonuses

title: Directeur général
description:
Notre client, chef de file au Québec spécialisé en distribution d’outillages de coupe, recherche une personne hautement qualifiée, pour occuper à son siège social sur la Rive-Sud de Montréal le poste de :

Directeur général

Poste permanent, temps plein

Rattaché au conseil d’administration et en complicité avec les membres du conseil, vous et votre équipe serez appelé à optimiser la performance de l’entreprise à court et moyen terme tout en gardant à l’esprit les orientations recherchées à long terme. Excellent visionnaire et bon stratège vous participerez à la démarche stratégique pour ensuite en assurer le déploiement et l’exécution. À titre de Directeur général, vous participerez avec votre équipe à la gestion opérationnelle de l’entreprise et à son développement des affaires. 

Mission principale

  • Développer des relations saines et à long terme avec tous les partenaires d’affaires
  • Faire preuve de leadership de cœur et démonter une grande habileté en gestion et en mobilisation d’équipe
  • Mettre en pratique une forte expérience commerciale supportée par une grande maîtrise des techniques de communication 
  • Gérer l’équipe de ventes 
  • Supporter par vos connaissances toutes démarches de transformation numérique et de développement des affaires 
  • Déterminer les objectifs court, moyen et long terme et en assurer la réalisation 
  • Investir dans des technologies pour assurer une transformation numérique lesquelles permettront d’optimiser la productivité de l’ensemble des collègues 
  • Entretenir des relations étroites avec les actionnaires, les informer sur le développement des affaires envisagé, sur l’avenir de l’entreprise et veiller à leur pleine satisfaction 
  • Assurer une veille sur les nouvelles tendances des secteurs d’activités et repérer des segments d’activités et de marchés sur lesquels il serait important d’investir et de développer 
  • Favoriser une culture d’entreprise et mobiliser tous les collègues autour d’un projet commun 
  • Incarner les valeurs de l’entreprise et de ses actionnaires.

Compétences recherchées

  • Formation universitaire pertinente (maîtrise en administration des affaires serait un atout) 
  • Expérience professionnelle minimum de 15 ans 
  • Leadership inspirant et sens aigu du marketing 
  • Qualité de visionnaire 
  • Excellente maîtrise de français et de l’anglais parlé et écrit.

Vous rêvez d’un environnement de travail où vous aurez l’occasion, de développer et de faire grandir une entreprise prospère, en collaboration avec des personnes passionnées et dévouées. Vous êtes en quête d’un nouveau défi à la hauteur de vos aspirations!

Cette position s’accompagne d’une excellente structure de rémunération (salaire de base & bonifications) complétée par un programme complet et compétitif d’avantages sociaux.

Veuillez transmettre votre curriculum vitae, en toute confidentialité, à l’attention de Jean-François Giroux:

T 418 704-7125 

La forme masculine utilisée dans ce texte est générique et s’applique aux hommes comme aux femmes.

Vous êtes en quête d’un nouveau défi à la hauteur de vos aspirations!']

title: Service Manager
description:
Agriculture Service Manager

Job Description:

The Service Manager position at Robertson Implements offers a dynamic environment of which you will be a key in meeting the service levels our customers have come to expect from us. A normal day will have you in contact with customers discussing a variety of repairs, managing the day-to-day operations of the service shop, and managing work order flow through the shop to keep all techs at maximum efficiency. It requires an ability work independently and work as part of our store team.


Qualifications:

  • 3+ years of Ag equipment service experience
  • In-depth knowledge of a variety of agriculture equipment
  • Ability to multitask and handle the timeliness of customer needs
  • Experience in successfully managing a team
  • Proven work ethic and superior communication skills
  • Preference will be given to candidates possessing a journeyperson certificate

Robertson Implements is an employer of choice in our community. We offer a competitive compensation package including company supported health and dental plan, a pension plan, and a work environment that encourages teamwork with opportunities to develop and grow. Robertson Implements is part of the Robertson family Group and committed to employee development, customer service and to the communities we serve. For more information, or to apply now, please go to our website: https://robertsonfamilygroup.prevueaps.com/jobs/

title: Service Manager
description:
Service Manager

Sansom Equipment Limited

Fredericton, NB

 

Sansom Equipment Limited is the leading distributor and service provider for pumps, generators, blowers, valves, VFDs and packaged engineered system for industrial and municipal applications across Eastern Canada.

We are currently looking for a personable, detail-oriented Service Manager to join our growing organization in the Fredericton, New Brunswick branch office. In this position, you will provide excellent customer service experiences and maintain strong relations with customers, manufacturers, dealers, sales representatives, and service team members. As such, you must be a positive, energetic leader who excels in working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.

Responsibilities

  • To oversee all services and workspaces in and out of the shop
  • Delegate and direct service tasks
  • Plan and monitor service progress for all current and pending projects
  • Consistently deliver excellence in customer service with your superior knowledge, advice, and trouble shooting skills
  • Act as the highest source of information for all service, inventory, product-knowledge concerns, and work process matters for both internal and external customers
  • Focus on maintaining strong partner relations with key manufacturers and dealers
  • Prioritize health and safety standards and a clean work environment
  • Focus on growing service and aftermarket products by establishing an effective sales program
  • Monitor employee work and provide regular progress reports to improve employee satisfaction and efficiency
  • Follow and abide by all industry standards, regulations, and laws
  • Stay up to date on industry standards and any new innovations, materials, tools and/or processes that can benefit the company

Qualifications

  • A dynamic leader with a proven track record in service management
  • Strong computer proficiency with an ERP system, Microsoft products and inventory catalogs
  • Professional oral and written communication skills
  • Works well under pressure and manages stressful situations with ease
  • Organized, efficient, and results-driven
  • Previous experience with rotating equipment (pumps, generators, blowers, etc.) is desired
  • Technical diploma would be considered as asset

Work with Us

We are looking for someone with the right fit and energy to take on this challenging opportunity to work with and learn from knowledgeable and experienced individuals in a growing company with over fifty years of history. This position holds great opportunity for growth within our organization. Sansom Equipment Limited offers medical and dental benefits, employer matched RRSP, group insurance, and a competitive compensation package.

Sansom Equipment Limited values diversity and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to the principles and practices of employment equity and encourage all qualified individuals to apply.

 

 

Powered by JazzHR

title: Service Manager
description:
Our culture believes in POWERING YOUR POTENTIAL. We provide global opportunities to develop your career, make your community a better place and work with today’s most innovative thinkers to solve the world’s toughest problems.

We believe in flexibility for you to explore your passions while making an impact through meaningful work within our inclusive workforce. That’s what #LifeAtCummins is all about.

We are looking for a talented Service Manager to join our team specializing in Sales and Service for our Distribution Segment in Mississauga, ON.  

In this role, you will make an impact in the following ways: 

  • Manages in shop service operations, department personnel, and the departmental budget. 
  • Manages all operations including service staff and supervisors; resolves most complex business problems for those on the team. 
  • Provides employees with timely and constructive performance feedback; develops employees and provides opportunities that enhance employee career growth. 
  • Leads continuous improvement activities by reviewing, changing, and improving processes in line with changing customer expectations/organizational goals. 
  • Regularly reviews key performance indicators for service operations and addresses issues. Identifies trends and initiates improvements necessary to achieve goals while ensuring customer needs are met without interruption to service levels. 
  • Ensures the volume of work produced meets company standards and ensures customer satisfaction. Measures, reviews, and maintains superior customer satisfaction levels. 
  • Establishes positive and professional working relationships with key customers. 

To be successful in this role you will need the following: 

  • College, University or equivalent degree in relevant discipline is preferred. 
  • Minimum 3 years of relevant experience, including supervisory experience, required.  

At Cummins, we are committed to the principles of diversity and employment equity under the Employment Equity Act, and we strive to ensure that our workforce reflects the diverse nature of Canadian society

Our policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified persons without regard to race, gender, color, disability, national origin, age, religion, union affiliation, sexual orientation, veteran status, citizenship, gender identity and/or expression, or other status protected by law.

The successful candidate will go through pre-employment background check process consists of a Criminal Background Check which includes a criminal background check as well as an education and work experience check. Specific Tickets / Licenses are checked as required, and Drivers Abstracts are required for any position where driving is part of the job.

title: Service Manager
description:
Service Manager (Calgary)

Founded in 1991, the Mircom Group of Companies is North America’s largest independent designer, manufacturer and distributor of intelligent building and life safety solutions. Reaching customers in over 100 countries worldwide, our portfolio includes: fire detection alarm, communications security, mass notification, nurse call, and building automation smart technologies.

Mircom’s mission is to save lives and protect property by providing a line-up of innovative and advanced solutions which are scalable to satisfy diverse user demands, from small buildings to the largest complexes. Our unwavering commitment to North American manufacturing enables us to offer the highest quality and best competitive value across our vast range of products and solutions.

Summary:

The successful candidate will oversee Mircom’s service operations for the Calgary location.  The Service Manager will organize and manage all service activities and performance of the Montreal service team. 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Establish and manage technician installation schedules to ensure optimum work load efficiencies and timely equipment deliveries.
  • Mentor, train and develop skills with Technicians
  • Coordinate installation activities with General Contractors, Engineers and building officials to ensure all documentation and approvals are delivered.
  • Identify project changes leading to equipment and labor cost overruns.
  • Create an environment which achieves ultimate customer service, while meeting or exceeding branch targets.
  • Monitor direct labor hours, project costs, and work schedules.
  • Coordinate and assist with expediting material requests, replenishing truck stocks and requesting other necessary supplies for technicians.
  • Ensure vehicles are clean and in safe operating condition by conducting regular inspection.
  • Ensure all safety guidelines are followed and that the company is in compliance with all regulatory rules and regulations.

Requirements and Skills:

  • 3-5 years of experience in the Fire and Life Safety industry.
  • Proven manager/supervisor experience in the Fire Alarm industry
  • Canadian Fire Alarm Association (CFAA) certification or ASTTBC (Applied Science Technologists and Technicians of BC) certification in fire alarm
  • University, College, or Technical Post-Secondary education.
  • Proficiency to review drawings, conduct field surveys, prepare all required information to perform complete installation activities.
  • Strong computer skills and competency in Microsoft Office applications
  • Ability to work flexible hours including weekends to meet customer/technician requirements
  • Strong organizational skills, a positive attitude and the ability to learn quickly.
  • Possess a valid driver’s license and a clean driver's abstract
  • Strong verbal and written communications in the English language

What Mircom Offers:

  • A great working environment with opportunity for career advancement
  • Competitive salary
  • Group Insurance benefits
  • Company RRSP program

All candidates are asked to submit their resume to Human Resources.

We would like to thank all applicants for their interest in this position however only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Disclaimer: Mircom does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved in advance by Mircom to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited

title: Service Manager
description:
Service Manager (Calgary)

Founded in 1991, the Mircom Group of Companies is North America’s largest independent designer, manufacturer and distributor of intelligent building and life safety solutions. Reaching customers in over 100 countries worldwide, our portfolio includes: fire detection & alarm, communications & security, mass notification, nurse call, and building automation & smart technologies.

Mircom’s mission is to save lives and protect property by providing a line-up of innovative and advanced solutions which are scalable to satisfy diverse user demands, from small buildings to the largest complexes. Our unwavering commitment to North American manufacturing enables us to offer the highest quality and best competitive value across our vast range of products and solutions.

title: Service manager
description:
Service managerTake your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB Robotics & Discrete Automation is a pioneer in robotics, machine automation and digital services, providing innovative solutions for a diverse range of industries, from automotive to electronics to logistics. As one of the world's leading robotics and machine automation suppliers, we have shipped over 500,000 robot solutions. We help our customers of all sizes to increase productivity, flexibility and simplicity and to improve output quality. We support their transition towards the connected and collaborative factory of the future. ABB Robotics & Discrete Automation employs more than 11,000 people at over 100 locations in more than 53 countries. www.abb.com/roboticsThe Service Manager is part of the local management team, heading up the Service organization for ABB Robotics in Canada. The role involves running the day-to-day Service business to ensure profitable growth and productivity improvement through implementing delivery and performance standards and ensuring consistent quality and customer satisfaction.Reporting to the Head of Robotics, Canada, you will implement the global Service strategy and drive Service growth locally, achieving targets, optimizing use of resources, and ensuring that plans are implemented consistently through collaboration with other businesses/hubs.
This position reports to
Local Division Manager, Robotics
Your responsibilities

  • Working to improve product quality while suggesting developments in new Service products to expand the portfolio
  • Creating a culture where health, safety and integrity are key
  • Executing the strategy within the local unit, productizing Service offerings and materials, and driving Service sales
  • Building sustainable customer relationships and utilizing feedback to drive consistent development of processes and practices
  • Guiding, motivating, coaching, and developing the skills, knowledge, and competencies of the Service team
  • Working with HR Management to ensure that the Service team is properly organized, staffed, skilled and directed

Your background
  • Bachelor's degree
  • At least 10 years of project management experience (real world achievements) with international experience
  • PMP certification an asset
  • Bilingualism in English and French essential
  • Ability to manage multiple projects with converging delivery dates in a fast-paced environment
  • Collaborative, solution-oriented attitude, and strong communication skills both verbal and written
  • Strong analytical, problem solving and decision-making skills
  • Business acumen, good understanding of customer needs and ability to maintain good customer relations

Benefits
  • Retirement plan
  • Medical insurance
  • Wellbeing program
More about us
Named to Forbes 2020 list of top 15 employers in Canada, ABB values the dedication, commitment and expertise of our employees. ABB is an Employment Equity Employer and believes in an inclusive and diverse workforce. Committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.#LI-Hybrid

title: Directeur général
description:
SKYSERVICE AVIATION D’AFFAIRES                                 

Skyservice est un chef de file nord-américain de l'aviation d'affaires. Établissur les principes clés de sécurité et de l'excellence du service, nous offrons une expérience de service complète, allant de la gestion au nolisement d’avions, en passant par la maintenance et la vente d'avions à partir de nos terminaux de services aéronautiques qui s’étendent du Canada à l'ouest des États-Unis. Les gens et les valeurs sont des atouts inséparables qui animent notre engagement en matièrede qualité, de sécurité, de respect et d'efficacité. Ces valeurs fondamentales nous guident quotidiennement et contribuent à construire notre réputation de chefs de file dans les services de l’aviation. Skyservice est une équipe dévouée au soutien et au perfectionnement de ses employés. Si vous souhaitez optimiser votre carrière, élargir vos horizons et votre expérience, Skyservice est l'équipe idéale pour vous.

RAISON D’ÊTRE :

Relevant du directeur, Exploitation des terminaux d’affaires, le poste de directeur général est un poste de direction vital de supervision des installations des terminaux de services aéronautiques de YYZ. Le directeur général doit s’assurer que toutes les tâches, méthodes et procédures sont toujours exécutées de façon sécuritaire, en conformité avec les exigences réglementaires et les pratiques exemplaires de l’industrie. De plus, il veille à la conformité aux procédures normalisées et aux normes d’entreprise. Sa sphère d’influence inclura les installations de YYZ et d’autres installations afin de soutenir la croissance et l’expansion de Skyservice.

 SOMMAIRE DES RESPONSABILITÉS :

  •  Dirige le développement, la communication et met en œuvre de procédures et politiques opérationnelles efficientes et de stratégies de croissance efficaces;
  • Assure la gestion efficace du personnel, notamment en proposant des initiatives de gestion du rendement et des effectifs, et d’autres initiatives de RH;
  • Fournit des renseignements pour l’élaboration des descriptions de poste, interviewe les candidats pour pourvoir les postes vacants, intègre les nouveaux employés et établit les horaires et calendriers (supervision de la saisie des heures, demandes de vacances, etc.);
  • Motive le service pour atteindre les objectifs de vente, de rentabilité, les objectifs opérationnels en aidant à générer des ventes et à attirer de nouveaux clients d’avions à Skyservice;
  • Supervise les activités sur la piste et les aires de trafic adjacentes, en collaboration avec les autorités aéroportuaires et les locataires voisins;
  • Favorise un environnement et une culture de sécurité au travail, en assurant l’application efficace de tous les programmes et normes de sécurité;
  • Supervise et gère les enquêtes sur les rapports d’incidents (c’est-à-dire avise les autorités compétentes et gère la clôture des dossiers d’incident) pour les services en escale et le service à la clientèle;
  • Planifie, organise et dirige les activités opérationnelles de terminal d’affaires et est imputable pour l’obtention des résultats financiers;
  • Participe à la préparation des budgets et prévisions financières des terminaux d’affaires de YYZ pour les services en escale et le service à la clientèle, y compris les dépenses d’immobilisations;
  • Fait la promotion d’un environnement de travail positif et harmonieux pour fournir la plus haute qualité de service à la clientèle, tant à l’interne qu’à l’externe.

FORMATION ET COMPÉTENCES :

  • Études postsecondaires ou expérience équivalente; diplôme en aviation ou en gestion des affaires, considéré comme un atout.
  • De 5 à 10 années d’expérience dans un terminal de services aéronautiques à l’aéroport, avec connaissance approfondie du milieu de l’aviation, des concessionnaires de services aéronautiques (FBO) ou des services commerciaux au sol;
  • Excellente feuille de route en matière d’acquisition de nouvelle clientèle, d’obtention de résultats financiers et d’améliorations de rendement;
  • Laisser-passer de zone réglementée et attestation de sécurité de Transports Canada;
  • Souci constant de la sécurité, expérience du SGS et des procédures de gestion de la sécurité
  • Aptitude de premier ordre au service à la clientèle, entregent, aptitudes à la gestion de personnel, au leadership, à la résolution de conflits et à la répartition des ressources;
  • Souplesse à faire des heures supplémentaires et à travailler sur appel, au besoin.

Skyservice est l’équipe idéale pour vous. Skyservice est un employeur qui souscrit à l’équité en matière d’emploi et qui accepte la candidature de toute personne intéressée. Si, pour une raison quelconque, vous ne pouvez soumettre votre candidature par notre site d’emploi, communiquez avec un membre de notre équipe des Ressources humaines pour prendre des dispositions spécii

title: Service Manager
description:
Responsibilities:

  • Plans and coordinates department activities to meet sales and profitability goals set by the manager
  • Purchases and orders departmental supplies.
  • Ensures that the prices from the head office, the circular and the optical cash register are in agreement.
  • Takes inventory of empty bottles, cigarettes and the lottery.
  • Authorizes refunds due to punching errors, merchandise returns, etc.
  • Carries out the balancing of the cash registers, the store, the safe and the lottery.
  • Responsible for collecting deposits from cashiers and recording data.
  • Completes employee work schedules.
  • Ensures departmental loans are available for business.
  • Ensures compliance with company policies (reception, security, etc.) and occupational health and safety standards.
  • See to the hiring, reception, training and evaluation of employees.
  • Other related tasks

title: Assistant Restaurant Manager Toronto Pearson Airport
description:
• $45K - $48K / year + Quarterly Bonus Potential + an extra $100 for each week worked until 8/30/22**
  • Full-Time
  • Hiring Immediately
  • Full Benefit Package
  • Free Meals while working
  • Free Parking 

**Be rewarded for every hour you work this summer! SSP Canada is offering a new and exciting BONUS PROGRAM. Between now and the end of Summer 2022, you can earn an additional $100 / week for every week that you work (paid out quarterly)! This is your chance to land a great career while also increasing your take-home pay for the entire summer. This is in addition to all the other amazing benefits SSP Canada employees enjoy.

We are passionate about bringing cool, authentic restaurants to airports that reflect a taste of place.

SSP Canada operates several restaurants throughout Toronto Pearson International Airport located in Mississauga, ON. Our restaurants include: Tim Horton’s, Freshii’s, Boccone, Mill Street, Camden, Urban Crave, Tap & Pour, Dirty Bird, Distillery Food Hall, Built Burger, Upper Crust.
 
The Assistant Restaurant Manager has the very important job of partnering with the Restaurant General Manager on leading the restaurant team.  Our Assistant Restaurant Managers are experts at delegating tasks, delivering exceptional customer service, leading by example and developing their team.
Essential Functions
  • Recruits, trains, develops and communicates with team of Food Travel Experts Implements and maintains guest service standards and/or brand specifications.
  • Maintains all merchandising standards, display presentations and signing standards and monitors inventory levels.
  • Develops, plans and assigns daily goals, tasks and Team Member assignments.
  • Manages, supervises and evaluates Team Member performance through follow-up to ensure proper completion of assigned tasks and goals and provides feedback including disciplinary action.
  • Assists in monitoring sales performance through the analysis of sales reports and comparison shopping.
  • Maintains adherence to all company policies and procedures, as well as provincial health/sanitation standards.
  • Manages all office tasks, including management of funds, receiving, inventory, purchasing, team member scheduling and payroll.
  • Minimum of two (2) years of experience in the food & beverage industry, in a management/supervisory capacity
  • Full Service and/or Quick Service restaurant experience preferred
  • Proven ability to effectively manage conflict and ensure successful outcomes; work under pressure and deal with high stress situations while exercising sound judgment and decision making
  • Excellent written and verbal communication
  • Effective organizational maturity to prioritize daily, weekly, monthly and yearly activities

Ontario Applicants:  SSP Canada is an equal opportunity employer and complies with the requirements of the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities, 2005 in our recruitment and employment practices. If you require accommodation at any stage of the recruitment process, including the interview and assessment stage, due to a disability, please inform us of your need and the nature of the accommodation(s) that may be required.  

At SSP Canada we believe if we take care of our employees, our employees will take care of our passengers. That’s why we offer competitive benefits, and our first source for filling management positions is our internal team.

  • Health & Prescription, Dental, Vision, and Life Plans
  • Paid Public Holidays & Vacation
  • RSP (Retirement Savings Plan)
  • Awards and Recognition
  • Free Parking

EOE/D/V/M/F

title: Restaurant Manager, Guest Experience -Swiss Chalet
description:
Overview:

Swiss Chalet is looking for a Restaurant Manager for our North Bay location!

 

At Swiss Chalet we deliver delicious â€œhome-madeâ€ food, made fresh in-house just for you. Our atmosphere is warm, welcoming and feels like home.

 

At Swiss Chalet, we work as a team and help each other succeed. Our Managers are hands-on and our team works together to deliver the Perfect Guest Experience to our guests each and every time. We genuinely care about each Guest and every Associate.

 

We are looking for individuals that are passionate about Food, Hospitality, and are Guest focused as well as being a strong and motivating team player.  

 

Responsibilities:

  • Oversee the day-to-day management of the dining room as directed by the Franchise Owner and General Manager
  • Possess the potential to effectively run the front of house and lead all shifts to meet Brand standards as well as financial goals
  • Ensure the store is operating to all standards of a "Benchmark Restaurant", and creating a Perfect Guest Experience every time
  • Continue to develop associates

 

Core Duties:

  • Oversee and ensure the Perfect Guest Experience
  • Development Associates
  • Support and implement Standards and Controls
  • The successful candidate is expected to be a leader in demonstrating behaviours consistent with Recipe's Principles.

 

Qualifications:

  • Previous Front of House Management experience
  • Must possess the "Hospitality Gene" (Ability to Create Connections, have a Passion for People and Service Excellence)
  • Driven and focused
  • Inspirational/Motivational
  • Must be available to work days, evenings, weekends and holidays in a busy fast paced environment.  Including opening, midday and closing shifts.

 

PERKS! Why should you work for us?

  • 20% employee discount dining card valid at all Recipe brands
  • Flexible scheduling
  • Competitive wages
  • Growth and advancement opportunities within the restaurant
  • Career advancement opportunities in a company that has more than 1,400 restaurants across Canada

 

If you are interested in joining us please send apply online today!

 

 

Recipe is committed to providing a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace. Celebrating people, being passionate and curious, owning it, and doing the right thing are the values that guide how we build our teams, support our franchisees and create a company that unlocks the full potential of everyone.  


Recipe is dedicated to providing accommodations in accordance with applicable human rights and accommodation legislation. For individuals that require accommodations please contact

recruit@recipeunlimited.com

.

 

 

Some positions may be with our Franchise Partners, which are independently owned and operated.
