title: Director of Service (Contract, Full Time)
description:
Director of Service

Are you looking for an inviting and exciting career opportunity? Do you want to positively contribute to an organization that serves the community? If the answer is “Yes!" this is the job for you!

Catholic Social Services is currently recruiting for a contract, full time, forty (40) hours per week, Director of Service to join our Immigration & Settlement Service in Edmonton, AB.

This position is a one (1) year contract (benefits eligible).  Contract ending August 2023. 

You will be joining an established Agency that is guided by faith to care for and bring hope to people in need with humility, compassion and respect. With more than 60  years of service delivery, Catholic Social Services is one of the largest multi-function social services agencies in Canada, with more than 1800 staff, and hundreds of volunteers delivering 100+ programs throughout Edmonton and Central Alberta.

Job Summary:

Reporting to the Vice President of Service, the Director plans, organizes, and directs the activities of the various departments. This position is part of the Service senior leadership team that carries out the overall strategy to develop, implement, monitor and evaluate programs. The Director will promote traditional and non-traditional partnership approaches implementing initiatives designed to integrate services and utilize funding to maximize resources and service impact within the community. The Director ensures delivery of quality of services and compliance with regulatory and funding requirements. This includes planning and development of programs and procedures in accordance with the Agency mission. The Director will manage budgets, quality assurance and will play a large role in the ongoing support and development of the staff.

Job Duties

  • Proactively build and maintain strategic collaborations and coalitions of stakeholders beneficial to the Agency based on a strategic understanding of the Agency’s mandate and challenges.
  • Take a long-term view of the needs of the Agency when focusing on potential alignments.
  • Identify interdependencies, define priorities and drive resolution of issues across groups, as appropriate.
  • Create and participate in strategic alliances and partnerships with key stakeholders to better meet emerging and future client needs and enhance the Agency and/or sector’s long term strategy.
  • Work with funding agencies and representatives to ensure ongoing and sustainable funding for programs. Foresee obstacles, risks and opportunities for the Agency (with a long-term horizon) and act accordingly.
  • Defines issues, generates opinions and selects solutions that are consistent with the strategy and vision.
  • Scan, seek out and assesses information on potential future directions.
  • Oversee the general management and accountability requirements of a comprehensive group of programs, which includes program development, delivery and evaluation as well as budget preparation and setting and knowledge management.
  • Maintain awareness of the external and internal social/human service, political and economic landscapes.
  • Stays knowledgeable about current legislation and policies affecting newcomers, including refugees, immigrants, temporary foreign works and others.
  • Collaborate with other members of the Service Leadership team to promote the Agency’s mission by identifying and developing programs/services to meet current and future  needs of newcomers and communities.
  • Engage others in order to accomplish organizational goals and strategies, with a commitment to succession planning.
  • Attract, develop, coach, and retain high-performance team members, empowering them to elevate their level of responsibility, span of control and performance.
  • Delegate full authority and responsibility with the latitude to do a task in their own way in order to develop specific characteristics, including the opportunity to make and learn from mistakes in a non-critical setting.
  • Encourage others to assess their strengths and weaknesses, career goals, and strategies for achieving them.
  • Together with the Vice President, will have overall responsibility for the Service resource allocation, including staffing, financial and property.
  • Develop the necessary systems, processes, protocols and tools to better support the facilitation, collection and sharing of knowledge that is generated by the programs.
  • Ensure Service activities comply with organizational requirements for quality management, legal compliance and client services.
  • Recognize the inherent risks involved in the delivery of social service programming and able to identify, evaluate and develop strategies to mitigate risk while maintaining quality service delivery and care.
  • Keep the Vice President informed of the department’s operations, including strategies to respond to emerging and evolving  program and operation needs.
  • Participate in the recruitment and appointment of Service Program Managers.
  • Convene, conduct and ensure serious occurrences and internal investigations are completed in accordance with Agency protocols and expectations.
  • Manage high-risk, complex, sensitive and multidisciplinary issues.
  • Prepare/coordinate multiple funding proposals and applications and interim and final reports.
  • Be familiar with funding, contract and accountability obligations and requirements.
  • Have experience with the management of multiple immigrant and refugee services.
  • Contributing to a communication strategy, supporting website updates/development and social media promotion.
  • Commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion development initiatives.

Requirements

Education & Experience

  • Master degree in related human services discipline or equivalent.
  • An experienced leader with 7 years or more of progressive leadership in a social services organization, with multi-site programs and services, multiple funders, including the immigrant settlement and refugee  serving sector.
  • Experience working in a fast-paced cross-cultural and diverse environment.

Skills and Abilities:

  • The ideal candidate will have a track record of effectively leading a performance-based and outcomes based multiple program and staff. The individual will demonstrate maturity, self-awareness and insightfulness and possesses high ethical standards and an uncompromising sense of integrity.
  • Strategic thinker who is able to analyze internal and external environmental factors in order to identify current and future opportunities, challenges and risks and ensure ongoing service excellence
  • The ideal candidate will be passionate about the mission of the Catholic Social Services and understands the intricacies of the nonprofit sector, including the immigrant settlement sector.
  • Be a voice/advocate for Catholic Social Services, is a persuasive, credible and an effective communicator, including experience with public speaking and media relations
  • Be a strong negotiator, problem solver and possess excellent conflict resolution skills and have experience in solving complex issues.
  • Knowledgeable about immigration, settlement and adjustment issues affecting newcomers.

 

Please apply online at www.cssalberta.ca/careers to competition number 2745.

Closing date for Applications: May 11, 2022 

The successful candidate must be able to travel to various locations, have a valid driver’s license and possess a vehicle. They will have ability to travel, with some overnight stays, if required.

If you are a strategic leader who consistently provides high quality and effective results, please submit your application today.

We offera competitive salary, comprehensive benefits package and a supportive working environment.

Police Information Check, Intervention Record Check and/or summary of driving record are conditions of employment and the financial responsibility of the candidate.

We embrace diversity and offer equal opportunities to all qualified applicants regardless of origin, culture, ethnicity, age, ability, gender identity, sexual orientation,  and people of faith or no faith.

We thank all applicants. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Operations Supervisor
description:
The Operations Supervisors are responsible for Cando's day to day and shift by shift operations while ensuring customer commitments are met safely and on time.

Roles and Responsibilities

Safety

  • Actively participates in the execution of Cando's Safety Management Plan and Initiatives including audits and reports; observes, documents, and evaluates safe work practices as per rules and regulations
  • Facilitates employee meetings to emphasize safety and discuss safety risks; participates on customer safety and quality teams as required
  • Investigates accidents and incidents, determines root cause

Service Delivery

  • Ensures employees are providing superior service in keeping with Cando's Vision, Mission and Values
  • Supports daily and weekly operating plans and customer interaction for the team ensuring customer needs are being met
  • Performs regular audits and confirms that all preventative and scheduled maintenance and inspections are completed as required to ensure the facility and equipment remains in prime operating conditions at all times

Management and Administration

  • Assists in managing monthly budgets, service plans, personnel development plans, timekeeping and resource requirements
  • Manages the customer relationship
  • Assists in establishing and maintaining the operating team including participation in hiring, coaching, leading activities, monitoring payroll and WCB functions
  • Maintains standard operating procedures, operating the site safely and meeting all regulatory requirements

Leadership & Employee Development

  • Influences and inspires others to achieve company objectives
  • Builds and maintains positive relationships with peers, customers and other third parties
  • Leads others in adapting to innovative work environments and ensures company initiatives, decisions, and policies are communicated
  • Provides for the delivery of training and developmental requirements related to the department through employee coaching and mentoring
  • Provides direct supervision, conducts proactive proficiency observations, and daily records of operations
  • Trains team members and provides operational assistance and expertise when required

Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities

  • Communicates effectively both orally and in writing with people of all backgrounds and levels of comprehension including managers, employees, customers, and the public
  • Demonstrates initiative to work with others to foster a respectful workplace; creates a work environment that is open to maintaining positive relationships; empowers individuals and teams to set and accomplish goals
  • Understands effective cost monitoring, control, reporting, and bottom-line profitability and accountability
  • Ability to exercise discretion and good judgement in providing information to internal or external customers in a courteous and tactful manner with regard to sensitive or confidential issues
  • Ability to handle a diverse range of responsibilities in an entrepreneurial environment
  • Proficient in the use of computer equipment, operating systems, word processing, spreadsheets and database software
  • Ability to obtain and maintain all necessary certification and meet all safety and customer requirements including clear drug and alcohol testing; hold and maintain a valid provincial driver's license

Education and Experience

  • Minimum five (5) years' working in heavy industrial environment; rail experience is an asset
  • Minimum two (2) years in a leadership or supervisory position
  • Experience working with Safety Management Systems

Note: This description is not intended to limit the assignment of work or be construed as a complete list of the many duties to be performed by the incumbent. The qualifications are provided so interested candidates understand of the level of expertise required.

title: Operations Supervisor | FirstOntario Centre & FirstOntario Concert Hall
description:
Overview:

The Operations Supervisor reports to the Director of Operations and is responsible for assisting in the administration, daily planning, scheduling and payroll for the operations and building security staff at the facility including back of house services, technical services, information technology, conversions, custodial services, and equipment inventory control and performs related day to day responsibilities as required.

 

Responsibilities:
  • Assists the Director of Operations in the overall daily operation and maintenance of the facilities.    
  • Oversee the set-up of events; coordinate facility arrangements with concessionaires and vendors; direct and monitor the work of contractors, coordinate with tenants on facility arrangements and set-ups
  • Plan, coordinate, and review the work plan for event operations; meet with staff to identify and resolve problems; assign work activities, projects and programs; monitor workflow; review and evaluate work products, methods and procedures
  • Responsible for the scheduling and payroll for all Operations and Building Security staff
  • Assume management responsibility for all services and activities involved in maintenance and operations, electrical, mechanical, plumbing, ice making
  • Hire, train, motivate and evaluate staff; provide or coordinate staff training; work with employees to correct deficiencies; implement discipline and termination procedures.
  • Participate in the development and administration of the Operations budget; forecast of additional funds needed for staffing, equipment, materials, and supplies; monitor and approve expenditures; implement adjustments as necessary
  • Order supplies and materials for maintenance programs within budget guidelines; receive and maintain supplies with approval from Director of Operations  
  • Maintain hazardous materials communication program, material safety date sheets and required records and permits; maintain knowledge of changes in pertinent Federal, Provincial and Local regulations
  • Develop and maintain an accurate record keeping system
  • Perform other duties and responsibilities as required and assigned
Qualifications:
  • Minimum of two (2) years experience in event management and/or building maintenance including some supervisory responsibility
  • Bachelorâ€™s degree from accredited college/university in a related field (Event Management, Sports Management, etc.) preferred
  • Must be able to work a flexible schedule including, early mornings, evenings, weekends, holidays and extended number of consecutive days
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills in the English language
  • Strong organizational skills and time management skills
  • Proficient computer skills and experience with Microsoft Office
  • Experience working in a union environment a plus
  • Familiarity with OSHA requirements/WSIB
  • Self-motivated with excellent interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to function and make management decisions in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment

Spectra, an industry leader in sports, entertainment and venue management, is dedicated to recruiting and developing individuals with the skills, experience, desire, and values to contribute to the continued growth and success of our organization.   Together, with our 250+ sports & entertainment venue partners, we transform events into experiences! These experiences create excitement, turn heads, and make memories.   Come Join Us!    You can learn more about Spectra  at  www.spectraexperiences.com/

 

Spectra is an equal opportunity employer and our employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, handicap, marital status, or any other status or condition protected by Federal and/or State/Provincial laws, except where bona fide occupational qualifications apply.

Vaccination Statement:

We are committed to ensuring all our buildings and office locations are the safest in the world for artists, teams, employees, and fans. Based on recent encouraging trends in the U.S. and Canada. We highly encourage our employees to continue to get vaccinated and boosted against COVID-19.    Should circumstances change, we may need to reinstate vaccination requirements, in whole or in part, to safeguard the health of our employees, guests, performers, athletes, and partners.

title: Service Manager - Pickle Barrel (London)
description:
Overview:

The Pickle Barrel is looking for a Service Manager at our 387 Wellington Rd, London, ON N6C 4P9 location.

 

The Pickle Barrel began with a mission. We believed that amazing dining experiences didnâ€™t need to be elitist, so we began a restaurant that combined â€˜qualityâ€™ with â€˜incredible valueâ€™. Today we have restaurants all across the Greater Toronto Area, with a menu that offers over 200 items brought to you by over 1,000 employees- with no shortcuts. We promise to put real fresh food on the table every time!

 

We are looking for individuals that are passionate about food, hospitality, and providing their Guests with a Perfect Dining Experience to join our Pickle Barrel family!  

 

 

What you will do in this role:

  • Train and supervise staff
  • Ensure all food safety procedures are strictly adhered to according to regulations
  • Work closely with management to meet revenue objectives
  • Maintain safe working conditions for associates and Guests
  • Audit inventory levels to ensure product availability, and order products as necessary
  • Demonstrate ability to attract and retain excellent performers and develop high performing team mates
  • Promote a culture of dialogue, role model the values and practices of Recipe and possess developmental leadership skills  
  • Assist teammates whenever necessary  

 

What we are looking for:

  • 3-5 yearsâ€™ experience as a Manager in an upscale dining environment with similar sales volume
  • Post-secondary education, bonus points for hospitality and/or a business related field
  • Exceptional business acumen, including an understanding of budgets and operating costs
  • Extensive knowledge of upscale dining operations, food and beverage and long term sales growth
  • Demonstrated ability to motivate and direct others.
  • Possess an entrepreneurial spirit through having presence "on the floor" and in the community
  • Ability to work well independently and as part of a team

 

Whatâ€™s in it for you:

  • 20% employee discount dining card valid at participating Recipe brands
  • Flexible scheduling
  • Chance to be part of an energetic and dynamic team
  • Competitive wages
  • Fun working environment founded on respect  
  • Growth and development opportunities within the restaurant
  • Career advancement opportunities with a company that owns some of Canadaâ€™s most iconic restaurant brands  

 

Did you know Pickle Barrelâ€™s very own President started off as a busboy? If you are interested in this fantastic opportunity and growing your career, apply online today!

 

 

Recipe is committed to providing a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace. Celebrating people, being passionate and curious, owning it, and doing the right thing are the values that guide how we build our teams, support our franchisees and create a company that unlocks the full potential of everyone.  


Recipe is dedicated to providing accommodations in accordance with applicable human rights and accommodation legislation. For individuals that require accommodations please contact

recruit@recipeunlimited.com

title: Operations Supervisor
description:
About GWL Realty Advisors

GWLRA is a leader in both the commercial and multi-residential real estate industries. Driven by our values of Integrity, Ambition, Creativity, and Empathy, our vision is to be a sustainable company known for exceptional real estate management, trusted advice, and outstanding service by consistently fulfilling our mission to deliver strong, long-term results for our clients. 
 

We’re looking for an Operations Supervisor to oversee two of our commercial properties in Downtown Ottawa! This role is responsible for ensuring that our buildings are well presented and operated according to the highest possible standards. To be successful, vision should not only be focused on the day-to-day operations of the property but also the long-term potential of the property. This role is counted on to establish and maintain strong relationships with tenants, staff, and contractors. It also assists with the implementation of new programs and ensure policies and procedures are followed.
 

RESPONSIBILITIES
 

Operations Management

  • Manage property repair and maintenance operations, including but not limited to building mechanical, electrical and life safety systems.
  • Responsible and accountable for the staff’s daily activities, which includes the repair, maintenance and replacement of the building’s major components and related systems.
  • Oversee the operations of the building automation systems to ensure maximum energy efficiency and occupant comfort.
  • Develop, administer and follow-up on preventive maintenance programs for all equipment and the building in general (Angus Preventative Maintenance).
  • Ensure life safety and risk management programs are implemented and kept current.
  • Perform routine inspections of buildings ensuring the Property Manager is kept updated on any discrepancies and the remedy
  • Document and arrange for appropriate remedial work using the company purchasing/procurement guidelines
  • Oversee and monitor customer service levels provided and implements continuous service improvements
  • Ensures organizational adherence and accountability to standard operating procedures
  • Oversee all health and safety requirements
  • Ensure all applicable code and/or regulatory testing and inspections are done on time and documented
  • Oversee site security team and administration of the security system
 

Reporting + Budgeting

  • Review and update both technical and operations manuals including Fire Plan, Emergency Management Plan, Disaster Plan, Construction Rules and Regulations, Asbestos Management Plan, Energy Management Plan
  • Log daily and provide monthly reports on base building operations to the Property Manager in a prompt fashion.
  • Establish building service contracts specifications, prepare tenders based on the policies and procedures established, make recommendations, obtain approval, and follow up on execution and performance.
  • Oversee preparation and ongoing administration of capital project administration, documents, contracts and related functions

 

Relationship Building

  • Monitor, mentor, coach and develop direct reports, ensure adherence to policies and procedures, provide recognition; evaluate and provide feedback on performance, address performance concerns and resolve problems
  • Lead their team in providing the highest levels of service to all customers with whom they interact, whether internal or external, with the goal of continuously improving the customer experience
  • Liaise with tenants regularly to ensure complete tenant satisfaction and ensure that tenant concerns are promptly addressed.
  • Oversee tenant improvement work and obtain proposals and pricing for work

 

REQUIREMENTS

  • Must be able to attain and maintain a Secret Level clearance
  • 6+ years of commercial industry experience at multiple properties, including people leadership experience
  • Post-secondary education in Engineering, Building Sciences, BOMI Designations (SMA/SMT) and/or Trades training (BES Class 1 and 2)
  • Solid contract management and computer skills (Outlook, Excel, Word, Office 365, YARDI, ANGUS, Cority and some shared database exposure)
  • Knowledge of LEED and BOMA standards, and an environmental focus
  • Excellent people leadership abilities and a dedication to continuous improvement
  • Approachable, positive demeanor with a hands-on and team-oriented work style
  • Proven analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to quickly understand and identify issues and propose solutions
  • Takes initiative, is proactive in their work, and results-oriented
  • Ability to manage and adapt to change
  • Must be a resourceful team player, with a strong commitment to customer service and the ability to effectively balance numerous priorities. Able to adapt to shifting priorities
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to communicate proficiently in the English language (verbal and written)
  • Bilingualism (French) an asset but not a requirement

What we Offer
  • 3 Weeks of Vacation per year
  • 3 Paid Personal Days per year
  • Up to $2,000 annual Education Allowance
  • Up to $5,000 annual Mental Health Coverage, plus other comprehensive benefits and savings programs
  • Up to $400 to use towards wellness annually to help support your financial, physical, and mental wellness

Our Business
Learn more about our commercial and residential businesses, our values, and careers at GWLRA.

Our Commitment to Diversity
GWL Realty Advisors is an equal opportunity employer. It prohibits discrimination based on age, color, disability, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other legally protected class in accordance with applicable federal, provincial and local laws. We are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace. If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know.

title: Evening Shift Operations Supervisor
description:
At EVRAZ, our strength starts with our people! As a team we collaborate to solve problems, contribute ideas and challenge each other to ensure growth and ultimately success for the business and our employees.

Job Description and Responsibilities

EVRAZ North America has an opening for an Evening Shift Operations Supervisor who will be responsible for supervision of hourly employees engaged in the processing of ferrous scrap metals.

EVRAZ is committed to maintaining and promoting a safe, healthy and injury-free environment.  It is required for all jobs.

  • Train and monitor employees including lead hands, operators and labourers

  • Help to meet and exceed processing goals on a daily basis and ensure safe and efficient operation of the shredder, and mobile equipment equipment used to process yard material

  • Ensure compliance with all Environmental, Safety, Health and other Company policies, procedures and requirements

  • Assist in development and enforcement of the EVRAZ safety program

  • Monitor small repairs of equipment

  • Conduct and report daily safety observations

  • Ensure work areas are cleaned

Requirements

  • 3-5 years of leadership roles ( military, lead hand, supervisor or management experience)

  • Experience in a unionized environment is an asset

  • Mechanical or electrical tickets not need but encouraged

  • Ability to lead inside and outside workforce

  • Ability to build and retain a strong team

  • Strong planning and organizational skills

  • Knowledge of Automotive components is a definite asset

  • Capacity and desire to grow professionally

Our total compensation package includes amazing benefits!

  • Competitive wages and bonus opportunities
  • Family medical, dental, and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost
  • Short and long term disability programs
  • Competitive retirement plans
  • Paid vacations and statutory holidays
  • Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company
  • Tuition reimbursement

All applicants must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship.

While we thank all those who apply, only those being actively considered for employment will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

EVRAZ North America is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

 

EVRAZ North America is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail

careers@evrazna.com

or call: (312) 533-3577. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

Join a team that manufactures excellence, drives success and builds careers!

title: Wendy's Kitchen Supervisor
description:
Kitchen Supervisor

Wendy's - powered by REEF Kitchens. REEF’s Neighborhood Kitchens enable restaurants – from local heroes to national brands – to expand reaching thousands of new customers in the largest cities in the world. We do this by providing turnkey delivery solutions for the preparation, distribution, and expansion of food concepts.

We are looking for energetic and reliable leaders to join our existing high-performing teams. We are also recruiting for another exciting location coming soon!

Requirement/Qualification:

You are trustworthy and have trust in others. You find joy in the details and believe good quality is uncompromisable. You work well under pressure. You are a leader, attentive to detail, friendly, and reliable.

  • Work well with others to ensure quality, production, and service standards are met and to create a safe, efficient, and professional environment for all staff members to flourish
  • Flexible schedules are available - Daytime, Evening, and Overnight Closing Shifts
  • Experience in inventory control and ordering are considered an asset
  • You inspire Crew members to always be their best, you are a role model
  • Roll up your sleeves and jump in to lead your team in a high-volume, fast paced environment
  • Know how to get great results the right way through working with others to achieve your restaurant goals
  • Enthusiasm to grow & develop your management skills in a rapidly growing organization
  • Have a strong work ethic and be committed to your team

What’s in it for you?

  • Competitive wages starting from $18/hour based on experience
  • Employer-provided benefits including medical, dental and vision. Employer RRSP matching contribution for Full-Time employees
  • Paid Vacation
  • An energetic and inclusive team environment where you are valued
  • Great locations that are easily accessible by public transit
  • FREE meal at each shift!

Working Conditions:

  • Must be comfortable working up to 8-10 hours in a fun, friendly environment
  • Required to work in 28' "food truck" style Kitchen
  • Must be able to cope with frequent changing priorities and deadlines with a high degree of optimism, professionalism, and collaboration

Other titles: Manager, Chef, Cook, Kitchen Helper, Shift supervisor, Team Leader, Crew trainer, Grill Operator, Closing Food Production Team Lead, Fast Food Restaurant, Fast Food Worker, Wendy's Food Service Worker, Quick-Service Restaurant

Wendy's - powered by REEF Kitchens provided the following inclusive hiring information:

We are an equal opportunity employer and consider all qualified applicants equally without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Regional Manager
description:
About Us

Dropit is a SaaS multichannel digital platform with solutions for shopping centers, retailers, and consumers. Founded in 2016 with the launch of Handsfree Shopping in London's West End, we are present in over 500 stores across more than 350 brands throughout the US, Canada, UK, Ireland, and Belgium. For brands and shopping centers, our omnichannel fulfillment Platform and industry-first Marketplace unifies retail in-store and online.

Our vision is to enable the entire retail ecosystem to work together and meet the needs of the shared consumer in a way that's collaborative and sustainable.

About the role

Dropit is looking for a Regional Sales Manager to be responsible for onboarding stores and retailers to Dropit's suite of services. In this role, you will form connections and build relationships with stores and key retailers at mid/senior levels across multiple market segments. This role will require selling/closing skills, business credibility, and the gravitas to deal with complex business offerings. You'll work closely with our retail partners to educate them on how Dropit's services can benefit their stores, business operations, and customers. This is an active and engaging senior role with a fast-growing tech start-up.

About you

In this position, you will be both a consultant and Dropit retail expert and will be continually focused both on new sales and on helping our B2B customers improve engagement of the Dropit service. You will be familiar with the major retail players throughout the ecosystem and comfortable dealing with new concepts and services.

What you will do

  • Generate, develop, and execute a pipeline with viable opportunities, Onsite and corporate levels.
  • Develop a bottom-up sales cycle: from store managers up to c-levels
  • Develop sales plans and solutions based on excellent business and functional analysis during the sales cycle that results in the successful closing of enterprise-level deals
  • Customer service, building relationship with brands, training, onboarding
  • Create business plans to drive new revenue within the enterprise and corporate accounts
  • Work closely with on-site teams to expand their local relationships with the retailers to establish HQ relationships
  • Prospecting, forecasting, presenting, and negotiating with Dropit strategic partners
  • Attend industry events and stay up to date with current industry trends

You'll be great for this role if you

  • 5+ years of sales experience in the B2B tech industry – a must!
  • 2+ years of managing complex partners, negotiating with senior leaders, and closing complex, long term deals - ideally within retail
  • Process-driven and knowledge of data management platforms (DMPs)
  • Ability to travel across the country
  • Strong relationship building ability
  • A true collaborator and ability to liaise with Product and Marketing to drive success
  • Excellent people skills - including skills required to build and maintain excellent client relationships
  • Excellent communication, analytical, problem-solving, and cross-functional collaboration skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills for both external partners' management as well as internal stakeholder
  • A Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or any other related field.
  • Adaptable and able to work in a fast-paced start-up environment with changing and evolving responsibilities
  • Understanding of the fashion & retail industries - a big advantage

title: Food Service Supervisor-MUHC_Montréal
description:
Company Description

Looking for a change, an opportunity to show your exceptional skills, a chance to help lead and build a team? Grow your career with a company that shares your passion!

Contributing to The Well-Being and Quality of Our Consumers

The well-being of our consumers is at the heart of Sodexo's approach, customer engagement is integral in the services provided by Sodexo employees in various locations across Canada. We work closely with our consumers and clients to create an interactive and personalized environment for the well-being of everyone we serve.

Sodexo is proud to announce these nominations:  2021 Canada’s Best Diversity Employer; 2021 Canada’s Greenest Employers; 2020 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index featured company; 2020 Parity Certification - Platinum level and Progressive Aboriginal Relations (PAR) Program company – Gold Level.

What We Can Offer You

Sodexo offers you a flexible and dynamic work environment, competitive compensation, access to ongoing training and development programs, and countless opportunities to grow within the company.

Sodexo is committed to providing a safe and healthy working environment for our team members, customers, clients, contractors, business partners, guests and members of the public with whom we regularly interact.  As a provider of services in many client locations, including hospitals, long term care facilities, and senior homes, we require that all new hires to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

Job Description

Sodexo is growing! We are looking for a Food Service Supervisor to join our dynamic team. This position is a part-time role. You will be offered a great team environment, work/life balance and the chance to become a recognized leader.

Qualifications

During your mandate, you will be asked to oversee and ensure smooth service in our cafeteria and/or patient meal service. You will ensure that an exceptional level of service is achieved for all patients and clients by focusing on employee training, performance management and leadership. You will also manage weekly work schedules ensuring they reflect business needs and other key performance indicators.

You will be asked to guide staff in a productive and efficient manner by ensuring service delivery standards are met.  Ensure that employees comply with all company and local government rules, policies and regulations regarding health safety, food safety and fire and hazard safety. You will also have to carefully prepare and review all equipment for daily activities, maintain proper inventory, assist with inventory management and any other related duties that may be requested.

A high school diploma, table service training - food service or equivalent experience is required. You must respect the highest standards of hygiene, work effectively under pressure and be able to anticipate and solve problems. Bilingualism (French and English) is required.

What's Next?

If you're looking for a role where you can truly impact the lives of others, click "I'm interested" for a quick 5-minute online application.



Additional Information

Sodexo is committed to Employment Equity and Diversity. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of national origin, race, religion, ethnicity, age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status or any other federal, provincial, or local protected class.

We welcome and encourage applications from persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates who participate in all aspects of the selection process. 

Thank you for your interest in Sodexo.

Please note that only selected candidates will be contacted.

Follow us on social media to see first-hand what we are all about!  

Instagram: @SodexoCanadaCareers

Twitter: @SodexoJobsCA

LinkedIn: Sodexo Canada Careers

Facebook: Sodexo CA Jobs

title: Gérant
description:
Sommaire du poste

Sous la responsabilité du Directeur de restaurant, le Gérant de restaurant est quelqu'un de passionné par la nourriture et le service aux clients. Il est capable de résoudre les problèmes, s'appuyant sur une solide éthique de travail et un fort leadership. Le gestionnaire comprend que la satisfaction des clients reste prioritaire et requiert une gestion des opérations du restaurant efficace.

Rôles et Responsabilités

  • Gérer les opérations du restaurant avec passion, intégrité et connaissance.
  • Créer une expérience client positive en garantissant un haut niveau de service et en s'assurant que tous les membres de l'équipe s'engagent à comprendre les besoins des clients et dépasser leurs attentes.
  • Répondre aux plaintes des clients, en prenant toutes les actions appropriées pour transformer des clients insatisfaits en clients qui reviennent.
  • Gérer les activités de restauration afin de répondre et dépasser les normes de qualité des aliments, de sécurité et d'hygiène.
  • Fournir des directives aux membres de l'équipe concernant les questions opérationnelles et de procédure.
  • Développer les membres de l'équipe en fournissant du feedback continu, en établissant des objectifs et en conduisant des évaluations de rendement.
  • Constamment examiner les activités de restauration afin d'identifier les possibilités d'amélioration.
  • Tenue et animation des réunions quotidiennes précédant les quarts de travail.
  • Constamment surveiller et mesurer les coûts du produit et du travail afin de rester dans les objectifs budgétisés.
  • Respecter les politiques et procédures des 3 Brasseurs.
  • Veiller à ce que les procédures de sécurité appropriées soient en place pour protéger les membres de l'équipe, les clients et les actifs de la société.
  • Supporter le gérant général dans diverses fonctions administratives tel que les commandes auprès des fournisseurs, horaires, prévisions de ventes et autres fonctions.

Compétences

  • Expérience dans la restauration. L'expérience dans une chaîne de restauration est un atout.
  • Les candidats qualifiés doivent être grandement motivés, capables d'initiatives et doivent posséder de fortes compétences organisationnelles ainsi qu'un grand souci du détail
  • Disponible pour des quarts de travail flexibles, y compris les soirs, fins de semaine, et jours fériés.
  • Capacité de communiquer (verbal et écrit) et lire en français et en anglais.
  • Capacité à travailler à un rythme soutenu, dans un environnement en constant évolution
  • Doit posséder de bonnes aptitudes de communication pour faire face à une équipe diversifiée.
  • Maintenir les informations confidentielles, adhérer et imposer les politiques de la compagnie, les programmes ainsi que les questions de conformité.
  • Détenir des compétences de base en informatique (Connaissance du courriel, internet, Word et Excel) et de la suite Maitre D – Un atout
  • Certification de manipulation des aliments, Educ'alcool et RCR – Un atout

title: Golden Skybridge, Operations Supervisor $25/hr
description:
What will be your daily pursuit?:

Supporting and leading the Operations Team, to ensure they provide safe and professional hospitality

What perks can you expect?:
  • Work in a dynamic, culturally diverse team from around the globe  
  • Work experience in an  iconic, unforgettable, and inspiring location  
  • Free access to Pursuit attractions for staff and family, send a friend at half the price!
  • Discounted hotel stays under Pursuitâ€™s lodging offerings, and discounted food & beverage and retail experiences
  • A safe work environment with structured COVID procedures and vaccination policies
  • The chance to work in an  inclusive culture  and  make life-long friends  
  • Access to subsidized mental health and wellness resources
  • Opportunities for career growth  or future work at  other Pursuit  locations  
  • Access to one of the worldâ€™s most beautiful and iconic National Parks  
What will you do in this job?:
  • Assist in the day-to-day management of the Attraction team and ensure they provide upbeat and professional hospitality. Attraction team is responsible for Zipline, Challenge Course, Giant Swing, , mountain coaster, ticket validation, trail monitoring, interpretative programing and guiding
  • Responsible for supporting the daily work assignments (including meal breaks) of Adventure Guides
  • Training of new and existing Adventure Guides and provide ongoing coaching and feedback
  • Plan and facilitate emergency response drills and lead rescue procedures as needed
  • Create a positive and encouraging team environment and motivate team to deliver exceptional guest experience
  • Equipment inventory and upkeep
  • Responsible for opening and closing procedures, including conducting safety and maintenance inspections
  • Maintain high standards for employee appearance, customer service, safety and the environment
  • Upkeep and cleaning of work zone to ensure all areas meet expectations for cleanliness
  • Serve as the escalation point for customer service issues and handle customer concerns by reacting quickly and professionally
  • Execute all work in a safe, professional manner in compliance with H&S and our Always  Honest Policy
  • Perform the duties of an Adventure Guide as required
What skills and experience do you need for this job?:
  • A minimum of one-year supervisory experience with proven ability to manage a team
  • Strong physical stamina and conditioning. Physical demands of the position include: working outdoors in all weather conditions, repetitive actions and speaking, sitting/standing for extended periods of time, frequent bending/twisting, and ability to lift, push, and pull up to 50 lbs
  • Understanding the concept of mandatory safety at heights â€“ previous climbing experience an asset
  • Experience working as a ropes course or zipline attendant with high/low elements considered an asset
  • Experience facilitating groups of all ages and diverse backgrounds
  • Strong organizational skills and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong customer focus providing friendly, professional, and efficient service
  • Effective problem solving and critical thinking skills
  • Demonstrate high levels of positive energy and a willingness to take on new challenges
  • Meet and set a strong example for Pursuit grooming standards
  • Strong communication and listening skills with local and international guests and staff, second language skills highly advantageous
  • First Aid Training an asset
What will your work environment be like?:
  • Beautiful.  Youâ€™ll work in an iconic, unforgettable and inspiring  location. Youâ€™ll see amazing scenery and wildlife. Youâ€™ll participate in team events â€“ and fun!  
  • Independent.  Youâ€™ll spend your days in and around national parks
  • Remote.  Our home is filled with trees, lakes and blue-bird skies; rather than buildings, freeways and smog.  Connect with friends around a bonfire instead of  through  WiFi  
  • Busy.  You  need to be prepared for a physical working environment with walking, stair climbing, bending, reaching, lifting (up to 50 pounds with assistance) required    

This job description describes the role at a high level, but no document can anticipate every single task, issue or project that could come up.  We work as a team and believe that we succeed together â€“ these job duties may change based on the needs of the  team and company as a whole.  

 

To handle this job successfully, any person hired must be able to perform responsibilities as described. Pursuit will make any reasonable accommodation to help a person with disabilities perform their job. This job is based in Golden, British Columbia, Canada. Relocation to the area and the legal ability to work in Canada is required.  

 


#HKAB

EEO Information:Pursuit is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, religion, gender, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

title: Chef de cuisine
description:
Sommaire du poste

En tant que Chef de cuisine, vous serez entièrement imputable de tous les volets de votre cuisine. Vous veillerez constamment à ce que les plats que nous servons respectent le gage de qualité de la marque. Vous incarnerez et veillerez  à l'application des normes de la compagnie en tout temps. Vous aurez une vision d'ensemble des  sphères d'hygiène et salubrité alimentaire, organisation de votre cuisine, qualité des produits, coaching de votre équipe et de gestion des coûts.  

Responsabilités principales

  • S'assurer que votre équipe connaisse et mette en application les divers standards en matière de qualité des aliments et de réalisations des plats;
  • Être constamment proactif en matière de salubrité alimentaire : promouvoir et maintenir les bonnes pratiques, suivi de la température des aliments et des lieux d'entreposage;
  • En collaboration avec votre Sous-Chef, vous participerez au recrutement, formation et suivi disciplinaire de tous les membres de l'équipe de la cuisine;
  • Inventaire des aliments, préparation hebdomadaire de l'inventaire, rotation des stocks, gestion conforme aux normes de la société;
  • En étroite collaboration avec votre Sous-Chef :  gestion du coût des aliments, respect des recettes, gestion des déchets, élaboration et implantation de mesures lors de présence d'écart entre les quantités en inventaire réelles et théoriques;
  • Élaborer les horaires de travail de votre équipe, prévoir et gérer les coûts de main-d'œuvre en tenant compte des objectifs établis;
  • Promouvoir et maintenir les bonnes pratiques visant la sécurité des membres de votre équipe : entretien de l'équipement, la formation de vos employés sur la façon d'utiliser l'équipement de manière sécuritaire;
  • Suivi de votre équipement de cuisine : propreté, entretien préventif et coordination des réparations avec les tiers, au besoin;
  • Propreté de la cuisine, entretien de la cuisine pendant les différentes périodes de travail et respect des listes de vérification quotidiennes, hebdomadaires et mensuelles en matière de nettoyage;
  • Participation aux réunions hebdomadaires de la direction, ainsi qu'aux réunions mensuelles Chefs de cuisine;
  • Surveiller les réactions des invités.

Votre profil

  • Votre expérience de management dans un concept à haut volume;
  • Vos capacités analytiques : analyse des coûts des aliments et planification des mesures;
  • Votre leadership incontestable : capacité d'embaucher, de former, d'encadrer et coacher votre équipe;
  • Vous êtes toujours disponible pour votre équipe lors des périodes achalandées : le soir, le week-end et les jours de congé lorsque l'achalandage du restaurant l'exige;
  • Vous disposez d'une certaine aisance à communiquer verbalement et de lire en anglais et en français lors des réunions impliquant les Chefs des provinces de l'Ontario et du Québec;

Remarque

  • - Le genre masculin est utilisé sans discrimination et dans le seul but d'alléger le texte.

title: Food Service Supervisor
description:
A&W in Victoria , BC, is seeking  full-time, permanent, Food Service Supervisors,  to start immediately in our Bay Centre location.

The Company Operating Name:  Island Burgers Inc.  O/A A&W 

Title of Position: Food Service Supervisor 

Business Address: Bay Centre - #432 1150 Douglas Street, Victoria BC V8W 2C8

No# of Positions: 2

Terms of Employment: 2 years permanent 

Language Requirement(s): English

Wage: 17.00 per hour 

Benefits Package (if applicable): Dental benefits, Group insurance benefits, Life insurance benefits, Vision care benefits 

Hours (each week): 32

Location of work: Bay Centre - #432 1150 Douglas Street, Victoria BC V8W 2C8

Education: Secondary school 

Work Experience: Minimum 3 years experience in food preparation. 

Job Duties:

  • Supervise, co-ordinate and schedule the activities of staff who prepare, portion and serve food to serve to guests
  • Estimate and order ingredients and supplies required for meal preparation
  • Establish work schedules and ensure staff follow procedures
  • Maintain records of stock, sales and wastage and report to management
  • Train staff in job duties, and sanitation and safety procedures and ensure skill transfer to new employees
  • Ensure that food and service meet quality control standards and corporate brand standards
  • Deal with cash, opening and closing procedures with accuracy
  • Ensuring customer satisfaction and resolving issues as required
  • Maintain climate relationship between team members  

Apply for this job if you:

 

  • Have a passion for guest service and creating exceptional guest experiences;
  • Enjoy working in a fast-paced environment
  • Have excellent communication skills;
  • Enjoy learning new things;
  • Have a ready smile and a warm personality;
  • Are available to work 32-40 hours/week. 

Posted: January 24th, 2022

We strongly encourage candidates to apply directly to this post the links, otherwise, if the link is not working, email your resume to: HR-MCM-BC@outlook.com

 

How To Apply

Please ensure that you are providing a current, relevant, resume with pertinent work experience and references. Anyone who can legally work in Canada can apply for this job. If you are not currently authorized to work in Canada, the employer will not consider your job application.

We strongly encourage Candidates to apply to this job posting through the available links first for priority processing, otherwise, in the case that the link is not working, you may apply with your resume,

  • by email: recruitment@mcmurraygroup.ca
  • by mail: Recruitment - A&W McMurray Group, 2739 30th St., Vernon, BC, V1T 5C6, or
  • by fax: 250-275-6707, or
  • through our Career Page https://bit.ly/2J7m6ki

For further information regarding this posting, or others, please visit https://bit.ly/2J7m6ki or call 250-275-6706 x322 during business hours (10am - 4pm Pacific Time). If you are viewing this ad, the position has not been filled. Only qualified applicants will be contacted for assessments and interviews.

title: Warehouse Area Supervisor Food and Beverage - 2022
description:
Overview:

Oversee all of Food Warehouse operations. This position is a 10 month contract beginning in February.

This position pays $20.00  per hour.

Responsibilities:
  • Oversee all warehouse operations
  • Staff training on job functions: safety procedures and company polices
  • Effective problem solving, recommending measures to improve staff productivity and staff evaluations
  • Coordinate and schedule the activities of the warehouse team in all aspects of distribution, receiving and inventory management
  • Ensure accurate procedures are followed on all product counts, receiving documents and physical inventory
  • Document/maintain records in inventory system and labour/expense budgets
  • The daily reconciliation of accounting between Accounts Payable and Warehouse Receiving
  • Organize, prioritize and schedule orders to ensure all deliveries are made in an accurate and timely manner
  • Ensure adequate staffing levels and schedule labour within budget
  • Ensure all warehouse vehicles remain clean and free of debris
  • Performs duties of subordinates as required and all jobs in a safe manner
  • Assist with other duties as assigned
Qualifications:
  • Must be a minimum of 18 years of age to be considered for this role  
  • Minimum 3-5 years related work experience in a warehouse environment and working with heavy equipment is an asset as well as, a proven ability to supervise a team of 10+ associate
  • Able to work full time hours beginning in April through Labour Day and on weekends until the end of October. Candidates must also be available to work part time shifts starting in February
  • Able to work flexible hours including early shifts (starting at 5am) and late shifts (ending at 8pm) as well as, working on weekends and holidays
  • Demonstrates excellent communication skills, ability to make decisions independently and perform basic math functions
  • A valid Ontario Driverâ€™s license (G/G2) is an asset. If hired, must provide an driverâ€™s abstract (if applicable)
  • Must have reliable transportation outside public transit and able to work in all weather conditions
  • Proven track record as a team builder and confidence to manage rapidly changing priorities and drive change
  • Qualified work boots are required and previous forklift experience is an asset; must be able to successfully complete CW certification; Smart Serve certification is an asset
  • Able to perform heavy lifting up to 40 lbs.
  • Ability to perform basic computer skills in MS Word and Excel
  • Must be able to work in cold environments such as refrigerators and freezers as needed
  • Able to wear personal protective equipment deemed necessary to perform this job safely (may include; gloves, mask and/or face shield, non-slip shoes etc)

title: Supervisor, Operations
description:
Brookfield Properties, Office

At Brookfield Properties, our success starts with our people. People like you.

We develop, operate, and manage more than 650 properties and 325 million square feet of real estate across the globe. Itâ€™s a feat that wouldnâ€™t be possible without our team, a diverse group of creative visionaries and innovative experts who are relentless in pursuit of one goal: to ensure our buildings donâ€™t simply meet the needs of our tenants, residents, and communities â€” but exceed them, every day.

Within our office business, this conviction guides every aspect of our work. Our signature structures not only define skylines but are also true destinations â€” bringing together office areas, retail spaces, and dining options all in one. And our high-end design capabilities and strong sustainability practices allow us to create properties that raise the bar for real estate everywhere. Itâ€™s why the worldâ€™s most respected businesses, non-profits, and start-ups choose us as their partner.

If youâ€™re ready to be a part of our team, we encourage you to apply.

Prior to the first day of employment with Brookfield Properties, successful candidates must be fully vaccinated and are required to provide proof in the form of a government issued record.

DESCRIPTION:

Reporting to the Manager, Operations, your primary responsibilities will be supervision of the buildingâ€™s daily operations and maintenance.  You will be required to ensure that day-to-day HVAC and preventative maintenance of mechanical and electrical equipment is operating at optimum levels.  You will also be responsible for supervising all operations and maintenance staff ensuring a high level of communication and teamwork within the team, as well as with other departments.  

 RESPONSIBILITIES: 

â€¢  Inspecting, supervising and coordinating the repair and maintenance of any building mechanical, electrical, life safety and envelope systems.   

â€¢  Liaising with tenants regarding any requests for services or information, ensuring issues and concerns are resolved to the tenantâ€™s satisfaction.  

â€¢  Organizing and overseeing mechanical and electrical contractors performing base building and tenant improvement work.  

â€¢  Ensuring all systems are operating in an efficient safe manner and that related safety guidelines set out in provincial Environmental Health and Safety legislation, and company policies/procedures are being met.   

â€¢  Providing guidance, coaching and direction to 7 operations and maintenance staff on a day to day basis, giving regular feedback.   

â€¢  Order necessary part for day to day projects/repairs.  Oversee to ensure that minimum inventory of essential and required equipment. 

â€¢  Working within Budget constraints.

â€¢  Embody and support Brookfield Propertiesâ€™ Safety, Health and Environment Policy.

    • Proactively identify, manage, and mitigate hazards to reduce risk to the workplace.
    • Engage in training and continuing education to develop the knowledge, skills, and competencies required to work safely.
    • Take action to stop work if it cannot be executed safely or if conditions or behaviours are unsafe.
    • Immediately report SH&E incidents, near-misses, unsafe conditions, and/or at-risk behaviours to their supervisor; then diligently work to correct the problem.
    • Promote safe work practices and safe working conditions in accordance with all Brookfield Properties Safe Work Procedures.
    • Wear Personal Protective Equipment when required.

SERVICE / PERSONAL SKILLS: 

This individual requires superior customer service skills, strong interpersonal skills, and the ability to deal with difficult situations diplomatically. This successful candidate must have a thorough understanding of operational and  technical  issues  in  an  effort  to  provide  direction  and  leadership  to  the  Operations  and  Maintenance departments  and  efficiently  interact  with  Construction,  Security,  Tenant  Services,  and  Building  Services.  The position  demands  flexibility  (able  to  work  on  call  and  over  time  as  required)  and  a  high  degree  of organizational and administrative skills to manage a variety of priorities and changing deadlines.

 EXPERIENCE & TECHINCAL SKILLS:

â€¢  Candidate must have five (5) yearsâ€™ experience with building mechanical systems and equipment. 

â€¢  Background knowledge of building automation systems, controls and instrumentation would be a definite asset. 

â€¢  Able to work independently with minimum supervision.  

â€¢  Ability to multi-task and effectively manage time in a fast paced and ever-changing environment.

â€¢  Ability and understanding of how and when to delegate.

â€¢  Ability and understand of how to follow up with projects/tasks etc.

â€¢  Proven troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.

â€¢  Previous leadership training is an asset. 

EDUCATION / DESIGNATIONS / LICENSES: 

â€¢  Minimum Grade 12 high school diploma or equivalent.

â€¢  4th class Power Engineering certification.

â€¢  Journeyman status or related experience as a Millwright, Plumber, or Electrician is an asset. 

â€¢  Completion of leadership/supervisory/management training  

 

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for pre-screening will be contacted.

Brookfield Properties is an equal opportunity employer committed to the inclusion and accommodation of all individuals.

title: Operations Supervisor
description:
We are currently hiring one Operations Supervisor for Vancouver, British Columbia.
 

Your mission at GardaWorld:

Reporting to the Operations Manager, you will be in charge of the Secured Transport team within our Cash Services Division. On a daily basis, you will be responsible for planning, organizing, and managing the work of your team and ensuring customer satisfaction.

We are looking for a passionate leader who will be able to establish great relationships with his/her unionized employees. 

GardaWorld, Cash Services, is the #1 supplier of cash services in North America and offers you the opportunity of an exciting career.
 

We offer:

  • Competitive salary and benefits
  • Permanent position
  • Shift schedule
  • Be part of a dynamic team
  • On-site parking
  • International company offering many career opportunities

 

On a typical day you will:

  • Plan, organize, and manage the work of your employees and ensure customer satisfaction
  • Investigate to verify and resolve customers' and shippers' complaints
  • Serve as a contact person for all workers from assigned territories
  • Implement schedule and policy changes
  • Conduct employee training sessions on subjects such as material handling, employee orientation, quality improvement, and computer use
  • Promote safe work activities by conducting safety audits, attending company safety meetings, and meeting with individual staff members
  • Participate in disciplinary process or settlements of grievances.
  • Monitor operations to ensure that staff members respect administrative policies and procedures, safety rules, union contracts, and government regulations
  • Monitor spending to ensure that expenses are consistent with approved budgets
  • Collaborate with other supervisors and staff members in order to formulate and implement policies, procedures, goals, and objectives
  • Prepare management recommendations, such as proposed fee or schedule changes
  • Conduct investigations, when necessary, in cooperation with internal or external agencies to determine causes of transportation accidents and to improve safety procedures

 

Your profile :

  • 5 years’ experience in administration and management of unionized employees
  • Available to work on an overnight schedule, if needed
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English)
  • Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint
  • Valid driver’s license with a good driving record
  • Health and Safety management experience
  • Working knowledge of WSBC reporting process
  • Restricted Possession and Acquisition License (RPAL) - If none, contingent on passing all necessary security clearance + courses provided
  • Driven by offering exceptional customer service
  • Sense of urgency, outstanding communication, and problem solving
  • Strong teamwork and partnership orientation
  • Mechanical and/or electrical inclination is an asset
  • Experience training and coaching is an asset

#LI-FB1

Interested in this job? Apply online or send your resume to Jonathan.Kamengele@garda.com!

title: Food Service Supervisor - TPT - Food Services
description:
Posting #: 2021-881898

Non-Union

Position: Food Service Supervisor

Department: Food Services

Status:Temporary Part-time for approx. 1 year (must provide availability of up to 0.4 FTE)

Hours: Monday to Sunday, Days and Evenings, various 8 hour rotating shifts;6:00 am - 2:00 pm, 12:30 pm - 8:30 pm and every other weekend (subject to change based on operational requirements)

Site: Oakville

This is what you'll be doing:

Successful candidate is a member of the Clinical Nutrition and Food Services Management Team, working with the Director, and Manager to ensurethe smooth operation of the Department. As a member of our team, you will be responsible for providing direct supervision of all staff in Patient Food Services and will provide leadership in the development of a superior customer service culture in Food Services. The successful incumbent will supervise the daily operations of the Food Services Department, including meal service to patients,sanitation, warewashing and security. You will ensure that all work practices are in keeping with Hospital, Departmental,and legislated standards (e.g. HACCP, Public Health, Canadian Food Inspection Agency Act, Workplace Safety and OH&S Act).

This is what you’ll need to do it:

Halton Healthcare endeavors to hire individuals who are competent in their chosen profession and who exemplify our mission, vision and values of accountability, respect and compassion which guide our individual behaviours and attitudes.

  • Successful completion of a Food Service Supervisor diploma required
  • Canadian Society for Nutrition Management Membership required
  • Serve Safe Certified- Advanced required
  • A minimum of 3years experience working as a Food ServicesSupervisorrequired
  • Previous experience working as a Food Services Supervisor in a hospital setting preferred
  • Working knowledge of WHMIS and HACCP required
  • Action oriented approach to problem solving and trouble shooting
  • Experience in large scale food production and service required
  • Excellent time management skills and proven initiative
  • Must beself-directed with excellent organizational skills
  • Proven ability to effectively supervise staff
  • Excellent communication skills both written and verbal
  • Proficient in the use of a computerfor data entry
  • Experience usingFood Service computer systems
  • Must be able to meet the physical demands of the position.
  • Satisfactory employment and attendance record required

Date Posted: August 10, 2021

Application Deadline for Employees:August 17, 2021

If you are passionate about what you do, motivated by a job well done, and as committed to excellence, quality and patient satisfaction as we are, we'd like to hear from you. Please submit your application via our website at www.haltonhealthcare.com directly to this posting and include a current copy of your resume.

We thank all those who apply but only those individuals selected for further consideration will be contacted.

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code, Halton Healthcare will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your accommodation needs to ensure your equal participation.

All personal information is collected under the authority of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act.

Halton Healthcare is a smoke free facility in and around all three sites. Smoking is not permitted on hospital properties. We thank everyone who works at or visits our hospitals for respecting this healthy initiative. We are also a scent-free environment for all employees and visitors to accommodate individuals’ health concerns arising from exposure to scented products, We ask for everyone's cooperation in our efforts to accommodate health concerns.

title: Service Manager - Spruce Grove
description:
Welcome to The Canadian Brewhouse, Canada's fastest-growing independent restaurant group!  We are proud of being the only Canadian-themed sports bar in town, and we know that without our incredible teams we wouldn't be a fraction of where we are today.  Our teams live and breathe our Core Values; these are 6 key principles that influence all of our decisions as an organization.

  • Take Care of Each Other and Yourself
  • Think Like a Customer
  • Support Your Community
  • Hurry, Donâ€™t Rush
  • Embrace Innovation
  • Be Persistent

When not at work, you may catch us out in the community volunteering, raising funds for The Canadian Mental Health Association or the local Children's Hospital, or having a couple of drinks with friends. The Brew Crew is a team of devoted, compassionate, and ambitious individuals that are hungry for what the future holds. We believe it's our duty to provide all of our employees with a safe, fun-filled work environment with endless advancement opportunities. Let us tell you more about why you should join the best team in Canada, today!

 

Letâ€™s talk about the Service Manager Position!

What will be your responsibilities?

  • Support and involve yourself with a high energy, passionate team 
  • Handle difficult situations and tackle them with the tools that we provide or that you choose to bring to the table
  • Table touching, ensuring all guests are receiving that â€˜wowâ€™ experience
  • Lead, coach, and mentor your team to embrace the Canadian Brewhouse values and culture
  • Working closely with your Assistant and General Manager to ensure all ordering and tasks are completed to successfully run the store
  • Support yourself and your team to grow to their full potential within our company!

What do you need?

  • Passion for people - experience in a supervisor role is necessary, food industry is a perk!
  • Willingness to learn and expand your knowledge, as well as grow as an individual
  • Dedication to learning a large database of many Brewhouse procedures - including food, drinks, policies, training programs, values, processes, the list goes on!
  • Strong ability to communicate effectively
  • Ambition and drive to create the best experience for your team and guests
  • A drive to find solutions rather than point out problems
  • Flexibility to work long hours (Days and/or Nights)

Benefits to Joining Our Team:

  • A company Health Spend Account after 3 months
  • A staff discount that we extend to your friends and family - show off your workplace, our house is your house!
  • Advancement opportunities are endless with the right attitude and passion - our CEO started out as a dishwasher!
  • The opportunity to Support Your Community - one of our core values, a great experience to volunteer with causes youâ€™re passionate about. 
  • Working with a team of like-minded individuals who have your interests at heart.  Our team is our family - We Are Brew Crew

title: Floor Manager
description:
Company Description

Are you a leader looking for a new challenge? Do you want to work for a brand that will invest in you and your career? Could you make the difference to a customer’s day?

If you answered yes - we would love to hear from you...

Here at COS we are recruiting a Floor Manager to join our amazing team in Laval. 

About COS...

COS is a fashion brand for women and men who want timeless, modern, functional and considered design. Offering reinvented classics and wardrobe essentials, we create pieces that are made to last beyond the season. Since launching in 2007 we have opened stores in over 40 countries worldwide, all in carefully considered locations, applying a design concept that preserves the buildings’ original features whilst creating a modern, contemporary space.

Job Description

Although every day will be different, some of the things that you will do regularly include:

About the role...

  • Offering customers a high level of service; starting conversations with them and helping them create outfits
  • Analyzing selling information and working with the store manager, maximize the sales performance of your department
  • Leading a team of sales assistants to achieve excellent standards of service
  • Supporting recruitment events and ensure all new colleagues are made to feel welcome and are well-trained.
  • Assisting the store manager to identify future talents and putting together development plans to support their progression
  • Being a COS brand ambassador and providing the best experience for our customers.
  • Stepping in for the store manager in his/her absence
Qualifications

About you...

To work as a Floor Manager you should have previous management/leadership experience plus the qualities below.

  • Approx. 1 year working as a manager within a retail environment.
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to lead, train and develop a team
  • Bilingual in both English and French 
  • Customer focused
  • Self-motivated & Positive
  • Adaptable
  • A genuine interest in others
  • Excellent planning and organizational skills
  • Good analytical and problem-solving abilities
  • Excellent commercial abilities and interest in fashion, retail
  • Ability to work a flexible schedule including early mornings, weekends and evenings when required


Additional Information

Why choose COS?

When you first join COS we will give you a full introduction, excellent training, and a mentor that will support you during your first days, weeks and months. In addition to this you will also receive lots of fantastic benefits including;

  • 25% staff discount 
  • Up to $1040 per year clothing allowance 
  • Start with up to 3 weeks vacation 
  • Company wellness pay 
  • Medical/Dental insurance benefits* 
  • Short term and long term disability benefits 
  • RRSP contribution plan 
  • Life Insurance 
  • Parental Leave of Absence 
  • Parental Leave Pay 

*Available on the first month after a 90 day probationary period

Our culture...

Over the last 10 years we have carefully built a culture where our people are supported, inspired and encouraged to be the best they can. Our brand is creative, forward thinking and modern; choosing longevity over passing trends.

We set the bar high at COS; we are committed to recruiting great people, offering an environment where talent is recognised and valued. We believe that a diverse workforce plays an important role in the success of COS. We celebrate individual differences and appreciate the contribution that all our colleagues make.

title: Service Manager
description:
We are looking for a Service Manager to join the team in Calgary, Alberta. Our Service Manager is responsible for creating, improving and maintaining Clearview's high standards of 5-star customer service. The person in this role must be committed to elevating Clearview and the brands associated with the company to be clearly the best home - service company in the nation. Our Service Manager will be passionate about consistent ride-alongs, coaching, on-boarding direction, and delivering relevant training and meetings for a growing team.

Essential Functions

Lead, manage, and hold accountable your team, including 1:1s, team meetings, coaching, etc.

Consistent involvement in Clearview sponsored & team building activities

Track technician interactions and performance; delivers unique coaching per tech.

Available 24/7 for phone coaching (on-call rotation between department managers)

Work with the dispatch department to make sure the right technician goes to the right job.

Meet weekly with the dispatch manager to review team schedule, specific technician needs & review scorecards for areas to surpass goal.

Consistently provide service and sales performance support to the techs via ride along, site visits, and coaching calls.

Always represent, deliver and train the Clearview brand and experience.

Understand and enforce service titan processes.

Assist owner with price book modifications.

Work with Clearview leaders to develop new motivations in line with Clearview's vision

Create the habit and enforce the restocking process

Enforce quality workmanship standards throughout the team.

Oversee technician's technical assessment & check off list.

Teach safety meetings and promote a safe work environment.

Oversee customer issue resolution: including site visits, oversight of repairs, phone call follow up, hand off to Finance for insurance involvement.

Skills & Abilities -

Education: High school graduate or equivalent: required.

Experience: Prior experience as a Service Technician for over 5 years in a residential and commercial setting. Management experience for over 3 years in a residential setting.

Computer Skills: proficient using mobile devices & Microsoft Office applications.

Certifications & Licenses: EPA, and a valid & clear driver's license.

Other Requirements: Proficient with Service Titan platform.

Why choose Clearview

Salary: negotiable, TBD

Bonus earning potential based on team's performance

Full Benefits: Medical, Dental, and Vision

Company-Paid Life Insurance

Company-Provided iPhone and Laptop

Stability: We've been in business since 1997, and we're only getting better!

Team-Focused Work Environment

Ongoing Professional and Personal Development Training Opportunities: Both in-house and across the country.

Fun! We're a little goofy, and no one here is above a little "toilet humor"
