title: Night Shift Operations Supervisor
description:
At EVRAZ, our strength starts with our people! As a team we collaborate to solve problems, contribute ideas and challenge each other to ensure growth and ultimately success for the business and our employees.

Job Description and Responsibilities

EVRAZ NA is seeking a Night Shift Operations Supervisor for our Navajo Recycling Facility in Calgary, Alberta. The Operations Supervisor supports the General Manager to coordinate all aspects of site operations including but not limited to; sales, production, purchasing, customer service and managing a team. The Operations Supervisor will also ensure that the site remains safe and environmentally compliant, while effectively and efficiently working within the guidelines of the administrative policies and procedures of the company.

  • Manage/direct the selection, training, development, appraisal and work assignments of exempt and non-exempt professionals (Mangers/Supervisors) and non-exempt hourly employee
  • Partners with the Environmental, Health and Safety Team to ensure that the site is adhering to all safety and environmental policies and procedures. Promotes a clean, safe, and environmentally compliant site for employees and customer
  • Manages, trains, and develops all employees
  • Responsible for staffing scheduling and managing the day-to-date operations of the site
  • Drive site performance by optimizing sales, production, and product purchasing
  • Manage financials by understanding and taking corrective actions in response to monthly financial statements and operating key performance indicators (KPIs)
  • Establish community relationships to promote and enhance the site brand
  • Follows company policy and procedures and leads by example for the rest of the employees
  • Ensure policies and procedures are communicated and implemented at the site level
  • Prepares operating reports for the management and operations team
  • Ensure that all sales transactions and cash management procedures are in compliance with company policy
  • Responsible for the overall safeguarding of company assets
  • Partner with all internal corporate support resources to ensure compliance with all laws and regulations to achieve results
  • Other duties as assigned

Requirements

  • Minimum of 3 years’ management or leadership experience in industrial manufacturing, automotive or distribution environments
  • High school diploma or equivalent preferred
  • Solid quantitative skills to understand site financial performance and operating statistics (KPIs)
  • Must have the ability to reconcile sales, prepare reports and read technical manuals
  • Able to handle multiple priorities while performing quality work in an efficient manner with minimal supervision
  • Able to work required hours which includes weekends and holidays and also at any site assigned within reasonable distance from home site
  • Loader and heavy equipment operator license preferred but not required
  • Manual dexterity to handle tools and the ability to move 50 pounds
  • Must have strong interpersonal skills
  • Willing and able to work in variable weather conditions including hot, dry summer conditions and cold, harsh winter conditions

Our total compensation package includes amazing benefits!

  • Competitive wages and bonus opportunities
  • Family medical, dental, and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost
  • Short and long term disability programs
  • Competitive retirement plans
  • Paid vacations and statutory holidays
  • Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company
  • Tuition reimbursement

All applicants must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship.

While we thank all those who apply, only those being actively considered for employment will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

EVRAZ North America is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

 

EVRAZ North America is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail

careers@evrazna.com

or call: (312) 533-3577. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

Join a team that manufactures excellence, drives success and builds careers!

title: Service Manager - Landing Group
description:
Overview:

Oshawa, Ontario Landing is looking for a Service Manager to come join our team!

 

Our vision begins with genuine and fun experiences and ends with our Guests and teammates knowing we care. This goes beyond the building and fixtures. It means menus are developed, service standards are perfected, music is handpicked and experiences are made with our people as our focus. Your lifestyle inspires our hospitality. With core values that are based around quality, community and commitment to excellence, The Landing Restaurant Group is excited to showcase a truly fantastic product and experience. The menu, service and atmosphere at each location are what make working here exciting.  



What you will do in this role:  

  • Train and supervise teammates to ensure the perfect Guest Journey each and every time
  • Ensure all food safety procedures are strictly adhered to according to regulations
  • Work closely with management to meet revenue objectives
  • Maintain safe working conditions
  • Audit inventory levels to ensure product availability and order products as necessary
  • Attract and retain excellent performers and develop high performing teams
  • Promote a culture of dialogue and role model the values and practices of the company
  • Other duties as assigned  

 

What we are looking for from you:

  • Full Time  
  • Proven success with both people development in leadership positions and long-term sales growth
  • Passion for all things hospitality
  • Possess an entrepreneurial spirit through having presence "on the floor" and in the community
  • Superior business acumen, including an understanding of budgets and operating costs
  • Extensive knowledge of restaurant operations, food and beverage
  • Excellent understanding of the upscale dining industry
  • Demonstrated ability to motivate and direct others

 

Whatâ€™s in it for you:

  • 20% employee discount dining card valid at participating Recipe brands
  • Flexible scheduling
  • Chance to be part of a team that is committed to growing leaders who care  
  • Competitive wages
  • Fun working environment  
  • Growth and development opportunities within the restaurant
  • Career advancement opportunities with a company that owns some of Canadaâ€™s most iconic brands  

 

Interested in this fantastic opportunity? Please apply online today, weâ€™d love to hear from you!



Recipe is committed to providing a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace. Celebrating people, being passionate and curious, owning it, and doing the right thing are the values that guide how we build our teams, support our franchisees and create a company that unlocks the full potential of everyone.  


Recipe is dedicated to providing accommodations in accordance with applicable human rights and accommodation legislation. For individuals that require accommodations please contact

title: Service Manager
description:
Welcome to The Canadian Brewhouse, Canada's fastest-growing independent restaurant group!  We are proud of being the only Canadian-themed sports bar in town, and we know that without our incredible teams we wouldn't be a fraction of where we are today.  Our teams live and breathe our Core Values; these are 6 key principles that influence all of our decisions as an organization.

  • Take Care of Each Other and Yourself
  • Think Like a Customer
  • Support Your Community
  • Hurry, Donâ€™t Rush
  • Embrace Innovation
  • Be Persistent

When not at work, you may catch us out in the community volunteering, raising funds for The Canadian Mental Health Association or the local Children's Hospital, or having a couple of drinks with friends. The Brew Crew is a team of devoted, compassionate, and ambitious individuals that are hungry for what the future holds. We believe it's our duty to provide all of our employees with a safe, fun-filled work environment with endless advancement opportunities. Let us tell you more about why you should join the best team in Canada, today!

 

Letâ€™s talk about the Service Manager Position!

What will be your responsibilities?

  • Support and involve yourself with a high energy, passionate team 
  • Handle difficult situations and tackle them with the tools that we provide or that you choose to bring to the table
  • Table touching, ensuring all guests are receiving that â€˜wowâ€™ experience
  • Lead, coach, and mentor your team to embrace the Canadian Brewhouse values and culture
  • Working closely with your Assistant and General Manager to ensure all ordering and tasks are completed to successfully run the store
  • Support yourself and your team to grow to their full potential within our company!

What do you need?

  • Passion for people - experience in a supervisor role is necessary, food industry is a perk!
  • Willingness to learn and expand your knowledge, as well as grow as an individual
  • Dedication to learning a large database of many Brewhouse procedures - including food, drinks, policies, training programs, values, processes, the list goes on!
  • Strong ability to communicate effectively
  • Ambition and drive to create the best experience for your team and guests
  • A drive to find solutions rather than point out problems
  • Flexibility to work long hours (Days and/or Nights)

Benefits to Joining Our Team:

  • A company Health Spend Account after 3 months
  • A staff discount that we extend to your friends and family - show off your workplace, our house is your house!
  • Advancement opportunities are endless with the right attitude and passion - our CEO started out as a dishwasher!
  • The opportunity to Support Your Community - one of our core values, a great experience to volunteer with causes youâ€™re passionate about. 
  • Working with a team of like-minded individuals who have your interests at heart.  Our team is our family - We Are Brew Crew

â€‹

title: Service Manager
description:
Requisition Number: 111134

Job Description

Cintas is seeking a Service Manager to directly manage our customer facing Service team. Responsibilities include hiring and performance management; managing the overall performance of a team; providing leadership by fostering a safe working environment; successful resolution of customer related issues; training a team on effective sales techniques; performing goodwill of customers at the customer site while maintaining a high level of customer satisfaction; achieving sales, profit, inventory and payroll goals; managing a budget and dealing with operational issues that affect service. Hands-on support of direct reports includes accompanying our service representatives or visiting customers alone when necessary, to assist in the pick-up and delivery of products or services; driving a company-owned vehicle to and from customer locations; lifting, carrying and walking Cintas products in and out of customer accounts while maintaining world-class service and goodwill to customers; performing managerial duties.

Skills/Qualifications

Required

  • The ability to meet the physical requirements of the position
  • High School Diploma/GED; Bachelor's Degree preferred

Qualified candidates must meet all Provincial requirements for driving a regulated vehicle weighing more than 10,000 lbs. In order to comply with Provincial requirements, qualified candidates must, prior to their first day of employment:

  • Possess a valid driver's license in good standing

 

Preferred

  • Management experience
  • Experience in industrial sales or customer service

Our employee-partners enjoy:

 

  • Competitive Pay
  • Weekly Pay Cheques
  • RRSP and DPSP Contribution
  • Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance Package
  • Disability & Life Insurance Package
  • Paid Vacation & Holidays
  • Career Advancement Opportunities

 

Headquartered in Cincinnati, Cintas is a publicly held company traded over the Nasdaq Global Select Market under the symbol CTAS and is a component of both the Standard & Poor’s 500 Index and Nasdaq-100 Index.

Cintas Corporation helps more than 900,000 businesses of all types and sizes get READY™ to open their doors with confidence every day by providing a wide range of products and services that enhance our customers’ image and help keep their facilities and employees clean, safe and looking their best. With products and services including uniforms, mats, mops, restroom supplies, first aid and safety products, fire extinguishers and testing, and safety and compliance training, Cintas helps customers get Ready for the Workday®.

To support our growth across North America, we’re seeking driven professionals with ambition to move up within our company. Our professional culture, our dedication to our employee-partners and limitless career opportunities—these are just a few benefits we’re proud to offer. Our employee-partners know every job is critical, and that teamwork drives innovation. Let’s talk about how you’ll fit into our team and how your hard work will be recognized through competitive pay, world-class benefits and ongoing career development. Are you Ready™ for limitless opportunities at Cintas?

In accordance with applicable laws (including human rights and accessibility legislation), accommodations will be provided in all parts of the hiring process. Applicants are required to make their needs known in advance.



Job Category: Service 
Organization: Rental
Employee Status: Regular
Schedule: Full Time
Shift: 1st Shift

title: Service Manager
description:
Brandt is currently seeking a Service Manager for our Corner Brook and Grand Falls locations, based out of Corner Brook. The Service Manager will be responsible for managing the sales and delivery of heavy duty equipment after-market support services (component diagnostics, repair, and replacement). This includes managing all aspects of the service department and day-to-day activity of foremen, leadmen, service writers, and shop, field, and resident heavy duty mechanics.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Managing service workflow
  • Enforcing standards, policies, and reporting practices are followed to established standards
  • Development and management of the Service Department budget to meet financial and operational goals
  • Preparing quotes for customer work orders; opening & closing work orders
  • Inspect/operate customer equipment as part of resolving concerns/diagnostics
  • Monitor service revenue and expenses monthly
  • Ensure work is performed according to established safety and industry standards
  • Reviewing employee performance against goals on an ongoing basis
  • Able to communicate effectively and professionally with customers, employees, and branch personnel at all levels
  • Must be self-motivated in learning and applying new knowledge and skills and is willing to share knowledge with others
  • Must be able to travel to customer worksites, and as required, operator and work on or around heavy equipment
  • Must be proficient in using work-related desktop applications and web-based productivity applications
  • Has the confidence, critical thinking, knowledge, and technical skills to assess and solve customer, business, and personnel problems effectively and efficiently
  • A recent driver's abstract will be required
  • Demonstrates a strong commitment to occupational health and safety
  • 5-7 years’ progressive, combined experience in service, management and business (i.e. journeyperson heavy duty mechanic, combined with 3 years’ management/supervisory experience in the heavy duty equipment industry
  • Has a solid foundation of knowledge and skill in the operation of a heavy duty equipment dealership
  • Demonstrated ability to organize work, set priorities, and achieve work related objectives and goals
  • Demonstrates a strong customer service orientation, and exercises sound judgment when dealing with customers

title: Assistant Restaurant Manager -Swiss Chalet
description:
Overview:

Swiss Chalet is looking for an Assistant Restaurant Manager for our Simcoe location!

 

At Swiss Chalet we deliver delicious â€œhome-madeâ€ food, made fresh in-house just for you. Our atmosphere is warm, welcoming and feels like home.

 

At Swiss Chalet, we work as a team and help each other succeed. Our Managers are hands-on and our team works together to deliver the Perfect Guest Experience to our guests each and every time. We genuinely care about each Guest and every Associate.

 

We are looking for individuals that are passionate about Food, Hospitality, and are Guest focused as well as being a strong and motivating team player.  

 

Responsibilities:

  • Assist with the day-to-day management of the dining room as directed by the Franchise Owner and General Manager
  • Possess the potential to effectively run the front of house and lead all shifts to meet Brand standards as well as financial goals
  • Ensure the store is operating to all standards of a "Benchmark Restaurant", and creating a Perfect Guest Experience every time
  • Continue to develop associates

 

Core Duties:

  • Oversee and ensure the Perfect Guest Experience
  • Development Associates
  • Support and implement Standards and Controls
  • The successful candidate is expected to be a leader in demonstrating behaviours consistent with Recipe's Principles.

 

Qualifications:

  • Previous Front of House Management experience
  • Must possess the "Hospitality Gene" (Ability to Create Connections, have a Passion for People and Service Excellence)
  • Driven and focused
  • Inspirational/Motivational
  • Must be available to work days, evenings, weekends and holidays in a busy fast paced environment.  Including opening, midday and closing shifts.

 

PERKS! Why should you work for us?

  • 20% employee discount dining card valid at all Recipe brands
  • Flexible scheduling
  • Competitive wages
  • Growth and advancement opportunities within the restaurant
  • Career advancement opportunities in a company that has more than 1,400 restaurants across Canada

 

If you are interested in joining us please send apply online today!

 

 

Recipe is committed to providing a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace. Celebrating people, being passionate and curious, owning it, and doing the right thing are the values that guide how we build our teams, support our franchisees and create a company that unlocks the full potential of everyone.  


Recipe is dedicated to providing accommodations in accordance with applicable human rights and accommodation legislation. For individuals that require accommodations please contact

recruit@recipeunlimited.com

.

 

 

Some positions may be with our Franchise Partners, which are independently owned and operated.

title: Restaurant General Manager
description:
Restaurant General Manager


Pride, Passion, Family, Values, Integrity.  Just some of the words we live by...

We are an industry-leading company searching for an ambitious, enthusiastic, motivated and inspiring General Restaurant Manager. If you are interested, please apply today for our locations in Etobicoke. We employ hospitality professionals who are competitive, expect to win and can build sales. We are a great company for talented General Manager professionals to make their mark! If this sounds interesting to you please do not hesitate to contact us immediately for this position in the Etobicoke area.

Title of Position: Restaurant General Manager

Job Description: The Restaurant General Manager will oversee the day-to-day operations of the restaurant including sales, fiscal operations, accounting, recruitment, and maintenance of the building and equipment. The General Restaurant Manager will be responsible for managing the revenue with the goal being to exceed budget and preserve cost-effectiveness and profitability in agreement with company policies. The General Manager will be required to prepare monthly reports for the corporate office and should have the ability to follow corporate office financial procedures, including but not restricted to; handling cash, credit cards, accounts payable, accounts receivable, payroll and all other financial transactions. A large part of being a good leader and better General Manager is the ability to build an outstanding team around you, hiring, mentoring and guiding the team to achieve success both personally and professionally.

Benefits:

  • Competitive Compensation 

  • RRSP Program

  • Bonus Program

  • Health Benefits

  • 3 Weeks Paid Vacation

  • Thorough and Ongoing Training

Qualifications:

· The Restaurant General Manager must be extremely guest orientated with the highest degree on honesty and integrity

· Open availability is a requirement for the General Manager

· The ability to drive positive sales is a must for the General Manager

· The General Manager must be passionate about and thrive on the development and mentoring of others

· This position requires a minimum of 3 years’ experience as a General Manager

Apply now - Restaurant General Manager in Etobicoke.  Send your resume to

scotts@geckohospitality.com

today!

title: Seeking Restaurant General Manager
description:
Denny's has been proudly serving local customers for over 40 years, and we are continuing to grow with the right people! With over 50 restaurants across Canada, you need not look any further than your local Denny's to understand the secret of its success: employees who enjoy flexible hours, benefit programs, competitive wages, a fun-filled atmosphere, and opportunities to grow.

Benefits:

  • Medical Insurance
  • Dental Insurance
  • Life Insurance
  • RRSP Employer Contribution
  • Gain Sharing Incentive Program
  • Management Bonus Program
  • Employee discounts with Revelstoke Resort, YYOGA, TELUS, Rogers Mobile, Dell, Kal Tire, Soft Moc, Frazer Way RV, Park n Fly, Serta Mattresses, and more!

Primary Focus:

The General Manager is responsible for the total operational functionality and profitability of the restaurant. They are accountable for planning, organizing, and coordinating all resources and activities in the restaurant including setting targets, achieving goals, and controlling costs. Additional activities requiring their involvement are recruiting, training, and coaching the entire restaurant team.

Scope:

The General Manager reports to the Regional Manager of their area and supervises all employees within their location including the Restaurant Manager and Assistant General Manager.

Duties and Accountabilities:

  • Prepares and interprets financial and operational reports, analyzes data, and develops solutions to ensure operating goals are achieved
  • Achieves controllable profit goals by monitoring controls and taking corrective action to achieve the desired result
  • Plans and checks work schedules
  • Conducts weekly meetings with the Management team
  • Sets and achieves profit and loss targets
  • Coordinates the entire operation of the restaurant during scheduled shifts
  • Develops and coaches hourly employees on brand standards, internal policies and procedures, and other guest focused programs/activities to meet or exceed guest service standards
  • Develops Restaurant Managers and hourly employees through corporate training programs, individual development plans, and assignments

Qualifications:

  • Must have 2-5 years' experience in restaurant or hospitality industry; additional operations and/or leadership experience strongly preferred
  • Must have excellent oral and written communication skills and the ability to communicate with all levels of the organization
  • Must be able to interpret financial statements and understand contributing factors
  • Must be able to budget and forecast financial operations
  • Must place a value on diversity and respect for others
  • Must be licensed to operate an automobile without restrictions
  • Must have reliable transportation in order to meet banking obligations

SUMMATION:

Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. **ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE**

Dencan Restaurants Inc is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. Dencan Restaurants Inc does not discriminate on the basis of disability, veteran status or any other basis protected under federal, provincial or local laws. title: Restaurant Assistant Manager
description:
Restaurant Assistant Manager – Vernon, B.C.

Our Assistant Managers not only have an appetite for bottomless fun & compassion for our crazy loyal guests, they manage day to day operations of the restaurant. As a part of the leadership team, they are an ambassador of Company & Brand Equity Standards to ensure the loyalty of our guests and profit maximization. Our Assistant Managers are role models to Team Members and contribute to their ongoing development. They are master resolvers with guest interactions, driven to optimize profits, and ensure product quality and restaurant cleanliness. 

 

At Red Robin, we believe the responsibilities of the AM should also represent our BURGER values:

Bottomless Fun

  • Be the Maestro of restaurant operations (primarily Front of House while supporting Heart of House) including scheduling, planning, forecasting, and driving sales while being a champion of culture & bottomless fun.
  • Have a cheerful spirit while also influencing and adhering to all company standards and policies including the code of conduct, attendance, uniform and appearance policy.
  • Be the delegator of duties and follow up on tasks while remaining accountable overall for the restaurant and Team Members to make sure our guests continue to love coming to Red Robin.

Unwavering Integrity

  • Do the right thing, even when it’s tough or no one is looking: adhere to federal, provincial and local laws in addition to company policy, protect company assets, and hold Team Members accountable to these standards.
  • Ensure adherence to company cash handling and payment processing procedures.
  • Emphasize safety, sanitation and security awareness, and ensure that Team Members are properly trained to create safe situations.
  • Ensure company standards on equipment, facility, and grounds are maintained by using a preventative maintenance program.
  • Maintain our gold standard following the best practices of the company and brand equity standards to ensure guest satisfaction and profit maximization.

Relentless Focus on Improvement

  • Prepare and conduct performance appraisals with Team Members and provide any coaching in line with company standards.
  • Since we are always striving to be better, prepare reports and analyze metrics to identify opportunities and act promptly to correct.
  • Regularly measure and evaluate service standards by using various feedback tools to develop and implement plans for continuous service improvement.
  • Provide support in ensuring the optimization of profit by utilizing labor efficiently and ordering food and supplies to maintain appropriate inventory, portion correctly, minimize waste etc.

Genuine Spirit of Service

  • Unbridled hospitality and personal connections are in our DNA – build year over year sales by promoting the restaurant locally and ensure guest satisfaction with prompt problem resolution.
  • Ensure complete and timely execution of corporate & local restaurant marketing programs including off premise catering and sales.
  • We believe in a total team mentality, expect to spend limited time performing hourly FOH/ HOH functions including food preparation, cooking, cleaning, serving and greeting our crazy loyal Guests.

Extraordinary People

  • Remarkable people make us better: The Restaurant Management Team is responsible for the selection, on-boarding and retention of all Shift Supervisors & Team Members through motivation, recognition, coaching and development.
  • The AM will be the master motivator and mentor to approximately 75-100 Team Members.
  • Honor our Team Members by setting performance expectations and monitor training process to ensure quality of training.
  • Require operational excellence, recognize legendary acts of leadership, and develop management staff in all areas of restaurant leadership and Company standards.
  • Be a great mentor by devoting time to train, coach and develop team members by adapting to individual styles and motivational needs.

Recognized Burger Authority

  • Maintain food quality standards for the restaurant – because nobody does burgers as well as we do.
  • Make sure we are the gold standard in taste, quality, and presentation by complying with OHSA, local health and safety codes as well as Company safety and security policies.
  • Ensure that Team Members avoid cross contamination, improper food handling and/or storage practices, etc., through proper training and supervision.
  • Complete diligent line checks ensuring that we uphold the cleanliness standards of the restaurants and pass Health Department audits with exceptional ratings. Partner with management team on training FOH and HOH staff on proper sanitization guidelines.

Be better for being here as a Red Robin Manager and enjoy:

Flexible work schedules
Paid time off
Comprehensive 8-week training program
Participation in a management incentive plan
Health, vision, and dental insurance plan for you and your family
Referral bonuses for bringing new members to our team
Meal benefits

Fantastic growth opportunities as we look towards Brand expansion in the future

Red Robin is proud to be locally owned and operated.

Red Robin is an Equal Opportunity Employer

 

 

 

 1-2+ years of Restaurant Management experience preferred.

  • Has strong knowledge of commonly-used concepts, practices, and procedures in a restaurant.
  • Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.
  • Must have ability to accurately handle money, make change, process credit card transactions and have strong menu knowledge.
  • Performs a variety of tasks. A certain degree of creativity and latitude is required.
  • Must be 21 years of age.
  • Passion for the business and compassion for people.
  • Outstanding leadership and communication skills.
  • Ability to recruit, develop and motivate team members.
  • Must be able to create fun in a fast-paced and stressful environment.
  • Must be able to lift approximately 50 lbs.
  • Typically works under general supervision and reports to an GM.

title: Front of House Manager
description:
Overview:

Front of House (FOH) Manager

A Front of House Manager at Canada's leading casual dining restaurant, Boston Pizza, assists the General Manager with the Restaurantâ€™s daily operations. This includes supporting the training, development, staffing, scheduling, and performance management of the Front of House team members. The Front of House Manager supports the team to ensure that our most important people, our Guests, and team members, have an excellent Boston Pizza experience from start to finish. They also demonstrate outstanding leadership abilities, believe in championing a fun and safe work environment, and contribute to thriving workplace culture.

Responsibilities:

Why Is BP A Great Place To Work?

  • What is important to you matters to us, so we have raised the bar to provide flexible scheduling that fits your lifestyle and contributes to your life-work balance
  • Come for a job, stay for a career â€“ there are exciting opportunities for career growth within the restaurant or at Boston Pizza head office
  • Build relationships and give back to your local community
  • Boston Pizza Scholarship Program *
  • Management Training Programs, Leadership Development Sessions and access to dynamic mentorship programs and initiatives
  • A respectful culture and work environment where your feedback matters
  • Fantastic reward and recognition programs

What does a successful Front of House Manager look like?

  • Leads by example and works "Shoulder to Shoulder" with team members and coaches in the moment
  • Driven by professional development opportunities, and is consistently seeking new learning and skill-building moments
  • Achieves goals through strong organizational skills and effective time management
  • Builds relationships by finding common ground and working cohesively with all team members
  • Committed to championing the "Foundations of Hospitality," Boston Pizza's Brand Standards and Food Safety
  • Effectively communicates, sharing goals, challenges, and is continuously coaching the team on ways to progress
  • Maintains a positive composure and thrives in a fast-paced environment
Qualifications:

Boston Pizza was established over 50 years ago and is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's 50 Top Managed Companies for over 20 years in a row. We are committed to the development & growth of our team members, integrity, philanthropy, and innovation. If you love working with people in a team environment and believe in exceeding the expectations of Guests daily, Boston Pizza is the place for you!

title: Restaurant Assistant Manager
description:
A&W Restaurants in Lake Country, BC is looking for permanent full-time Assistant Manager to start immediately.

Compensation Starting: $43,705, depending upon experience and/or completion of in-house training.

Benefits which include an extensive single or family Medical/Dental Benefit which comprises of Pharmaceuticals, Hospital Care, Paramedical, Medical Equipment, Travel, Visioncare, Basic and Optional Life, along with an optional Group RRSP.

The McMurray Group is a franchise company with 40+ A&W restaurants extending across British Columbia and the Yukon Territories. Our working environment is based on respect and listening. Everyone's efforts and results are recognized and celebrated.

ROLE

The Assistant Manager works together with the Manager, supervising overall shift and daily operations of the restaurant. The Assistant Manager is responsible for operating the restaurant according to A&W Standards, Provincial WCB, and Employment and Health regulations on a daily basis and would be able to continue smooth operations of the restaurant in the absence of the Manager. The Assistant Manger will be scheduled in positions, working hands-on alongside the team members.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Operations

  • Balance key goals high quality, speed of service and cost control through effective management of the operating system
  • Maintains Provincial WCB and A&W standards daily; recognizes areas for improvement and acts where improvement is needed
  • Schedules staff, including self, and assigns shift roles and responsibilities
  • Knowledge of workplace climate goals and ensuring they are practiced daily

Human Resources

  • Trains, develops, confronts poor performance
  • Ensures staff safety and a healthy, motivating work environment applying daily workplace climate goals
  • Ensures Employment regulations are maintained on a daily basis
  • Documents critical incidents and reports them to key individuals

Financial

  • Completes daily, weekly, and period accounting administration as directed by the manager
  • Manages inventory control, ordering, cost control and weekly inventory counts as directed by the manager
  • Applies cash policies and food cost management principles

Customers

  • Ensures that cleanliness standards and safe food handling practices are met
  • Ensures high level of service to guests through efficient preparation, stocking, and staff positioning
  • Assists Manager with local store marketing
  • Manages accidents or complaints, implementing service recovery program
  • Ensures teams appearance is up to standard

QUALIFICATIONS

  • 3 years experience in a restaurant supervisory role
  • Strong interpersonal skills and proven leadership
  • Expertise in all restaurant positions
  • Complete knowledge of restaurant Operating Systems and Operating Standards
  • High interest in developing others
  • Ability to do accounting and manage administrative aspects of the operation

PREFERRED SKILLS

  • Acceptable oral and written English communication skills
  • Acceptable mathematical skills
  • Ability to train and coach others in a hands-on approach; imparting knowledge
  • Competent in Microsoft Office applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook
  • Ability to lead meetings

ADDITIONAL NOTES

Physical Demands

  • Standing and walking for extended periods.
  • Some heavy lifting

How To Apply

Please ensure that you are providing a current resume with pertinent work experience. Shortlisted candidates will be required to provide references and finalists will complete a Background Check.

Apply with resume by

  • responding to the links in this job posting,
  • by email: recruitment(at)christys.ca,
  • by mail: Recruitment - A&W McMurray Group, 2739 30th St., Vernon, BC, V1T 5C6,
  • by fax: 250-275-6707

For further information regarding this posting please call 250-275-6706 x322 during business hours. Only qualified applicants will be contacted for assessments and interviews.

Job Posted: October 13, 2021

PM21

How To Apply

Please ensure that you are providing a current, relevant, resume with pertinent work experience and references. Anyone who can legally work in Canada can apply for this job. If you are not currently authorized to work in Canada, the employer will not consider your job application.

We strongly encourage Candidates to apply to this job posting through the available links first for priority processing, otherwise, in the case that the link is not working, you may apply with your resume,

  • by email: recruitment@mcmurraygroup.ca
  • by mail: Recruitment - A&W McMurray Group, 2739 30th St., Vernon, BC, V1T 5C6, or
  • by fax: 250-275-6707, or
  • through our Career Page https://bit.ly/2J7m6ki

For further information regarding this posting, or others, please visit https://bit.ly/2J7m6ki or call 250-275-6706 x322 during business hours (10am - 4pm Pacific Time). If you are viewing this ad, the position has not been filled. Only qualified applicants will be contacted for assessments and interviews.

title: Restaurant General Manager (FT)
description:
Make A Difference, Have Fun and Be Your Best Self
Join Alberta’s only Certified Great Place to Work™ Quick Service Restaurants Operator.

Hi-Flyer Food Canada, Inc is proudly recognized as one of the 2021 Best Workplaces in Canada list.
  • 2021 Best Workplaces™ in Canada – 1000+ employees
  • 2021 Best Workplaces™ for Women
  • 2021 Best Workplaces™ in Retail and Hospitality
  • 2021 Best Workplaces™ for Inclusion
  • 2021 Best Workplaces™ for Mental Wellness
  • 2021 Best Workplaces™ in Alberta
  • 2021 Best Workplaces™ for Giving Back
  • 2021 Best Workplaces™ for Today's Youth

Hi-Flyer Food Canada Inc, KFC, and Taco Bell operator in Alberta and Manitoba, is engaged in delivering finger-licking good comfort food that is familiar to Canadians. The company's existence is aptly stated by its mission "To provide smiles in our community through teamwork, pride, and passion." We pride ourselves in providing our employees a sense of belongingness or a second home where their contributions are recognized, enhanced capabilities, and opportunities for advancement are defined.

At KFC/Taco Bell, we feed the world. But we do more than fill people up. We fulfill their life. Our meals matter, and when we serve them with southern hospitality, we make our customer’s day. So our jobs are more than a paycheck – they’re about being independent, having fun, and making new friends.

If you’re already a successful manager, you need to check out our Restaurant General Manager position. As a Restaurant General Manager, you have the keys to a successful business. And when you grow your team and the business by making our customers’ day, you get rewarded in a big way.

You are responsible for the operation of the entire restaurant and building a strong team that consistently provides customers great food and a friendly experience. Key responsibilities include finding, hiring, developing Team Members and Shift Leads, conducting new hire orientation, and developing the training plan for each new hire. You're also responsible for scheduling and deploying the Team correctly, addressing performance issues, and managing the restaurant budget and financial plans.

Restaurant General Manager behaviors include:
  • Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Self-motivated and demonstrates initiative.
  • Service and results-oriented.
  • Ensuring the entire restaurant team is properly trained and developed.
  • Interacting well with customers, management, and the restaurant team.
  • Resolving conflicts in a timely and effective manner.
  • Making sure your team understands and acts on business priorities.
  • You set high standards for yourself and for your people.
  • You're up for a challenge. You love the excitement of the restaurant business and know every day is different.

Experience:
  • Three years of relevant management experience.

Keep in mind, this is just basic information. You'll find out more after you apply.
If you are looking for an exciting opportunity and to build a career in an innovative and dynamic organization, submit your resume NOW.

You love the excitement of the restaurant business and know every day is different.", 'Three years of relevant management experience.', 'Resolving conflicts in a timely and effective manner.', 'Self-motivated and demonstrates initiative.', 'Making sure your team understands and acts on business priorities.']

title: Restaurant General Manager
description:
A&W Restaurants (Turnaround Foods Ltd.) in Whitehorse, Yukon Territories, located at 2222 2nd Ave, Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1C8, is looking for a permanent full-time Fast-Food Restaurant General Manager to start immediately.

Starting Salary $48,880 per annum, in addition, up to 15% base salary bonus paid quarterly depending upon the restaurantâ€™s results. 

We also offer various benefits which include an extensive single or family Medical/Dental Benefit which comprises of Pharmaceuticals, Hospital Care, Paramedical, Medical Equipment, Travel, Visioncare, Long Term Disability, Basic and Optional Life, AD&D and Critical Illness, along with an optional Group RSP, vehicle and cell phone allowances and free meals.

Start Dateof Employment: As soon as possible

Job Type: Full-time, permanent position. Work includes various shifts (Days, Evenings and Weekends).

The McMurray Group is a franchise company with 40 A&W restaurants extending across British Columbia and the Yukon Territories. We take pride in offering our employees a job like no other, and a work environment that can't be found anywhere else. Our working environment is based on respect and listening. Everyone's efforts and results are recognized and celebrated.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Operations

  • Manages the restaurant to ensure a good balance of the key goals of speed, quality, service, cleanliness and profit
  • Maintains A&W standards and conducts Performance reports regularly; recognizes areas needing improvement and takes action where necessary
  • Schedules staff to provide an excellent customer experience while meeting the restaurantâ€™s labour cost goals
  • Makes sure equipment and facility is in good condition and makes arrangements for all repairs

Human Resources

  • Recruits and hires hourly staff to ensure the restaurantâ€™s goals are met.
  • In conjunction with the Area Manager makes decisions regarding the hiring and promotion of supervisors and Assistant Managers
  • Trains and develops staff to ensure restaurant goals and standards are met.
  • Confronts poor performance in a timely and appropriate manner
  • Develops a healthy working climate through day to day behaviour and semi-annual climate meetings
  • Ensures compliance with provincial employment standards, WCB and Health Board regulations
  • Has knowledge of and administers all company Human Resource policies

Financial

  • Ensures restaurant profitability by managing revenues and costs to levels agreed upon in the annual profit planning process
  • Participates in the annual profit planning process
  • Ensures daily, weekly and monthly accounting is accurate and completed within the time allowed.
  • Ensures compliance with all company cash management policies. Works quickly to resolve any cash problems

Customers

  • Ensures that cleanliness standards and safe food handling practices are met.
  • Handles all complaints and customer involved incidents according to company policy and ensures staff are trained in service recovery
  • Builds business and awareness through local store marketing and community involvement

Requirements

  • Minimum requirement - 3 years experience as a supervisor or management role in the food service industry, within the previous 5 years, is a must
  • A minimum education level of high school graduation or equivalent
  • Must be fluent in English
  • Strong interpersonal skills and proven leadership/ supervisory experience
  • Expertise in all restaurant positions
  • Complete knowledge of food safe practices and requirements
  • High interest in developing others
  • Ability to do accounting and manage administrative aspects of the operation
  • Ability to stand and walk for extended periods.
  • Able to do some heavy lifting
  • Having a valid driverâ€™s license is an asset

Posted March 1, 2022

We strongly encourage candidates to apply directly to this post the links, otherwise, if the link is not working, email your resume to: HR-MCM-BC@outlook.com

How To Apply

Please ensure that you are providing a current, relevant, resume with pertinent work experience and references. Anyone who can legally work in Canada can apply for this job. If you are not currently authorized to work in Canada, the employer will not consider your job application.

We strongly encourage Candidates to apply to this job posting through the available links first for priority processing, otherwise, in the case that the link is not working, you may apply with your resume,

  • by email: recruitment@mcmurraygroup.ca
  • by mail: Recruitment - A&W McMurray Group, 2739 30th St., Vernon, BC, V1T 5C6, or
  • by fax: 250-275-6707, or
  • through our Career Page https://bit.ly/2J7m6ki

For further information regarding this posting, or others, please visit https://bit.ly/2J7m6ki or call 250-275-6706 x322 during business hours (10am - 4pm Pacific Time). If you are viewing this ad, the position has not been filled. Only qualified applicants will be contacted for assessments and interviews.

title: Kitchen Manager
description:
Welcome to The Canadian Brewhouse, Canada's fastest-growing independent restaurant group! We are proud of being the only Canadian-themed sports bar in town, and we know that without our incredible teams we wouldn't be a fraction of where we are today. Our teams live and breathe our Core Values; these are 6 key principles that influence all of our decisions as an organization.

  • Take Care of Each Other and Yourself
  • Think Like a Customer
  • Support Your Community
  • Hurry, Donâ€™t Rush
  • Embrace Innovation
  • Be Persistent

When not at work, you may catch us out in the community volunteering, raising funds for The Canadian Mental Health Association or the local Children's Hospital, or having a couple of drinks with friends. The Brew Crew is a team of devoted, compassionate, and ambitious individuals that are hungry for what the future holds. We believe it's our duty to provide all of our employees with a safe, fun-filled work environment with endless advancement opportunities. Let us tell you more about why you should join the best team in Canada, today!

 

Letâ€™s talk about the Kitchen Management role! 

 

Our kitchens are an opportunity to exhibit your current cooking skills and learn some more. We don't believe in segregating our line cooks to a single station; it's important that everyone learns every part of our back of house operations so that we can support each other and ensure that when the opportunity comes knocking for growth, you're already set up to grow!

 

Safety and cleanliness are cornerstones to our food program, and we expect each of our team members to hold them both in high regard and take good care of themselves, their fellow Brew Crew, our guests, and our house.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Oversee all BOH operations
  • Prepare and send out only top-quality dishes
  • Coach, lead, and mentor a team of cooks under your direction
  • Ensure and maintain a safe, sanitary, and clean work environment at all times
  • Develop and nurture a positive relationship between the FOH/BOH teams
  • Schedule within budget laid out by GM
  • Minimize food waste through adjusting prep par levels and ordering products within budget set out by GM
  • Provide and gain experience in the business side of cooking - food costing, time management, inventories, etc.
  • Be proficient in all prep stations and all line stations
  • Ensure proper training of BOH team members through proper onboarding and coaching
  • Be present and execute peak service volumes
  • Communicate clearly, calmly, and often

What do you need?

  • 2-3 years kitchen management experience
  • Knowledge and understanding of health and safety regulations
  • Knowledge of components contributing to food cost control
  • A strong set of leadership skills
  • Level headed and remain calm under pressure
  • A passion for cooking
  • Organized and detail oriented
  • Strong interest in developing and motivating others
  • Dedication to learning a large menu with many in-house made items
  • Ability to communicate effectively
  • A drive to find solutions rather than point out problems
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skillsâ€™
  • Ability to delegate and follow through

Benefits to Joining Our Team:

  • A staff discount that we extend to your friends and family - show off your workplace, our house is your house!
  • Scholarship program for part-time and full-time students.
  • Advancement opportunities are endless with the right attitude and passion - our CEO started out as a dishwasher!
  • The opportunity to Support Your Community - one of our core values, a great experience to volunteer with causes youâ€™re passionate about.
  • Working with a team of like-minded individuals who have your interests at heart. Our team is our family - We Are Brew Crew
  • Opportunity to travel as part of our Corporate Training team

title: Front of House Manager - Jack Astor's
description:
Company & Brand Overview:

At Service Inspired Restaurants we take great pride in our diverse portfolio of restaurants and believe a brave, bold and results-driven culture inspires and creates new opportunities for everyone. Our values and promises are not simply a dream, vision, or mission, but a way of life for every person that becomes or wants to become a member of our team. Our goal is to be the first choice of our guests, team members, supplier partners, communities and investors by living our values and promises in everything we do. These values and promises describe how we conduct business, achieve our goal, and live our passion. We offer opportunities at the corporate level, as well as across all our concepts, including: Jack Astorâ€™s Bar and Grill ®, SCADDABUSH Italian Kitchen & Bar ®; Canyon Creek ®, Reds ® Wine Tavern, The Loose Moose ® and The Antler Room, Duke's Refresher ® + Bar and Abbeyâ€™s Bake House in Muskoka. So what are you waiting for â€¦ come learn more and see if you have what it takes to join our team!

 

Why work for us?  

  • Privately owned Canadian corporation
  • Opportunity for advancement across all locations
  • Culinary and Bartending competitions
  • Real food made from scratch
  • Passionate and focused hospitality leaders
  • Strong focus on personal and career development
  • Accelerated Leadership Programs
  • Competitive pay and benefits offered at all levels
  • Employee discounts across all locations
Duties & Responsibilities:

At Jack Astorâ€™s itâ€™s all about personality, yes, weâ€™re all about a delicious menu and fantastic beverages, but more than that we own fun. Yep, our teams are more than our co-workers, theyâ€™re our Peeps. Whatever role we hold in the restaurants, we are there for each other. Jacks is about being ourselves and having fun â€“ and when we have fun our guests have fun too. The point is if youâ€™re friendly, fun, and maybe a little crazy then youâ€™ll fit right in and the possibilities for your career are endless. As a Front of House Manager for Jack Astorâ€™s you will be responsible for the following:

  • Work alongside the General Manager to lead our peeps to provide the highest quality standards for food, a guest experience that is outstanding, and service that is memorable.
  • Develop leadership skills under the mentorship of the GM and in turn coach and lead our peeps to help to ensure they receive great training and support.
  • Learn and manage the financials, and work to achieve and exceed established goals.
  • Live and teach Jacksâ€™ Values and Promises.
  • Use strong time management skills and attention to detail to complete our jobs.
  • Spread the enthusiasm and energy among all of our peeps!  
Qualifications:
  • If youâ€™ve had 1-3 years previous restaurant management/supervisory experience in a comparable restaurant environment weâ€™re interested.
  • Communication is key, so youâ€™ll need to speak and write English well.
  • Comfortable using computers and learning new software.
  • Youâ€™ll be managing sales goals, inventory, cash and other stuff that requires good math and analytical skills.
  • Previous scheduling experience and Smart Serve Certification is an asset.
  • Possess five values that define our people:
    • Hospitality. Enhancing the dignity, comfort and well-being of Our People.
    • Authenticity. Being forthright, truthful and transparent with Our People.
    • Quality. Working to always improve the experience of Our People.
    • Fun. Bringing the spirit of laughter, celebration, sharing and joy to Our People.
    • Courage. Acting with conviction in the balanced interest of Our People.

 

Service Inspired Restaurants ® is committed to fair and equitable recruiting practices. We prohibit discrimination based on age, color, disability, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other legally protected class in accordance with applicable federal, provincial and local laws. We are also committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible work environment. If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation at any stage of the interviewing process, please let us know.

title: Assistant Chef Manager
description:
Company Description

At Farm Boy, it is our mission to create a fun, fresh experience for all! Whether you are a team member or a customer, Farm Boy is passionate about creating a unique fresh food shopping experience and ensuring that we deliver on our commitments.

As we continue to grow within Ontario, Farm Boy is excited to welcome new team members that share our passion for providing the best fresh shopping experience!

Job Description

This position is responsible for assisting the Department Manager in the achievement of company, store and department goals as communicated by the Store Manager and Department Manager. The performance of the duties must ensure a quality service approach to all employees, customers and suppliers. All responsibilities must be performed in a manner consistent with the Farm Boy Way.

Major Responsibilities:

  • Provide superior customer service and support Farm Boy’s vision of the best fresh shopping experience.
  • Assist in the development of the team by supporting the training, coaching and recognition while maintaining a high level of confidentiality and trust.
  • Effectively communicate and support the team with huddles, product knowledge, corporate policies and procedures and Health and Safety.
  • Floor support and supervision, including serving customers, merchandising and rotation, breaks and general department cleanliness.
  • Support office management (e.g. completing inventory and orders, invoices, scheduling, payroll).
  • May be requested to undertake other related duties on a periodic basis.
Qualifications

  • Typically requires completion of a post-secondary program with an emphasis in business, plus a minimum of 1 year of progressively responsible supervisory or management experience in a similar role or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Excellent organizational, interpersonal and analytical skills.
  • Clear and effective communication style, both written and oral.
  • Good judgment and decision-making abilities while communicating with customers and Farm Boy team members.
  • Ability to learn manual and automated systems/tools.
  • Skilled at working in a fast-paced environment while maintaining priorities and a high level of performance.
  • Flexible schedule, including weekends, evenings and holidays.
  • Fluency in English and French shall be considered an asset.

Work & Sensory Environment:

  • Providing service to several people or departments, working under many simultaneous deadlines.
  • Required to stand and walk for long periods of time during shift.
  • Required to lift, carry or handle heavy objects.
  • Required to adapt to temperature changes on occasion (working on the retail floor as well as in coolers and freezers)

 



Additional Information

FBSWO

Accommodation is available upon request for applicants and employees with disabilities.

title: Directeur adjoint de la restauration et des boissons
description:
Le Club de golf Islesmere recrute!

Sous la responsabilité du directeur de l'alimentation et des boissons, vous faciliterez le fonctionnement quotidien des installations d'alimentation et de boissons.

RESPONSABILITÉS :

  • Se présenter au poste de travail aux heures prévues, afin de maintenir l'efficacité des opérations.
  • Effectuer en temps opportun toutes les tâches demandées par le directeur de la restauration et le directeur adjoint de la restauration.
  • Accomplir toutes les tâches liées au travail et les fonctions requises pour exécuter avec succès les opérations de banquet.
  • Travailler de manière sûre et efficace, en particulier pendant les heures de service, afin d'obtenir une qualité de service élevée et constante dans un environnement productif et rentable.
  • Se conformer à tous les manuels d'exploitation, aux procédures d'ouverture et de fermeture, aux feuilles de travail quotidiennes, aux procédures du restaurant, aux horaires de nettoyage et à toutes les autres tâches requises pour exécuter avec succès les routines quotidiennes dans un restaurant efficace.
  • Aider, si nécessaire, à la réception des livraisons et à la vérification minutieuse des factures pour la qualité, la quantité et le prix des produits.
  • Communiquer de manière professionnelle et directe avec le chef exécutif, le directeur de la restauration et l'équipe de restauration sur toutes les questions relatives au service alimentaire.
  • Se comporter de manière professionnelle à tout moment et se représenter, ainsi que l'équipe de restauration, le club et ClubLink, au plus haut niveau.

QUALIFICATIONS :

  • Passionné(e), intéressé(e) et dévoué(e) à un niveau et une norme extrêmement élevés de qualité et de cohérence du service.
  • Hautement créatif, travailleur et motivé par des styles de service de pointe.
  • Excellentes compétences en matière de communication et de service à la clientèle.
  • Sens aigu de l'organisation.
  • Ce poste nécessitera de travailler selon un horaire varié tout au long de l'automne, notamment les soirs, les nuits et les fins de semaine.

Il s'agit d'un poste saisonnier.

ClubLink est un employeur qui souscrit au principe de l'égalité des chances et s'engage à offrir un lieu de travail inclusif. Veuillez contacter

jobs@clublink.ca

si un aménagement du lieu de travail est nécessaire tout au long du processus de sélection. Nous vous remercions de l'intérêt que vous portez à ClubLink.

title: Maligne Lake, Food and Beverage Assistant Manager $21/hr
description:
What will be your daily pursuit?:

To support, coach and inspire the food and beverage team to create an unforgettable dining experience.

What perks can you expect?:
  • Work in a dynamic, culturally diverse team from around the globe  
  • Work experience in an  iconic, unforgettable, and inspiring location  
  • Free access to Pursuit attractions for staff and family, send a friend at half the price!
  • Discounted hotel stays under Pursuitâ€™s lodging offerings, and discounted food & beverage and retail experiences
  • A safe work environment with structured COVID procedures and vaccination policies
  • The chance to work in an  inclusive culture  and  make life-long friends  
  • Access to subsidized mental health and wellness resources
  • Opportunities for career growth  or future work at  other Pursuit  locations  
  • Access to one of the worldâ€™s most beautiful and iconic National Parks  
What will you do in this job?:
  • Achieve revenue and profitability targets
  • Manage inventory
  • Ensure effective reporting to Food and Beverage Manager and communication to greater team
  • Build a high functioning and positive team
  • Create the â€œWOWâ€ experience for each guest
  • Continuous improvement of guest and employee experiences
  • Develop consistency within the Food and Beverage offerings, follow and improve standards based on guest needs and wants
  • Daily inspections on cleanliness and organization
  • Train the team to see  our outlets from a guestâ€™s perspective
  • On the spot guest service resolution
  • Create proper service standards, procedures, key notes to work when greeting guests, pairing of food and wine, upselling, clearing, timing on tables
  • Team scheduling; following labour guidelines from Food and Beverage Manager
  • Ensuring food quality is following the guidelines set out by Food and Beverage Manager and Executive Chef
  • Daily reports on promos and guest feedback
  • Work as one unit with the Back of House â€“ one team, one food and beverage department
  • Work collaboratively with sales, marketing and group services in executing of events
What skills and experience do you need for this job?:
  • 1 year of experience in a leadership role
  • 2+ years of experience in the food and beverage industry â€“ concentrating on high volume
  • Diploma/ Degree within Hospitality focusing in Food and Beverage is an asset
  • Experience building relationships and working on teams across all levels of an organization
  • Strong experience in upscale and high volume restaurants and special event execution
  • Proven track record in maintaining a high level of organization on and off the floor
  • Effective communicator and able to implement and uphold high service standards
  • Driven to fostering a team building environment and creating positive guest experiences
  • An eye for detail and quality
  • Showing leadership in a positive, calm, consistent and focused manner
What will your work environment be like?:

This fun, summer job runs from May 9 to October 13, 2022.

  • Beautiful.  Youâ€™ll work in iconic, unforgettable and inspiring locations. Youâ€™ll see amazing scenery and wildlife. Youâ€™ll participate in team events â€“ and fun!  
  • Independent.  Youâ€™ll spend your days in and around  national parks.  
  • Remote.  Our home is filled with trees, lakes and blue-bird skies; rather than buildings, freeways and smog.  Connect with friends around a bonfire instead of  through  WiFi  
  • Busy.  You  need to be prepared for a physical working environment with walking, stair climbing, bending, reaching, lifting (up to 50 pounds with assistance) required  

This job description describes this role at a high level, but no document can anticipate every single task, issue or project that could come up.  We work as a team and believe that we succeed together â€“ these job duties may change based on the needs of the  team and company as a whole.  

 

To handle this job successfully, any person hired must be able to perform responsibilities as described. Pursuit will make any reasonable accommodation to help a person with disabilities perform their job. This job is based in  Alberta, Canada. Relocation to the area and the legal ability to work in  Canada  is required.  

 
#CHFAB
 
EEO Information:Pursuit is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, religion, gender, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

title: Food Services and Hospitality Manager
description:
Company Description

We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.

Job Description

The Food Services and Hospitality Manager is a key member of the contract team at a historical remote site in the Canadian Arctic. The position reports into the Contractor Site Manager and is responsible for the overall delivery and execution of hospitality services including food service, housekeeping and janitorial. An 8 weeks on, 8 weeks off rotational schedule with flights to and from the worksite in Nunavut leaving from Trenton, Ontario. A unique opportunity to contribute to the operation of an entire community supporting members of the Canadian Armed Forces.

This position requires Government of Canada security clearance at the Secret status level.

Key Responsibilities Include:

  • Oversee and manage hospitality service elements at the site including food services, housekeeping and janitorial.
  • Day-to-day management of menu planning, meal production and service.
  • Manage housekeeping and janitorial services to maintain standard of cleanliness in guest rooms and common areas.
  • People leadership including hiring, scheduling, employee development and performance management.
  • Food procurement including budgeting and expense management.
  • Solicit and incorporate guest feedback to ensure client satisfaction and continuous improvement of services.
  • Ensure hospitality services meet contractual and regulatory authority requirements and compliance with relevant health and safety regulations and practices.
Qualifications

  • Minimum of five (5) years of experience in managing a multi-faceted hospitality and customer service operation in an institutional environment.
  • Red Seal Certification and/or certification in Hospitality Management.
  • Training, certification and/or experience in sanitation, quality control and client care.
  • Completion of Food Safe Handling training.
  • Ten (10) years overall work experience in hospitality.
  • Ability to obtain Government of Canada security clearance at the Secret Status level (requires a 10 year background check and Canadian Citizenship or Permanent Residency).
  • Ability to obtain fit-for-duty medical assessment from a physician.
  • Customer service and guest experience orientation.
  • People skills including active listening, ability to effectively mediate disputes and tolerance of differences.
  • Training, instructing, teaching and mentoring skills.
  • Inuit cultural awareness, knowledge and respect.
  • Strong organizational and time-management skills.
  • Speaking and written communication skills; ability to effectively convey information to employees and guests.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office and windows-based computer systems.
  • Flexibility to meet the unique requirements of the site including potential rotational shift changes and working after hours “on-call” duties.


Additional Information

  • An opportunity for work life balance. 8 weeks on and 8 weeks off allows you to use your time to do what you enjoy.
  • Continuous wage payment throughout your time off.
  • Competitive wages, benefits and an RSP matching program.
  • Retention Bonus of up to 10% of wages earned paid on the completion of a 2 year contract.
  • Paid travel time.
  • Unique experience in the northernmost continuously inhabited place in the world.
  • Training and development opportunities to help grow and diversify your career.
  • Transfer opportunities to other Dexterra sites across Canada.

Dexterra Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

*Please note this job is based in Alert, Nunavut, Canada.

title: Restaurant Supervisor - Kelseys
description:
Overview:

OAKVILLE Is Now Hiring a Restaurant Supervisor

 

Welcome to the Roadhouse, re-invented! Weâ€™re about fresh ingredients prepared in-house, always indulging outrageously and never letting a road trip become a guilt trip. Weâ€™re about making every journey better and every plate a delicious one.

 

Ready to hit the road at the Original Roadhouse?

 

 

What you will do in this role:

 

  • Be responsible for your timely progress through the Restaurant Leader Certification Program, taking on additional responsibilities as learning and skill enhancements happen
  • Assist in the day-to-day leadership and management of a Kelseys restaurant and itâ€™s associates, as directed by the General Manager (GM)
  • Be accountable for key financials and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), in partnership with the management team
  • Assist in running both dining room and kitchen operations and lead all shifts to Brand standards
  • Support the GM in all aspects of operating a "Benchmark Restaurant" to the Brand standards, creating a Perfect Guest Experience every time, while focusing on continuous associate development

What we are looking for:

  • Post secondary degree/diploma, bonus points for Hospitality and/or Business related field
  • Must possess the "Hospitality Gene" - Passion for People and Excellence
  • Demonstrates drive by raising the stakes with your associates, your operation and yourself through taking decisive action  
  • Integrity and value diversity and ability to create a contagious passion around pleasing your Guests
  • Ability to create a vision for growth by being highly proactive and anticipating barriers that lie ahead through understanding the business
  • Demonstrates focus through setting priorities and working fast while staying agile and adaptable at all times

Whatâ€™s in it for you:

  • Flexible scheduling
  • Competitive wages
  • The chance to be part of a close knit team  
  • A complimentary Management Meal during every shift
  • 20% employee discount dining card valid at participating Recipe brands
  • Growth and development opportunities within the restaurant
  • Career advancement opportunities in a company that owns some of Canadaâ€™s most iconic restaurant brands

Interested in giving road-trippers a truly Canadian experience? Apply online today!

 

Recipe is committed to providing a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace. Celebrating people, being passionate and curious, owning it, and doing the right thing are the values that guide how we build our teams, support our franchisees and create a company that unlocks the full potential of everyone.  

Recipe is dedicated to providing accommodations in accordance with applicable human rights and accommodation legislation. For individuals that require accommodations please contact

recruit@recipeunlimited.com

.

title: Jasper Lodging, Food & Beverage Supervisor
description:
What will be your daily pursuit?

Providing our guests with top-tier hospitality and dining experiences to keep them energized for their adventures! 

What perks can you expect?

  • Work in a dynamic, culturally diverse team from around the globe 
  • Work experience in an iconic, unforgettable, and inspiring location 
  • Free access to Pursuit attractions for staff and family, send a friend at half the price!
  • Discounted hotel stays under Pursuit’s lodging offerings, and discounted food & beverage and retail experiences
  • A safe work environment with structured COVID procedures and vaccination policies
  • The chance to work in an inclusive culture and make life-long friends 
  • Access to subsidized mental health and wellness resources
  • Opportunities for career growth or future work at other Pursuit locations 
  • Access to one of the world’s most beautiful and iconic National Parks 

What will you do in this job?

The Food & Beverage Supervisor under general direction trains and directs frontline staff to perform their duties to Guest Experience standards. Responsibilities include:

 

  • To act as the Location Manager in the absence of the Manager covering vacation and days off
  • Preparation and verification of daily cash reports
  • Ensuring accurate cash, debit, and credit card transactions
  • Involved in the placing of and receiving food orders
  • Coordinate food and beverage inventories
  • Interacts with customers and maintains the highest level of customer service
  • Receive payment for all services provided to the customer
  • Listen to and resolve any customer complaints
  • Ensure the restaurant area is clean and organized at all times
  • Serve tables, bartend as required
  • Uphold the high standard of environmental stewardship expected for all employees
  • Report all maintenance and repair needs to the Location Manager
  • Report and assist the Location Manager with performance management of employees
  • Ensure opening and closing checklists are up to date and being used properly daily
  • Detailed daily communications; to staff via lineups and on the floor discussion, to leadership via shift pass ons, in addition to daily shift reports outlining the shift in detail
  • Motivate staff and have an influential part in in team building and bonding
  • Lead GEM and tour functions;
    • Printing and advance review of BEO’s
    • Setup and service of all events – ensuring no details are missed and the guest experience is seamless
    • Completion of GEM and Tour Billing ensuring accuracy and timeliness

What skills and experience do you need for this job?

  • Hospitality certification preferred
  • Minimum three (3) years’ experience in restaurant operations with supervisory experience
  • Proserve and WHIMIS certification
  • Excellent knowledge of food & beverage service
  • Good knowledge of wine, spirits and beer
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal, guest and public relations skills
  • Neat and clean in appearance and work habits
  • Ability to accept and give direction
  • Ability to motivate train and provide on-going coaching
  • Be able to work with minimal supervision
  • Ability to work within a team
  • Positive attitude
  • Ability to deal with guest challenges and solve problems as they arise
  • Able to work all shifts including split shifts

What will your work environment be like?

This fun summer job has start dates in April and May and runs to October 30, 2022.

  • Beautiful. You’ll work in iconic, unforgettable and inspiring national park. You’ll see amazing scenery and wildlife. You’ll participate in team events – and fun! 
  • Independent. You’ll spend your days in and around our historic hotel 
  • Remote. Our home is filled with trees, lakes and blue-bird skies; rather than buildings, freeways and smog. Connect with friends around a bonfire instead of through WiFi 
  • Busy. You need to be prepared for a physical working environment with walking, stair climbing, bending, reaching, lifting (up to 50 pounds with assistance) required  

This job description describes the role at a high level, but no document can anticipate every single task, issue or project that could come up. We work as a team and believe that we succeed together – these job duties may change based on the needs of the team and company as a whole. 

 

To handle this job successfully, any person hired must be able to perform responsibilities as described. Pursuit will make any reasonable accommodation to help a person with disabilities perform their job. This job is based in Alberta, Canada. Relocation to the area and the legal ability to work in Canada is required.

 

 #CHFAB  

EEO Information

Pursuit is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, religion, gender, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.
